Name: Dr. Gauri
Title: Beautiful!
Review: Inside the property it is mesmerizing, Bada Imambada, Bhool bhulaiya, Bauli etc...picture scenic beauties.

Name: Madhukar Varma
Title: Imambara kindness of Nawab Asifudaulah
Review: A historical place the imambara has a mosque  the stairs of which mesmerizes you  the corner of the stairs form a pyramidal structure which at first site is difficult to unravel . The main structure has a big  hall which has no support in the middle stretch . the alleys in one part are so formed that a person may loose his way , this is known as Bhulbhulaiya literally meaning confusing. There is a waterbody too and it is believed that if you loose your way you may get trapped in the waterbody .The Imambara was built by Nawad Asifudaulah to feed his subjects by engaging them in construction at the time of a severe famine.

Name: SagarVS
Title: A sight to behold
Review: The sight of the imposing monuments of this place are a sight to behold. The place is well maintained and kept clean. You might be required to take off your footwear in some places and ladies are required to dress modestly. Do make a trip to the labyrinth and also visit the well. A must do in Lucknow.

Name: Hotel Indraprastha inn
Title: Nice place
Review: Good view with a lot of information, I had Mughlai food also in old Lucknow. Really its a amazing place

Name: SVAYAMBHU C
Title: Bara Imambara Dec 2022
Review: Our Savaari cab took us next to Bara Imambara complex. We had about an hour of sunlight left and the sound decision that we took was to complete Bara Imambara and not do the others and try to come back to it. Bara Imambara was quite something with its large halls without any pillars. Our private guide was knowledgeable and gave us the right context. The Bhulbhulaiya or The Labarynth is one of the most intricate man-made creations I have seen. We walked through pitch dark corridors and reached junction points made up of four roads of which only one was right. There were different groups in the maze and we were able to come out only because we had the services of a guide. The bawli or step well was awe inspiring and hats off to the engenuity of the builders of that era.

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: An iconic place of Lucknow
Review: This is one of the prime historical areas of Lucknow and one has to see it to believe it. The technology used to built the huge dome with unsupported pillars, the Labyrinth (Bhul Bhulaiyan) are worth the admiration.One needs a guide to visit this place and charges are other than the entry ticket.

Name: DBG_Aprl
Title: Beautiful and royal architecture
Review: Bara imambara is iconic and magnificent architecture of its kind. Entry ticket is 50 Rs. It will take atleast 1.5 hour to complete all places inside. Location is accessible from moat of the places from Lucknow. You can take shared auto to reach here. Guide is advisable as you need to be guided inside the place. It's sacred place so dignity and respect for the place is desired.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Architectural masterpiece!
Review: This is a piece of great architecture by the Nawabs, and the most awe inspiring structures in Lucknow.The labyrinth 'Bhool Bhulaiya' is a must see with a Guide, as he can only bring you out of it once inside!The stepwell 'Baoli' is another interesting structure inside, besides the Asafi Mosque which is the most picturesque monument inside.A must see in Lucknow!

Name: Nil0tpalC
Title: Nice
Review: It is Heritage property plus particular community religious place so removal of shoe is compulsory. One should visit this place as itwas built by Nawab of Lucknow. Bhulbhulaiya is very interesting to know.

Name: flyingwish
Title: Must See Site in Lucknow
Review: Even though it was scorching hot during our visit but it was well worth visiting Bara Imambara. The architecture and religious importance is impressive.

Name: Nagarajan L
Title: Good historical monument that requires better maintenance.
Review: Good historical monument that requires better maintenance.Plastic chips covers and water bottle thrown all over. You are expected to remove footwear and walk in this garbage ...you are surrounded by people for hiring guides wish they can clean the place and enforce. Ban on plastic

Name: DESHPANDE S
Title: Visit to Imambara
Review: huge but no guides, no voice or written material, more  'romantic 'place for locals, Keep fit to see this place it has lots of steps to climb and lot to walk

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Mosque & Imambara
Review: Great place to visualize old world charm of Lucknow. The history of the place is fascinating & so is the maze of Bhul- Bhulaiya

Name: Sakshrek
Title: Heritage Zone
Review: What a place, huge building was built for releaf famine program by nawab Asaffudaulla. Amazing Labrinth advisable to visit with a tour guide or else there are chances you will get lost in the maze. When in Lucknow must visit this place.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Bada Imambara Complex
Review: Bada Imambara complex is truly an unparalleled sample of pre-industrial engineering, a unique structure with different architectural styles... The view from the terrace of the Bhul Bhulaiya is also stunning where along with the Asafi Mosque, you can get a snapshot of the sprawling courtyards, ornate gateways and even the Lucknow city skyline

Name: Atasi P
Title: Nice Checkpoint
Review: Overall a good sightseeing option. The building upkeep is not up to the mark. The Bhul Bhuliya is the main attraction here.

Name: VaidyaVikrant
Title: History speaks a Lot Bada Imambara..
Review: Bada Imambara is one of the Face of Lucknow.The Walls which transfers sound from distance, the well which shows the reflection multiple ways short passages and only one leads to Exact gate ..its all worth seeing, it has a Masjid so avoid going To visit on Friday Morning better to visit after 3pm on Friday..alas its Bade Imambara

Name: silva s
Title: Beautiful place
Review: A beautiful memory to cherish forever. This is a place where history speaks to you. The royal grandeur of Lucknow.

Name: debarshid73
Title: Bara Imambara
Review: Architectural marvel. It is a must visit place while you are in Lucknow.Guide is must while you are in Imambara. Bag pack is not allowed inside Imambara and that need to be deposited @Rs.20, videography is also prohibited. It is really interesting to know the story behind this great architecture and that is really amazing.

Name: BISWABRATA
Title: Bhul Bhulaiya
Review: This place is must see place in Lucknow. Mobile allowed but no digital camera, Pl. Visit with guide specially for Bhul Bhulaiya. Pl. Carry drinking water as you may require for Bhul Bhulaiya walking, lots of stairs have to climb.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Good place
Review: Staying in Charbagh area of Lucknow , took a share auto from Charbagh to parivartan chowk(Rs 15 per person) and from parivartan chowk took another share auto to teeli wali masjid(Rs 10 per person).From teeli wali masjid bara Imambara is about 10-15 minutes walk. I am not sure if we get share autos to bara Imambara from parivartan chowk.          Combined entrance ticket for Bhool bhulaya (Labyrinth), bowli,chota Imambara, picture gallery with entrance ticket for bara Imambara costs Rs 50 per person.          Guide charges for bara Imambara, bhul bhulaya and bowli costs Rs 150 for 1-2 persons. But one guide will have 10 - 15 people in one group by combining many group of tourists which is not correct. The administration of bara Imambara must look into this. Guides are mandatory for couples who want to visit bhul bhulaya.          Footwear has to removed before entering Bara Imambara and the same must be deposited at footwear keeping centre which is at right side of entrance to Bara Imambara by paying Rs 2 per persons footwear. Imambara is impressive and beautiful. Bhul bhulaya is also good but the tourists must act responsibly as they have scribbled in walls of bhul bhulaya. Bowli area must be maintained more neatly.        There ia a mosque too called Asifi masjid in Courtyard of bara Imambara but tourists are not allowed inside this mosque.          Do carry sufficient drinking water with you when visiting this place especially in afternoon. Try to visit this place in morning before it gets too hot.       Just outside of bara Imambara we can take auto/tongas to go to chota Imambara, roomi darwaza, ghanta ghar & picture gallery. Roomi darwaza, ghanta ghar & picture gallery is on the way to chota Imambara from bara Imambara. One can also walk from bara Imambara to chota Imambara seeing roomi darwaza,ghanta ghar & picture gallery.

Name: Shubham Srivastava
Title: Place of historical value
Review: If you are visiting lucknow for the first time or live here and have not visited the same, then do visit to know about the hsitory of lucknow. Beautiful garden. Nice for picnic and sight seeing.

Name: Ashok B
Title: great
Review: very goodvery nice Surreal experience of age old grandeur and perfection. Wonder how people of old constructed such beautiful monuments. Well kept outdoor gardens/grounds present a perfect setting for this must visit place in this city.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Great monument. Can be maintained more.
Review: Great experience with a guide, but can be more well maintained. Take help of guide definitely if you are visiting for the first time.

Name: Kumar Rahul
Title: Very nice
Review: You have to take a whole day for fully tarvel in bara imambara love the atmosphere here I went with my friends and har lots of fun, nice one again,

Name: AnupamSharan
Title: Bhool Bhulaiya is a misnomer
Review: The Bhool Bhulaiya inside Bara Imam Bara was actually not built to be a labyrinth. They are the supporting pillars, walls and beams in the 2nd floor of Imam bara through which once can walk as they are big. However, too straight and simple to get lost.

Name: Aman J
Title: Spell bound !!
Review: Excellent location to recollect memories of 17/18 th century rulersThis location also has other attractions near by like chotta Imambara and Bulbullayya ( you really get confused , how to get out once you enter in first floor)The echo system on these ancient structures is scientifc wonderAlso attempt to trace linkage with Gomti river

Name: Rohit Gupta
Title: Lifeline of Lucknow
Review: Place : AwesomeVibes : ClassicAccess : Very easySecurity : PAC force stay theirHistorical : YesNearby : Multiple MonomentsThis is an apt place for shooting songs/movie and for photography.

Name: Sahil Khan
Title: Don't Forget To Visit
Review: One of the best structures in Lucknow if you love monuments must visit place. The interior and exterior of the monument is simply remarkable. You are gonna fall in love with the place. The intricacy of art work done on columns are magnificent. Place is filled with inspiration and ideas for Design elements. Interior of the design has very nice topics like fish, flowers and leaves etc shows awadhi culture very well loved it

Name: DrKlair
Title: Truly grand
Review: It is much more beautiful than it looks in pictures .Go early in the morning before the rush of tourists to appreciate the acoustics. Except the mosque inside the Imambara where only muslims can enter ,the rest of the complex is open to all religons.

Name: Jamesbondo7
Title: Wonderful
Review: Its wonderful and Beautiful.  Very nice architecture side . Must visit with 2 to 3 hours time. Bhulbulaiya was Amazing.

Name: JoyBose
Title: The must see attraction in Luckno, complex contains baoli, mosque, labrynth and main building
Review: This was built by Nawab Wajid Ali Shah in the 17th century to save people from a famine. It is a religious building as well as a touristic building. The complex consists of an outer gate, inner countyard, inner gate and buildings. The main building is a sacred building in Shia islam, so one has to take off shoes and deposit them.  In the first floor, one can clap from one side fo the building and it will echo on the other side. Bhul bulaiya labrynth is part of the complex, a place with narrow openings where one can get lost easily. It is better to take a guide. Asaf Ali mosque is amazingly beautiful. The baoli was built for the city's water supply from river Gomti, the guide can explain how it works and take you to the lower levels. Entry combined ticket is Rs 50 for Indians and 300 for foreigners. Guide costs Rs 100, more for bigger groups. It is closed during namaz time on Fridays.

Name: Jade on bike
Title: Brilliant ecoustic architecture
Review: Very nice architecture with hidden, misterious staircases where one can easily get lost. Without the help of a trained Guide it's a big thing to come out of those myriad lanes.   Had a great funny time there.

Name: Akshita Shukla
Title: Nice architecture
Review: It's good but little bit scary (that's what I felt) so don't try to go alone, you can take a guide there.

Name: Amitesh Gaur
Title: Imambara
Review: Imambara is a very beautiful page in the history of Lucknow, in which artists have presented their artistry in a very beautiful way.

Name: Shubh
Title: स्वच्छ भारत अभियान
Review: Wonderful view Amazing amazing example of architecture bhul bhulaiya is really fabulous you can enjoy the sunset over there on the rooftop. Garden is also beautifulBut only thing you need to keep that in mind you will be allowed only to go up without shoes or slippersAttaching my some of Fabulous click

Name: R1chardN
Title: Impressive architecture
Review: The Bara Imambara is an impressive building.  Even more so as it was built to create work for about 20,000 people during the great famine in the late 1700's'.  An imambara is a tomb for a Muslim holy man.  Although we did not see visitors being given scarves or similar clothes you should dress appropriately for this religious site. Inside the entrance gate is a large formal garden leading to the main building.  The gardens are attractive and well maintained.  The architecture of the main building is beautiful.  There are three storeys that house many grand rooms but we did not go inside..There is a step well that we did not go to as we had previously visited Abhaneri (the home of one of the steepest step wells in India).  To the right of the main building is the Asifi Masjid where only Muslims are allowed.Our visit was part of a city highlights tour with our guide.  It is a fascinating building and well worth taking the time to visit.

Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: MY VISIT TO BADA IMAMBARA (ASAFI IMAMBARA), LUCKNOW
Review: Lucknow was ruled by AwadhNawabs for nearly sixteen decades. Here we still find the glorious tradition and heritage of Nawabs in the form of great mansions, palaces, mosques and gardens. BadaImambara is the star attraction and most popular historic monument in Lucknow. Every day nearly three thousand people visit this beautiful mansion with spacious courtyards, carvings and massive arches. The word Imambara means the residence of Imam or a Muslim priest who leads prayers in a mosque. So it is a prayer hall where religious congregations are held through the month of Muharram and on other important occasions by Shia Muslims. In cities like Cairo, Aleppo and Baghdad this type of prayer hall is seen as an annexe to the main Mosque.  In 1722 the Mughal emperor Muhummad Shah made Mohd. Amin Masawi or Sadat Ali Khan I as Governor of Awadh. Sadat was the grandson of a rich trader from Khorasan in Iran who migrated to India. Thus the rule of AwadhNawabs (a native Governor appointed by Mughal emperors) began. In 1775 the fourth NawabAsaf-ud-Daula ascended the throne. He shifted the capital from Faizabad to Lucknow. During his rule there was a severe famine almost for one decade. To provide employment to starving people Asaf-ud-Daula undertook the construction of this Imambara which was started in 1784 and completed in 1798. Nearly twenty thousand people were employed to complete this huge mansion. The Nawab spent nearly one crore rupees for this construction. Every year he spent four to five lakhs to beautify and maintain this building. He selected an architect from Delhi, Kifayitullah, who used his talent and skills to construct this building in ornamental Mughal style. The western entrance called “Roomi Gate or Turkish Gate” is the west-facing 59 feet high entrance gate with three arches done with lavish decorations.  The  arches have the royal insignia of dual fish carved on them. It was built in ancient Awadhi style and resembles the gateway at Istanbule, Turkey, once the capital of the Roman Byzantine Empire. The word “Roomi” is the changed version of the word “Rome”. On the top of the three-storied Darwaja, a small octagonal place called “Chattri or Umbrella” is seen looking over both sides of the gate. A staircase leads up to it. This place was used for vigilance or for ligting up the gate. Four minarets are seen at four corners.  The 67-foot tall Husainabad clock tower adjacent to Roomi gate was constructed by Nawab Nasir-ud-Din Haider in 1881 to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, the first Lieutenant Governor of the United Provinces of Awadh. The eastern entrance gate was destroyed by the British in 1858 when this building was converted to a military fort.The roof of Imambara was made from rice husk and the roof has been put together with interlocking bricks without any beam or girder. No wood or metal has been used in this building. This is a unique building with arched entrances without having any pillars for support. Unlike the Mughals who used red stone, the Nawabs of Lucknow used limestone which is delicate and can be carved with designs of creepers, various flowers and intricate designs. This building has three halls—China hall with decorative domes, Persian hall with the graves of Nawab’s family and Tazias (replicas of the tombs) of Imam Hussain and Hasan who sacrificed their lives at Karbala in 680 A.D. and the Kharbooza Hall the domed ceiling of which is shaped like a watermelon.  The Persian Hall is the most spacious hall measuring 170x55x15 feet without any supporting columns. In the center of large vaulted Persian hall the graves of Asf-Ud-Daula, his wife and the architect, Khifayoitullah are seen. Just above the central hall one can see eight chambers with different heights permitting the space above to be re-constructed as a labyrinth or maze (called BhulBhulaiya) with interconnected one thousand passage ways through 489 identical doorways. This maze supports the weight of the building. Our guide told us that the royal ladies used to come through secret underground passage to attend the prayers conducted in the central hall. People say that there are many secret passages leading to Gomti River and even up to Agra and Allahabad. It would be better to enter the maze with the help of a guide as there is a risk of losing one’s way in the labyrinth with so many passages and doors.  On the left side of this building there is a step well of Pre-Nawabi Era with five stories called ‘ShahiBaoli” built in Indo-Islamic style. It is a water reservoir used for supplying water to people. This reservoir is connected to Gomti River. Only the topmost two stories of the step well are seen and the three stories are under water. On the right side of the building there is Asifi Masjid where only Muslims are permitted. This monument is open from 6.00 a.m. to 5.00 p.m. One should go in decent dress to visit this sacred religious place. The entry fee is rs.50/- per person and Rs.500/- for NRIs. It would be better to take the help of a guide. We bought a ticket from U.P. Tourism office at 400/- per person. They will provide the vehicle along with the guide. We need not pay the entrance and parking fee. Of course only historic monuments are included in the schedule and not temples or parks. This monument is really a worth seeing construction with many unique features and is a typical specimen of the Indo-Mughal architecture.

Name: Tom B
Title: It's okay - didn't think it was amazing.
Review: This is obviously a very important piece of Lucknow history but as a tourist it wasn't amazing to go around.  I must add that we had a tour guide for the first part which I believe everyone probably gets - he was amazing and by far the best part of the experience.

Name: Sarika
Title: Amusing visit
Review: I went to Imambara with my family. It was truly amazing to explore it. The guide we hired explained us stories and beliefs behind the architecture and artefacts present in the Imambara. It had a hallway where one can hear whisperings so loud and clear regardless of the long distance present in between the source of sound and the listener. The labyrinth present was cool to explore and without a guide one can surely get lost. It also had a stepping well and one can see the person's reflection in the well, who is standing outside of the gate from inside. Overall its a nice place to explore on a fine day. Also the monument is aesthetically pleasing as the architecture is remarkable.

Name: MPJ
Title: Excellent place to visit and get a glimpse of the past glory of India in full splendor
Review: Enjoyed every moment of our stay. Will need at least 6 days stay at Lucknow if you have to do justice to your trip to Lucknow.

Name: Francesco T
Title: Wonderful history
Review: The architecture is stunning and the preservation of this site has been very good.  You can opt for a guide but I didn't need one. Reading the history of why this was built was very interesting - you need to go there to find out!

Name: GRVARCH
Title: A good historical bulding
Review: This place is a good attraction in Lucknow.Entry fee is 50 rs.It's premises is vast and many other buildings are inside it.Beware of guides they can cheat you.They forced to hire them with min. 125 rs.With it's entry ticket, you can see Chhota Imambara also for free.

Name: shakeela bano
Title: gud place
Review: wonderful city great people by the language and neuter special about food that awadhi food is awesome i really enjoyed and like it very much.....

Name: Mitesh
Title: Imambara
Review: A staircase from outside leads to a series of labyrinths known as Bhool-Bhulaiyan, which is a complicated entanglement of zig-zag passages. Visitors are advised to visit only with authorised guides.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Iconic
Review: Lucknow's Iconic landmark that should not be given a miss .You need to buy one ticket that holds good for also Chotta Imambara too.One can take pictures all through of great architecture  as well as religious objects inside  .

Name: Anuradha
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: Excellent Awadhi architectural style with grand complex consisting of Imambara, masjid, a beautiful Baoli and labyrinth going up to the top floor of the Imambara. The view from the top was stunning. A must visit place.

Name: Climber67448047151
Title: City of Nawabs
Review: Mesmerizing architecture and beautiful landscape.  Bhool Bhulaiya - A must visit place in Lucknow apart from other places in the city.  One can also go to Chowk which is at stone throw distance and enjoy authentic lucknowi cuisine

Name: Steven R
Title: Beautiful buildings and gardens
Review: Very interesting and well preserved buildings and beautifully maintained gardens. A very impressive vaulted ("unsupported") ceiling in the grand hall and interesting exhibits in some of the alcoves. Well worth the visit.

Name: Manojaero
Title: Grand Heritage
Review: A great structure of all time. If story of Asaf Ud Daula, nawab who built this grand building, as told during visit is true then he was also a great ruler. There was saying in his period "jiske na da maula usko de Asaf Ud Daula" meaning " even if God is not taking care of anyone then Asaf Us Daula takes care of him".

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Historic site
Review: Historic site. Easy access from KD Singh metro station. Ample parking available. Unique construction. Must visit

Name: Ian b
Title: definitely worth visiting
Review: Spent a really nice morning here. Guide was excellent. very interesting place. Shame it never stopped raining!

Name: Azhar
Title: Bara imambara
Review: There is actually 4 things main is Bara Imambara, Bhul Bhulaiya, Asifi Masjid and Baowli it's all build by awad 4th Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula it's made by Iran's architecture it's completed in 11 years.It's really beautiful when ever you went Lucknow must visit here❤️❤️❤️

Name: secret s
Title: Nice plc
Review: Heart of lucknow ....iam veey happy feel the nawabi touch in this city...........bara imambara is nice plc  for feel good..

Name: niya27
Title: Must Visit Place
Review: There are three things to see in bada imambada - baoli, bhul bhulaiya and imambada. Hiring a guide is must to enter bhul bhuliya. The rate of guide is fixed and depends on number of persons. Photography is allowed everywhere.

Name: Deepak the traveller
Title: Awesome place
Review: I was not very keen to visit this place, however I am glad I did visit. It’s superbly but and one can see the architecture which has imprints Of Moghuals. A must see if you are in Lucknow.

Name: Tanvi
Title: A most visit place
Review: I visited here with my husband and kids . Architecture is beautiful . Bhulbhulaya was fun . We also took a guide who helped us to explore this place ...

Name: K72
Title: Interesting buildings
Review: The buildings in this complex are interesting in design. The great assembly hall is a large hall unsupported by any pillars. Take the steps up and explore the labyrinth and see how this architectural feat was achieved. The surrounding area is also very interesting with lovely buildings and gateways. It's a very pretty area.Entrance was 500rupees and you must have a guide.Shoes off to explore. The mosque was only open for pryaers, not visitors.

Name: NLinNZ
Title: Much better than expected
Review: We stopped off to have a quick visit and I am very glad we did. At first it didnt feel very nice. Lots of beggars, needed cash for tickets which we didnt have, didnt see any women at first and the men were staring. When we decided to leave the guide came up and started showing us the labyrinth and the history and it became really interesting and felt safe. I normally dont use guides but in this case I really recommend to understand the history of the place and to get out of the labyrinth!

Name: Dr P K Mehrotra
Title: Bhool Bhulaiya
Review: A visit to Lucknow without visiting Bara Imambara famous for its Bhool Bhulaiya, is incomplete. A monument with fantastic architecture and history. Advisable to take a guided tour.

Name: engineertripster
Title: Worth a visit when you are at Lucknow
Review: We arrived at the Bara Imambara. There are 3 main sections - Baoli well, Labyrinth and Asafi Mosque. You will need to take a guide here - the good thing is the guide prices are fixed, however, each section has a different guide and price. We enjoyed the architecture of the Baoli well. In the Labyrinth(Bhool-Bhulaiya), do take the guide as it is well worth it. They will also leave you to find your way out (don't worry, they will be around ;) ). It's a good experience overall and gets completed in around 1 hour.

Name: David
Title: Worth seeing historical place
Review: Bada imamabara is one of the top recommendation to visit. It is very nice and worth visiting it. It was neat and clean.

Name: Sarbajit
Title: An architectural marvel
Review: The most popular tourist destination of Lucknow n rightfully so. Very beautiful and well maintained. The kids would love the place specially the Bhool Bhulaiyaan but it's advisable to take a guide to get a complete experience.

Name: Chandra P
Title: Overwhelming
Review: The place is huge.  The architecture is magnificent and fairly well preserved.  This must have been quite spectacular in era that the rulers were here.  It is well worth visiting if you are in Lucknow.

Name: chikpick
Title: Good to visit once...
Review: Dress decently and modestly. On entering it gives a very grand view but not so well maintained. Taking a guide is a chaos. Also a much hyped "bhul bhulaiyya" is so much overcrowded that one loses the feel of it. Avoid fridays as it is quite crowded.

Name: Hemant M
Title: Imposing presence
Review: The bada imambara is well worth a visit, it has an imposing presence and gives a great feeling of its historical significance. Very conveniently located it can be visited very easily.Avoid the Bhool Bhulaiyan, it was a very bad experience. The entire bhoolbhulaiyan is really narrow and claustrophbic but the worst part is it stinks of sweat and grime and make it impossible to stay there but once youre in youre trapped till the guide takes you out. Not worth getting in, Enjoy the Imambara and its features like the Jal Mahal which is beautiful if tall and a no of steps.

Name: Kehren Eade
Title: Amazing
Review: We never expected this unbelievable architecture in Lucknow. It was expansive, interesting, unique, fascinating. NOT to be missed!

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Are h
Review: The Bara Imambara of Lucknow is one of the most famous monuments of the city. Also known as Asfi Imambara, after the name ofafter the name of the Nawab of Lucknow who got it constructed, important place of worship for the Muslims The Imambara is primarily known for its incredible maze, known as Bhul Bhulaiya locally, which is located on the upper floor of the monument. It is said that there are 1024 ways to get inside.very good architecture design.

Name: TJRDunne
Title: Impressive
Review: Such an impressive sight and place to explore. We didn't take or felt we needed a guide. You have to hand your shoes at the outdoor counter before you go in. Often closed on holidays, so check ahead of your visit, well worth it.

Name: naveed
Title: Wow
Review: Bara imambara is lucknow s one of the bestest monument built by mughal emperor.This is UNESCO s one of the best building and I love the weather there and such a huge feeling there

Name: Ani397
Title: Great place
Review: Nice historic place..beautifully made and designed architecture..A must visit if you visit Lucknow..

Name: ShikshaC
Title: The main attraction of Lucknow…
Review: I visited Bara Imambara on my visit to Lucknow during the evening. As it was near closing time we had to go in a guided group tour of the place. Also couples need to mandatorily take a guide here. The place has good architecture with the Baoli and Bhul Bhulaiya being the main attractions. The place also has a mosque in its compound along with the famous Rumi Darwaza. Also you need to take off your shoes when visiting the place.

Name: Mr traveler
Title: Awesome place
Review: Visited this place after a long time with some friends and we enjoyed a lot. A must visit destination in lucknow. You can actually feel the old nawabi style. The Grandness of the hall and exhibits are good. What a feeling to be at Bara imambara( bhool bhualiya).

Name: viky570
Title: Memorable Place
Review: We visited and enjoyed a lot in this place. Historical memory has captured in mind, it's very nice. Good to see..

Name: Nishant Dwivedi
Title: Ancient architecture.
Review: If you are looking for an archaeological site her you should come. Making of this site is completely different from any other space in India, you can feel the vibes of vintage Lucknow

Name: Sarah H
Title: Expensive, but interesting!
Review: The Bara Imambara is one of Lucknow's most well known buildings, and is worth a visit.It costs 500r to enter as a foreigner (much steeper than the 50r for Indian's), but it's easy to spend a few hours exploring, and is ultimately worth the money.I particularly enjoyed the Labyrinth on the top floor of the maze, great fun to find your way around!

Name: umalaviya
Title: A must visit place in Lucknow
Review: one of the most famous monuments of Lucknow is Bara Imambara. Bara Imambara is very famous for its incredible maze, known by the name “Bhul Bhulaiya “ and is located on the first floor of this monument. Bhul Bhulaiya has around 1024 ways to get inside but only two ways to come out. People can also view the grave of Nawab Asaf-Ud-Dowlah and his crown, kept in the middle of the hall. This Monument is famous for its religious as well as architectural importance. Bara Imambara is the largest Civil structure that is made without the use of wood or metal and is still standing without the support of beams. It is considered an an outstanding specimen of engineering and the best example of the Mughal Architecture.It is a worth seeing place of Lucknow.

Name: RAMESHSHIRALI
Title: WORTH VISITING
Review: Bara Imambara, Asifi Mosque, Bhul Bhulaiya, Baoli are all very interesting monuments.A guided tour is recommended, requires atleast 2 hrs to cover the place.

Name: ghoomboom
Title: good historical place to visit
Review: Try to make an inclusive visit to all places that are around. An Auto will take you around for a nominal charge. A horse cart is also an option.

Name: rogerl044
Title: Wonderful building
Review: One can only be impressed by the skill of the builders who construct and design these building. I think you need a guide but it will be worth it. Try not to rush and enjoy the scale of the building and decorations around you.

Name: exposure_with_twinkle
Title: Khoobsurat-e-lucknow
Review: All can visit this place . This place is the AAN BAN n Shaan of lucknow . ❤This place is the heart of lucknow. ❤

Name: FeatureSM
Title: Day out with friends
Review: We went over there to see bhul bhulaiyaa.It is said that there are numerous ways to enter the monument but you will get mingled and can't comeback on same track..so it's compulsory to take guide over there.Must visit place in old Lucknow

Name: Ashok S
Title: Tourist
Review: Visit to Bhool Bhoolayya above Bara Imam highly recommended with authorised guide available at Rs100/

Name: scud56
Title: Disappointing...
Review: I visited this place some time ago and really enjoyed my visit.. However, this time around I was disappointed to learn that the admission price was ~£5 per person. Furthermore, you could no longer take a camera into the main hall or visit the labyrinth/rooftop above the hall.Came away felling robbed this time around!

Name: SunnyandBuster
Title: Huge mosque and gate
Review: The grounds here are extensive and include an impressive massive ornamental gate called the Rumi Darwaza. We were told no photos but noticed all the other visitors were taking pictures with their cameras without incident. You are not able to bring in an actual camera but they don’t prevent phones (with cameras). Head covering was not required for us here. There is a really cool labyrinth to explore but be sure to have someone with you.

Name: Mayank Gupta
Title: One time visit
Review: Bhool bhulaiya is good and must visit. Architecture wise nice to see but getting worn off. Go atleast once if you have time in Lucknow. I dont think so you will remember any history but a guide is a must

Name: varunamayya1
Title: Beautiful architecture.
Review: Loved the place. Would have preferred if they had audio guide available too to get more details on the history of the place. However, I guess you will need a person as a guide in the Bhool Bhulaiya so that you do not get lost.

Name: Dibyendu87
Title: Best place in Lucknow
Review: The best place in lucknow. This imambara has three portions with separate entry tickets. 1.Bauli 2.Imambara 3. Bhool Bhoolaiya. The bhool bhoolaiya is amazing. You can easily lose your way out inside. So better to take a guide. It will take atleast 2.5hrs to cover the Bara Imambara. You can buy a combined ticket of Rs 50 which also  include entry to chota imambara, Picture gallery just within 1km of Bara Imambara. Beware of fake guides and e rickshaw drivers posing as guide as they don't have the permission to enter the monuments. official guide is available inside the monument.

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Historical visit
Review: If you love historical places and architecture, this is a must visit place. The architectural beauty is amazing. The place is truly rich in culture. And the history behind the place is interesting too. Suggestion: Hire a guide especially when visiting the labyrinth, it will be much more fun and exciting

Name: LUCKNOWKAZAYAKA
Title: Nice Place
Review: Must VisitLucknow Ki Famous Place Nice PlaceMust GoLucknow Ka Famous Place Beautiful Structure#LUCKNOWKAZAYAKA- DRANIMESHVERMA

Name: Shardul Bahuguna
Title: Mesmerizing piece of history, terribly disappointing tour
Review: I visited Bada Imambara to revisit the place I had been to, more than 25 years ago and was expecting a similarly exciting tour of Bhul Bhulaiya along with the baoli.The buildings are legendary, the architecture impeccable and the history associated with it is remarkable.But the overall tour was disappointing. May be I was unlucky to get a terrible guide. But the tour was very short compared to what I had see all those years ago. In fact lot of details I remembered, I had to ask the guide and he did not know off. he finally told us that government has shortened the tours. Visit the place for the fascinating monuments but don't bank too much on the tour guides.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: History revisited
Review: This is one of the famous places in Lucknow. One must visit it to know the history & heritage of the city and ancient times. Good architecture and sufficient place to roam around and see the whole area. I should say it’s must visit place.

Name: Kuldeep Y
Title: Bara Imambara
Review: Nice place. If you are in Lucknow then a good place to visit. No trouble from the tour guides. Friendly place. Tour guides are available at reasonable rates.

Name: Virus King
Title: Lucknow ki shaan
Review: Excellent place to explore... i like this place... awesome location. also good for photography. thnks

Name: Manava
Title: Historic
Review: It is a lovely historic place. Decently maintained. Takes you back in time. It is of religious importance to many. One of the few monuments to see in Lucknow.

Name: JPHStVincent
Title: Awesome
Review: It is an awesome place. Even the gatehouse is a fantastic thing, so you are impressed well before you get to the main building. That is just astonishing. I was not expecting the so-called labyrinth to be up to much, but it really is a labyrinth, but on that is upstairs and three-dimensional, spreading over several floors. Superb views once you get to the top and well worth the effort. The only annoyance about this place is that they don't allow taking of photos with real cameras, but allow any kind of photo with a phone.

Name: Shahnwaz K
Title: Historical Lucknow ki Shaan
Review: Excellent place to watch...Worth going there to roam around Imambara and Bhul Bhulaiyya..A monument to know some history of Nawabs of Awadh... and the best thing is Roomi Gate adjacent to it, by which Lucknow is known.

Name: DSehgal
Title: Amazing Architecture!
Review: This monument, built to provide employment to people at a time of famine is an architectural marvel. Do hire a guide and try to find your way through the maze. Highly recommended.

Name: subbu11
Title: Bara imambara heritage history of Persian engineering and architecture. T
Review: he most interesting thing is, it has no pillars and the halls are huge and huge! There are said to be 1024 secret paths! Make sure you hire a guide to get that enquisite juices! Attaching some marvellous Persian architecture engineering!

Name: Abdulhameed A
Title: Amazing building
Review: An Amazing building structure with mazes like tunnels. The building dates back to before 1800. It contains a mosque and a hall for shia Muslim

Name: Manasvi K
Title: Spectacular Morning Walk Experience
Review: Went there for morning walk with family. Loved the experience. There is enough greenery to keep you fascinated and engaged while keeping the smog at bay. You can go there for walks, runs or bicycling. You can even rent the bikes if you want. We went early morning which was great because we didn’t have to pay the tickets and it was not very crowded. Most people there were with families for morning walks as well. It is well maintained with some food options inside the venue as well. I’d love to go there again on my next trip to Lucknow. No tickets before 8 am I believe! And a walk here can be a great start to your day especially before it gets too hot.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Grand and Sprawling
Review: This park is designed on the pattern of London's Hyde Park, and is vast and very green. There are excellent walking, jogging and cycling tracks inside. There are many water bodies too, and a grand statue of Janeshwar Mishra. The best park in Lucknow undoubtedly!

Name: SAGAR GANDHI
Title: walk
Review: nice ambiance and place, very clean and hygienic place for the family to visit. Jai Hind Jai Bharat.....

Name: Ashish Y
Title: Everyone must visit this beautiful. Top 10 places to viait in Lucknow.
Review: Largest park in Asia pacific, state of the art, world class standards, lush green forest spread over 375 Acres at the bank of river gomti. Surpqssing beauty it is, a recreational venue to each one of us. Everyone must visit thia place to feel the difference within a beautiful city.

Name: Mukul Agrawal
Title: Excellent city park
Review: A large well maintained park within the city, worth visiting. Electric golf cart is available for touring the park, it is very convenient

Name: Naveen T
Title: There is something for every member of the family
Review: A vast Park with amusement , boating , cycling , exercise , eating out, and jogging track all available at one place. dense greenery and beautiful natural surroundings provide relief to frayed nerves and relax the mind.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Huge park with several attractions…
Review: I visited Janeshwar Mishra park on a Sunday evening and the place is just huge to explore. Their are several water bodies, trees, children park, a jet and a very high Indian National flag located within the park. There is a nominal entry charge but the park is well maintained due to the same. There is a facility to take cycles for hote or golf carts to see the complete park and would definitely recommend taking one of these if you want to explore the compete park.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Average experience
Review: Nice and huge park. In evenings, facilities could be improved. No proper light facilities in evening around 7 PM.

Name: Aman J
Title: City Centre Park
Review: A delight it was, in the middle of the city to come up with a maintained park, with the lake around, it was a beautiful experience. Hope it maintains it high standards.

Name: Khilesh C
Title: Excellent for walks
Review: Really a large size park with plenty of space for walks. A limited area also has synthetic track for running and walking.

Name: RITU SAREEN
Title: lovely
Review: it s lovely and is very close to the main city and a lovely area to spend some time with your family . you should give it a try for sure there is boating as well ....... the ticket is cheap,,,, and good to go

Name: Jaswinder Singh
Title: Huge Huge park!
Review: The park is huge and you just can not complete a walk around it. It is a fun family palace, for boating and stuff. However not very maintained.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Good outdoor place
Review: Very good to hand out with friends and family. boar=ting option is also available, nice view at night

Name: Avimanyu Basu
Title: nice experience
Review: the place is soothing and ideal for an evening or a morning walk. we felt safe and the place is appropriate for kids

Name: Satyam S
Title: Peace & Blissful
Review: There is peace and bliss one can feel in this park,especially in the evening . I felt that the park deserves nature lovers .

Name: HD bro
Title: Nice place it is very beautiful place
Review: This park is very beautiful place it is very good park to enjoy your evening nice place this , view is also good

Name: Prakash
Title: Nice view
Review: Visited Lucknow with family to explore the Lucknow tourist places. Clean city n cooperative people's. Someone told us that u must visit janeshwar Mishra park . The park is Asia's largest park. Tooks entire day to complete tour of the park. Really we enjoyed there a lot . Best park in Lucknow.

Name: Tanvi
Title: One of the best place in Lucknow
Review: It is one of the best place in Lucknow . We enjoyed a lot here . Boating was really fun . My kids were enjoyed a lot . Garden is well maintained and clean also .

Name: RAJAT SINGH
Title: Awesome place, must visit
Review: Hey there...This park is Asia's largest park.You have to give whole day for complete tour of the park.Night lighting and sounds I like the most and yeah I'll suggest if you are going to visit then must take cycle from gate number 4 and take a round of whole park.

Name: exploring the best
Title: One more addition in Lucknow's beauty
Review: One of the finest place in lucknow to spend your evening with your near and dear one's. The best park in Lucknow. It's so green you can see so many birds here. The atmosphere of the park is also good. There is car parking available here and if you're tired and can't walk too much or with an elderly person who can't walk then you can use the facility of their carts which are available in gate no. 2 and 3. Overall it's a really good park. This place become even more beautiful at the time of sun set. You can go and enjoy the beauty of this park if you want to be surrounded by nature!

Name: chikpick
Title: Grand Park...
Review: Visited this park in the evening. A great and well maintained park with beautifully lined paths, lights and also some light music. There is boating also but since it was late evening we couldn't do so. Good toilet facilities. Also cafeteria is there. All in all a good place for evening strolls, morning jogs, leisure and picnics.

Name: Deepak S
Title: Lucknow sightseeing
Review: Nice and clean place to visit with family. Must keep 3-4 hours for walk around the park. Be mindful of young children.

Name: 780amber
Title: Awesome park
Review: Must visit place when in lucknow for outing in the evening,lot of stalls near by to eat good and healthy food and you can do boating as well.

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Fun
Review: Amazing ambience for family picnic . Good food, peaceful weather and ambience. Running tracks are very good for athletes . Also swings available are for different age groups which makes it even better. Very aesthetic location with boating facility available

Name: geeta s
Title: Lucknow's asset
Review: Janeshwar Mishra Park is the pride of Lucknow. It's lush green grounds, grooves, fruit trees, water bodies with colourful fish, open gym, children's area, rubber track, war tanks and plane and immensity leaves one awestruck. Monsoons wash the greens and enhance not only beauty but freshness. Taking morning walks and exercising is a great experience here. Mornings bring alive the chirping and twittering of birds..! Indeed a gift for ucknowites. Evenings attract picnikers and fun seekers.

Name: kumar
Title: Largest entertainment park of Lucknow
Review: A must visit place in lucknow. An ideal place for picnic.There is a beautiful lake and also a boat club in this park. Due to very large area of the park some of the portion is still to be developed.Overall this park is an ideal place for weekend outings specially in winter season.

Name: devashish
Title: Very Good park for picnic
Review: Very good park for picnic with lakes, gardens and benches. The advantage is that you can reach here easily

Name: Neelesh Srivastava
Title: nice place to hangout
Review: good place in the neighborhood of gomti nagar. Neat and clean, well developed and also battery-operated vehicles are available for old people.

Name: ranvirsinghrathore
Title: awesome amazing
Review: best time morning and evening for walk purpose otherwise you can enjoy with family boating not working may be some issue

Name: Steven R
Title: Massive Park.
Review: The park  is huge to walk around.There are a few lakes full of carp.A few different flowering bushes and lots of grass to sit on.Very quiet if thats what you want.

Name: M. M. KHAN
Title: Park for everyone
Review: It's a large park situated at Gomti Nagar.entry ticket price is Rs.10.A big lake with sitting area around it.a big tricolor and big statue of janeshwar mishra are in the middle.Rental cycle and boating facilities available here.it is not possible for anyone to cover whole park by foot, battery operated scooters are there.Playing area for kids, teenagers are good.Everyone can spend good time here.Once must visit

Name: tickettoamoment
Title: Good place to hangout
Review: I visited this place twice. But it's quite huge park that I didn't see this place closely. But what i have seen in this park is enough. Better luck next time I would like to roam all around this park. 🤩🤣

Name: Dipanshu Awasthi
Title: Your next door Singapore
Review: This place is wow !! Go there on a cool evening and you will would want to stay there forever. Perfect place to spend time with your family. It has a little place for kids too.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Lush green
Review: Urban park and it claims to be one of the largest garden. Park has a variety of plants and birds flocking the garden

Name: My experiences m
Title: Best park
Review: Best park in lucknow. Go there and enjoy the greenery there. You will feel amazing with your family.

Name: Kais Khan
Title: Not bad
Review: Everything was good but we feel  little bit dirty things were expensive people were cheating take care yourself

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: AWESOME
Review: One of the amazing and wonderful place in lucknow. Very good environment here so everyone can enjoy whole day.

Name: Sandeep Kumar
Title: A amazing place for enjoying whole day
Review: I visited here in last year enjoying alot with my friend there is so many place for resting,for picnic,for time spending,for waiting someone.There is large area of ground which is looking awesome

Name: vinybhu
Title: Awesome place in lucknow
Review: I have visited park several times solo as well as with my wife. It is one of the best place to visit in lucknow. In summer evening and morning are best times. In winter and monsoon you may be there throughout the day. Water and canteen facilities are there. Boating and cycling facilities are also available. Children will have good times as a lot of attractions are available for children. Thee are activities designed for children. The park is spread across several acres so you cannot visit it in one complete day. Frequent visit is recommended if you live in lucknow. Place has a lot of moments for couples and everyone.In monsoon you will enjoy the place because its awesome in rainy season. A lot of waahrooms are available along each tracks and they are near ans clean. This place is recommend for every age group be it children , old , couples or morning and evening walkers. The park has blogging tracks which are very helpful if you want to do jogging everyday. The park become very romantic in evening when light become glowing Whenever you visit park make sure to be there at least till 7:00 PM. In evening it become very pleasant and wind make it delightful and peaceful.Boating is very pleasant experience. You can do paddle boating or motorboating. Here you will find almost all types of trees arranged in very beautiful manner. This park is best for photography. If you have camera then must take it. You will find several places for awesome photography.

Name: P singh
Title: Review
Review: Very nice park for morning walk and exercise. It is situated in a large area with lots of trees and flowers.

Name: Prafful Gupta
Title: Evening walk
Review: The place has been maintained well enough to give serene environment of lush greens in the mid of the city. You can go here to spend your evenings in peace away from the hustle and bustle of the town.

Name: brijendra96moef
Title: A place worth frequenting
Review: Located near sinous curves of Gomti river in a sprawling area of more than 250 acres of green boon provided to now modernised Lucknow. Well manicured lawns with winding pathways and attractive walking arena alongwith open air gymnasium attracts lot many visitors on regular basis. It will take atleast few hours to visit the area due to vastness of area. Though maintenance of arena is now posing problem to the LDA due to sustainability aspect were not provided appropriate thoughts during creation period.

Name: Dinesh Sinha
Title: Worth seeing.
Review: The park has been beautifully designed, developed and maintained.Best park in Lucknow. One must visit.

Name: Nitin S
Title: Family fun
Review: Good place to enjoy with family and friends. There are many options for small kids and children up to 14 .

Name: saurabh k
Title: Largest park of Asia
Review: It is one of the largest park in Asia situated in Gomatinagar area. Entry fee is about ₹10-15.You  may also visit this to see Uttar pradesh tallest flag.If you are Indian you will absolutely feel proud on seeing the flag.

Name: Dev Misra
Title: Pre wedding
Review: I went there for pre wedding shoot found it really awesome. Nice locations and views with enough security and ample parking space.

Name: Cavalier3C
Title: To show park to visiting friends from other city.
Review: The park is very large with lawns, water bodies, neat tracks, pathways, seating and covered Shelters at intervals. The beauty starts from the entry which is paid with proper parking areas and vendors seeking juices, fruits and tea vendors. The park is well laid out, very well maintained clean and organised. Large statue, tank and fighter plane are attractions along with one of the largest /tallest Tirana. Days outing, picnic, healthy walks and yoga sessions it is an ideal place. Never overcrowded.

Name: AJAY KUMAR A
Title: Very resourceful park
Review: A very large park, Good enough for morning walk or evening roaming, installed some children swings. Have an small lake like water body, fountains and paddle boating, full of greenery.

Name: Jen H
Title: Maybe don’t visit in the middle of the day
Review: This is a very large well maintained park with a big playground for children and other entertainment but it is very hot in the middle of the day so best to visit in the morning or early evening.

Name: GoPlaces65661648539
Title: A fine example of civic responsibility and moral leadership
Review: We were moved by the purpose of this memorial and equally impressed by its fine architectural and construction marvel.

Name: abs0110
Title: Fun
Review: Fun place to hang out with family and friends. Kids will love the ample open space. Lot of options to eat.

Name: Raaz_Still_Raaz
Title: Relaxing, Meditation and Joggers Park
Review: In the morning one can enjoy the beautiful sunrise and do yoga meditation in a cool calm and peaceful environment. In the evening can have great fun with family and kids. Main attractions-- Mig fighter, A very tall National flag. Boating is also available.

Name: ASHISH PATEL
Title: Perfect spot for picnic with friends and family
Review: Very large area and well maintained park. Nice for morning walks and exercise as well as has a large and unique play area for kids. It is very interesting to know that children play area has no stairs to climb on any of the rides all have unique ropes to climb. Atmosphere is also very good here and many activity areas are available. Huge parking spaces are also available in front of every gate of the park. Boating is also available in the park entry to be made from gate no. 4 for boating. Nice get together place. Must visit place in Lucknow.

Name: Jeevan Shanbhag
Title: Very nice and big Park
Review: Nicely maintained Park with very big statue of Janeshwar Mishra, Lake, Indian Flag etc. This park is spread over a big area and difficult to cover the entire park.

Name: shivshankarsingh
Title: Large park lacking in civic amenities
Review: This is a  large and green  park with lots of flora , water body too but could not be properly kept due to neglect and poor supervision. No proper drinking water, improper parking and lots of garbage around make it look so poor and ugly.

Name: Sharil I
Title: Enjoyment with family on a weekend
Review: This is the most prominent recreational place in the city. While it is a strict family place to visit you can certainly go for solo, couple and friendly visits too. Here you have the option of sitting, enjoying, relaxing and leisurely giving time to the family.

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: jogging time
Review: the park is famous for its events like small marathon runs , a good park to run and enjoy the greenery around the park

Name: rajatkant
Title: a park which lucknow needed but did not deserve
Review: a grand public space and equally well maintained and used by people of all ages.mostly used in the mornings and evenings.wish they could add a food court too.

Name: Harshit
Title: Fun time
Review: This is very exciting park it contains boating and it is also good that it is having a good cycling track and people also come for walking and it also contain a huge india flag which shows alot of respect

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: A day at the Janeshwar mishra park.
Review: Very nice place for kids to enjoy, my daughter was not ready to leave the place, I had to bribe her for leaving the place.

Name: Abhinav D
Title: Absolute Luxury !
Review: Its an absolute luxury after coming from metro cities where even imagining a park of this size & infra is not possible !Ideal place for morning /Evening walk or a cycle ride around the park , Has a Gym , Boating option as well !

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Garden to see
Review: A nicely landscaped area with lakes, cycling and walking tracks, benches to relax and trees to cool the surroundings.

Name: Himanshu Rao
Title: Nice place Evening Walk
Review: This place is too big, spread over a vast area, you have to devote 2 full days if going to cover it on feet. Beautiful Landscape, fresh n clean lake with nicely designed greenery, tracks n pathways.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Good chill place
Review: If you all are sitting ideal and fell boring so visit janeshar park I is so big park you leg will tied visit full park it is best for picnic will maintained park no waste product you see in park if you are planning to visit the place keep so eatable place to feed fish into the river there many colourful fishies every visit keep so food for fish so visit the I hope you all love the place thanks

Name: Aman Agarwal
Title: Awesome
Review: Yesterday i went to this park with my friends . And it was just superb experience, amazing greenery , nice walking track, perfect picnic spot , very well maintained. Enjoyed alot

Name: Madhavi A
Title: Very impressive open space within Lucknow city
Review: Wonderful for long walks, games or just sitting down to enjoy some fresh air. The entry fee is only nominal ten rupees. Maybe LDA can consider blocking some play space here for children from public schools and low income families without charging them any fees - even allocating space for a few hours every day will help these children also to access the park just as their better endowed brothers and sisters are able to do.

Name: Huzefa
Title: Giant of a part
Review: some greens, some water bodies, clean walkways, limited shade... but ok for an evening stroll. Of course on Sundays is crazy crowded

Name: Baquar I
Title: Good place for picnic with Family and friends
Review: This place is vast and spread far and wide, it is best if you spare a full day for the visit.There is boat ride , cycle ride, play zone for kids, MIG 21, Rose garden, Battle Tank, you can feed the fish, Statue of Janeshwar Mishra.In winter you can enjoy for the day, however in summer it is best to visit in evening.Found the bath room clean, I might have been lucky, but someone was taking care of the place.Canteen is also good and has variety of options available, does not accept payment by card or wallets.It is a pity that e rickshaw ride is not available for people who would like to afford it, but is only available for people with CONNECTIONS.Old people could have enjoyed the whole park instead of just one section.Good place to go with Family and friends for picnic.

Name: Ideal_Lover
Title: Picnic
Review: Enjoy with sun in winter season.we take lunch and play game.Roaming in group and take a lot of selfie.

Name: Samanvya
Title: very calm and serene place
Review: This is a proper park where you can walk for hours with friends and family. It is huge and has a proper water body right in the middle. Also the park has too many herbs and plants that are actually mosquito repellant therefore in the entire stretch of concrete walkways, you will not encounter much mosquitos. Thoughtfully designed. Also, the national flag is a must watch.

Name: Shashialabur
Title: A lovely place at any time of the day !
Review: This is a very large park and is an ideal place just to relax or for a morning / evening walk or exercise.There are large open spaces with lots of trees, many shaded areas with gazebos which have large benches, ideal for a picnic too.The artificial lake, the huge statue of Janeshwar Mishra and the battle tank at the entrance add a bit of a variety to the place.

Name: Amarkrishna
Title: A good place to relax for all
Review: It is a huge park approximately 370 acres in area. For children there are ample place for playing cricket or football. There are jogging track and cycling track also. For elderly people there were benches at regular intervals. We visited the place in the morning with my son and wife. We all enjoyed the place very differently. Son visited the place for his half marathon running. Wife enjoyed her walk with an eye on plants and tree. I enjoyed a short walk, cycling and sitting on the bench at various points accompanied with snacks.We enjoyed two hours in total.

Name: Gyanendra
Title: Very good park
Review: I travelled on Sunday in the park and enjoy whole day. Very good park in Lucknow. Nature is so beautiful.

Name: anujsharma21
Title: Fun with Family time
Review: Its a romantic place for couples and good place for family to spend a day. It is spread on more than 110 acre of land. And boating is also available there.  Total fun if u r coming with family.

Name: vsrinet
Title: Great Walk and Outings
Review: Excellent park with great facilities for tourists.It has a foid court,though with limited options,but it is a welcome facility.This pati has boating facility too.Visitors can hire bicycles at Rs.10 per hour.It has toilets,clean drinking water,bigger than adjacent  Lohia Park.But Lohia Park is more welk maintained .Since there are security guards from the opening at t am till closing at 8 pm,the place is safe and secure.

Name: PRADEEP R
Title: Green park in city
Review: This is best park in lucknow .entry fees only Rs.10 which is very nominal charge .there have a artificial water lake with fountain looks so nice .you can enjoy there with family or make a plan for picnic there .green n fresh air make beautiful enviornment .must go on

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Beautiful place
Review: One of the finest places for a good environment and it is definitely a place to relax in the morning.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Nice place
Review: This is asia largest park. You will feel proud on seeing such huge flag. I strongly recommend to visit this place at evening.

Title: Neet and Clean park for entertainment.
Review: Very interesting place for walk with family and biggest park in lucknow.it is also safe for morning walk.

Name: sshuklalko
Title: Excellent place for Walk
Review: Beautiful park with lots of greenery.It has beautiful lamps on the path  .Good place for photography . It looks awesome in evening and early morning.

Name: Neeraj166
Title: Everyday morning walk
Review: Excellent ambiance .. greenery everywhere and moreover the walking path isexcellebt along with high.

Name: Mahesh Kulkarni
Title: Biggest Park in Asia - Janeshwar Mishr Park at Lucknow
Review: Largest recreational park in Lucknow, Capital of Uttar Pradesh.Well maintained structureClean water bodiesHuge water fountainsTall statue of Pt. Janeshwar Mishr nestled between middle of the ParkGood jogging tracksComfortable sitting areaNumber of huge lawnsLarge play areas for childrenStreet chaat available at the entranceHealthy diet sprout based eatables available at morning walk timings

Name: Sachin M
Title: Awesome place
Review: Awesome place for outing with kids. Lot of activities for children. Different play area for different age group kids. Nice view ooints for photoshoot. Boating is by luck. Not always funtional. Altogether a fun place for family outing.

Name: Madan Mohan S
Title: good for family outing in lucknow
Review: good for family outing in Lucknow.  you can use boating and also you can play here badminton, cricket.

Name: contactmytraveldiary
Title: Janeshwar Mishra Park
Review: Nothing much to explore here. A huge area with greenery and ponds. Good for people who want to jog in the morning/evening./

Name: S P S
Title: Great amusement park of Lucknow
Review: It is one of the big amusement park of Lucknow where elders can enjoy whole day, children can play outdoor games, swings on jhulas, rides on boats etc.

Name: BPB2012
Title: An attractive park recently constructed
Review: It is a very well conceived and managed park in the city of Lucknow - an addition of recent years in memory of a leading leader of a leading political party. It attracts large number of visitors daily.

Name: Hedonist_Surya
Title: Scenic environment with a clean and maintained environment.
Review: Janeshwar Mishra Park yes its the biggest park in asia till now.The green cover is pretty good alongside it do has a selfie spot area with its own special importance.The park is too big to be covered in a single day and yet its in construction mode but you can go there.The joggers path and the scenic view from the seat behind the waterfalls is enough to blow off all your tension.Believe me it worths coming here(only if you are in group,familyor couple).Often termed as hangout place for couples.Parking facility also availible here at good prices.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Huge and beautiful
Review: This is a huge park and very well maintained. Boating activity is also available here. It’s newly built and a very good place to visit with family and friends.

Name: Vidhuchandola
Title: Very good
Review: The park is very huge and difficult to cover in 1 trip.The visitors should take care as lots of stray Dog are also in the park, earlier there were stray cases of Dog biting also but ptobably now that particlular dog may have been removed from Park

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Very big and huge complex
Review: We were there for picnic with friends and with bigger group.Lake surrounds very good.Indian flag  also very huge.One of the biggest park of Asia.

Name: Ankur P
Title: Good Place to explore in Cold Time
Review: This is a big naturally clean park which give you the feelings of abroad. I think in cold time you may enjoy a lot over here.

Name: rajputprincess
Title: Lovely park to visit in the winter
Review: Clean huge park, good walking trails, good fun even for children as there are lots of swings, fishes in the pond, and plenty of fast food available outside.

Name: kumarnkn
Title: Very peaceful
Review: this is a main attraction of Lucknow.Very big part and peaceful place.There are several gates. Gate number 2, 3,4 has used to enter. For boating  you need to enter from gate 4. You need to atleast 2-3 hours to cover main areas. It is situated  11 Km from Lucknow railway station. You will be enjoy!

Name: randhirt2017
Title: Good place for hangout
Review: When you tell about park,this place is a awesome,good place to spend time with family and friends,if you are going lucknow to see this park

Name: Niraj K
Title: Magnificent Park
Review: Really the then Chief Minister has given a park of which Lucknow can feel proud of. Do not forget to visit this park if you visit Lucknow. Take out atleast 4 hours to enjoy the evening in this park.

Name: ChicLifeByte
Title: Such a well maintained park in India
Review: This one was a pleasent surprise and honestly i was stunned to see such a well maintained park in India. It was a great place to spend the evening. I entered and saw a beautiful river with fountains where I stood for a relaxing time. Light music buzzing on the speakers made the whole experience even more enriching. Greenery galore. Could see a lot of benches as well where I could spot families as well as couples. There was actually something for every age group here. Swings for kids, boating for the grown ups! Absolutely loved my experience!

Name: Niya1315
Title: Big Park
Review: Janeshwar Mishra Park is too big to cover on a single occasion. The lake view is really nice. I visited here on Saturday evening when it was little crowded. A jogging tract is there.

Name: hreela
Title: Not good for family and children
Review: I spent some time in evening hours, and found most of couples were their in the position not suitable for children and family.

Name: Gautam R
Title: Great place to rejuvinate
Review: Park is well equipped with various Jhulas for all age group kids i.e. 0-2 years, 2-4 years, 5-7 years etc.... It is having a artificial jogging track and a pool with GONDOLA boat too.

Name: Rajesh R Kumathekar
Title: Fantastic Lucknow
Review: I visited Lucknow after a good gap, it was official visit and we completed the important work in time and we decided to go for site scenery and come here

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: A commercial hub of Lucknow
Review: While visiting Lucknow one cannot miss this place. It houses lots of commercial complexes and eateries. The place is expensive but comes to life in the evenings. A must visit place while in Lucknow

Name: Rohit B
Title: The best marketplace in Lucknow
Review: There are many market places in Lucknow. While Chowk and Aminabad may be considered more downtown and local, it is the Hazratganj area that is more upmarket and convenient for shoppers. Much better laid out, with less congestion, and wider roads, this place has some of the best eateries in town too. Make this your first shopping stop if pressed for time, and remember to pick local Chikankari (embroidery) work and Itr (perfume) from this area.

Name: flyingwish
Title: Old City Bustle for Shopping
Review: This is a great shopping area for special cotton kurtas (long shirts) which this city is famous for. We went to Janpath Market to do all all clothes shopping in one-stop. Otherwise, the Hazrat Ganj area is very crowded and dirty as in  any old city in India.

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Market with old world charm
Review: Market place in heart of Lucknow. Great for shopping & snacks. Must visit for anyone wanting to purchase Chikankari work

Name: Atasi P
Title: Great Place to hangaround
Review: A great market strip. It was fun too roam the street, do shopping and eat. The local cuisine options are great.

Name: Dr. Mehak Burza
Title: Enjoyable
Review: We had a fun time exploring this place! There were plenty of things to experience. Though the market place was a bit crowded, but we had a truly great time!!

Name: DipuKV
Title: Old world charm
Review: Traipsing around Hazratganj is one of the most pleasant activities in Lucknow. The place is a blend of the modern and the traditional, with its range of options for movies, eating & shopping.

Name: Ashwin
Title: A lovely experience !!
Review: It is like walking down the memory lane !! The food , the shopping experience is amazing.Fantastic !!

Name: John Muriango
Title: OK
Review: Honestly, it has not only some good side, but also some negative side. If I speak, I'll be in trouble, so I recommend you experience it yourself.

Name: Diksha pathak khan
Title: Great place of Lucknow
Review: Family realaxed environment. You can just have a cup of tea and enjoy. Very clean roads. The surrounding have good brands for shopping

Name: Mohit H
Title: The best evening while gunjing
Review: This is the place where you need to be to shop or kill time. They call it gunjing. So did I ! This place has a resemblance to Connaught place Delhi. While CP is a circle. these have straight roads. I guess that is also fine. Totally Different ambience

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Great Evening Market. Delight for Vegetarians
Review: Hajratganj is a great market and visited this place for food and evening shopping. You would find good restaurants for vegetarians here.

Name: Kumar Rahul
Title: Big markets
Review: Very good place for shopping for kids and chikan garments.  And amazing for market of Prince market good experience in

Name: Rohit Gupta
Title: One of awesome place of Lucknow
Review: Can not compare any other area better than Hazratganj in Lucknow and it’s one of oldest area too of Lucknow

Name: DrKlair
Title: Old only whites market
Review: This was the only white market of pre independence India. Has many beautiful old buildings .Best place to shop for traditional Luckhnow garments.

Name: JoyBose
Title: A complete experience for history buffs, food buffs and those into shopping
Review: This is the main market built by the British. It has lots of heritage buildings, many shops having the best brands like Manyavar. Also has Sahu cinema, some good bookshops like universal booksellers, coffee house, etcIt can get crowded in evenings and weekends. It has a lot of delicious eateries as well for having chaat and biryani. Its a nice place for taking a walk with family and buying clothes or simply enjoying the sights. The roads are wide and generally it is kept clean.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Great
Review: Beautiful place with the remnants.of the mughal and british rule. Place is very clean and well maintained. Railways station is not maintained properly but the roads are perfect.

Name: Ranjana
Title: Hazratganj
Review: Hazratganj is the soul of City of nababs Lucknow, Market is very beautiful,also royel cafe Basket chat.

Name: Yasub
Title: Wallah Ya habibi
Review: Heart of cityIf anyone wants to explore then you start walking from blackberrys showroom to Universal bookseller then make a u-turn from GPO crossing and again start from woodland showroom to be back at Bombay dyeing in front of Chief Post Master office, you will get Good walk for health and quality products and eatables.

Name: MOHD MOHSIN
Title: Hazratganj
Review: Hazratganj is a heart of Lucknow. It blend of British and Nawabi Architecture.It's a place where you can meet entire community people and normally people comes to hazratganj to enjoy their weekends or for shopping. .In Hazratganj where you can get lots of restaurant (like Moti mahal , Royal cafe , Ram Asrey sweets etc) ,famous street food point (like Bajpai puri bhandar,  Shukla chat corner, Bombay pav bhaji, Chinese corner, New Shukla tea corner etc) , All brands showroom  (like Tommy , US Polo , Woodlands,  Reebok, Nike,  Puma , Mufti etc)....And mainly Hazratganj called as hub of coaching institute (Medical , Engineering,  UPSC , Bank , Railway etc)..In Hazratganj there is love Lane market which is only for Women Get free WiFi for first 30 minutes. .Some famous Heritage located in Hazratganj like CATHEDRAL CHURCH ,  GPO , VIDHAN SABHA, ST FRANCIS COLLEGE etc

Name: Hemant Gupta
Title: Ganj ki shaam
Review: Reviews for ganj is felt better that reading and writing. You have a feeling 'Mushkuraiye ki aap LUCKNOW me hain..

Name: MPJ
Title: Lucknow visit
Review: Hazratganj is very close to Cark's Avadh hospital where we stayed. Good place for local Chickakari clothes shopping

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Hazratganj
Review: Hazratganj is a popular destination to enjoy. One must visit this location if they have little time.

Name: Sovan D
Title: Hazratganj
Review: Its a unique place smell of kebabs, Mughlai cuisines, Kachoris. Nice place some portion reminds of Connaught Place, New Delhi. Good connectivity by Metro. Nice place to hang out.

Name: Mitesh
Title: Great Market Place
Review: Hazratganj, is the hub and heart of Lucknow in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. In addition to bazaars, it also contains shopping complexes, restaurants, hotels, theaters and offices etc.

Name: Anuradha
Title: Upscale market of Lucknow
Review: A nice market with all the major retail outlets. Old world charm adds to shopping experience. Must eat basket chat at the Royal cafe.

Name: Pawan S
Title: GREAT PLACE IN LUCKNOW
Review: This is a most popular and centre place of Lucknow You can find out all the things which you require for your daily routine like...clothes, ,fashion, ,style, ,,wellness, ,commercial, ,,even all types of dining MUST VISIT IF YOU ARE IN LUCKNOW

Name: Omdutt S
Title: Hazratganj
Review: This is one of the most prominent places in lucknow.  The maine road offers a wide variety of shopping options.  There are  some good places to eat including Royal Cafe and Motimahal that provide good chaat and dining options.  There is a popual Hanuman temple right at the start.  The walk along the road gives a feeling of yesteryears and a mix of traditional and modern ambience.

Name: Ashish Shukla
Title: Ganjing and local food
Review: Had great time Ganjing(as people say while roaming around in Hazratganj). Enjoyed tasty items like Aaloo Tikki at Shukla Chat House and Kachouri at Bajpai Kachauri

Name: niya27
Title: Market place
Review: Hazrat is a place where one person can have true Lucknavi touch. Restaurants, hotels, shops all are there at one place. It can be visited using Lucknow metro. The prices are slightly on the higher side.

Name: David
Title: Great Market to visit
Review: It was a great experience to walk on the main road of Hazarat Ganj. Not much was there in the Jan path market. Have parking garage.

Name: Renana P
Title: A shopping district
Review: A shopping district, mainly for clothing and the traditional Chican embroidery. Visit the store called Ada, on both sides of the road. Dine in the Royal Cafe,

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Bustling market of Lucknow
Review: Hazratganj is a popular market area of Lucknow where you can just stroll on the streets and shop from branded items to local items all in one place. It also had a variety of eating outlets when you get hungry with all the shopping. The place however tends to get crowded and has frequent jams but Lucknow metro has a stop right in the middle of the area.

Name: Swatiib
Title: Heart of Lucknow
Review: This is the heart of Lucknow and from here one gets an access to all that is important in Lucknow. One should visit Hazratganj to get a feel of Lucknow

Name: chikpick
Title: A mix shopping experience
Review: This place gives an experience of both window shopping and street shopping. Some good brands and sarees and chickenkari products can be bought from here. The shops in Janpath are also good for some stylish stuff and some bargaining can also be done. The must have is the chaat at royal cafe and also some kulfi. Some good eating shops are there too.

Name: Mital_Ashish
Title: Shop and Loiter around
Review: Nostalgic memories of the childhood, loitering around in the many many shops, eating joints and Paan & Sweet shops. not to forget the Hanuman mandir

Name: Hemant M
Title: A la Connaught Place Delhi
Review: Place to go shopping of a varied kind, very organised and clean. Lots of eateries, Moti Mahal was a nice beg option. Reminds one of Connaught Place in Delhi in terms of layout

Name: Amit Gupta
Title: Lucknow visit
Review: This is the greatest human made structure in Lucknow the city of Navab. It is situated in the side of Gomati river. It looks very beautiful.

Name: SSNOHWAR
Title: Incredible Service @ Park Avenue store
Review: Simply Nawabi Service-I was traveling to Lucknow for a wedding function.
