Forgot my belt  while packing my stuff. decided to explore the Hazrat Ganj area to find something suitable.while shopping for the belt, I notice one jacket ( half sleeve reversible) in the shelf.upon trying i realize its one size smallar, store service guys checked their stock and said that my size is not available (size 40) got really heart broken.In the meantime Mr Syed ( i think store manager) came from behind and started having conversation with me about the Jacket. As we were their only for 2 days, I asked Syed how he could help us. He immediately checked the stock availability of jacket near my hometown Gurgaon. He manage to find one in Moradabad store, he called the manager  of that store and requested to deliver the jacket to my home address in gurgaon. I was not not very comfortable to pay in advance, because what if i dont receive the product on time, As we were due to travel overseas very next day.You wont believe what Syed did next, He said i could pay after receiving the jacket.which is quite unbelievable, As we didnt know each other, i was simply a walkin customer. within 24 hours jacket was delivered to Gurgaon while i was still in Lucknow.Never experience such warm,sincere & amazing customer service.Will never forgot this experience.Keep it up Team PARK AVENUE TEAM @ Hazrat Ganj# Lucknow

Name: FeatureSM
Title: Centre of Lucknow
Review: Hey guys this is Hazratganj centre of Lucknow amazing place and everything is there For everyone u specially for girls.

Name: regm889
Title: Most popular hanging place in Lucknow
Review: Been here many times to shop, eat, stroll, and sewa chicken, also to Bhajpai Kachadi, really good local breakfast, wide road with new metro now,

Name: Ashok S
Title: Shopping and eating
Review: This is a place where one can do shopping of Chikan Kari dresses and Sarees. Well known shop Ada and small shops on Janapat offer wide choice.This area also has Moti Mahal and Royal cafe well-known eating places of Lucknow.

Name: Pravesh Goswami
Title: Nice place to visit.
Review: One of the main markets in Lucknow. Many famous restaurants & food outlets are here. Attraction for visitors.

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Shopping
Review: Hazratganj, is a major shopping area situated in the heart of Lucknow in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. In addition to bazaars, it also contains shopping complexes, restaurants, hotels, theaters and offices.

Name: Deepinder Singh
Title: Hazrat Ganj is best place in Lucknow
Review: Hazrat ganj is the most happening and crowded place in Lucknow.This is good for shopping from mall as well as you will get large number of variety from small shops like chicken kurta and suits. Designer chappals, jutis.Sahara ganj mall is the biggest mall of Lucknow and it is also situated in Hazratganj.If you are travelling to Lucknow, I recommend you to take hotel in hazarat ganj only.

Name: Manava
Title: Shopping
Review: It is the place for shopping. Inside Janpath market you will get juti, mojdi, bangles, Lucknow kudta and sarees. There are Many options so look for a good vendor/ shop. Prize ranges from 400 to thousands!

Name: geeta s
Title: An Evening in Hazratganj
Review: Hazratganj  was the first market I explored when I came to Lucknow soon after my marriage in 1982. I was as if awestruck by its grandeur , classy looks, glittering lights, huge shops ,tempting eating places,Janpath ,where I loved to sit and enjoy chat or something else....truly Lukhnavi nafasat and people , the church and the elegant Mayfair hall.....all was as if a fantasy at that time as I had come from a very small and simple town of Roorkee. Today, when Lucknow has transformed drastically and there are hordes of departmental store and shopping malls ...the charm of Ganj pulls me still. I find excuses to visit it. Today too I take my guests to this magical spot ....and why not its the revered  feather in the plush plume of  destinations every visitor must go

Name: 383qasimf
Title: Best Place for Shopping
Review: Hazratganj is one of the old and best market place in lucknow. You can find the old architecture buildings and all famous brands here.A must to visit place

Name: Shalini B
Title: The city of Nawabs
Review: Beautiful city with a wonderful metro shuttle joining and connecting mist of the important places in Lucknow... The city retains its essence of happiness and joy of traditional cuisine which includes dahi papadi chaste .. Paani batasha ,Bun Makkhan, kulladdh ki chaaye... Rabadi malai jalebi and other mouth watering sweet savouries... The famous Chikan Kurtas for all age groups is available at a reasonable cost.  Must visit between September to March...

Name: Sanjay B
Title: Historical
Review: What we can say about this place.. because this place no need to introduction...We can visit here for everything you want ..and whenever

Name: traveller n@@wabz@di😎🤘
Title: Evening ppl.kinda place..🥈🥈🥈🥈
Review: This place was very near to my hotel so just thought to take a round in evening...n it was fun to roam around...the best part its a place wid every pocket budget....if u are. Street kinda prson go to lovelane n shop...otherwise almost all high end stores are here....n yes dont forgot to taste royal Cafe basket chat....

Name: vsrinet
Title: Heritage and History
Review: Hazratganj is an iconic shopping centre,well known the world over for its choice of ethnic wear shops,classy eats from street food to chat and in close proximity to Clarks Avadh Hotel.The Universal Book Depot is a hot  favourite for people of all ages,on e can spend hours browsing here and Chander ji,the learned owner,very kindly provides coffee to the regulars!Cafe Coffee Day is close by,as also the Hanuman Temple.There is ample parking(paid).The place is very crowded in the evenings because of its popularity.However,one can easily spend half a day doing shopping,sightseeing,browsing,eating and sipping coffee.

Name: Uday S
Title: Heritage feeling
Review: It was a late evng visit yesterday.. For dinner snacks.. Non veg and sm stroll amongst the old nawabi style architecture well lit by night sky and flash lts

Name: Preeti S
Title: Good market
Review: This is  good place for hangout unlike old Lucknow markets.... some really nice chicken stuff , if looking for exclusive ... not to miss Moti mahal and  Tokri Chaat on Hazrat ganj

Name: Reyan11
Title: Shopping area
Review: It contains bazaars , hotels , shopping complexes and theatres. Famous for chikankari embroidery.various handicrafts are available

Name: Pinki mishra
Title: This is really nice palce in Lucknow
Review: fantastic hazratganj in Lucknow.I really like this. This is really nice place to visit.I am really enjoyed in Hazratganj.

Name: Ashok Handa
Title: An evening stroll in Hazratganj
Review: When ever I visit Lucknow, I make it a point to visit Hazratganj in the late evening. Just a stroll on each side of the wonderful broad road takes you back to the historical Nawaabi era. You may shop / window shop any thing from traditional Chicken dresses to latest brands etc. When tired just sit on the wrought iron benches, eat tradtional fast food like Chaat.GolGappa etc or relax over a coffee in  CafeCoffee Day  I donot know the reason but a cool breeze was blowing in the late evening defying the hot summer of Lucknow.

Name: rupak0309
Title: Good place to hand out
Review: This place is like Connaught place of Lucknow. Very happening and offers good options for food and clothes. You can also shop for perfumes or attars at sugandhco

Name: saurabh k
Title: city centre of Lucknow
Review: if you are History lover you will certainly like this place.You will find every brand showroom from sparky to gucci,zara etc.it is the heart of Lucknow.

Name: Mohit R
Title: Takes you back memory lane
Review: You got to go banking as they say. A stroll.window shopping and eating street food like chana not garam , going to janpatgbto see authentic chikan work is worth. Stop at Chaudhary sweets in winter and have hot jalebi and hot badam.milk.Takes you down memory lane

Name: Mayank S
Title: Best of both worlds
Review: We loved this place for the beautiful old-world charming buildings mixed with all the latest shops and trends you would need. We loved the architecture  the food and everything. It's well connected to the metro. The only problem is the traffic, there's just too much traffic. Good thing is they have a multi level parking to counter that. It's a must visit place in Lucknow.

Name: nisha rawat
Title: Fantastic place
Review: Historical place of Lucknow...made by hazrat mahal (queen of Lucknow)...she was very nice and polite Lady... my favorite place...

Name: AkhilVashist
Title: Old with Modern
Review: Blended with the old structures new developments like parks and market provide a pleasant experience for short visit. delighful eateries like tunda kebabs are not far away either.

Name: Advisor1991
Title: Good Place for sight seeing
Review: This is a good place for friends to have a sight seeing and time spending place.Can be much better with tourist facilities.Roads n transport need to be more tourist friendly.

Name: Prahlad S
Title: New Hazratganj
Review: A must for visit. It looks like new place with wonderful Metro stations and modern stores and shops.

Name: Asim A
Title: Must see
Review: If you are in Lucknow then Hazrat Ganj visit a must.  I loved the walk there in the evening and had one of the best chat in a basket.  Must see!

Name: vikram g
Title: lucknow's market place
Review: it is a shopping market where one can buy chikankari embroidered stuff and have a good time eating the local delicacies like chat/pan/juices/shakes/roasted gram and has a new metro station to boast for easy connectivity from railway station/  airport or all the main localities of lucknow.

Name: gagansharma11
Title: Family Visit
Review: Heart of Lucknow. Lots of showrooms for shopping. I visited with my family. Street Food are awesome.

Name: tickettoamoment
Title: Heart of lucknow ❤
Review: The best place to shop, its costly to shop here. But new trends are here only. The best shops in hazratganj is meena bazaar, madame these two are my first preference. And for college going student there is love lane the material if cloths are not so good but it's fine for college going student. #bestplace to roam in the evening. 💃🏻You can eat from street shops over there and hangout with frnds in the evening is the best part of it.❤

Name: Singh744
Title: Heart of Lucknow
Review: If you know Lucknow, Hazratganj is the heart of the city, "Ganjing" is the word a evolved here only, series of British Era buildings and shops still present there, good this is Metro Connectivity now, due to Metro Ganjing started once again. Highly recomended to visit .....

Name: er_shivamtiwari
Title: Hazratganj Metro Lucknow
Review: excellent connectivity and cleanliness. Metro departs in every 5 mins for either sides.1 Towards Lucknow Airport2 Towards Mushi Pulia via Railway Station & Hazratganjsame lines goes underground from Charbagh (Lucknow Railway Station) till Hazratganj. reat stations are elevated.

Name: FANOUT
Title: GANJING...
Review: thank you LMRC...with you out (oops...under) my way Lucknowites can be back to self....no more snapping and road rages... Tahzeeb please....with summers round the corner do pull out your cottons and go Ganjing.....

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Must do
Review: One of the must do things if you are in Lucknow, walk down Mahatma Gandhi road in Hazratganj - many restaurants and shops.

Name: Jeevan Shanbhag
Title: Best Area for Shopping, Eating,Travelling etc.
Review: One must visit this area when in Lucknow. This place is blessed with very famous Moti Mahal Restaurant, Royal Cafe,Metro Station,Open Air Restaurant, Dasterkhawn,Sharmaji ki Mashhoor Chai and many parks etc.

Name: pckimothi
Title: Ganjing
Review: Hazaratganj is very old attraction for Lucknow residents. Although Lucknow have many famous and attractive places but Hazratganj is known for ultra modern place to visit for Lucknow residents. Near about 200-300 meter long road connected to various sides of Lucknow city is famous for shopping, roaming , evening n night time outing and it is called as Ganjing in Lucknow people language.Now place is well connected with Metro and easy to visit from many corners.

Name: P singh
Title: good place
Review: main market place of lucknow. we can shop here for cloths etc. bu its a costly market. number of showrooms are here.

Name: Sharil I
Title: Hear of the city
Review: While at this city, Hazratganj has been know for its stroll of luxurious shopping areas and good food craving streets.

Name: AnkitaVerma
Title: Great place
Review: Great place to spend your evenings for shopping and eating. One should definitely try 6 types of water with pani puri, basket chaat and chaat from shukla chat bhandar. Janpath market is good for shopping especially if one wants to buy the traditional chikan work.

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Shopping
Review: Nice place for food and shopping. Also it is best to stay here when in the city. Very good convenience. Clean area. Great for outings

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: Maketing in HAZRATGANG
Review: Hazratgang is a major shopping area situtated in LUCKNOW . In addition to bazaars  it also contains shopping complexs,Restaurants,Hotel, Theaters and office .

Name: shashi09
Title: The fading glory
Review: Have been visiting for the famous Hazratganj. Over the period many old landmarks have disappeared. But still the place evokes nostalgia of the yore. For the people with taste buds for typical Lucknowi food, the place is a must part of their itinerary.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: A day in the city
Review: Hazaratganj, a place which is a market has everything, from clothes to food to electronics. Basically its an open mall which has been there in Lucknow when none of the malls were there. A to Z everything is available and even has hotels for a beautifull stay.

Title: Heart of Lucknow
Review: Well maintain place of Lucknow. All top variety and all top brands are available at this place. multi purpose parking available here.The most unique things is all shop boards are in black colour no other colour used in hording or boards of shops.

Name: John M
Title: Too much traffic
Review: We had a car and driver but sat in traffic for two spells of 30 minutes without moving.  There is a good range of shops and the lanes are interesting but by the time you arrive you are fed up. I would give this area a miss due to the traffic.

Name: srg45
Title: Hazaratganj has lost it s charm!
Review: Many years ago Hazratganj was a a charming area with well maintained shops & theatres . It was a pleasure to walk through the long verandas on both sides. It was extremely sad to see the decadence of this famous street.

Name: nikrang
Title: Old City charm
Review: Nice to shop around in the lanes(if you know were to go), and eat chaat at the Royal Cafe, Dotted with old buildings and one can only imagine how beautiful it must have been in the old days. Love Lucknow, the city of  Asli Thezeeb

Name: AMT
Title: Memories
Review: I came to hazratganj for second time though , but nothing changed here evrything is same and i remember my old days when i was used to live near by and hangout with friends here in this area.I ate Kabab Paratha for the first time at this place.

Name: Aman Agarwal
Title: Heart of city
Review: Hazratganj is the heart of lucknow. Its just superb and amazing. But due to metro 🚈 construction there is lot of traffic . But thanks to multi level parking .

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Nice
Review: A beautiful market in centre of city. Have lost its charm due to metro work bus as the work have started down finalizing it have again started to regain its original old view. There are stores of multiple brands ranging from clothing, fashion to electric apliences, banks and jewellery.

Name: Samanvya
Title: Was the heart of Lucknow
Review: Hazratganj, till a decade ago was the heart of Lucknow and was famous for evening strolls called 'Ganjing' but that era has passed and it is no more than a local market now. Infested with the ongoing Metro construction, you are better to avoid this place or else you will be stuck for quite a long time in the traffic.

Name: Sandip Bosu
Title: Nice Markets and Monuments
Review: Hazratganj has historical monuments, markets, shops, churches and Tehzeeb (mannerisms) and Nafasat (sophistication) in people. We stayed there for three days and loved every bit of our stay. Universal Book Store, and all the places we visited were great.

Name: Amit7488
Title: Happening Street of Lucknow
Review: Most happening place of Lko for shopping eating, evening walk, from good chikan clothes, perfumes to different chats n tandoori chai, Hazratganj is nice place n worth to visit n stay nereby

Name: Manas R
Title: Evergreen
Review: No matter how many times you have already been there, you would always find the same level of attraction. A sense of familiarity would just make your experience delicious.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Nice area!
Review: we had a car + driver so we went there and saw many beautiful places and did some shopping also. It is worth a visit.

Name: Travel Enthusiast
Title: Heart of the City!
Review: Right at the heart of the city. Sightseeing spots, famous eateries are all close by. Good for shopping

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Carries the Nuances of British Lucknow
Review: It felt like the teenage stage of Lucknow. You can have a mix of food expeditions, an architectural extravaganza.Walk by the markets, visit The famous tea stall in morning.Eat famous chaat.do shopping.Everything a traveller is looking for.

Name: Christopher B
Title: Heritage Ignored by Ignoramous Lucknowians
Review: People in our country love to harp on our ancient culture and old traditions, but the reality is that they all stand by and watch areas like Hazratganj being destroyed by hoardings, garish sign boards and remodelling, with ZERO REGARD for the old arcades and elevations! The chaos that results is simply a mirror image of the minds of IAS officers, City Engineers, and our Municipal Commissioner!AWAZ! Awake!Save Hazratganj!

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: posh area
Review: this is one of the best posh area in lucknow.lot of eataries and shops are there. best place for shopping.

Name: safdar
Title: Excellnet
Review: It is an absolute modern and up market place. It also has local shops selling chiken cloth. You will get a lot of street food options by road side.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Must do
Review: This place is a delight for photographers. Amazing buildings all over and they are all well maintained and clean. Surely worth visiting, but I suggest you take a guide with you to understand the significance of the monuments here and the history and stories behind it.

Name: SVAYAMBHU C
Title: The Residency
Review: The Residency was a revelation. Very well maintained by ASI, the buildings which still wore the bullet wounds and mortar shell shots, took us back to the mutiny that took place almost 170 years back.

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: The dilapidated residence of British forces
Review: This is a place where British officers and soldiers used to stay during the pre-independence era. The place is well maintained. There is an entry ticket. One needs a guide to understand the ruins.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Very colonial
Review: During the siege of 1857, the British Residency was used for a vast number of Britishers to reside. The structure built much earlier by the Nawab of Lucknow has remained in its ruined form ever since. A good visiting place for the history lovers!

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Steeped in History
Review: Gives goosebumps to imagine what the British soldiers & their families must have felt during their 5 month siege in 1857. Great place for children to experience the horrors of conflicts (even with much less sophisticated  weapons of old world)

Name: SuprabhatC
Title: Heritage at its best
Review: Well maintained. Although the sound and light show was not available. We sent a great time in the evening reliving the mutiny during the British period. Public transport options can be more for easier access to the place, specially in the evening.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Ruins of a Bloody Tale
Review: The imposing 3 storeyed building was meant for the British residents in the city leading to the name given to the compound.... during the Mutiny of 1857, families of a lot of British Officers had taken refuge in the underground rooms located in the southern part of the building.... you can easily spot the cannon-ball and bullet marks sprayed across the walls bearing evidence of the intense confrontation

Name: Atasi P
Title: Nice history
Review: Really well maintained. One could get the sense of history of the place. The grounds are really great top stroll and see the ruins.

Name: silva s
Title: Great place to visit
Review: It's like revisiting history. The place is ruins of the grand past of India. There is a small museum too. We had a great time here. One caution is that you have to walk a lot. I had senior citizens in my team and no wheel chair service was available.

Name: BISWABRATA
Title: British Residency
Review: Good Place to see. Well maintain the area. Historical must see place in Lucknow. Mobile photography only allowed here.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Good historical place
Review: Residency is located near Kaiserbagh bus stand in Lucknow. You can reach Kaiserbagh bus stand from wherever your in Lucknow through bus or share auto's or using combination metro and share auto's. From Kaiserbagh bus stand residency is about 15-20 minutes walk.      It's a historical place connected with 1857 mutiny. The area is well maintained and entrance charges here is Rs 20. There is also a small museum inside residency where we can enter showing the ticket of Residency. Guides are not available at this place and in front of every building/monument within the Residency there is a brief description written about that particular building/monument.     This place has Greenery and good kept lawns but in afternoon because of heat it will be tiring to visit this place as it involves a lot of walk.        Before entering Residency ensure you have sufficient drinking water stock with you . A good place to visit in Lucknow.

Name: John Muriango
Title: Amazing.
Review: Really fascinated with the history behind this place. After the end of the last Nawab of Lucknow rulers, the British formally established their reign, however, some remnants laid siege to the new British lords and it was here that the British fled for refuge.

Name: AnupamSharan
Title: 1857 Mutiny History forgotten by many
Review: This is the starting point of 1857 Mutiny. A fact not many are aware, and was an eye opener. A must visit place when visiting Lucknow. Take a guide to understand and appreciate the historic facts

Name: DrKlair
Title: Relive India's first war of independence.
Review: Must visit. This complex houses the ruins of residency as they were after the first war of independence in 1857. Take a good guide .You can spend a whole day here if you are a history lover.

Name: Jamesbondo7
Title: Nice
Review: It's very beautiful side to visit.  It very huge so you have to walk a lot . Its pity there is no guide service to explain this beautiful and historic side .

Name: JoyBose
Title: A heritage building built by British, famous for the 1857 War
Review: This complex is managed by the Archeological Survey of India. Tickets are Rs 20 for Indians. One has to scan the QR code and pay online during Covid. It consists of a number of buildings. The main building has a museum commemorating the 1857 war, explaining the history with paintings, weapons etc. Other buildings include begum kothi, where a british wife of the nawab used to live, along with a mosque. Another one is the banquet hall. Another important building is the doctor's house. Most the the buildings were shelled during the 1857 war and so are ruined. The complex also contains a cemetery for British soldiers, and memorial for those killed in 1857. Its quite clean and well maintained. Would recommend to anyone interested in the history of Lucknow and British India.

Name: R1chardN
Title: A most for historians
Review: Lucknow is a gem for history enthusiasts.  The town holds a very special place in the rise and eventual fall of British rule.  It is the scene of the 1857 mutiny where about 3000 people took refuge in the Residency.  The battle and siege continued for about 5 months and only about 1000 marched out at the time of surrender.The British Residency is a must see and a guide is a must to get the most from this incredible site.  The grounds inside the gated walls are immense and the buildings grand and infrastructure advanced.  The ruins still depict the great halls, living quarters, administration blocks and other buildings.  Some of the walls are riddled with holes from cannon shot and others bear the scars of fire damage.  The battles must have been ferocious but, prior to the siege, it was a grand existence and not difficult to see why the Europeans enjoyed their time and were reluctant to return home.Do visit the museum which has a scale model of the site and some historic exhibits.  Unfortunately it was partly closed on the day we visited.  It was a little sad to see this once great structure in this ruined state but it is not difficult to imagine how severe the fighting must have been.  This a must see historic site.

Name: Tom B
Title: A piece of history
Review: A facinating place.  It's just ruins but there is so much to learn from here.  The history is incredible and facinating.  It's very clean - a few stray dogs but this is part and parcel of India generally.  It's well worth a couple of hours having a walk around.

Name: MPJ
Title: Lucknow as of now
Review: Fairly well maintained. Beautiful site worth a visit any day. To do justice to Lucknow visit, it will need 6 days at least.

Name: GRVARCH
Title: A ruined Historical Building
Review: This building is a witness of freedom fighting in India.A good option to spend time.Many burnt buildings are inside its premises.There is a small museum here.Entry ticket is 20 Rs.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: British Residency
Review: British Residency is a good place to watch. One must visit this place to get a glimpse of this wonderful architecture.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Well Maintained Ruinous State
Review: The tales of 1857 revolve in Lucknow around this place  and it surprisingly is well kept in ruinous state still .It is a large place and requires walking  and one must have atleast two hours to see the place .

Name: Vivek K
Title: British Residency
Review: Visited remains of buildings of British Residency. Good efforts to preserve the structures right from revolt of Indian soilders against Britishers in 1857. There are signs of bullets on the walls. Salute to those unknown Indian freedom fighter soilders. Worth visiting.

Name: Anuradha
Title: Shadow of the atrocities of the colonial Era
Review: A must visit place for the history lovers. It’s a witness of the atrocities done by the British colonisers during The Revolt of 1857.

Name: Manojaero
Title: Visit of Residency
Review: It is good place to take children there and tell them about our history. Specially last period of Oudh nawabs.

Name: Ian b
Title: Loved the history of the place
Review: Spoilt by the weather. But it is a must visit place so much history really enjoyed walking around the ruins. Museum is a disappointment.

Name: WorldTraveler
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Best attraction in Lucknow but that’s no huge compliment. If you like war or history then it is very interesting and tells a great story. Could be better maintained.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Good place
Review: It is one of the most visit place in Lucknow . But it is not quite well maintained and not clean too . I visited here with with my family.

Name: David
Title: Old decaying building
Review: British Regency buildings are old and shows British legacy in Lukhnow. It is great for walking around. Buildings are falling and not maintained.

Name: Sarbajit
Title: Where every brick tells a story
Review: After the Bada Imaambara this is the place one should not miss if you are interested in a piece of history. The ruins of old british quaters are spread across a large area. Also a good place to experiment some architectural photography competitions.

Name: Chandra P
Title: Worth visiting
Review: The ruins of the residency are well worth seeing to see the difference in lifestyle of the British rulers to the average citizen.  It is in stark contrast to the average person who lives here.  The site is being upgraded but is wonderful shape.  All of the writings are in both English and Hindi.  You can take the place in on your own pace in a few hours.

Name: pravalkshukaa
Title: good
Review: very good for vistors very good for foreign travellers cheap ticket and good ancient building of 1700's

Name: TravellerMentor
Title: Cool!
Review: This is awesome colony and a great place, architecture  of the whole place was classic. must visit place if u are in pune.

Name: viky570
Title: Good place
Review: This place carries totally historical memory. We came for weekend and enjoyed at this place while coming at Lucknow.

Name: RAMESHSHIRALI
Title: SITE OF FIRST FREEDOM STRUGGLE
Review: A visit to this site will provoke a feeling of Patriotism. First Freedom Fight commenced from here in 1857.Hats off to the Freedom Fighters and martyrs for our Independence.

Name: rogerl044
Title: History preserved
Review: I especially wanted to see this to understand the situation during the siege. It is worth knowing the history of the battle before going as I found the guide content to just explain what the building were. Only half of the original property is available for inspection as the army uses the rest but the holes made by the cannon shot and musket fire is very visible and reading the grave markers brings alive the daily life of the resident during the bombardment.Definitely worth seeing.

Name: rajeev_poet
Title: History teaches
Review: Visiting this place is entering in the past. Our freedom fighters of 1857 eliminated the foriegn rule and ruined the british authourity success fully. The hindu and the muslims fought together and won. A must visit place, very well curated .

Name: Dibyendu87
Title: Residency still carrying wounds
Review: One of the best place to visit in Lucknow. The residence was the cantonment of the British which was destroyed by the Indian soldiers during the Sipahi Virodh in 1857. The residence is still bearing the wounds of the shells and bullets till date. Its an ASI monument. Ticket price is Rs 25

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Historical visit
Review: It's good. Really good. Has a lot of things to see and also a museum. Gives a good glimpse of the British phase of India and Civil Engineering of that time.Has a nominal entry fee of maybe ₹20.Not a good place to visit alone. Go with friends or family. Not very crowded and is generally peaceful.Closes around 6:30 p.m.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Must see for historians
Review: Good architecture and structure to see. Historic place since long. Symbol of british occupation in India. It’s must see for anyone visiting Lucknow. It’s part of heritage & culture of Lucknow too.

Name: steve l
Title: Amazing
Review: A must for any visiting Brit Very emotive and historic place where more VC medals were awarded than anywhere else in the world Well kept and great staff

Name: Kdue2
Title: Ghost town full of Romantic couples
Review: This is a special place with a tragical past but a hopeful future. I would recommend going in the early morning. It gets quite hot and humid at the end of day.

Name: taotzu
Title: Good for history buffs
Review: Architecturally it's a nice place to see but we didn't enjoy here since it carries the memories of one of the darkest chapter of Indian history. It has been maintained very nicely but the authorities. A must-see for the history buffs.

Name: Sanjay B
Title: Best in the city..
Review: This place is all lit..You can visit here any time specially at the time of festival..You may enjoy every bit...Children can play their fav games..

Name: Reyan11
Title: Historical significance
Review: It was a living place for British general. Beautiful and well maintained. Banquet hall is the best place here

Name: durham05
Title: Lots of important Anglo Indian history
Review: Enjoyed my time here exploring the ruins. Site is well maintained and its very though provoking to see the battle scarred walls and to visit the cemetery where those who died in the 1857 siege were buried. Museum itself is very poor. Gardens are lush and green. A must for all visitors to Lucknow.

Name: apul_goel
Title: Residency: glimpse to British living in mid-1880s
Review: Situated on the banks of river Gomti, in center of Lucknow, the Residency, occupies an important position in history. In ruins today, it stands as silent witness to the brutal attack on the British during the 1857 uprising. It provides a glimpse to the living style of the British during those days. It is located close to other important landmarks of the city of that era.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: GOOD PLACE
Review: Its good place for visitors specially for history lovers and students. Its give many information about history.

Name: niya27
Title: Good place for history student
Review: It is spread over a big area. 1857 Memorial museum is also in British residency. A lot of history is associated with this place but I didn't find any guide here.

Name: notacanada
Title: Ghosts of nawabs and mutiny
Review: The British Residency, rather haunting if not haunted, was the living quarters of the East India Company at the courts of the Nawabs. The buildings were destroyed during the Siege of Lucknow during the Indian Rebellion of 1857. What is left of the buildings is still rather imposing. At times while in the ruins, pandemonium of shy, green parakeets flew away as soon as they perceived my presence.

Name: Prahlad S
Title: Amazing Historical Building
Review: It was great visiting the Residency. If you are interested in history of India's independence you must visit.

Name: SUDHANSHU1955
Title: A great monument
Review: A wonderful collection of monuments from British legacy ...Has a fascinating history .A must on the list of visitors to Lucknow. Needs two hours to see properly with the museum itself needing half an hour ....A delight for photo enthusiasts

Name: PaulJanet
Title: Eloquent evidence of a troubled time
Review: This large complex of buildings now mostly stark ruins bears eloquent witness to the Indian Uprising of 1857 when the area was under prolonged siege and bombardment. The buildings are surrounded by well-maintained gardens.

Name: RGM
Title: Seeped in History
Review: Excellent for history buffs. Each ruin in the residency has a story to tell. Too hot in the summer months

Name: Naveen
Title: Nice colonial era architecture
Review: Nice colonial era architecture, clean and neat.Ideally for couples ,the place was serene and beautiful

Name: Dave P
Title: Fantastic
Review: This place is wonderful! We went on a Saturday and it was not at all busy, just a few families taking a stroll. You can really feel the history and also see it in the bullet and cannonball holes. The museum was great too, there's a documentary shown daily in Hindi/English, not sure of the times, if you're lucky to be there at the right time. The gardens were clean and very well kept. The staff were friendly and very helpful indeed. Great and thanks!

Name: GoPlaces65661648539
Title: A Palatial Beauty
Review: This residency is a fine example of British leadership, splendor and exploitative culture. Also, it depicts the excellence of architectural, engineering and construction skills of the Nawabs.

Name: GaddisGadabout
Title: A peaceful place ... today
Review: Despite the brutal legacy of the Mutiny (or The First War of Indian Independence), the people of Lucknow have respectfully maintained the old British residency, still marked with cannon and bullet holes. It's a quiet green space today. There's a small graveyard, the ruins of the garrison church, and a modest museum that includes a diorama of the cantonment circa 1857. It helps to come with some prior knowledge of the history of that struggle or with a guide because there aren't too many information points.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: In ruins but recommended
Review: The place which must have been vibrant during its day, is in ruins after the rebellion. Good place to visit to understand the history.

Name: Jeevan Shanbhag
Title: Must Visit Monument
Review: One of the Historic place in Lucknow. Nicely maintained. One must also visit, 1857 Memorial Museum within the premises.

Name: Janaki Visvanath
Title: Wow history lesson!
Review: If you want to understand the period around the 1857 Sepoy Mutiny, this is a must see.Beautiful maintained by the government and a wonderful museum inside. Life under the East India Company and the British rule and how a handful of soldiers created a Mutiny is a must see.

Name: Sharil I
Title: Black History Reminder
Review: There are many reminders that history has left us with which haunt us till date with things that really cut a sorry figure for Humanity. While this monument reminds of the revolt simultaneously it shares with us the horrors of war also. But all in all a place to get peace and understand what is the benefit of peace.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Great Place
Review: Another historical building in Lucknow that one should see while visiting Lucknow.Though now in ruins but once it was the official residence of British Governor General. The historical 1987 Freedom Strugle also started from here.

Name: Puja_deb
Title: History
Review: Historical place to see and spend some time. Shooting place for many movies. You need to buy tckt but you can do without a guide. There is also a museum inside.

Name: Nabeel N
Title: Good place
Review: Good architecture and peaceful place. You can se some good sightseeing. Place is just ok not to much to explore.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: The british residency
Review: THE BRITISH RESIDENCY of Lucknow is a famous  architect related to indian freedom struggle.It associate with 1857 revolt.Many signs of bullets are still there.The building is in ruin condition.

Name: kppmumbai
Title: Definitely worth a visit when in Lucknow
Review: The remains of the British residency have been preserved very well. The place is symbolic of the first war of independence in 1857 and some of the stories there relive the event. The small museum to is worth the visit  I feel one should allocate atleast around 1 hour at a non sunny time.

Name: Faiz
Title: Historical place.
Review: Culture & history always speaks, you can feel it by visiting The British Residency in Lucknow.It has mostly the ruins of the great Indian Rebellion of 1857.It is a very unique photogenic heritage place.It has been declared a protected monument by The Archaeological Survey of India.It is very nice to see buildings without roof because they ruined during 1857.

Name: Dornick
Title: Excellent.   Unmissable. Number 1 on a list of sights to visit in Lucknow.
Review: It’s correct name is The Residency, not the British Residency. No one who visits Lucknow should fail to visit this place. It’s the site of the 1857 First War of Independence  when Indians and British clashed in bloody conflict resulting in horrific fatalities on both sides. Buildings were shattered and left as they were after the combat  providing a poignant memory of the battle. Although the site is sizeable, well maintained pathways render it easily walkable. There’s so much to see, so much to absorb and think about. The green spaces are well maintained, staff are pleasant and efficient. A sad period in history lingers on long in the memory. A small museum is attached with very interesting exhibits and displays that echo the conflict. One could spend a whole day here in pensive thought.  Lucknow City Corporation ( or whichever body is responsible for the site ) should be congratulated on a job well done.

Name: SteveByfleet
Title: How did this defend the Residency for so long
Review: The seiege of Lucknow lasted for about 5 months, but how on earth did the fairly small British contingent survive for so long against so many enemy? Following year, the british regained this area, but it didn't last, rightly so!!

Name: keith h
Title: Evocative Ruins Surrounded by Extensive Lawns & Shaded by Massive Old Trees.
Review: The Residency was my number 1 reason for visiting Lucknow. This particular period of history has long interested me so I was very pleased to arrive at the gates on a sparkling, sunny, warm morning.   I was quite surprised to note the size of the site but thrilled to see how well it is all kept & despite the death & destruction that took place there, how peaceful & beautiful it is now with massive trees & flowering shrubs studding the lawns & towering over the ruins.   The British had been allowed a residency here in the Kingdom of Oudh but when they finally annexed Oudh on the pretext of maladministration it became one of the factors that provoked the mutiny/ uprising of 1857.   The Residency became a sanctuary for the British as Mutineers overran the city & they held out ( with large losses on either side ) for 5 months. The Banquetting Hall  became a hospital. Sir Henry Lawrence was in charge of the British Garrison but was fatally wounded early on. After 3 months re inforcements arrived, led by General Havelock, easing conditions but it was a couple of months later that Sir Colin Campbell with his Sikh's & Highlander's broke the siege.  You can still see the bullet & cannon shot damage to the walls. A small museum houses a model of The Residency site & some lithographs.

Name: Rajesh P
Title: History Unfolds!
Review: Gives a peek into the Britishers way of living of 18th and 19th century Lucknow. Very well maintained  neat and well marked. Ruins throw a lot about times. Some are eerie...must visit.

Name: smitagupta
Title: a walk into History
Review: well maintained place, with signboards telling us what each of the buildings were, but i wish there were more details....only when we visited the museum and saw the model of the Residency did one learn the details. Though there was a notice outside mentioning timings of the film show, but the staff inside were very hesitant in screening it....only when we insisted and called the Museum Manager, did they agree to screen the film

Name: Ellenjarvie
Title: Brutish residency
Review: A must see to learn about the British in Lucknow to see where and how they lived and what took place there. Allow a lot of time for this visit and go with a tour guide one who can tell you the history

Name: Cantfind
Title: An absolute must when visiting Lucknow
Review: This monument to the people who fought and died here is remarkable.  It is like actually being involved in the siege.  The grounds and what remains of the buildings are beautifully maintained and the small museum is very interesting.

Name: Rosalynde J
Title: Moving monument of a bygone time.
Review: The residency is well maintained within beautiful grounds it must have been quite something in its heyday. The mutiny or first war of independence is a sad reminder of different times.Well worth a visit and the little museum and cemetery are not to be missed.

Name: ImageWrighter
Title: Time Warp- Photographer's delight
Review: Very well maintained ruins; a photographer 's delight, specially if one is into historical architecture. With a nominal entry fee, this place is worth spending an hour or two. Apart from residential quarters and army barracks, it also houses a mazaar and a temple, sprawling lawns. The museum is closed on Fridays, but it's a small one and nothing you would miss.

Name: John M
Title: Interesting historical site
Review: Staying in Lucknow so decided to visit this place.  Its consists mainly of large buildings in ruins.  The museum located in the grounds is fairly interesting but not much to see. Strange to see 9 staff at a very small museum mmm! Buildings show evidence of cannon and rifle ball damage.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: Nice place to hamg out
Review: This place was build by one of the Nawab of Lucknow to accomodate British in Lucknow. Once recognised by government in late 90s have been maintained well. It also have got many symbols of cross firing between British and Fredom Fighters.

Name: nikrang
Title: Mutiny Monument
Review: The ruins are sad and magnificent and reeks of an era of violence and colonial rule. Well preserved and maintained and very very interesting. The musuem on site also has a few nuggets of interest

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Trip down the memory lane
Review: This is the place where the mutiny of 1857 started. The tell tale signs are visible all over the ancient buildings. Built from 1775 to 1800 to accommodate the British resident, the structures are opulent and suggestive of the lavish lifestyle of its occupants.The museum on campus shows some nice pictures.

Name: Arjun S
Title: A slice of history
Review: Revisited the Residency, which is maintained in a neat and clean condition, so was pleasantly surprised by that.  In the small museum, there is a useful diorama depicting the layout of the Residency before the siege.

Name: Aman Agarwal
Title: Good place
Review: If u wanna Visit some historic place of british rule then u can visit this place . Visit in a group otherwise u will get bored . Not to see much , but good when u visit when friends

Name: Huzefa
Title: touch of the raj and clean
Review: the stories around this place are interesting... and glad that the govt is taking care of this... certainly worth spending time walking through time and grandeur of British Raj living

Name: Lopita M
Title: Beautifully maintained
Review: Must see this when in Lucknow. The place is beautifully maintained and is a treat for history lovers.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Best historic place
Review: Mind blowing place I visit the place my god such a historic place very good best environment the ford are my good many people come to visit the place the place so good I missed the chance to enter the museum because today is Friday and Friday is off day for museum if any one is planning to visit the place make min three hrs thank you must visit the place

Name: Samanvya
Title: Most under-rated
Review: This place holds a significance in the Indian freedom struggle. This was the place where the Indian won their first battle and gheroed the British high officials. The light and sound show that takes place almost every evening is a must watch. It gives a detailed information. Very beautifully maintained. Must go.

Name: Sandip Bosu
Title: History written on the bricks of each building
Review: When I visited the Residency I could feel that the bricks and plaster of each building were taking to us. They whispered the events of 1857 and on one hand I felt proud for the first freedom fighters of India who tasted freedom for 86 days, and felt the pain of so much bloodshed on the other. I spend about 3 hours in the place and would have loved to spend more.

Name: Vipul K
Title: Experience History !!!
Review: Must see on your list if history interests you. Very well maintained and preserved structures. Depicts a very important part of Indian history, please read up before you visit or arrange a guide. Requires already 1-2 hours, opens at 10 and closes by 5:15 pm.

Name: Betula103
Title: Important historically
Review: Lucknow appeared not to attract as many tourists and many other places in India although it is the capital and largest city of the state of Uttar Pradesh being an important administrative centre.  It is a major Islamic area but was once once a major headquarters for the British, hence this large British Residency complex, some of which is in ruins following the 1857 Siege of Lucknow. A church has completely gone. The gardens and lawns are well maintained and there is a small museum within the grounds plus a cemetery..

Name: lalani_13
Title: Nice!
Review: we went there with our car+driver+guide as part of the tour and saw the short movie and took lots of photos also.

Name: Travel Enthusiast
Title: Awesome
Review: Well maintained by ASI. A must visit place in Lucknow. One can spend almost the whole day here. The walls still bears the bullet marks. Innumerable benches to take rest after walking for long. Don't miss it!

Name: Rahul117
Title: Must visit place in Lucknow, British Redidency
Review: A beautiful place for monument lovers amidst the hustle and bustle of city life of Lucknow. You can find a good dose for your eyes as well as for camera. Try it on week days when number of visiters are less. You can communacte with the walls of British era. The museum inside The Residency narrates the entire story of 1857.

Name: felicityjg1
Title: A must do
Review: poignant and excellent.  Beware of some guides who might give a biased view of what occurred during the Indian Mutiny - Fortunately, we were well aware of the history and also that the British didn't come out squeaky clean at the end - but the Residency has been well preserved and was definitely a highlight of our trip.

Name: milesnmeals
Title: A good green walk
Review: It's an easy walk around, but a beautiful place where ruins make beautiful frames. Worth  a visit for photography,\Toilets are available, benches are there to rest. drinking water is available.

Name: 592abck
Title: History experience
Review: One can go here and see the history of old India. Not much to see here but whatever is there is mesmorizing

Name: Stuart C
Title: Brilliant historical site
Review: The British Residency is a fantastic historical site best visited with a local guide who can explain the intetesting history of this place..recommended

Name: Karl V
Title: Well worth the visit
Review: Once a symbol of oppression, the Residency now stands, with an Indian flag, as a sobering reminder of the struggle for independence that was hard fought and of the ultimate sacrifice paid by so many. The walls, both inside and out, of the remains bare the scars of cannon and rifle shot from the harrowing siege of 1857.

Name: CAPT. Nagaraj Subbarao
Title: Brilliant
Review: The British Residency is the place where the British made their last stand in 1857, with the rebelling Indian sepoys baying for their blood. It's history that can be seen!

Name: indrajit1405
Title: Haunting
Review: its quite a huge place and one can see and admire the beauty of this place and the life of the nawabs and later the Englishmen who stayed there and the Indian soldiers who captured it later. The place is beautiful but quite haunting

Name: SagarVS
Title: Interesting history
Review: Full of history and a legacy that many who passed of this school cherish with love. We went around this place and spent about an hour and a half. Lots of historical information apart from the tomb of Claude Martin. If you are into histary, its worth visiting. Several imposing beautiful structures.

Name: SVAYAMBHU C
Title: LMC Dec 22
Review: A visit to this sprawling heritage campus is a must. Extremely well maintained campus, buildings and grounds. There is a horse stable as well and a retro ambassador thrown in

Name: Mayank_Jhnj
Title: beautiful & great architecture
Review: Was quite pleasantly surprised with the architecture of the main building. It is spread across big area and one would be happy to see the art work in the college. Do insist on visiting the main building and see it from inside.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Dipped in history & architecture
Review: An educational institution as this one is very inspiring. Especially because there is a lot of history with it. It is a monument that has stood over 2 centuries, and the gandeur of the place can be felt when inside Constantia House. Visit this place and take a piece of history away with you.

Name: Deepika M
Title: Uncouth Teachers at La Marts Boys
Review: On a visit to the school during their independence function, I witnessed a bunch of teachers misbehaving with and humiliating a parent. What example are such teachers setting for the children they are supposed to educate?Very disappointed and disillusioned. I intend to share my experience with the school's Management Board.

Name: Ankurcfa
Title: Must visit
Review: Yes its a school, but a must visit to see th building and architecture. Its open to public, no restrictions

Name: venkatrams2
Title: Journey to the past
Review: It was great to see the reputed college which is over 170 years old.  It gave a nice feeling to think that the same building, the same rooms, the same classes educated people more than a century ago

Name: John Muriango
Title: Amazing
Review: A historic school started by a French military officer two centuries ago. The grounds are lush and ambience is lively, and so too are the education standards.

Name: Nilakshi S
Title: Awe inspiring.
Review: The sheer size of the campus is awe inspiring. Had read up about this college but seeing it was a great experience. Although we were not allowed entry inside the college, driving through the campus and seeing the various facilities provided to those privileged makes one proud.

Name: Rakesh K
Title: Famous fascility
Review: Landmark going strong after 175th academic session,real happening for students driving them to the core to tudy and get results

Name: Rohit Gupta
Title: Old and Gold
Review: Structure : AwesomeLocation : SuperbIs college open/Close : Closed due to CovidRecommendable : YesStaff : Heard that perfect

Name: DrKlair
Title: European style
Review: Beautiful architecture with a splendid history Though it was closed due to covid yet they were kind enough to let us see and explore. The main building has been recently renovated as is the church inside. Not to be missed

Name: Ajay
Title: Best
Review: In these unprecedented times of Covid pandemic, we found the hotel following every protocol of social distancing and sanitation. The room was clean, service was excellent.

Name: saumya
Title: best school i lucknow
Review: good for boarding tudents and days scholars . teachers are well trained and helpful. campus is huge with many facilities

Name: R1chardN
Title: Impressive architecture
Review: We had a guide for the day to see the highlights of Lucknow.  We were at the college for about an hour and were impressived by the  architecture and our guide explained some of the history.It continues to be a working college and places are much sought after.  I have the impression that success in sport is greater than academically.  The grounds and sports fields are impressive and the students went about their day in a purposeful and polite way.

Name: Tom B
Title: Family History
Review: We made a trip to the college where my partners Grandfather boarded as a young boy before coming to England 75 years ago.  The burser and the headteacher spent hours with us talking us through what it would have been like at the school then and the history of the area which was fascinating.  I Apologise for not remembering the names of the two gentlemen - I wish I could but my memory is clearly much inferior to both of them.  The headteach my god remembered my partners extended family from that long ago that remained in the area.  He pointed us to their exact old home which is no longer a home but still amazing to experience and see.To top if off they then found pictures that we had never seen of my partners Grandfather when he was at the school and some of his sporting records which was again amazing.I can't thank you enough for the time you gave us.  It was a special day and a special trip for us so much appreciated.

Name: Francesco T
Title: Very interesting
Review: Some great history here and I enjoyed walking around the grounds. It provides a window into the history of benevolent colonialism based on the altruism of an individual. It must have been in incredible elite college in its day

Name: daun065
Title: Visiting my fathers college
Review: I have only seen photographs of La Martiniere, the college my father attended in 1934 so it was with great pride that my trip to Lucknow enabled me to have an insight into his school days.  I have to agree with all the other reviewers that it's certainly a place to visit with its impressive architecture and military history.  We were lucky enough to meet up with the Bursar and Principal who graciously spent time going through past records. A wonderful experience.

Name: Carole W
Title: Worth the trip to visit
Review: Great piece of architecture with a history that makes interesting reading. Took a taxi, but a good local guide would take you and explain and point out it many features.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Awesome place
Review: Good architectural monument with the colonial building. I was there for a bike trip but enjoyed every bit of it

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Must See for Historical Buffs
Review: This by far is the most well kept of the places  in Lucknow and must be on must see list for visitors interested in 1857 .All marks for keeping the property so well kept and allowing visitors to see a functional school .

Name: Avik Mukherjee
Title: Era of East India company and Major General Claude Martin at Lucknow
Review: Established by  Major General Claude Martin(established in 1845). Now its La Martiniere College, Lucknow one of the best school of northan India. Opened on weekends. Major General Claude Martin who was born in Lyon-France(1735). He was part of East India company, and had acquired a large amount of land while serving the Nawab of Awadh Asaf-ud-Daula and bequeathed a major part of his estate to establish the schools. He died in Lucknow on 13thSep1800, So day of his death is called as 'Founder's Day' of the school. This is a must visit place in Lucknow.

Name: Ian b
Title: Wonderful to see where my wifes family went to school
Review: Had a nice tour around both Girls and boys schools. Staff were very nice and helpful tracing our family roots

Name: Ruchi
Title: Very well maintained
Review: We visited this place last night and it was quite surprising to notice how well they have maintained this place, so clean and nice. They have preserved everything against time and it is a must visit place in the city of Lucknow.

Name: l0vesunshine50
Title: Beautiful setting
Review: Interesting history, beautiful setting and surroundings. Nice to see the students roaming around and participating in chores to keep the grounds immaculate.

Name: rogerl044
Title: Massive school with interesting buildings
Review: This school is a reminder of Versailles in the middle of India. It is still functioning  and boasts stables , a mews and an interesting concept of burying the founders in the school grounds.We were there in the Diwali holiday but some borders were still on the premises and were very polite to us.Interting to visit but I think you need a guide to allow access.Don't miss the ex-Christian Chapel were Christian  hymns are still sung as a matter of tradition by the Hindu pupils.

Name: Aslam
Title: One of the best campus in India...........A true educational heritage
Review: This is one of the best maintained campus that too 150 years old.....Hats off to the team to manage & keep this educational heritage & forward the legacy in such a professional manner.Loacated in the heart of city this is indeed one of the best campuses in India.

Name: Stillwaters
Title: A beautifully nostalgic experience
Review: Its the feeling of a tryst with history as one visits this premium boys school. More than a hundred years old, it was the opulent residence of the Frenchman Sir Claude Martin. One can feel the history as one walks its grounds or sits in the spacious library.

Name: Sharad @1064
Title: La martinere boys college
Review: One of the best maitained school building with lots of greenery.Depicts the French art which is renovated recently. Must visit place.

Name: durham05
Title: Beautiful
Review: College is free to get in and I went on a Sunday as someone else on TA said best to go when students are there. The main building is very impressive and the Chapel was nicely decorated with many historic monuments.  Able to climb onto the roof for excellent views.  Free to visit. Highly recommended.

Name: Michael D
Title: La Martiniere Boy's College
Review: My visit to the college where my uncles and father studied in their youth was a memorable experience made more so by the favoured treatment I received from the current Bursar. The old buildings are kept in pristine condition and the gardens where the masses of students played sport and studied are exceptional.

Name: notacanada
Title: Strange building
Review: I did not know what to think of La Martinière, an over-the-top concoction of no particular style that has been home to an elite boys’ college for the last 170 years. The stories surrounding Major General Claude Martin are most colourful. As I walked throughout the house, one of the cleaners opened the door to the trophy room living me aghast at the sight of several taxidermied tigers. As I walked around the grounds, resident students were milling around.

Name: PaulJanet
Title: Grand House nowa leading school
Review: Built originally as La Costantia a huge residence designed and built by Major General Claude Martin it was bequeathed as a school and is still in use as such. Beautifully restored it is now available to visit by special arrangement.

Name: GoPlaces65661648539
Title: A Great Experience
Review: Our visit was instructive as we learned of the academic excellence of La Martiniere College and the many contributions to society and the communities surrounding Lucknow by its founder and benefactor. .

Name: Shankar M
Title: Hoary legacy
Review: A hundred acres of land in the heart of Lucknow, maintained with love and care. If you are fortunate to meet the Principal, he will regale you with the history of the buildings and of his own ancestry. Mr. Mc Farland traces his family tree to a gang of horse thieves (that is what his family name translates to, in Scottish!). An interesting fact: this is the only school in the world to have been awarded royal battle honours for its role in the defence of Lucknow during the mutiny of 1857.

Name: Win Htut
Title: Nice Place to visit
Review: The France Style Architecture of La Martiniere College is really awesome. It was worthy to give time to visit during Lucknow trip.

Name: suryaram
Title: great place but th dp is wrong
Review: Its a great school beautiful building very well maintained. Lots of activities happen. Saw beatiful horses there. Tourists are allowed till 5 pm

Name: Sharil I
Title: Carrying A legacy Ahead
Review: This is one of the most prominent colleges of the city Lucknow. But as time has forwarded so has the condition of this college while it still maintains its orginality yet it lacks the authencity of studies which were available earlier.

Name: SteveByfleet
Title: School for extremely priveliged boys
Review: Amazing school, I wished I'd gone there. Incredible facilities, stunning grounds, and from what we understand, high quality education. Lucky lads!!

Name: Monika Dass
Title: A School/College of Standing!
Review: The college consists of two schools on different campuses for boys and girls. La Martinière Boys' College was founded in 1845 and La Martinière Girls' College was established in 1869. The Boys' College is the only school in the world to have been awarded royal battle honours for its role in the defence of Lucknow during the mutiny of 1857. The two Lucknow colleges are part of the La Martinière family of schools founded by the French adventurer Major General Claude Martin.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Starting of my life
Review: I am a La Martinier, started my education from here, a place full of discipline. For boys definitely the best school. The best campus.

Name: Rajesh P
Title: So French!
Review: LA MARTINERE building is just astonishing...very well maintained..so nostalgic..picturesque...amazing piece of French architecture...a must visit!

Name: srg45
Title: Beautifully restored!
Review: Visiting this school after a very long time . It is looking very good & maintained well , restoration work going on in the Chapel. Rest of the heritage building restored very well . It was a pleasure to see the trophy room donated by one of the old students. . The principal was extremely cordial & facilitated for us to look around. Thank you.

Name: nikrang
Title: Wow
Review: What a building and campus, our driver sneaked us in for walk and he was so knowledgeable about its history. Beautifully maintained and they have great horses there too. So all the kids in action as it was a working day.Fun experience

Name: Huzefa
Title: great open boys school
Review: Claude Martin did a super job... and his architectural prowess was remembered through this monumental school

Name: AmanRustagi
Title: Amazing visit to era gonebye, not to be missed
Review: 1.Must visit.2. famous private boarding school.3. European architecture built by order of will of Major General Claude Martin.4. has prayer hall, canteen, trophy room,stables, skating rink, famous LMC  building, makbara of gori bibi, one cannon who was moulded in allahabad foundry.At stepping stones of main building, alumni have engraved their names and year of passing.Parts of buidling mentioned above are open for public visit.Students from up,uttrakhand, bihar, kolkatta vye for admission in this school. Expensive but worth for getting in.

Name: Sightsee611662
Title: British Architecture
Review: Great history and good learning seat . Enjoyable walking through the place and meeting the alumni and the teachers including the principal if available....the stained glass windows and the arches are nice to see

Name: Betula103
Title: Excellent place to visit
Review: I wondered why we were going to a school for boys; but what a surprise! The school began in 1845. The grand French styled building was originally built as a home by Lyon-born Major General Claude Martin. Under the terms of his will a school for boys was to be established.  It is a large property with its manicured gardens and playing fields. The building includes a chapel, classrooms, trophy room, common room and much more. On the steps leading up to the main building with the small cannon in front you will see where pupils carved their names.

Name: FANOUT
Title: excellent place to spend an afternoon in winters
Review: The students' canteen is a must visit ,, best day to visit is the last Sunday of the month.... referred to as SUNDAY BUN DAY ...

Name: felicityjg1
Title: pleasant enough
Review: We had a nice walk around the grounds which were very pretty - as was the college - but there really wasn't a great deal more to it.  It is a famous, very expensive, boys school

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Brilliance and Grandeur
Review: We had an access to the inside which made it a worth while visit. But it is still worth to walk about 1.5 kms to inside of the complex past the lush green fields, to see this magnificent strusture.Do try the buns at the canteen.

Name: Paulbo4
Title: Stunning college with a variety of sports to witness
Review: Stunning college with a variety of sports to witnessIt is lovely to just aimlessly walk around here. Very peaceful, free to enter and you can see cricket, basketball, archery and race horses here. The main French influences building is stunning!

Name: indrajit1405
Title: what a campus
Review: The college , though we saw school students only, is a must visit when in Lucknow because of the size of the campus and the European architecture. Its quite a walk around the place but its a beauty and worth a visit just to see  European architecture at its glory and its very well maintained as well

Name: Abhinav P
Title: School with french architecture building
Review: It's a school with a french designed building.It has french cannons as well.Race course is also there.

Name: Vivek P
Title: Good Education System
Review: Students and teahcers are well profession and disciplined.Good quality chicken and Kebabs are really good.Good quality chicken and Kebabs are really good

Name: Sarosh I
Title: La Martiniere Alumni
Review: i had the pleasure of performing for this wonderful institute and its past students, my rock band One Night Stand, from Bombay had a wonderful time in the extra cold weather, this is one of the most prestigious educational institutes in the world, and i'm told that the late legendary Freddie Mercury of Queen, was a student here too sometime

Name: vipin k
Title: Huge Architectural Marble
Review: Here is excellent Architectural structure built by a  French Soldier who rose to the rank of Major  General.. half the building is converted into a very reputed College and part of it is open to Public.. must visit Place in lucknow

Name: Jaideep Chandra
Title: Lamartiniere is a primary boys school
Review: I've studied there. And my son is currently doing so. It's an architectural marvel with history. We have a separate all girls school not far away. And two sister institutes in kolkata and Lyons , france. It was home of a French major general Claude Martin, who dedicated it to a school in 1840.

Name: Pratyakshism
Title: A historical supremo!
Review: One of the finest institutions of India with a legacy of more than 150 years treasured with the heritage of this great building, the Constantia. Truly a visitor's delight encompassing the French era of Lucknow and the splendour of the architectural inticracies and beautiful tell a tales from the staff & students. Recommended to every person who has ever had an indulgence in history!

Name: anujsharma21
Title: Excellence in Education
Review: One of the finest education  institution in the city of Nawab. purely convent ,Dificult to get admission.Building structure is Awsum & roman structure situated on the bank of Gomti-River

Name: Naveen T
Title: A colonial stamp on a Nawab’s Capital
Review: This is a must visit for tourists who would want to have a glimpse of the tragico- romantic history of Awadh (Oudh). The last Nawab(ruler) of Awadh , Wahid Ali Shah was one of the most intriguing character who has become a subject of myths and lore. His reign saw the pinnacle of opulence and ended in a tragic downfall and doom. In a town full of buildings of the Nawabi era and later British residency period , This complex stands out conspicuously to tell a different tale. The building in this complex is an amalgamation of different genres of European Architecture representing Claude Martin’s dual and enigmatic character. Claude Martin bequeathed the estate to a Trust which now runs an elitist college here. A quiet oasis struggling to keep the chaotic growth of the city at bay.

Name: manasmuglani
Title: The beat moments of my life
Review: The place which i worship the most and find myself blessed to be a part this iconic schools in lucknow Hope to keep the legacy going by willing my son also to be a part of this place in future :)

Name: 2548bharti
Title: Heritage
Review: Amazing place near bank of gomti river.its a very quite place with nice view.Heritage palce in nawab city Lucknow.

Name: Deepak J
Title: ok
Review: good and nice place to visit... great area and peoples happy to enjoy there... good city and good country

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Exquisite Architecture
Review: This is a institutional place right beside the vip area of the Lucknow. The place is extremely well maintained and the architecture is surely exquisite.

Name: Shravan B
Title: must see this mismerizing college
Review: i have seen this college in many shapes , it is changing day by day and this building in lucknow  is now on top .. this is the best school in Lucknow.

Name: randhirt2017
Title: best school in lucknow
Review: the school is good but the seniors ar vey bad they raging with junior,like they strip of money them,and if they complaint teachers they beat them.and blackmail also

Name: samirsaran81
Title: The place to visit.
Review: The grandeur of the college building is undoubted but it has been renovated making it one of the best tourist spots in addition to being the top college in Lucknow. The war memorial and chapel add to the beauty.

Name: KhannaK491
Title: La Martiniere's old world charm might put Hogwarts to shame!!
Review: La Martiniere has an old world charm attached to it.Its more like an ancient monument with its grandeur beauty , visible from afar. If you're fond of visiting monuments, you might want to step by for a visit at this one, although you might not be allowed within the campusI visited it as part of Corporate sector responsibility of my company-The school had offered its playing ground, badminton and Volleyball courts for our Final Sport event which had to select kids from disadvantaged background for student scholarships.That is went i  saw the school from inside. Its huge.It was a saturday and the kids , before their hometime were playing all sorts of games , from outdoors like basket ball and football, to life size chess, skatingIt was like a different world of its own within those imposing walls.  It might put Hogwarts to shame with its style

Name: Niraj K
Title: Best College
Review: The name itself is sufficient. Once it was the best English Medium College of Lucknow. Being an Ex Matineer now see the drastic fall in discipline and education standards. Even then a good school to give education tou your sons.

Name: Pachseven
Title: This is one of the great historical/archaeological wonder of modern times.A MUST for anyone visiting Lucknow.
Review: This is a famous school and is one of the top 3 in India.I did my schooling here and spent the most wonerful years of my youth.The building is an architectural wonder constructed about two centuries ago.In recent times lot of conservation steps and measures have been undertaken to preserve the beauty of the structure.It is a MUST visit place/site for anyone coming Lucknow and is a great tourist attraction.

Name: Ravindra R
Title: Simply grand
Review: The school is huge, well maintained and very grand. The architecture is amazing and well maintained. On the bank's of Goti river, it provides a perfect setting for a historical visit. A small canteen selling refreshments helps. Worth a visit.

Name: asthecrowsfly2
Title: Beautiful Architecture
Review: We visited La Martiniere College in February 2018.  The buildings are impressive with ornate architecture and colonial designs.  The grounds are extensive, and well maintained.  We didn't go inside the buildings as the children were finishing their classes for the day.  The many trees lining the grounds are selected from all over the world, including countries such as Madagascar and Australia.

Name: gerry3f
Title: If Bollywood ever remakes 'If...'
Review: If Bollywood ever remakes 'If...' La Martiniere College would be the perfect location. It oozes with colonial pomp. It's the only school to have won royal battle honours (during the Mutiny/First War of Independence). Designed by a frenchman, Claude Martin, it is the best preserved colonial building in Lucknow. Everything else he built at the 'Residency' a few miles away got shot to pieces. I would visit this first so you can get a better idea of what those ruins represent.

Name: masaccio
Title: Bit weird but worth it
Review: It feels distinctly odd to be wandering around a college campus and when we went, we were able to wander into a number of areas including a chapel under renovation. The campus is very pleasant and a real change from the chaos of Lucknow. There are very few passing tuk tuks or taxis, but we got an Uber in a couple of minutes.

Name: Cliff N
Title: A lovely school campus that has lots of history
Review: I will admit I didn't expect much when we headed to the Martiniere for a visit.  However, and much to my surprise, I found it to be very interesting and pleasant to walk around the campus.  It is a quiet place in a very hectic city.

Name: Michele D
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: This place turned out to be an eye opener, a 200 year old grand building very much in European style surrounded by a number of well laid out buildings built since, and so much well maintained greenery, even a set of horse stables ... this would have to be the most attractive boys college in all of India.

Name: STV I
Title: Beautiful campus and history
Review: This was an impressive school campus with an interesting history, lovely buildings and very well  known private school.

Name: YashwantDShah
Title: Best Boys School in Lucknow
Review: La Martiniere College, founded by the French General Claude Martin stands on the banks of River Gomti and next to the Chief Minister's Residence in a sprawling 700 acres of land. The main building known as 'Constantia' is supposed to be the finest french architecture in India. Following the ICSE / ISC pattern for 10+2 education, the current Principal Carlyl McFarland is a dynamic person who are brought about tremendous changes and the college is beautifully restored to its glory with excellent renovation. The home to about a thousand boys, it starts from KG right up to Standard twelve. Many famous personalities have been alumni of this prestigious institution.

Name: Nikhil P
Title: European architecture
Review: This place reminds of the colonial past of Lucknow . The European architecture stands out and has been well preserved. It is considered as one of the most prestigious educational institutes in UP as well as in India. My cousin sister had completed her education from here.

Name: Sandeep V
Title: Nice collage
Review: La Martinière College is an educational institution located in Lucknow, the capital of the Indian State of Uttar Pradesh. The college consists of two schools on different campuses for boys and girls. La Martinière Boys' College was founded in 1845 and La Martinière Girls' College was established in 1869. The Boys' College is the only school in the world to have been awarded royal battle honours[1] for its role in the defence of Lucknow during the mutiny of 1857. The two Lucknow colleges are part of the La Martinière family of schools founded by the French adventurer Major General Claude Martin. There are two La Martinière Colleges in Kolkata and three in Lyon. La Martinière provides a liberal education and the medium of instruction is the English language. The schools cater for pupils from the ages of five through to 17 or 18, and are open to children of all religious denominations. The schools have day scholars and boarders. It is one of the most prestigious colleges of India and often features in the top schools of India.

Name: Siddhartha Biswas
Title: Exquisite
Review: If you are a lover of history and of exquisite architecture, then you must visit the Constantia House located inside the La Martiere Campus. The campus itself is beautiful with sprawling grounds and very well behaved children. The Constantia House is a wonderful monument to the French influence that shaped a part of India. Meant to be the house of Major-General Claude Martin, this house records the aesthetic side of India's colonial past. It is worth spending some time in. If you are looking for more touristy places, then you can safely give it a miss.

Name: Kaustav B
Title: Amazing Architecture
Review: Visited the place after reading the reviews and we are really thankful for that. An amazing place with an amazing European architecture. The place now houses the La Martin college and this would rank as one of the best (if not the best) college campuses in India.
