The main building is a gigantic structure with figures of Lion and Angels adorning the roof. The main building is called the “Constantia” and is also a part of  Lucknow history. It was sad that there was no guide to tell us details about the place. This place is a must visit and a welcome change in sight after watching all the Mughal Architectures.

Name: Rohit RC
Title: A very well maintained and beautiful building and campus
Review: This is one of the most beautiful buildings in India!The motto of La Martiniere is ‘Labore et constantia’ "By Labour and Constancy". The La Martiniere College was established in 1845, founded in accordance with the Will of Major General Claude Martin. Born in Lyon, France, in 1735, the Founder died in Lucknow on 13 September, 1800. Muzaffar Ali, the noted Bollywood film producer, director of Anjuman, Gaman, Umrao jaan and many others studied at this school. Coming from Lyon, Claude Martin must have acquired an eye for imposing architecture from his childhood days in his beautiful home town. His architectural skills were much in demand at Lucknow and his nearness to Nawab Asaf-ud-daula gave him a unique opportunity to participate in the making of modern Lucknow. Some of the buildings of Lucknow which have Martin's distinctive touch are: Farhad Baksh, Asafi Kothi, Bibiapur, Barowen and of course the Constantia.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Impressive
Review: Bequeathed by Claude Martin, this is mighty impressive architecture. A fitting use of the money he accrued, probably at the expense of others. Very accommodating staff, as we were allowed into the chapel, library and other interesting parts of the complex.

Name: wing6rider
Title: A great find...
Review: our driver bought us to visit.  We had a good wander around and were amazed at the size of the campus and how nice it was.  The main old building seems to have a unique eclectic character all of its own.  Lots of voices have been heard in the  corridors here.  YMMV

Name: Rajani B
Title: College in Constantia House
Review: This is the college housed in Constantia house. Built in Italian architecture style, this college played a great role during the sepoy mutiny and helped in the seizure of Lucknow. The place has carpet like grass spread and beautiful lawns. Dwell in the memory of India's first battle during freedom struggle and enjoy the peace at this place.

Name: Abhishek S
Title: Good Place
Review: We went here with our friends here. We played cricket here and spend good quality time with old friends.

Name: ChiefExplorers
Title: Heritage School
Review: The La Mart School is in true sense a Heritage School - In a sense that it is a heritage space and structure back from Medieval times which is converted into an institution. This school for both boys and girls has been serving as a top most learning centre in Lucknow, contributing their bit in field of knowledge in the city.

Name: Meg_Redding
Title: Upper Class India, Oh So Colonial
Review: Visiting the college is an eye opener to how the rich educate their children in India. Not sure if the college is now for the poor or the rich. Probably for the poor emulating the rich. Horse riding was included.  Smells of urine in some places. But it was an amazing visit with views of architecture, history, culture. The chapel is beautiful and very special. Met a young student studying in the chapel.  We were there on a Sunday and he sat next to the Emblem Table, studying. He understood some English so we chatted for a little.  Beautiful rooms around and wonderful grounds. Worth a visit because of the history.  Took pictures of the brass bell and the historical arches, and chapel, and beautiful cross. Loved it and stays in memory ....

Name: AAA
Title: Very Beautiful
Review: La Martiniere is very prestigious and beautiful college of lucknow. This college spread over a large area. It's pretty much beautiful. Must Visit place.

Name: JatinAmbani
Title: Educational institute- As royal as it can get
Review: La Martinière Boys' College was built in 1845 and Girls' school n 1869. This is the only school in the World as recipient of Royal Battle Honours for defending Lucknow in 1857 Viplav.. Steps have names of students carved & as old as 1902 that we could find. Wash rooms are located on backside & are clean. Tea/Coffee & bites are available in canteen near entrance. Architecture of the building is amazing & well maintained. Constantin looks marvellous.. These schools were founded by the French Major General Claude Martin. along with 2 others at Kolkata and three at Lyon. This school has boy's & girl's hostel & teachers residences in campus which is  around 200 acres , surrounded by chief minister & his cabinet residences & a Golf Club. Sketing ring outside is excellent & activities related to sports & music are seriously good.

Name: 268yusufn
Title: BEST SCHOOL OF LUCKNOW
Review: This is very famous and reputed school of lucknow .The campus is huge and beautiful form inside .This school do lots of extercalicullar activity .

Name: Vibhu S
Title: La Martiniere College
Review: This is very famous college in Main Lucknow place but there are already almost full admission and very good education in La Matiniere colleges

Name: sun_abhay
Title: One of the best schools in Lucknow
Review: Most respected and sought after school for lucknow residents , having huge infrastructure and campus, a beautiful place to visit but not for casual visitors.

Name: anu m
Title: Very famous college
Review: La martinier college is very famous in lucknow and known for its education. The college campus is huge and beautiful from inside.

Name: sandeep kumar
Title: Nice collage
Review: It is educational collage many boys are visiting for their admission. In this collage both girls and boys has different campus.

Name: 810wanderwoman
Title: Interesting school with lovely gardens and a tiny little tomb for the Indian mistress of  the British commander.
Review: Just ask at the gate if you can walk around.  They'll say yes and then go in and be charmed by the gardens, the classroom buildings, the stables, and the very polite students - the creme de la creme of Lucknow's youth are enrolled here.

Name: Alok N
Title: SEE IF YOU ARE ALLOWED IN
Review: This is a school/college where I would like kids to study. The feeling in the air is of 'overall development' of the child rather than just  ' text book'. The playgrounds, the buildings (some very old) are a treat to see. Really liked the place.

Name: Dusty Traveller
Title: Awe inspiring buliding
Review: One of the interesting places to visit in Lucknow. Its a boy's school and dates back a couple of hundred years almost. Its imposing and steeped in rich history.

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: What an entrance gate
Review: This is a gate with excellent architecture wherein from one side there are three stories and from the other side it is a single story. The architecture and motifs are pleasing and remind of Awadh architecture and intellect.

Name: DBG_Aprl
Title: Magnificent Architecture
Review: It's a magnificent and royal architecture of its kind. Very wide. Located next to Bara imambara. No tickets. Easily accessible by auto.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Majestic monument
Review: The Rumi Darwaza stands in between the Bara Imambara and the Chota Imambara. It is an impressive structure and derives its architecture from Turkish influence. The motifs on the arch have Chikankari design, and pan leaves & fruits, that were the choice of the Nawabs in those days.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Must Watch at Hussainabad Heritage Zone
Review: Standing at 60 Ft, midway between Bada & Chhota Imambara, built in 1784 by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daulah this imposing structure marks the entrance to the old city of Lucknow... designed after the Imperial Gate or Bâb-ı Hümâyûn at the Topkapi Castle of Istanbul is also an example of Awadhi school of architecture

Name: debarshid73
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: If you are standing in front Bara Imambara facing towards it, Rumi Darwaza will be on your right side. This massive structure used to be the entrance of old Lucknow city. It is  located in between Bara Imambara and Chota Imambara, so if you moving towards Choto Imambara from Bara Imambara you need to pass through Rumi Darwaza.

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: Beautiful darwaza
Review: Roomi darwaza is situated at about 5-7 minutes walking distance from Bara Imambara towards chota Imambara. If we have to visit Ghana ghar, picture gallery and chota Imambara from bara Imambara we have to pass through roomi darwaza.       This is a beautiful gate for clicking pictures. Many vehicles ass through this gate.         A beautiful darwaza in Lucknow.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Nice Monumnet
Review: Again as with different monuments of Lucknow, I found this also to be a great monument. However, I am not sure if any body is looking towards its maintenance.  Must visit for first time visitors to Lucknow.

Name: Shveta S
Title: Old&, beautiful
Review: Beautiful darwaza, with intricate work. Be careful of guides around coz not required as such.its close to bada Imambara. Bada Imambara was closed  on Friday till 3pm.sobplan accordingly.

Name: Aman J
Title: elegance of old lucknow.
Review: Rumi Gate is one of the old Lucknow entrances and is still in great shape.Some restoration work is underway.Its a nice drive through moving from Bara Imambara to Small one

Name: Rakesh K
Title: What a darwaza
Review: Ancient history galore is Lucknows forte and this is one place to be seen and felt the glory and the labor involved to build it.

Name: DrKlair
Title: Wonderful unique architectue
Review: Just adjacent to the Bara Imambara is this imposing five story high gate .It has different styles on both side .Beautiful place to click pictures

Name: JoyBose
Title: Its an amazing piece of architecture, from any angle
Review: It was built by the nawabs of Lucknow, it is situated in Chowk area of old Lucknow, walking distance from the imambara. It is a huge gate, climbing it is not possible but one can view from outside. Its beauty is phenomenal from any angle and at any time of day.

Name: Ajeet
Title: One of Identities of Awadh
Review: A very beautiful Awadhi architecture masterpiece, certainly Lucknow’s most photographed place. However this structure needs good maintenance to keep its glory.

Name: R1chardN
Title: A grand gateway
Review: This grand gateway has beautiful architecture and is the entry point to the city.  It's size is impressive and there seems to be a marked difference in the atmosphere on the two sides of the gate.We walked with our guide from inside the city though the gateway to the outside - it is quite exceptional.  On the inside, of course, you will be greeted by the numerous horse pulled carriages where you can buy a guided city tour.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Architechtural landmark, the USP of lucknow
Review: The very good place comes under the heritage zone of Lucknow. very lively in the evening time. A must-see.

Name: Saif Khan
Title: Awesome
Review: Rumi darwaza is one of the famous darwaza and one of the best darwaza beautiful must watch this ek khawat hai jise na Da maula usa de ashf ud daulah

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a very good place to visit atleast once. The architecture is wonderful and should be visited.

Name: Mitesh
Title: Door
Review: Rumi Darwaza in the heart of Lucknow looms over the busy everyday traffic of Lajpatnagar. It is very famous among all of ages

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Marvellous
Review: Located on through fare  near Imambaras  this is a great photo opportunity place with much to see .Superb architecture .

Name: Anuradha
Title: Old world charm
Review: A symbol of Lucknow! A gateway made in a beautiful Awadhi style is a must visit place when you are in Lucknow. Situated in between Bada Imambara and Chhota Imambara, it takes you to 19 th century charm. If you have affinity for old culture you will live this place.

Name: Pawan S
Title: SYMBOL OF NAWAB
Review: A good example of fine architecture of Nawab empire Mixed style architecture of mughal and European And standing with its own style

Name: niya27
Title: Big Gate
Review: This is a big gate near bada imambada. The structure was magnificent. The gate is on the road. There is traffic going through this gate.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Good
Review: Rumi darwaja is beautiful . It was huge and my kids also liked it . There was huge traffic there . Never saw such huge and beautiful darwaja ...

Name: engineertripster
Title: It's a huge gate
Review: We visited this along a list of other attractions when we landed at Bada Imambara. The private guides out there will take you along a 1.5 km journey from Rumi Gate, to Clock Tower and over the Gomti river front. They will say they are taking you to show how Chikan(embroidery) is done, but they will just take you to a shop, which sells finished goods.The Rumi Gate is huge - the front and back designs are completely different. You'll find many vehicles stopped on the side, with groups of friends taking photos.

Name: David
Title: Old Gate
Review: Lukhnow has too many Mugal darwaja like this. We passed many times through Rumi Darwaja, not noticed it because you see several of them around bada imamabara.

Name: Chandra P
Title: Magnificent
Review: The Rumi is part of the gigantic palace complex of the rulers of old. The architecture is stunning and the scope and scale overwhelming. It is well worth seeing.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Gate in the middle of the road…
Review: Rumi Darwaza is one off the iconic attractions of Lucknow. It is an intricately carved door which is right in the middle of the road and has traffic going across it.

Name: chikpick
Title: A short visit to feel the history
Review: Grand gate built with an impressive architecture. Winters are a perfect time to visit. Nearby is immambara. Also tonga ride is a good experience. Quite clean and broad way it is and gives a glimpse of old lucknow. Nearby there are lot of chickenkari shops but don't try those as they tend to sell some cheap stuff.

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Very famous landmark
Review: This is very famous landmark in Lucknow. It is famous for its architecture. Good for first time visitors. Well cleaned and maintained place.

Name: TJRDunne
Title: Stunning, but hard to get a close look at
Review: The Rumi gate is still in use and the road is busy and active. Unless you go at dawn its hard to get a close look at it. It is stunning

Name: Ani397
Title: Just a gate
Review: Nothing so special about this place just a gateway designed in Mughal architecture..You can have few clicks near the gate and also the clock tower is nearby ..I would like to mention here that the auto driver outside the gate will purposely drag you to a few textile shop which they are commissioned from..

Name: rogerl044
Title: Impressive gate
Review: You can only drive through and stop the car long enough to take pictures and appreciate what it must have been like to enter the city through it. It is impressive enough nowadays

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Exciting
Review: From the Bara Imambara, we hopped onto a tanga, & made our way to the Rumi Darwaza. Our excitement was doubled with our first horse carriage ride & the grand gateway ahead of us.The Rumi Darwaza is a gateway built under the patronage of the same Nawab & in the same year as the Bara Imambara. The front facade is a fine, fine example of Awadhi architecture!As it's an operational gateway, you've to be careful of traffic. There's no ticket to see the Rumi Darwaza.

Name: pemmireddy
Title: Good to see
Review: Worth the visit ... no fees as the traffic drives through it. Get a local tour guide to give you the background info

Name: SunnyandBuster
Title: Impressive in size
Review: This is the great ornamental gate of the Bara Imambara. The scale is impressive and there is much to explore. The whole architectural group here includes a huge mosque. No cameras allowed when we visited and a head scarf was not required.

Name: Shardul Bahuguna
Title: One for the history buffs
Review: This is a huge monument right next to the Bara Imambara. You can walk to the mammoth gate. no tickets, not gates. Traffic uses the gate so you need to hop on and off the road a bit. The structure is humongous and beautiful. For history buffs, there enough to read and learn about the place, but for a regular tourist it may not amount to much except for a few pictures.

Name: Dev Marwaha
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Roomi gate built in 1784 is one of the most peaceful architecture in lucknow and is now used as the symbol for city of NAWABS.It used to mark the entrance to Old Lucknow City, but as the City of Nawabs grew and expanded, it was later used as an entrance to a palace which was later demolished by the British insurgents.

Name: nilesh_nagar
Title: Historic
Review: Ancient place of historic importance. Architecture is good and it’s part of heritage of the city of Lucknow. Take a few snaps there and move on. Nothing much special for common people but for history lovers it’s important place.

Name: Manava
Title: Simple
Review: This is one bigish gate... it is ornate and stands between Bara Imambara and Chota Imambara. It is a 5 min visit only.  You dont need any ticket or anything to see it. The place is of historic value. But basic and simple. Lots of cycle rikshaws hurdle around here.

Name: Kdue2
Title: Beautiful
Review: You can walk from Chota Imambara via Rumi Gate to Bara Imambara. It has too many cars parked in front but it is a beautiful gate.

Name: taotzu
Title: Outstanding City gate
Review: This is a very outstanding City gate loading to bara imambara. The  promenade with cobbled streets leadings in to the old city before this gate is amazingly colonial reminding us of European City. Great.

Name: Rajjat Sabhrwal
Title: You should once visit to witness this
Review: I must say that if you are in Lucknow, you should once visit this place to see its architecture, it’s really nice if you know a little bit about this place. This was actually built in 1784 - 86, it has approx 69 feet entrance and looks really great once you cross this.. many vehicles go it from this gate as its in in the middle of the road.. also people say that there is no visible support to this high entrance.. make sure you also pass this gate..

Name: prakharsingh
Title: great
Review: my experience was great, i roamed all around the area which was surrounded with epic things. lovable place to shop for cheap and ethnic stuffs.

Name: tickettoamoment
Title: Great art work
Review: This gate defines the beauty of mughal times. If we see this design up side down it looks like chicken work. Which is one of the famous design of Lucknow. Great source of income during mughal empire.

Name: Indieopus
Title: Was expecting more but it's fine!
Review: This is a specially made Darwaza or door on the main road which is no more a spot to stand and click photos or do something there, you can pass through the door as that's the only road for all the vehicles to pass through! Could have made a podium or something to click photos !

Name: Jatin Lamba
Title: Iconic and landmark gateway
Review: Rumi Darwaza is an architectural marvel and an iconic landmark gateway of the city of Lucknow.  This was built by Nawab Asaf-Ud-daula during the late 18th century.  There was severe drought conditions for several years in Lucknow during those days and to help the people earn money, the Nawab decided to built this iconic structure.  11 years' period was consumed in building this gateway.  In order to let people continue to earn livelihood, the Nawab used to get construction works done during day time and destruction partially during the night hours so that maximum period is consumed and help in the form of wages can be accorded for the betterment of the public at large.  It is a huge structure and traffic pass through this.  It is adjacent to the Bada Imambara.

Name: durham05
Title: Impressive
Review: The impressive mughal gate is certainly worth checking out and there are many other historic Islamic buildings in the surrounding area.

Name: Shyam S
Title: Place eflects Nawabi Architecture and beautiful work
Review: Its transit for small vehicles, yet its must visit. Best if you can step out and behold ancient beauty.

Name: 982pradipb
Title: A Hurried Trip
Review: The Darwaja is located next to the Bara Imambara. It presents different views from the front and the back . The area around is not well maintained. A road passes through it .

Name: Mayank S
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: It's a beautifully built door on the middle of the road and seemed nice to drive through it. The road is extremely wide and we'll maintained. I would suggest you to avoid the private guides who'll just not stop following you and would give inaccurate facts about this place. It's better you visit this place without one. The private guides here are a scam.

Name: apul_goel
Title: Rumi darwaza: the symbol of Lucknow!
Review: Standing gracefully near the Bara Imambara, the Rumi darwaza, has a unique architecture. Give some time to appreciate its beauty!

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: GATEWAY OF LUCKNOW
Review: Its really amazing and very huge. Its looking like RAJ MAHAL. Nice to see this beautiful historical place.

Name: S P S
Title: Gateway to enter Imambara
Review: See the art and architecture of the building, mehrabs, stone used to built the gate.  It has three gates with such heights through which trucks could drive easily.

Name: Asim A
Title: Beautiful.
Review: After completing a great tour of Bara Imambara my cousins took me to the Museum and on the way there we went through this beautiful historical gate.  It was a treat to see this beautiful gate and learning the history.

Name: Naveen
Title: Nice Architecture but requires cleaning of surrounding area
Review: Nice Architecture but towards chota imam bara and chants Ghar it becomes a toilet , place requires cleaning and traffic control

Name: rajesh
Title: lucknows best example of avadhi architecture
Review: its one of the best example of awadhi architecture and is easily related to the name of  lucknow.a must visit

Name: Bharat K
Title: Magnificent structure, good to see from a distance
Review: Located between the Clock Tower and the Bara Imambara, it is architecturally beautiful.You can get a good view while walking or driving past from the Clock Tower to the Bara Imambara or vice versa.Do stop and have a good look to appreciate the architecture. It is a 2 minute attraction, and is also visible from the Clock Tower and from the Bara Imambara.The traffic is very chaotic and heavy in the evenings from 5 pm, and finding a parking spot is difficult.

Name: Dr. Rohit Mody Cardiologist Mumbai
Title: Good experience
Review: Nice place to visit. Place is near Bada Imambara. Many other places. Clock Tower and Chicken Cloth Factory, Nimbu Park is good places to visit. Darwaja is historically and artistically very important landmark. This darwaza has been filmed for Film Gaddar and shown as Lahore Gate. This information given to us by Guide.

Name: GoPlaces65661648539
Title: Stately and Peaceful
Review: Our visit was truly enjoyable because of the peaceful and serene setting that punctuated the backdrop

Name: ASHISH V
Title: Must place to visit in lucknow.
Review: Its one of the historical monument of Lucknow. A must visit place if you are planning to visits Lucknow.

Name: rajivtyagi
Title: RumI
Review: Made to mark respect for famous persian poet Rumi. This is a faboulous structure with differen designs on both sides. An iconic structure in lucknow. This is located just next to Bara Imambara.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Magnificent
Review: One of the most beautiful gates,I have come across, very impressive considering when it was built, still a bustling part of town.

Name: Janaki Visvanath
Title: Majestic
Review: What a view! It's majestic, standing right in the middle of the road! With traffic all around, it stands tall to the Shia traditions of Lucknow

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: darwaza
Review: a historical place made in 1784 by the nawab of lucknow . beautiful piece of architecture and one of the famous historical place in lucknow . famous gateway to lucknow and famous tourist spot

Name: Lbs123
Title: must visit place
Review: very beautifully design gate from one side its looks like three story building on otherside its looks like one story, if you look gate upside down its famous embroidery for most of lucknowie kurtas.

Name: Sharil I
Title: An insight into the heart of Lucknow
Review: This place has an environmental benefit rather than anything. Here you can learn the historical legacy of the city while visiting to different parks and sit thrus that give you peace and relaxation.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Classical Architecture
Review: Just near the Imambara. Once it was the entry point to Lucknow. Prefer to see it in late evening when illuminated by lights.

Name: FATBOY
Title: RUMI DARWAZA
Review: Rumi Darwaza,Built by Nawab Asaf us daula in 1784, is a historical monument near Bada ImamBada, Lucknow. Takes you back in time showing the brilliance of awadhi architecture. It has a big lantern on top of it which lights this monument at night. Definitely a place to visit in Lucknow.

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Sightseeing
Review: Rumi Darwaza is located in front of Bada Imambada. Nice place to click some photos. The architecture is different from both sides

Name: Krupabn
Title: Gateway which is like 2 sides of coin
Review: Gateway has intricate designs carved in it.. Both sides of the gateway are different.. Iconic landmark of Lucknow.. Premises is not maintained well but worth a visit.

Name: keith h
Title: Iconic Victory Arch.
Review: The Arch is synonomous with Lucknow & is modelled on one of Istanbul's gates to Asia Minor. It was constructed under the auspices of Nawab Asaf-ud-daula 7 straddles the road neat the Bara Imambara. As well as being of massive dimensions it is host to some beautiful carvings.

Name: Sweetbunnycute
Title: Beautiful gate
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a beautiful gate built by the Nawab of Lucknow. It is designed in such a way that it looks like a 3-4 storey building from one side and once you cross the gate and look around. The view is completely different. You see a single huge gate with such beautiful carvings. It is a real delight for one’s eyes.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: Landmark of Lucknow
Review: This is considered to be a landmark of Lucknow and is located right close to the bada Imambara. Basically it's also forms a part of local Road in Lucknow. Many historical places are within a kilometre  around

Name: Vaibhav Bakhshi
Title: A well suited identity for Lucknow
Review: This Turkish gate, built under the patronage of Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula stands as the identity of Lucknow city. It provides a fitting entrance to the palacial complex of the Nawabs. It was designed in Turkey and has been named after a Muslim sufi saint, Jalal ad-Din Muhammad Rumi. I personally have a lot of appreciation for the grandeur of this gate. With the recent renovations in the area, this gate is now accessible from all sides and there is an open sit-out area next to it which allows the visitors to enjoy this place in the evenings.

Name: nikrang
Title: The great Gate
Review: Very fine example of the old style. And looks awsome as it spans that main thorough fare. Well preserved

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Door of benevolence
Review: Constructed by the nawab to give labour to his people during a famine. Both it's facades are different. On one side are 3 orifices while on the other is the famous single door.Made with lentil as one of the ingredients, it also has clove replicas all over the structure.

Name: Akriti G G
Title: Its simply beautiful!
Review: we drove past this both during the day and night and it is simply magnificent! loved the detailing and architecture! it has a lovely charm to itself.

Name: Anupriya S
Title: Imposing Gateway
Review: Rumi Darwaza is a magnificent sample of awadhi architecture. It was built under the patronage of the nawab of awadh. A must visit.

Name: Huzefa
Title: Grand indeed
Review: Very grand... especially if you can imagine a train of elephants and mounted soldiers entering the city in old history... a must stop by

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good place
Review: Lucknow's wisdom and culture are unmatched. Rumi darwaze is one of the most satisfying places I have visited. Garden surrounding this monument are clean. It always makes me peace when I spend a couple of hours here.

Name: BloggersWithoutBorders
Title: Historical Architecture
Review: It's an road which leads to Imambara and Ghantaghar. It looks amazing but it is not maintained well. There is visiting charges but reaching early will help you to click some amazing pictures. If you are visiting Imambara and driving your own car you get parking at Rumi Darwaza. You can also hire a horse ride to take a spin around near by places and charges are very minimal.

Name: Ratish J
Title: Poor Maintenance
Review: Although the gate is majestic but it needs urgent attention. The thoroughfare should be out of bound for cars and bikes.It is well known structure at Bada Imambada and can be seen in many movies shot at Lucknow.

Name: Sightsee611662
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: Breathtaking beauty but amidst a busy roadside . Have to be careful regarding the traffic especially during rush hours

Name: Rahul r
Title: Great historical palce
Review: It's a great historical place in Lucknow. I enjoyed here with family and friends. Highly recommended for weakened holiday.

Name: Bee143
Title: Beautiful but requires maintenance...
Review: Located just outside of Bara Imambara in Old Lucknow...this area is definately worth visiting to appreciate the beautiful architecture.

Name: Manas R
Title: Unforgettable
Review: At times when the sun is not scorching, preferably around dawn or dusk, you would simply love to stare at the architecture, ignoring surrounding crowd or traffic.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Hugh entrance !
Review: we passed there in our car+driver+guide as part of our tour and we took some photos but did not get down.

Name: kondu
Title: Gate with a difference.
Review: It is just 10 minutes to see this darwaza the gate. on one side it is mohamedian aechitecture and from other side it is indian. it is a mere entry ans exit gate constructed in unison. even after three centuries they stand tall. worth viewing.

Name: Mousumee M
Title: Mughal Architecture
Review: It is close to Bara Imambara of Lucknow. A huge gate of about 60 ft height. As we got down from the local autorickshaw, a young guide approached us for a guided tour of Rumi Darwaza,Clock Tower  and Shahi Bawli. It was a short distance covered by a battery run small auto rickshaw. All these three huge architectural beauties reminds us about the rich nawabi heritages of old Lucknow. Somehow people go back to the history...the olden times.

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Just another GAte
Review: Only if ur local guise creates interest by the history of the architecture of the gate, it will create a buzz, else it is just another pass way to the imamabra in old city.

Name: Megha
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: You can travel on e rickshaw and visit all sites nearby but please beware of guides of rickshaw drivers who want you to divert from your plan and take you to particular shop of lakhnawi clothes.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Rumi Darwaza
Review: If you are visiting Lucknow and want to witness the epitome of Awadh architecture, then this place should be on your bucket list.

Name: Hads3g
Title: Iconic Awadhi architecture
Review: This darwaza is a symbol of Awadhi/ Nababi architechture which is a perfect blend of different kind of styles.

Name: Abhinav D
Title: Must visit for anyone visiting Lucknow
Review: Its the city's culture, heritage which is truly visible when you visit this part of the city !You will also be getting a variety of cuisines here which nowhere else is available in lucknow ! A few of the items not to miss in chowk are the famous Biryani, Shree Lassi ke Chole Bature, Raja ki Thandai , Aam ki kheer ,Radhey lal's sweets & makkhan malai.

Name: Mital_Ashish
Title: Must visit - see the photos
Review: must visit - beautiful, lovely architecture though not well maintained or preserved. Tourism and Archaeology go hand in hand - need to preserve and showcase our monuments and culture

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: historic
Review: this is the entry gate of bara imambara and bhul bhulaiyya. the structure is maintained very well. good place to take photos.

Name: indrajit1405
Title: evolution of the kurta neck designs
Review: the entire gate when seen upside down it shows how the neck designs of the kurtas started. its just a gate in the heritage area of Lucknow next to the Bara and Chota imambaras

Name: MoushumiBhattacharya
Title: Designed as inverted Naulakha Haar!
Review: Rumi Gate is made in the design of a Naulakha haar, inverted. Also designed like the Lucknow famous Chikankari embroidery work. Very close to Bara Imambara, it has a beautiful setting to see the city passing by the gate. From one end, you can see the four stories of the architect whereas from the other end, it is the only one piece. A true marvel.

Name: rajivdst
Title: Classic Arch gate
Review: Rumi Darwaja is part of the complex housing Bada Imambara and Chhota Imambara and on the passage from one to the other. It had one main arch and two side arches, meant for passage of elephants and horses during the Nawab rulers.

Name: Demétrio S
Title: Must see

Name: Amitabh
Title: Best temple
Review: Absolutely stunning place and very peaceful location, out from city. We went there with our team and reached in early morning hours. No words for beauty of temple.

Name: Sachin Gupta
Title: Temple Of Lucknow - Chandrika Devi Temple
Review: Jai Mata Di . Very good temple , area is more crowded on Monday and festival sessions. It is very famous temple in Lucknow .

Name: Abhinesh kumar
Title: A must visit place in Lucknow
Review: DOn't miss your visit to this temple during your Lucknow visit. The whole route is so scenic and beautiful that you will love the tour. The surrounding resorts and fund places and farm houses like- ANGELS PARADISE etc are great in itself ! Must visit ANGELS PARADISE at Kathwara Road, whenever you visit this temple in your next visit

Name: Abhishek K
Title: Chandrika devi temple visit
Review: There was less crowd due to covid crisis. Usually it’s very crowded and takes 2-3 hours for darshan.It was overall a good temple visit with family.Started drive early morning to avoid traffic and crowd at temple.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Felt good
Review: Temple is beautiful and a little away from city . But it was good visiting here . Felt nice here I visited here with my family here to seek blessings .

Name: kalvakota k
Title: Pilgrimage
Review: Very good temple in small village a Durga temple worshipped by babbreek grand son of gahtochka on advise of krishna

Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: My Visit to Chandrika Devi mandir, Lucknow.
Review: This is a very ancient temple dating back to Ramayana period. The name of this temple is mentioned in Skanda Purana. This temple is seen on the banks of Gomati River in Kathvara village beside the National Highway No.24 between Lucknow and Sitapur. This temple is nearly 28 kms from Lucknow. We went there by taxi. The presiding deity is a form of Duiga or Chandi. The road is very smooth flanked by fields and greenery and small houses. The temple is seen on an elevated platform. A welcome arch is seen at the entrance of the temple. A row of shops greets the view of the pilgrims who have to go through a queue. A colorful bundle of votive pieces of pink cloth and a number of bells are seen hanging in the temple hall. In the inner sanctum a row of three small pindis symbolizing Chandi is seen. On the right side Nava Durgas in the form of pindis(Lingas) is seen. These idols are said to be installed by Sage Narada according to some legends. The present idols were installed by Thakur Beni Singh Chauhan, the landlord of Kathwara village nearly two hundred and fifty years ago.  According to legends Rajkumar Chandraketu, son of Lakshman, founded Lakshmnapuri (later called as Lucknow). Once he was travelling with Ashwamedha horse through a dense forest which appeared quite dark and dreadful. He prayed to Durga, who appeared there with bright moonlight and blessed him. He established a temple here. So the goddess is called Chandrika. In Dwapara Yuga Pandavas, during their exile period visited this place and Yudhistir performed a Yagna here. Ghatothkacha’s son, Barabareeka, on Krishna’s advice did penance here for three years to acquire mighty powers. Some Puranas say that Lord Chandra was freed from Daksha’s curse when he came and bathed in the holy pond. Yudhistir’s son, Sudhanwa worshipped the Goddess and hence this place is also called Sudhanwa Kund. In twelfth century this temple was destroyed by the army of Sayyad Salar Masud Gazi. Two hundred and fifty years ago villagers found the idol in the cavity of a neem tree. They informed the landlord of the village. He built a temple and a Vedi for performing Homas. The temple pond is called Mahisagar Theertha. A small bridge is seen across the pond with a beautiful statue of Lord Shiva in meditating posture. At the back of the temple there is a small shrine for Kala Bhairav.  In this temple special poojas are done during Amavasya (new Moon) and during Nava Rathri festival.  The temple timings are from 5.00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. and from 4.00 p.m. to 11.00 p.m.  Aarti is performed three times in this temple at 6.00 a.m. 1.00 p.m. at 7.00 p.m. You will find this temple in scenic surroundings surrounded on three sides by the Gomati River.

Name: Parth101
Title: Beautiful campus
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple is situated in Aashiyana and is dedicated to the Hindu Goddess. Its beautiful temple and big campus. We have there for two hour.

Name: tickettoamoment
Title: Zor se bolo Jai Mata Di 🙏🏻🙂
Review: Beautiful and religious place the most famous dugra mandir. Lots of bhakt have faith on this place. The shakshat place of dugra maa mostly people says that, so as new travel blogger of this city I visited here first. On this navratri festival... Happy navratri to all of you. 🙏🏻

Name: Niraj K
Title: Jai Mata Di
Review: A very famous religious place for hindus having an idol of Maa Chandriks Devi.Situated at the outskirts of Lucknow near Bakshi Ka Talab on Lucknow Sitapur Highway.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Jai Mata di
Review: A place where you can have peace, people all around will be praying for their loved ones. Chanting of prayers and music from the rhythms of the bell and gong soothed our hearts. My wish came true instantly the moment i wished. All the best to everyone.

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Visit to holy temple
Review: We in a group of friends went to visit holy Chandrika Devi Temple. I went after long time and was very excited to be there for darshan.We did our Pooja and got blessings.very much satisfied and happy to be there.

Name: SAURAV C
Title: Blessed are you if you reach there
Review: You are one of the Blessed if you happen to visit the Great Chandrika Devi Temple. I was Blessed to visit the Place, Be there to be blessed.

Name: Sudhir S
Title: A hindu temple with great faith
Review: Approx. 30 KM  away from Charbagh Railway station and about 10km off sitapur road in bakshi ka talab. A number of people visiting this temple regularly from Lucknow and nearby places. On Navratris and weekend rush is there.. People have great faith in the temple.Mundan (head shave of children) is done behind the temple.A number of make shift resturants have come up serving tasty snacks and tea.Good pedas are avalable at reasonable price

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Temple
Review: Chandrilka Devi Temple is situated on Sitapur road. This temple is a center of devotion and is a nice place.

Name: PRADEEP R
Title: Holly place in between jungle
Review: This is very holly place in between jungle with good road way .u can go here by your own wheclie otherwise hire car . Its 40 km far from lucknow . If you like pecefull place and faith in Goad this is best place . You must go on once in your life .very pecefull place

Name: Hedonist_Surya
Title: A hindu religeous place with many of its own belief and spiritual importance.
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple is good place you would feel good only at the temples.the parking insn't good and most of foolish people had also made the sacred water place even dirty by washing clothes and using soap for bathing right there in sacred pond which isn't good.A bit of messy place due to stalls but the temples are way good.To visit here i recommend bring your own vehicle and keep a half day long time with you with some food.Excellent place for spiritual and religeous beliefs!!!not a place for hangout.

Name: randhirt2017
Title: Most famous temple in lucknow
Review: Nice to go there,so peaceful from the city,the lord shiva's statue is also a tourist attraction,come here and have blessings,after darshan you can have tea cold drinks pakoda etc from any stall.

Name: KhannaK491
Title: A divine retreat and great place for long drive
Review: The temple is revered in and around Lucknow. Even people from distant places come and visit.Ideal time to go is early morning to have a peaceful darshan Else it gets too crowded and you have to stay in long queues to get a glimpse of the deity.The place has a pond / sarovar too with a huge Shiv Statute in the centre. If its raining, the beauty of this place magnifies !!It has a series of shops dotted along the path to the temple ( a few stairs that be be easily ascended) with everything from beads and bangles to chunri, accessories available.It has dhabas near it as well, so visit the temple early morning and wind up your trip with a breakfast of Jalebi and pakori and tea. From the main highway- the temple is a 10 kms drive and the road is single lane with mostly forest and fields on both sides.You can visit any time of the year- During Navaratri - the temple sees footfall of millions.

Name: Ankur P
Title: "Things are improving "
Review: Last time when i visited this place there were less facilities for dinner & parking. but now you can enjoy good food facility with safe parking.

Name: shuchivratmishra
Title: Best religious place to visit in Lucknow
Review: Chandrika Devi Mandir an ancient and awesome religious place to visit is a temple of Goddess Durga. On every  new moon a fair is organised here. Auto rickshaw and other public vehicles are available for this place from Charbagh. If you are in Lucknow so you should definitely visit this HINDU TEMPLE.

Name: Rohit T
Title: Devi darshan
Review: Located about 30 km from Lucknow, This temple attracts devotees from far-off places. A must visit for Devi devotees.

Name: Maruti J
Title: Holy Place
Review: I visited this Temple last week and with my great fortune i am able to attend morning aarti. As per my discussion good time to visit is early morning because there will not be rush and you will be able to do pooja without any problem.

Name: Jaspal_Singh
Title: Nice Spirtual Place
Review: Its in the outskirts of Lucknow. Well managed with religious flavor. Nice sarovar by the side and good darshan. Overall a good trip.

Name: Manish Pande
Title: heaven for those seeking to worship the Mother Divine, a matter of faith, really a blessed person can only reach here
Review: heaven for those seeking to worship the Mother Divine, a matter of faith, really a blessed person can only reach here, you get what you pray for

Name: Ankur P
Title: My Visit at Chandrika Devi Temple Lucknow
Review: This temple exist out side area of Lucknow near bakshi ka talab (BKT). It's good place to visite with family and spend your day in peace.

Name: Roshini A
Title: Chandrika Devi Temple
Review: Holy place. Maa of Lucknow, One of the famous temple in the city beautiful spiritual and peaceful place.☆Felling blessed☆Must visit.

Name: That Gourmand Girl
Title: Must visit religious place !

It will approx take 40-45 mins depending on the traffic and from where you are starting your journey. The calm and peaceful environment of this place gives positive vibes. The place is seen crowded during navratri days.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Religious
Review: Very famous temple of mata. Great religious place. At the time of navratri there is the maximum Crowd. There is also a magnificent statue of Shiv ji. Must visit.

Name: PD1059
Title: If you want to visit a temple and like a small drive
Review: If you worship Mata, a want some time for your self as well this place is for you. Of course during navratras and few other occasions, lot of people come here

Name: Pankaj G
Title: Religious Place
Review: its famous for his aamavasya mela, that's place are also famous for his amazing shiv statue . i think one time will be visit for his nature touches and spiritual culture.

Name: Rajani B
Title: Powerful deity
Review: Located about 30 kilometres from the centre of the city, this temple is dedicated to goddess chandrika who is a form of Goddess Durga. The current temple structure is 300 years old but the temple here is said to exist since long as this temple is mentioned in Hindu religious texts. The temple was visited by us in the morning. There was not much crowd.

Name: Gurumurthy Bhargava
Title: Pilgrimage. ....continues
Review: Visited Mata Chandrika Devi Temple while returning back from Chakra tirth Temple as it falls on the Sitapur Lucknow highway .One has to take a detour of about 11kms from the highway.Although the temple is said to be old the present structure seems to  have  dwarfed the original temple.Since I visited around Dusshera time this place was crowded equally with pilgrims, kiosks selling various items including offerings for Mata Chandrika Devi and beggars. Anyways, had a nice darshan of Mata Chandrika Devi and also of Lord Shiva (an  impressive statue) installed in the adjacent pool.Another place for devoted Hindus.

Name: ILIKA
Title: People say Goddess here is very powerful
Review: This place is located at the outskirts of lucknow on the way to the city of Sitapur. Many locals have huge faith in the goddess here.

Name: Vibhu S
Title: Holy Place
Review: This is place at HN 24 highway of Sitapur Road and holy place of Hindu Darshan the name of Devi ji darshan

Name: ansh280810
Title: too good
Review: very good place to visit Thousands of people visit everyday. and in the season of Navratri fair organised. it is situated in Bakshi ka Talab, Lucknow on Lucknow -Delhi road. Distance of temple from Charbagh railway station is 30 km.and well connected with transport.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Peaceful place
Review: This is an old temple of Chandrika devi. I went here for the darshan on day of my birthday. Nice and peaceful place.

Name: Manish_Jaiswal123
Title: Blessed
Review: Clean place and very peaceful and if you visit Lucknow and don't  visit this temple then you really missed a place where you should be to enjoy and to have a peaceful meditation.

Name: sun_abhay
Title: Temple of godess with lot of peace
Review: a beautiful temple of Goddess Chandrika and Mahadev , place of worship with huge faith following and devotion, a must see place for people visiting Lucknow.

Name: Shailendra S
Title: must visit
Review: its a must visit temple if you have a little bit time , located in the bank of river Gomti, it is one of the finest Mandir, where people comes from very far places and during navratra this is little bit tricky place as you will find ques  big, but in mandir you really feel good, must a visit place

Name: sums444
Title: Maa chandrika
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple in Lucknow is an age old temple, situated around 28 Kms. Away from the city at the Sitapur Road near Baxi Ka Talab [near bank of Gomti River]. This temple is of Ramayan Era. It is said that elder son of Shri Lakshmana - the founder of Lucknow, Rajkumar Chandraketu, was once going with Ashwmegh Horse through Gomti. In the way, it became dark and hence he had to take rest in the dense forest.He prayed Goddess for safety. Within a moment there was cool moon light and the Goddess appeared before him and assured him.

Name: vinitasaraf2015
Title: feeling blessed
Review: A very popular temple with sceniv views. Its very peaceful and calm.The roads leading ofers good views especially during rains

Name: Anurag243
Title: SPIRITUAL
Review: One of the famous temples in the city.. beautiful to travel at monsoon.. a very beautiful spiritual and peaceful place....

Name: skrishna2016
Title: peaceful feeling
Review: I have visited there in monsoon season. The road leading to temple gives an awesome scenic green view of fields and gardens. Temple is also situated in a very nice location. It gives me an inner feeling of peace and contentment. The experience was really soul filling. One can enjoy every moment spent there. There are various  food joints also where you can have some snacks.

Name: Nupursingh
Title: Similar like other temple
Review: This place is similar like other temple in the city. Nothing great. Please come if you have ample time.

Name: ansangam
Title: A temple with a natural environment
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple ,also called as Mahi Sagar Teerth,300 years old, situated on the bank of river Gomti at north-west of National Highway No.24 is a sacred temples of the Hindu god Chandi [Durga],28Kms away from Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, There is mention of this temple in the holy books of Skand and Karma Puran.A temple worth visiting

Name: qahead123
Title: Aasstha
Review: Tis place is a bit out of Lucknow. It has a beautiful temple and the natural pindies are still there alongwith the murties.

Name: anooojpal00
Title: it is holly place
Review: when i went chandrika devi temple that time no crowed in September but when nav ratri is started then here is lots of crowed but this place gives peace of mind..

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Visit to Chandrika Devi Temple
Review: This is the very old Chandrika Devi Temple in the city on the outskirts and devotees are coming here in large numbers during Navaratris (both Chaitra and Shardeeya Navaratri). Main attraction for Hindus and other communities having faith in Goddess.

Name: sujatapant
Title: temple
Review: about half hour from lucknow ,this temple is dedicated to durga and during festivals very crowded .its an ancient temple and quaint

Name: P N M
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent place for devotees. Chandrika devi Temple is appro. 10 Km. away from Sitapua Road in Bakshi ka Talab Lucknow. At every Amavashya big MELA is organised there. People sued go there for so many ceremonies of Hindu Culture   You may enjoye there  for so many hours .

Name: anuj729
Title: On a bicycle ride to this naturally beautiful place of Worship
Review: I had been to this temple twice on a bicycle ride of 60 kms along with my fellow riders. The temple is on the outskirts of Lucknow City on the banks of River Gomti.You have to travel on the sitapur - Lucknow highway for 20 kms and then another 10 kms in the interiors of bakshi ka talab locality.On the way you will natural sceneary just 20 kms away from the hustle and bustle of the city.Avoid going on Mela days as it's overcrowded by devotees and you will stick in traffic jam.Another 2 kms is a beautiful spot...a scared banyan tree surrounded by mango orchids.....it's a must visit spot in any season....Local Street food is available around temple complex but avoid it...if you are a traveller.

Name: Shubham Gupta
Title: really peaceful place for me
Review: I love worshipping god here. This temple is really very beautiful . You must visit when you are lucknow

Name: DhirajJurno
Title: Pilgrimage place of godess Durga Chandrika Devi
Review: Place is famous for its navratri and other melas amongst locals. One on the main worship centers of city and surrounding areas like Barabanki etc. Chandrika devi temple is also famous for its pond and serene location people used go out for picnic there.

Name: gireeshy2016
Title: Feel Good to visit here
Review: I feel Good to visit here. this is the very good temple you must visit ones especially in amavasya mela, on that time its environment is very different you feel that when visit.

Name: ManishaMehrotra
Title: Faith is the answer
Review: It's all about faith. People believe that all their wishes come true ,if they visit this temple. They tie bells after getting their wish fulfilled. You will find thousands of bells tied  in the railings and corridor of the temple. At the backside is river Gomti, and the entire atmosphere is full of positive energy.

Name: journey2016
Title: BEST TEMPLE OF DURGA MA.
Review: chandrika devi is most beautiful temple for hindus peaple. this temple is net 35 k.m from my house where i live in gomtinagar lucknow and appox 30 to 35 kilometer from charbagh railway station. this place is in bakshi ka talaab area in sitapur road i came here 3 times and if  i gets oppportunity to come here i never miss chance.during navratra here most of people come to here for pray of maa durga.this place is also famous for bhandara and mundan programmes. come here and enjoy

Name: Shri Krishan Kansal
Title: Faith jai mata ki
Review: An old temple of ma durga away from adversities of city about 30 km from Lucknow 9 km inside away from main road. Needs to be properly maintained seeing the faith of people from surroundings.

Name: Aman A
Title: Excellent temple
Review: This temple is located at a distance of around 30 kms from Lucknow city center. The temple is beautiful and has many temple goods shop and mini open air dhaba's.

Name: gayatriPune
Title: chandrikadevi temple
Review: We visited it recently. It's pilgrimage for many surrounding villages. the daities are found & many people believe it's significance. It wasn't crowded as we went at odd time.

Name: shankiscool
Title: Chankdrika Devi Temple
Review: This temple is an old temple built a few decades ago (NOT SURE!). It's a well built temple on the bank of the river Gomti. It's situated on a low plane, so won't suggesting visiting this temple during monsoons at any cost.Good place to visit if looking for a religious place to go to with family.

Name: Rahul Saini
Title: "A Divine place in lap of nature"
Review: It an awesome place to visit.. doesn't matter whether you are a devotee or not.... but if you visit there, sure would love the experience. Place is very calm away from the rush of city.

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A Nice and old Temple
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple is a 300 year old Durga temple located 28 kms from lucknow on the bank of river Gomti. The temple and nearby areas have relevance and religious significance in Ramayana and is called Mahi Sagar Teerth. Here main attraction is a huge idol of Lord Shiva in nearby Kund.Must visit place for devotee of Goddess.

Name: VaniChugh
Title: Temple with Strong Positive energy
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple is an old temple and famous for its association with the olden times. I visited with my family and felt some positive energy there. The Idol is beautifully decorated which causes the attraction among the visitors. There is a local market around where you can buy and eat snacks. But will suggest to go when the weather is good as its almost outside the city so will not get any good place to sit and relax.

Name: RAJKUMAR H
Title: Jai Mata Di
Review: I visited this beautiful temple on,4.8.15,and was truly fascinated by idol of Chandrika Devi.The temple was not crowded and I prayed with utmost devotion for some time,and then also visited Shiva Temple in left side of the temple Hall.TheShiv Lyring and Nandi,very attractive.The exit,door leading me to Kali Mata Temple,The idol of Kali Mata.The bid idol of Mahadev,in the pond was remarkable.I was truly blessed.

Name: plpalani
Title: Powerful Sakthipeth
Review: This temple about 25 km from Lucknow is the abode of Chandrika Devi. The road to this temple is very green with lot of mango orchards.The pundits here are quite knowledgeable and the poojas and haven are very  properly conducted

Name: Riya248
Title: Lovely palce
Review: The temple and the place is lovely. Its away from city rush, in a calm environment.There is a pond too near to the temple.

Name: bharati2408
Title: Experience the divinity!
Review: The place is nice, located away from the city rush.Visit the temple and experience the divine feeling of spirituality.There is a pond with a big statue of Lord shiva in the middle of it.Sit & relax in the temple premise, click pictures.there are several local shops to do shopping. You can also enjoy tea and snacks as there are many stalls nearby.

Name: VijayPratap0522
Title: Must visit in Navaratra.
Review: Very religious place and old temple of Mata. Go there in times of navaratra but be ready to face crowded roads there. Very peaceful environment.

Name: Mrinal Gautam
Title: God is Great!!!
Review: Everything about this place.... Cant comment on Goddess and her worship place.... This is "THE" place to be .... situated beside river Gomti it has both scenic beauty and spiritual atmosphere....

Name: avi692
Title: Jai mata Di
Review: A very known temple located at sitapur road..people come here with their families from nearby places/cities Anyone who comes lucknow must visit their once, to stay blessed!

Name: Avichal71277
Title: Nice picnic spot
Review: Devoted to Goddess Chandrika Devi, the temple is near Bakshi Talab, approx 30 Km from Charbaug. Situated on the bank of Gomti River, is a nice and clean place to go for a picnic. Pack your food and go.

Name: Amber S
Title: nice place
Review: well known place of lucknow 25km away nice place for dershan of DEVI MAA.one must visit the place with family.

Name: prabhakarbaba
Title: Mata Ka Darwar
Review: Chandrika devi temple is very historical place . Every amwasa there is rural fare ( Mela ) is organised . Arti of chandrika devi is very good.

Name: SjAwadh
Title: A Place of Devotion !!
Review: 1.  A place mentioned in ancient religious ancient scriptures believed to exist even at the great epic age .2. A beautiful temple is built here dedicated to goddess Durga  present here in pindi form.3. It is believed that goddess Durga first gave darshan to Chandraketu,Son of Laxmana,in the moonlight in Treta Yuga and the place also existed in Mahabharata times.4. The place was long lost in dense forest and was rediscovered by villagers around 300 years back5. The temple is built on elevated ground and is surrounded by river Gomti on three sides which enhances its beauty6. It is on the outskirts of the city and distance is around 30 kms on NH 24 , and going by public conveyance is a little tedious  .7.  Must visit place for people who believe in divine power

Name: RA680
Title: Great pilgrimage idea when you are in Lucknow
Review: The temple has been revamped and decorated and the process is ongoing. Facilities for devotees are increasing day by day. On days which are not special, it is a serene place for meditation

Name: Kunal G
Title: Good visit
Review: Its a good place to visit. I visited the temple with my wife and in laws. Its a good place to hangout with family. Located away from the crowd of city. The tea and pakodas are really good there.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: Temple
Review: A good place for devotees, away from city crowd. People visits here with lots of faith in Goddess. A worth place of visiting and warshipping

Name: abhishek_leo
Title: religious place ...
Review: a place with high local belief and following  ... located about 30 km away from the city on lko- IIM road ... should book a cab or take your own car.. annual mela held at navratri.. very crowded during that time ... avoid during monsoons ...

Name: Chaitanya A
Title: Religious place
Review: An very sacred temple of Maa Chandrika Devi .The temple is on Lucknow -Sitapur road about 35 kms from Lucknow 13kms from Bakshi Ka talab .Very good picnic spot also . Annual mela held during Navratri .

Name: MSaksham
Title: Nice temple
Review: I went there once or twice.I don't remember but it feels good to be there. It is situated by lake side.It is one of famous temples in lucknow.

Name: royalescape
Title: A perfect picnic spot on outskirts of Lucknow
Review: Chandrika Devi Temple is located just 27 kms from Lucknow ... less than an hour's drive. The location is scenic as there is a lake right besides the temple.You can bring your own food and enjoy picnic at mango orchards around the temple.

Name: mishrarohit9
Title: Must See...Chandrika Devi Temple
Review: One of the most famous temple in Lucknow . Beautiful Lord Shiva Statue in the centre lake This temple has high belief for pilgrims . Best place to find peace in there . Best time to visit these place is during amavasya as big decorations will be there and many different varieties of things to buy and to eat as well.

Name: Ankit Y
Title: Beautiful
Review: Such a beautiful place to visit here..... totally different atmosphere here,love to spent ma tym here !!

Name: ashishadvo22
Title: Best place to visit
