Name: ankit
Title: great peaceful place
Review: I am a regular visitor to the place and whenever i go to lko..i go to chandrika devi for sure with my family.Just to keep in mind not to go in rainy season as the river surrounds the temple and some times it becomess huge and only boat can reach to the place.but otherwise..a guud place children will be happy to see the stalls..Many dieties are present such as chandrika devi ji , hanuman ji ,shiv ji etc.the chandrika devi stature visible easily.

Name: shalini222
Title: religious
Review: nice place.....its a temple located in outskirts of lucknow........nice temple.............if u have your own convience then definitely its a must place to visit................public convience are not easily available.................to satisfy your platter you should taste the khaste

Name: praksabhijit
Title: Good to go !! This shrine is one of the famous and has high belief for ur wishes to come true
Review: This is one of the most famous temple in Lucknow .Around 15 km from the IET Engg College . This temple has high belief for the visitors and pilgrims . Best place to find peace in there . That Place have few more GOD to worship  , Shiv Ji , Hanuman ji temple with there best Statue and easy visibility on working days . Best time to visit these place is during amavasya as big decorations wll be there and many different varieties of things to buy and to eat as well.

Name: Srinidhi Rao
Title: Old city charms and perils
Review: Heard that it was a good place for shopping as well as street food. True that the shops are cheaper than those is Hazratgang and not so fancy. You will need to search for good bargains in the lanes. Do not take a car there. Go to the closest area and hire an electric tuk tuk.  The oldest Tunday Kebab outlet is there which is in a narrow lane full of motorbikes going to and fro. Quite an adventure to reach that place.

Name: flyingwish
Title: See Chaos of Old Lucknow
Review: Visit chowk to see the real old Lucknow chaos of people and vehicles. Also, the famous Idris biryani is located here. Unfortunately it was closed for renovations.

Name: Vidhata bache
Title: crowded, unhygienic, nontasty
Review: Its just another bazaar street with humans, cows, dogs, unauthorised vendors, filth, no footpath, flyover, crowded market, unhygienic food, non tasty food. Avoid.

Name: Stuti Das
Title: A foodies paradise- must visit for Makkhan Malai and Poori sabzi
Review: When in Lucknow, do what the nawabs would do. Hop on a rickshaw or a tonga (if you can get one from the rumi darwaza gate) and explore the old city. Do make a trip in the morning if you want to gorge on the best dessert ever made- Makhhan Malai. Available near the Chowk Chauraha (very close to KGMC), you will see a row of stalls selling this delectable dessert. Prices start at Rs 60 for 100 gm and do drop in at Gaya Prasad Makkhan Malai stall (near Paramapara sweet shop). Packing is also available in case you want to savour it at home. Also you can gorge on to some sumptuous poori and sabzi from sevak ram ki dukan (over 100 years old shop). Ask for directions from proprietor at Gaya Prasad stall. While at Sevak Ram you can also treat yourself to Black Carrot ka halwa (600 rupees kg) and it is out of this world. Also available are samosas and jalebis and khasta kachori.

Name: Ashwin
Title: Excellent shopping destination !!
Review: Enjoyed the shopping as the difference in rates from other marked is huge!!Range of material and choice is unbelievable. Really good!!

Name: John Muriango
Title: Amazing.
Review: Staff were amazing. Service was great. The taste was excellent. Ambience is top notch. I can't get enough of this place. Highly recommended.

Name: VIPIN_GOEL_TP_Impex
Title: Bought Lucknow Chikan Cloths
Review: Once in Lucknow, it is always tempting to buy world famous Chikan Cloths. So search for cheap and best takes us to Chowk Market. Travelled in a E-rickshaw for more than 40 minutes from Odeon Cinema to reach here. Lots of shops are there. Do not forget to bargain.

Name: Arun Sarna
Title: Tempting aromatic food
Review: crowed place filled with aroma.... tempting food all around..if you want good chat try at Parampara, & if unique authentic malai Makhan try at any of the vendor standing at chowk

Name: AnupamSharan
Title: Gol Darwaza to Akbar Gate food walk
Review: A culinary experience to walk in this street, and sample the Nihari Kulcha , Pink Kashmiri Tea, Tilgoza sweets, fluffy ice cream malai makhan and excellent paans. Ignore the dirty streets .

Name: DrKlair
Title: Excellent food and old Ambience
Review: Walk through from Akbari gate to Gol Darwaza through the really narrow lanes and by lanes of the old city sampling the food . Please note that the houses are so close and lanes covered that google maps sometimes fails .Do take a guide.

Name: GRVARCH
Title: A good market for food and shopping lovers.
Review: This is a good attraction in Lucknow.This is  a good market for food and shopping lovers.Many showrooms for Chicken embroidery work which is identity of Lucknow.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Foodies Delight
Review: Everywhere around are tempting places to eat  that have had made Lucknow  mecca of foodies .Walk through lanes and by lanes that smack of times gone by of Awadh of yore , albeit in decay .

Name: Anuradha
Title: A crowded Chowk
Review: A very crowded place with old shops and a variety of retail shopping and food. Makhan malai in winters is a must have dessert, which is just equivalent to Delhi’s Daulat ki chaat but a little heavier than that.

Name: Anupriya Singh
Title: Good place for shopping and eating
Review: We visited Chowk for shopping some local chikan work clothes. The area is full of shops that sell good quality chikan work at reasonable rates. The place is crowded and not suitable for taking kids along for peaceful shopping. Do not miss the makkhan Malai sold here during the winters.

Name: Rakesh
Title: A must visit place in Lucknow
Review: For better experience of city this is must visit place. Try malai makhan on the street. You will feel like haven fall on your feet.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Enjoyed
Review: Enjoyed a lot here food is amazing here . For shopping also this place is good . Bought many things from here.

Name: niya27
Title: Old Lucknow area
Review: I visited Chowk for bada imambada. There are many other attractions in the same area. I also enjoyed stree food here.

Name: engineertripster
Title: It's a good place for shopping and eating
Review: It's one of the shopping areas in Lucknow. It has many shops selling different types of Chikan embroidery. You will also find many shops selling zari designs as well.In addition, there are many restaurants around. The one thing we enjoyed the most was the Malai Makhan(we went during the winter season). It is soft and creamy and is sold around the market. It's a must-try.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Bustling market…
Review: Chowk is a bustling market area near Lucknow‘s attractions. It has several shops where you can buy a variety of items from chikan work to jewellery to food items. The famous makhan malai can also be found here during winters and is a must try item.

Name: Sanpreet Johar
Title: Best place of lucknow
Review: Best place for chillll with family nd friends  and chicken is faMous of this place and the place follow the old traditional form of lucknow😊🙏👍👌

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Eating & shopping
Review: It's not just heritage structures that lend an appeal to a place. It's also the traditional markets, cuisines, & culture... & Chowk contributes majorly to Lucknow's history! This market area is heaven for foodies & shoppers. The best way to get around is on foot...& don't hesitate to explore the tiny gullies! Seek out Phool Wali Gali. The flower mandi is 200-year-old... If I close my eyes now, I can still remember the fragrance!

Name: misiddiqui2017
Title: Central and Crowded
Review: Chowk is as good as it has always been. It's a paradise for shoppers and foodies! But the crowd there is a deterrent for anyone not used to it! It happened to be Dushera's time as well!

Name: Pravesh Goswami
Title: Heritage...
Review: The gateway of old lucknow. Lot of options for food & shopping. Pls come here with ample time to explore.

Name: taotzu
Title: A lovely area for Street food
Review: A local traditional area for Street food as well as good restaurants & sweet shops. Nearby is a market for a traditional handicraft on cloth chikankari. It's a bustling area. A must-visit.

Name: Christopher B
Title: A Must Visit to get a Taste Of Traditional life
Review: I visited Chowk looking for jeri-work on cloth craftsmen and found wonderful craftsmanship in the hands of women!

Name: Maria
Title: Heart of Lucknow!
Review: Chowk- Old Lucknow, is definitely the heart of Lucknow. Old building, historic monuments, the hustle and bustle of this place is something you cannot ignore. Some of the most authentic eateries and shops can be found in this place.

Name: Getaway46933868548
Title: its the heart of lucknow
Review: here you see what lucknow is all about.u can sense and feel the nawabi era.with mouth watering dishes, narrow lanes and big hearts , a place to visit.eat makkan malai, buy good clothes, visit oldest tundey kababi and rahim's nahari kulche.and dont forget to visit nakkhas .

Name: sawhneysaab
Title: Must visit
Review: Kind of a must visit place when you're going to lucknow - experience the restaurants, crowds and rickshaws.

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: Great Food
Review: I am big foody. Chowk is really only for food lovers. Amazing taste and great quality at affordable price.

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: eating point
Review: the chowk in lucknow is famous for its road side eateries . local food include chat , golgape , pakoda , kulfi falooda . its an crowded place , but best place to enjoy who like eating a lot.

Name: S P S
Title: Golden area of old Lucknow
Review: It is a place to see art work on fabric, chikenkari, delicious foods, thandai and culture of Nawabs at old Lucknow

Name: canpush
Title: Food plaza
Review: Chowk area near Aminabad chowk is full of eateries. Many good eateries are around providing variety of food. Particularly good was Tooday Kababi who provided great kababs.

Name: TRAVELANE_SHANTANU
Title: Chowk, Lucknow
Review: Chowk is a popular market in central Lucknow, located about three km from Bara Imambara. One of the oldest markets in the city, it comprises of inter-connected narrow streets, with small shops selling chikan garments, ittar and ornaments. The market still maintains its old charm and is best for buying chikankari cloths and antique items. You can shop for quality chikan embroidered materials as it is the hub of chikan garment manufacturers.Market is closed on ThursdayChowk market has more than 5000 shops spread around the narrow, labyrinthine cobweb of streets on both sides and sometimes taking much of the road itself. In these quaint shops, both bricked shops as well as temporary ones, you will find authentic chikankari and zardozi dresses, traditional handmade jewelleries, handcrafted home décor items from wood, bamboo and ivory, nagara shoes, ittar or perfume made from essence of real flowers, and innumerable other small and big items, in varieties beyond your imagination.Other than these, to soothe your tingling culinary senses, there are a handful of shops selling authentic Awadhi food - kebabs, biriyanis, paratha with chicken or mutton and milk products as well. A one day trip to the Chowk market means a true exploration of how Lucknow looks, feels and sounds like.The tourist spot of Imambara and Bhool Bhulaiya are nearby. You can include a visit to the Chowk with these places and take a day off your usual motor-run vehicles and taste the flavour of past.

Name: Rudra Sharma
Title: Enjoy the Original Lucknowi andaj.....
Review: Chowk is the center place of Lucknow. It is the biggest and very old market place where you will find any item, whether it is traditional item or the latest one. Lakhnawi chicken (both food and clothing) are available at their best at this place. If you enter the chicken garment area, you will find hundreds of shops spread in multiple numbers of buildings here. The quality and the rate both we found reasonable, but bargaining is a must in this market.But the main attraction of Chowk is its food variety. Besides the non-veg items, you will get very good quality vegetarian foods. We tasted a typical sweet called Malai gola. It is made of foam of butter. The taste was really very good, Besides this, we tasted hot milk mixed with saffron (kesar). This is also a speciality of chowk area.

Name: ASHISH V
Title: Must place to visit in lucknow
Review: If you are planning to visit lucknow. Must visit this place for shopping and for the food. Must visit destination in lucknow.

Name: somesh.nath
Title: Home to finest Awadhi Chikankari
Review: A trip to Lucknow can never be complete unless you have visited Chow. Primarily the market is defined by narrow lanes and myriad of shops selling, Chikan (Cloths), antiques, embroidery and jewelry for all occasions. You can shop till you drop for the whole day. The best way to commute is to walk  around or take a Rick saw or at best a two wheeler. Car and Auto 3 wheels add to the traffic congestion. With plenty of eating joints and street food vendors Chowk offers mouth watering Kebabs, Malai Makhan and Badam Shakes in order to satisfy the hungry.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Shopping
Review: Good place to experience the old parts of the city - crowded with shops, cycle rickshaws, vehicles and street food vendors.

Name: Sharil I
Title: Shopaholic Ring
Review: Ring is what Chowk means. Thus this place adores people who want to go on a shopping spree of Lucknawi chikan materials and clothing with the addition of good Veg and Non-veg delicacies.

Name: Niraj K
Title: OLD LUCKNOW
Review: If one is interested to eat specialties of Lucknow then he must go to Chowk. If you has not tasted the Makkhan Malai at the main gate of Chowk and Nearby Raja ki Thandai or Paan and Lassi you will repent life time

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Must visit
Review: Great place for chikankari shopping at reasonable price. Dont miss the makkhan malai during winter. Rahim ki Nihari & Idris ki biryani are must have when in Chowk

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Me and my STOMACH
Review: Dear if you want to taste the traditional dishes of Lucknow then this would be the right place to visit. From veg to non veg all is there, but believe me i love the non veg. Do visit if you are hungry.Religious people for you all there is Temple of Goddess Kaali ji which is also very old and has many faiths and believes.

Name: Sweetbunnycute
Title: Very crowded place just like Delhi’s Chandani Chowk
Review: It is the oldest market in Lucknow and hence really really crowded place. Although I went there only to visit and taste the original Tundaye Kebabi’s Kebabs. But I would not suggest anyone to go there unless you have a real craze for originality. In order to reach the outlet it took a lot of effort as the streets were really congested with heavy traffic and people.

Name: Abhinav D
Title: Shaan of Lucknow
Review: Anyone visiting lucknow & not visiting Chowk will never get to know what real lko is !This place specialises in its food, Market,Chikan clothes & Ittar perfumes & a lot of such items !Over all a must visit !

Name: vipulagrawal1
Title: Lots of Breakfast options.
Review: In winters Chowk is good for Makkhan Malai which is a sweet delicacy and very popular in Lucknow. There are many good sweet shops for Khasta, Jalebi etc. It's morning paradise for foodies

Name: Aman Agarwal
Title: Badiya
Review: If u wanna enjoy some tasty 😋  food then this place is for you . U will get amazing kebab , chole bhature , puri sabzi , and much more..

Name: Amit7488
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: Uncountable small n big shops of chikan clothes, at Gol dawaza you will find many tiny stalls selling “makhan” the special traditional sweet of Lucknow..If You like to buy chikan in lessor rates..this place has worth to visit

Name: Vipul K
Title: See real Lucknow here
Review: See two distinct faces of Lucknow- Gol Darwaza separates the two. Stroll Chowk area which satiates all senses quite literally. Great food, skill fully made local clothes, perfumes etc. Try original tundey kebabs just 300 m from Gol Darwaza. If biryani is your calling visit Idrees biryani shop about 1 km from Chowk.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Nice shops!
Review: we went there with our driver and bought some chiffon chikan kurti and the price was very good. Then our driver took us for other sight seeings.

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Up and close with true Lucknow
Review: We went there to reach out to the famous eateries, and RAm Asrey Sweetshop. One can shop for perfumes, sweets, and eat  a hearty meal. Not expensive, but pls beware of your belongings at is crowded and low on lihts

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Chowk
Review: Chowk is the old city area of Lucknow. This place is full of hustle bustle and numerous good food joints.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Must visit you are food lover
Review: This place is famous for food,here you will find variety of local receipies especially biryani.If you are food lover you must visit this place.😁😁😁If anything gone wrong don't panic KGMC is just few step ahead. 😀😀😀

Name: abhinavsaxena11
Title: Original flavour of Lucknow
Review: Original city flavours where you get everything, chats , makhan, chole bhature at shree, tunday kebabi, chicken karigari work on kurta with different price range..must have. If you’re visiting Lucknow then you must visit the market.

Name: AshisGhatak
Title: Busy place
Review: A visit to this place is a must to get a flavour of local culture and local food. One can get cheap Chikan shops too. But one must enjoy the crowd to be there.

Name: Nishesh K
Title: variety of foods and clothes
Review: If u want to have delicious makkhan which melts in mouth, or want to buy chikan dress for ur loved ones. CHOWK is the best place

Name: Vivek P
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: Culture of Old Lucknow, Biryani are very famous here. Must visit Place.Its a kind of Heart, you will get all the necessary big brands showroom here with good food market.

Name: Prashant K
Title: Chowk - Core of Lucknowi Tehzeeb
Review: This is the place for people looking for authentic Chikankari work and some of the most delicacies both for veg & non-veg lovers

Name: himanshulko
Title: Lucknow Foodies
Review: One of the best food in lucknow (during Oct - march). Chowk is always famous for its delicacies food. If tourist visit India-Uttar Pradesh-Lucknow-Chowk, then he/she must get good food to eat.

Name: Rishi B
Title: Foodies Paradise with history of Lucknow
Review: The best place to be in Lucknow for tasting all the delicacy Lucknow is famous for...Be it veg or non veg or chaat or makkhan malai...It also has famous historical monuments by which Lucknow is recognized...Rumi Darwaza and Ghanta ghar....All the authentic Lucknow made chickan clothes are made and sold here...

Name: KALKI
Title: Chowk restaurant
Review: Chowk is a great hotel in Lucknow,but it is small in size.taste was nice.south indians also like the taste of chowk.

Name: Bobby J
Title: Chowk market of lucknow
Review: Chowk market in Lucknow is one of those places of the city that are a window into its rich cultural heritage. Beginning from Chikan work to succulent kebabs, one can find it all at the Chowk market.

Name: Clara S
Title: "Busy Shopping Street*
Review: It's a great place for shopping. If you are looking for the famous chicken work clothing, this is the place. We found more variety and reasonably priced compared to other markets...

Name: NouvelleTraveller
Title: Excellent for Shopping!
Review: Chowk has shops selling the best and most affordable chikankari clothes. I would recommend Saraswati Chikan and PV Chikan. Wholesale rates and wide variety. Bit crowded but if you've been to Chandni Chowk in Delhi, you know how to manuver. Card and cash both work in shops, but take cash preferably.

Name: Amit M
Title: Experience Lucknawi Andaaz
Review: The real feeling of traditional Lucknow only be observed when in Chowk. Old congested market but very famous for traditional Chicken dresses; real taste of authentic sweets, kite flying and Lucknawi Paan.A must visit for tradition lovers.

Name: sanjeev05
Title: place to get the feel of old city
Review: its for those who want to explore places. Those who avoid crowds, pleased dont visit. Here one can get many chikan shops, food joints, the essence of lucknow

Name: Manish2618
Title: Tasty
Review: The place was so nice and there was so much of people which makes me to attract me having fun there and ate so much tasty food

Name: Syed K
Title: A must visit for Foodies
Review: Lucknow is the city for Foodies. It has its very own unique taste of mughalai dishes which you will find only and only in Lucknow. Chowk has so many unknown shops which are not famous but has better taste than any other city

Name: Gaurav C
Title: crowded old part of the city...
Review: Chowk is the old part of the city adorned with historical places....you have to brave the crowds to enjoy it...numerous places to eat and dine....you get the awesome makhan malai in the winters...chickankari suits...and a lot more places for kababs....its like the old delhi...

Name: Rohit T
Title: Lucknow's tradition
Review: Chowk is still the traditional spot of Lucknow. In winters visit the Chowk chauraha to have Makkhan malai and a cup of tea. In summers have thandai there. Besides many eateries and sweet shops , go shopping for chikan work. Places to visit nearby - chota and bada Imambara, Clock Tower

Name: Kaustav Datta 🍁
Title: Experience Old Lucknow
Review: Best place to experience old lucknow and its charm. Crowded and lot of walking needed. The place is filled with Chikan showrooms and delicious old town eateries. The best you'll have in Lucknow. A must visit for sure.

Name: Arvind Kaur Jain
Title: Amazing place for Chikankari Fans!
Review: If you have a flare for chikankari, this is a mecca for you... You will find amazing chikankari suits, dupattas and running fabric here... from cotton to georgettes, this place has all... Everything is very economical and a great place to taste the vibes of Lukhnow...

Name: mak_mshr
Title: Historical place
Review: Chowk is a good place for visit all historical monuments are near around the chowk, it is also the hub for pure awadhi food like tundey kababi, Irish, alamgir are well known non veg food joints, Milk product like Kesariya doodh ,pandit Raja ki thandai is there It also the hub of chicken art on clothes so you can do shopping there, the problem is only big traffic jam especially the streets and Nakhas road.

Name: Niya1315
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: This place is famous among food lovers. The place is also very crowded. Some old monuments of Lucknow is also near to this place. You can buy chicken suits here at a reasonable price.

Name: karan a
Title: Food lovers must visit!!
Review: A nust visit place for all foodies out there!!You will get a wonderful variety of food and that is economical too!!You will enjoy a great variety of tasty and healthy food.

Name: hreela
Title: you must have much time.
Review: I never prefer this place to move around. so conjugated, too rush,y place, but good for Non Veg Lovers, fortunately I am pure veg :)

Name: nitin m
Title: Old place for shopping
Review: This place is in old Lucknow and very famous for shopping of local Chikan clothes. Also has many shops selling famous sweets of Lucknow

Name: TAMOJIT2014
Title: cheap location
Review: many shops with whole sale rates, chikan materials, food shops and other items are also good, better than aminabad also in some cases

Name: Shivbalak
Title: Chowk
Review: It is a good market to go and have a walk..one can try the makkhan malai at the entry only..rajaji ki thandai..black gajar ka halwa inside the market just opposite to tunde kababi..and there are many more things to buy for families,kids..we visited it in the evening..so it was a good atmosphere at that time.

Name: Pradyumna M
Title: Quite crowded place
Review: Visited their multiple times and everything is available for good prices and mostly meat is easily available 🍗 so i like that place because near to it their is KGMU hospital too and that's a good area

Name: samyjamy
Title: CHowk
Review: CHowk is a good place to shop for authentic chikan Kari clothes. Here you will also find some good eateries to satisfy your taste buds.

Name: liferocks24
Title: the HEART of LUCKNOW
Review: Chowk is the place where the flavours of lucknow originate. this is the place  where one can find the lucknowi chikan clothing , the food , the traditiona land the cultural  feel of lucknow be it in language or the respect , attire ,the traffic ,the lanes, the tuk tuks..everything begins here. it is adjacent to RUMI Darwaza . the nearest landmark is the famous Raja thandai. to explore lucknow this is the place to begin with.

Name: smitagupta
Title: melt in the mouth.....
Review: a visit to Lucknow would be incomplete without a visit to the Chowk to have the absolutely divine " malai makhan or Nimish".... a dish to die for!!!!

Name: Aakash A
Title: Old Lucknow
Review: This place surely gives you feelings of old Lucknow. You can enjoy street -food here. If you get a time, please visit Idrees ki Biryani. They are famous for awesome non-veg. Please try Mutton Biryani and it was yummy.

Name: shahbaz h
Title: A monumental visit...
Review: I was alone and i decided to visit chowk which is famous for its monuments and non veg food. One of the famous monuments like Bara Imambara, Clock tower, Akbari gate, Roomi darwaja, Chota imambara, picture gallery etc... Were there and trust me that were awesome to me. Really i enjoyed a lot, than i visit chowk market, that was to big and cheap, and provides each and every kind of stuff for everyone. Real Tundey Kababi also there which is known for its delicious taste in the whole world. Apart from that i tried Kashmiri tea, Malai makkhan which was unforgettable to me. People were too supportive and kind hearted. Overall it was my one of the best visit. Thank you!

Name: Pawan Agnihotri
Title: Old Lucknow Charm
Review: You can easily say that it's the Chandni Chowk of Lucknow. Old Lucknow charm visible here to it's fullest. Good street food.

Name: Yogi
Title: The Old Charm
Review: This is what you expect out of an old city filled with heritage. The Chowk is about narrow streets and all kinds of shops. You can see a lot of locals coming out here for their shopping and stuff. The chowk is close to Imambara so it is easy to reach. One can find a lot of clothing outlets around with famous chiken work of Lucknow.

Name: gerry3f
Title: Best part of guided tour
Review: Without Arif our UP Tourism guide I would have never have got to see the hives of industry that are hidden away in the maze of alleys that make up Chowk. There was no pressure to buy in any of the establishments we visited although the textiles and perfume oils were tempting. We finished at the allegedly impossible to find Tunday for some delicious Galwati kebab.Unfortunately I did not have time to visit again before leaving Lucknow due to a cancelled train forcing me to re-schedule

Name: Dalbir_S_Virdi
Title: Couldnt Recognize the place
Review: I had visited Chowk way back in 1976 and obviously after 40+ years, things had completely changed. Its now a very crowded place with chaotic Traffic pouring in from all directions, unmanageable crowd, deafening noise of honking and roaring engines of vehicles and not to miss the pollution all around. This is definitely not the Chowk that I had in my memories. There are hundreds of Chikan shops here - the famous dress material of Lucknow. Arohi Complex in Chowk has maximum number of Shops. Chowk also boasts of traditional eateries of Lucknow. Here you can get best of the Kulfis, Makhan Malai (A must try) and mouth watering non veg preparations.

Name: Nikhil P
Title: Old world charm  of city of Nawabs
Review: If you want to have the feel of old world charm of lucknow, then Chowk is the place to be . The street food available over here is quite delicious and one will have a finger licking experience to remember for a long time. I personally liked desi ghee tikki.  One can also buy clothes , shoes over here .

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Feel Old Lucknow
Review: If you want to feel real Lucknow, the chowk is must visit. One can enjoy all the local food here. I went in the winters so got a chance to try a famous winter dish - Makhan Malai. This dish is only available for couple of months during winters. Best place to buy chicken hand work cloths from this chowk market.

Name: Manas R
Title: Chikan hub
Review: Crowded and poorly maintained traffic. But you should come here for getting a taste of old Lucknow, particularly if you have plan for shopping some chikan.

Name: shriyans b
Title: Makkhan
Review: I am from chowk lucknow and mainly the chowk is famous for chicken clothes dardogy, and for food.You can have makkhan malai, chole bhatoore, thandai, kachori and in clothing you can hve chicken kurtas for girls and boys and jhutti

Name: krishna831
Title: old city
Review: one of the oldest city of Lucknow.near this city river Gomti flowing. bda Imambara and medical college also very to this city.

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Old City
Review: Chowk is one of the places in the Old City of the City of Nawabs, Lucknow. I often visit this place to have amazing food.

Name: SrajantheCritic
Title: The Food Heaven of Lucknow
Review: To taste the best of delicacies of any city chowk is the place to visit.Same is the case with lucknow.Visit chowk to eat various awadhi delicacies especially Makhan Malia and Tunday Kebabetc.Anyone who comes to Lucknow and pay a visit to chowk and it's food centres.

Name: parusharouthud
Title: Chowk is near Bara Imambra in lucknow
Review: All visitors at chowk must taste Makkhan Malai.Though the cost of makhan malai is little high the taste is completely worth. The place is also famouse for food veg and non veg along with sweets.

Name: Daniel
Title: Makkhan Malai is to die for
Review: I visited chowk very early in the morning for Makkhan Malai and had it outside the Premji's sweet shop. Although I spent around Rs. 350 for travel, once I tasted the Makkhan Malai I felt it was completely worth it. At the end of the day, its just milk churned up to a foam with nuts, saffron but we can never manage it at home, so I had 3 of them. We did not shop around so I cannot comment on that.

Name: Sam3011
Title: Amazing Market place
Review: Your Lucknow visit is incomplete if you have not visited Chowk. Be it shopping for Chikankari dresses/saris or satisfying your taste buds. Chowk visit is must.

Name: Rick6d
Title: Chaotic but great nimish
Review: Seek out the numerous nimish sellers. Big mounds of sweet airy fragrant cream. With rosewater and saffron, plus nuts and silver. Lightest desert you'll ever have.

Name: HOMPRS
Title: Rustic
Review: Chowk is eating paradise for food lovers. You will get to have mughlai and few other old world dishes here. Market is not very crowded but the area certainly is due to encroachment.Must try: Rahims nihari and kulcha (morning), tundey kebabs (buffalo), idrees biryani till 3pm only, kaley gazar ka halwa (parampara sweets), daulat ki chaat at circle (many shops in 1 line), Malai paan (Ram asrey sweets), Chaat near allahabad bank after 8pm.

Name: rohanmitra06
Title: Best Place for Food
Review: For a foodie, there can't be any better place than Chowk. Though I couldn't try as many places/cuisines that I could wish for, I could gauge that this is paradise for food lovers. Though this place is renowned for Non-veg food, there are great options for veg, sweets, lassi, pan, etc.

Name: DGs
Title: Good zoo
Review: Perfect place to spend 3-4 hrs with your family specially kids. Toy train give you glimpses of the zoo all around. Children park has good slides.

Name: Shubham Srivastava
Title: Very Nice
Review: A place to enjoy with your friends and family. The history museum is also very good. Highly recommended for anyone who visits lucknow.

Name: Jayendra Gohil
Title: Nice
Review: Big Garden spacious and a small zoo based museum too, fav family outing. Plus another museum inside. Clean.

Name: Amit Shishodia
Title: Place which I visited most
Review: My fav place in Lucknow. I have visited Lucknow zoo at least 25-30 times in last 12 years. Good place to visit with family and friends. Little bit tough during the summer because of temperature. I suggest to visit this place from Oct to march.

Name: Ruby4861
Title: Childhood memories!!!
Review: We basically went to relive our memories... it was good to see that the zoo was maintained pretty well. It was clean with some new decor and greenery. The signs were good. There were animals which looked healthy...It was a good trip... sat on the train as well.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoo
Review: Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Zoo is a famous place to visit. It has many animals to watch and children will love it.

Name: Anuradha
Title: Very well maintained zoo with a museum inside
Review: We mainly wanted to go to the museum but at the ticket counter got to know that it’s mandatory to take the ticket for zoo. Initially we didn’t like the idea, but didn’t regret it after going inside. A huge Parijaat tree welcomed us, it was very beautiful. Kids love to see a great variety of animals this zoo offers. The museum was good with display of many historical artefacts specially related to Awadhi culture. Egyptian gallery was good with a mummy on display.

Name: niya27
Title: Zoo
Review: This place is also called Lucknow Zoo. This zoo is one of the best zoo in India. State museum is also inside this zoo.

Name: Tanvi
Title: My kids loved it
Review: I visited here with my family and my kids loved it . There's a entry fee also which is very less . We we're lucky enough to spot Cheetah . It is one of the best zoo I have visited ...

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Good place for visit with family
Review: Nice place for visit with family. There was small entry fees. Well cleaned and nice zoo. There was many wild animals there. Nice place to enjoy with kids.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Lucknow Zoo vidit…
Review: The place is quite popular and has huge number of tourists coming in. It houses several varieties of birds, fishes and animals including white tigers, hippopotamus, macaws, etc. to name a few. It has a small eating area inside for snacks and is good activity for family outing. It has a toy train or battery operated cars available for trips but you can also walk. The butterfly park which has extra ticket applied is not worth the money as there are no butterflies in it.

Name: FeatureSM
Title: Knowledgeable place
Review: Hi guys this is amazing place to visit with your friends and family mostly for kids because they will learn amazing facts and more knowledge about nature.

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Visit
Review: One of the best place to have a picnic with your loved ones be it your family or friends. Great place to visit with family specially with kid. So much to learn for them about animals and history. Museum was great to see and learn about Indian culture and history. There are Jain and Buddha era exhibition, Indian coin and weapons exhibition and so many other things. There are lots of wold animals to see.

Name: Parth101
Title: Known as Lucknow Zoo
Review: This zoo also known as Lucknow Zoo . It is located in heart of the Lacknow city area. Main attraction of the city. Good place for time spend with kids.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Fun time
Review: Best place to hangout with your family and friends best picnic place in there is 3d show and many things like boating full fun place must visit

Name: Indieopus
Title: Too Old Too Boring
Review: Not worth visiting this place as a tourist in Lucknow, though there are few good animals but the overall experience isn't that great as the place is unhygienic as well as not Maintened well!

Name: durham05
Title: One of the better zoos
Review: This site is quite large but there is lots to see with each animal cage close to the next.  There is also a nice train that runs around the park. State museum also with zoo. Liked the giraffes, hippos, tigers and lions. Lots of places to buy food  80 rupees to get in.

Name: Anshu Mishra
Title: Good Zoo with Low Facilities
Review: This is the only zoo in Lucknow and in fact nearby cities It has Tiger, Peacock ,Birds,Leopard ,Zebra ,Ziraf and many more animals and birds It also has monkeys But facilities are very less in this zoo, like parking is a biggest problem If you are visiting with kids than there is no comfortable place to sit with them Lake is dirty and not maintained There are few Electric Carts which are very less in numbers and you are. To wait for this Best part is, Plastic is ban insideIce cream  stalls are there Food shop is there in side Overall good place to visit in winters not in summer

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
Review: I love to see animals every time so we decided to visit here. In that zoo there are many thing for kids, beautiful flowers, indian air force cargo plane.

Name: AlokKumarGupta
Title: Trip to Lucknow Zoo
Review: Apart from zoological garden, it has many other activities for Kids. My nephews very happy with the trip. They spent most of their time doing other activities like swinging, sliding, climbing and Jumping. It also has a beautiful butterfly park where you can see the different coloured butterflies and spend some time in a flowered garden.

Name: Tibor S
Title: A Day At The Zoo
Review: The Zoo has some lovely exhibits like an old Indian Air Force cargo plane and canons and garden lots of beautiful plants interesting exhibits although strange that some animals have a fantastic enclosure but others have just a cage only cost 60 indian rupees to get in although the butterfly enclisure cost an extra 20 was a fun couple of hours.Was amusing that i was the only blue eyed fair skinned westerner there so i got more interest and selfies than some of the animals, while i not a fan of animals being caged for entertainment but some zoos do great work in breeding programs and keeping some animals from becoming extinct A good afternoon out  Another great point they had purified chilled water points don't get cold water often in India

Name: Anmol Bhargava
Title: Unethical
Review: The animals in the zoo are require freedom. The caged animals were weak and the zoo is over populated.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Nice place
Review: Centrally situated in the heart of Lucknow just walking distance. Commonly known as Zoo or Banarasi Bagh. The Museum in the campus is worth seeing. Also a family picnic place. Young children will definitely enjoy the animals like Lion, tiger, zebra , deer and not to miss the Langoor who is fond of Banana and teasing you.

Name: Jeevan Shanbhag
Title: Nice Zoo with State Museum
Review: Good place to visit with family. This zoo have a toy train, E vehicles to cover entire Zoo. Also has State Museum.

Name: Sharil I
Title: A must COLD Day Visit
Review: This is one of the oldest Zoological Gardens or ZOO as we would easily call it. It helps us the animals alot as there are a lot of families available here of Birds, Monkey, Lions and fish available here.

Name: Abhineet
Title: Family outing
Review: Wonderful place for children, in fact, the whole family can enjoy its day. The toy train ride is must try for kids and museum is also good.The only thing which troubles is the Parking Facility. Authorities must work on this.

Name: Puja_deb
Title: Good collection
Review: My husband visited the zoo during our stay. Very near to Hazratganj. He was impressed by the animal collection. There was aquarium also. Good for kids.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: My daughter's day out
Review: Since I love the nature so how can I miss this place. Some animals were difficult to see but in over all it was nice and the most import thing was that my daughter enjoyed. Food outside the zoo is not hygienic at all and over priced. The train show not that attractive.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: THE ZOO
Review: Nawab wajid ali sah zoo is spread in a large area of 71.6 acre.The place is a hotspot for natural photography and zoology students apart from regular tourists and local visitors.

Name: Harshit
Title: Picnic spot
Review: The place is very joyful and well developed it contain a 3d show and a very huge aquarium with lots of variety of fishes which is very enjoyful for childrens and it also contain a mueseum and a train which is very popular in children my small brother was very happy in sitting on train and zoo contain large no of species of animal so if u went with family for a picnic u must arrive on this place

Name: abs0110
Title: Fun place to be
Review: Lucknow zoo never disappoints. Best place to spend you Sunday afternoon with Kids.The place is neat and clean. There are food stalls within the zoo.Other facilities include the boating place, 3d movie place, museum etc.

Name: John M
Title: Nice day out
Review: Plenty to see and do at the Zoo. Took us three hours to walk around to see all of the animals.  Two cafés and food stalls to stop at.  There is a train that takes you around the park or you can opt for an electric buggy. Animals all looked well cared for but their enclosures could be improved.  There is also an aquarium section, snake building and butterfly House. Low cost entrance at 60 rupees offers good value for money.

Name: parshant
Title: Beautiful park for kids
Review: This is a beautiful zoo park with neat and clean environment, there is amlmost all kind of animals like monkeys, lion, tiger, giraffe, beer etc big area takes 2 hour to visit and also there is a kids trains facility for quick visit.

Name: Arjun S
Title: Oh, the tigers!
Review: Had such a nice time at this zoo watching the tigers romp around during their morning exercise.  The zoo is neat and clean, with lots of space for the animals.  Well done, Lucknow Zoo!

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Good nice
Review: I spend about 3 hours there with my family. I had a good experience there. It's really good for a nice family trip specially if you have children of age group between 5 to 14 years. The zoo has quite a good variety of animals including cat family, fox family, reptiles, birds, etc. Inside the zoo campus there a some nice food stalls, children park, and rest arena. Just inside the entrance gate on the left had side there is recently opened museum type facility which provides nice information about the history and the diversity of this park. There's also a 3d auditorium.

Name: 777vikas
Title: Very Good Zoo
Review: This zoo is located near to hazratganj. Opens early in the morning. You can find all types of animals, reptiles, birds here including Giraffe, rhynos, white tiger, lion, black panther, leopard, various types of snakes, python, owls, colorful birds. Toy train is a good attraction here for kids which covers the whole of zoo. There is a museum inside where and old plane is also placed. This zoo has a big seating and play area. Eatables are not allowed inside, there are eating points inside where you can enjoy lots of variety.

Name: Anjali P
Title: Delightful place
Review: Banarasi Bagh or Lucknow zoo is a very doable outing on foot for young famiLies, students and even oldies. With the installation of public toilets and a few eateries one can take a break from doing the rounds for a cup of tea or coffee. The state museum is also a treat, though some galleries need to be revamped. The Egyptian mummy is a star attraction in this museum.The tigers, lions, hippos and crocodiles seemed to be in good shape. But be sure to wear good, sturdy walking shoes to do the rounds of this zoo. Pathways have been tiled now so walking is easy. Plan for a three hour visit. And of course Hazratganj and its restaurants are just a ten minute walk from Banarasi Bagh. So happy walking and happy eating in the heart of Lucknow!

Name: 592abck
Title: Good place but dirty
Review: This place is good but not very well maintained. This place stinks and is very dirty. I found it bad.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Missing one man army 'hoolock gibbon  monkey"
Review: Still missing my favourite animal i. E. Hoolock gibbon. Few years back they died.They used to entertain the whole zoo alone.Once you tease them they use to make loud sound(hooko hooko). In the hope of their return i visited the zoo after 10 years but found nothing in their cage. Rest of the things are fine.

Name: pallavi a
Title: It was a fun experience
Review: Lucknow zoo has been under rennovation lately.We could spot various types of birds including Emu and Ostrich.Big cats like lion,white tiger,leopard.It was much greener now.Large varieties of fish could be seen.less reptiles were there.But overall it was fun.Big play area for kids.Butterfly park is a new addition.I liked it though it would be much fun in winters with lots of flowers blooming.Overall we loved the trip.

Name: dvatsa4u
Title: A Makeover Has made this place fantastic
Review: A must visit for children while visiting Lucknow.The Museum is too good and the Aquarium and the space for nocturnal creatures has been re done and so they are worth watching.

Name: Inspired_by_Xperiences
Title: A perfect place for a family outing with kids
Review: Zoo has always been an attraction for people of all ages, as you get to see many wildlife species which you would have otherwise seen only on television or in pictures. Lucknow zoo definitely has a variety of wild animals, birds and fish. While I found the zoo petty well maintained, somehow didn't find the animals being kept well. Though it's disheartening to see animals being captured in cages away from their natural habitat, but overall gives an opportunity to closely see these species. A must visit for all.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Good and nature friendly place
Review: It is the one of the best places in Lucknow it is Lucknow zoo it is very good place for family pacnic and friend group for outing it is fully natural things the animals also very good there many places inside where you and your family explore many things like museum where many historical things there which increase your knowledge in history which is a boring part of knowledge there boating there you can boat but is not so large it is small place for boating but make fun in it the big park are there your family sit under big tree and make relax you have to visit there you like this place the ticket price in Sunday is different it is 100 rupee per family half ticket is there on normal day it is 60 per member

Name: kkumar69
Title: IDEAL PLACE FOR ENTERTAINMENT
Review: situated in the heart of the city i.e. hazaratganj is an ideal place for whole family entertainment.

Name: Amit M
Title: Big Zoological Garden
Review: The Lucknow Zoo is having home to many species of animals and birds. Hukku Monkey is one of the major attraction of the Zoo. Good greenery, having restaurants and washroom facility is helping to devote good time there. A better place for Kids.

Name: Chandrma S
Title: Nice place
Review: I m going for there daily for morning walk.It is open for morning walkers daily 5am to 9 am on one rupees tickets.Outside gate there are many vendors who sell juices,fruits,green tea,coconut water and many more things.Also there are many flower excibition organise time to time from NBRI.great place 👌

Name: Sachin M
Title: Best place to hangout with family
Review: One of the best place go hangout with family whether young or old. Extremely low on budget and high on entertainment.

Name: shubhamag3
Title: Wide species of animals but not that much clean
Review: Lucknow zoo is having so many species of animals but some places are not clean. White tiger, Hippopotamus, Crocodiles, Ostrich are main attractions. Outside food and water bottles are not allowed inside.

Name: Rohit_G17
Title: Pretty good Zoo
Review: Lucknow Zoo is located at the centre of Lucknow near Hazratganj Chowk and is like any other zoo of India.The highlight was however the Giraffe and Ostrich...The bird park there is just amazing and has a huge variety. They also have an Own Centre and a Fish aquarium as well.Price Rs 60 per person.Train ride is recommended which takes you through the entire park. Rs 15 per person.

Name: Jaspreet K
Title: Very nice
Review: The Prince of Wales Edward VIII Zoological Gardens, popularly known as Lucknow Zoological Gardens, was established in the year 1921 to commemorate the visit of His Royal Highness, the Prince of Wales to Lucknow. The idea of establishing Zoological gardens at Lucknow emanated from Sir Harcourt Butler, the then Governor of the State and it was received enthusiastically by the prominent landlords and the leading citizens of the State who donated liberally for the construction of animal houses and cages and also presented animals and birds for display from time to time.A Committee of management was formed consisting of donors and other prominent citizens. Colonel Fanthorpe, Commissioner of Lucknow was appointed as the first President and Sheikh Maqbool Husain as first Secretary of the Commission. The Committee was registered under the Societies Registration Act on 17 August 1926.

Name: shahbaz h
Title: Outdated
Review: It was good but too much outdated , lack of all facilities like clean toilets, better food and benches... Number of animals like all sanaks, rhino 🦏 , etc..  no better facilities for animals too, they must work on cleanings and careing of animals, they have to add some new animals, and improve food canteens with normal rates. Thank you

Name: Deepti T
Title: Happy day with daughter
Review: It is a very nice place to go especially with children. Enjoyed the train ride. The variety of animals and birds are good.

Name: Sandeep V
Title: Very nice place
Review: Nawab Wazid Ali Sah Purani Udyan earlier known as the prince of wales zoological gardens, now known as Lucknow Zoological Garden. it was established in the year 1921 in the heart of capital city Uttar Pradesh. as for central zoo Authority of India, it is the large zoo in India. it was established in 1921 to commemorate the visits of his royal highness, the prince of wales to Lucknow. As per Zoo authority, there are various facilities available in this zoo for the visitors such as Indian & exotic animals, Birds, Reptile, Aquarium, Nocturnal House, State art Museum, interpretation center etc

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Nice Place
Review: A nice place to spend time with your friends or family. This place beautifies the city, Lucknow. The pride of Lucknow.

Name: gaurav
Title: Lucknow visit
Review: This zoological garden has a historical background. It is one of the most beautiful places to visit in lucknow. A variety of mammals , birds and reptiles are there at the garden. Toy train is available there. An Egyptian mummy in the museum is centre of attraction. This place is easily accessible. Overall a very good and beautiful place to visit in lucknow.

Name: Avneesh B
Title: Nice place to hang out
Review: Very nice place , lot of animals , specially  Bengal Tiger , Gir Lion , White Tiger , Himalayan Bear , Sloth Bear , Hona , Jackal , lot of birds , Ostrich , Emu ,  Cranes , Felicans and much more , A fish aquarium too , there is a museum ,children park , small boating area , and food court also . A very good zoo , animals are in a very good shape .A must visit place .

Name: khadds
Title: family entertianment
Review: Fav spot of my daughter, been here number of times. Lots of animals, birds, fishes, but best is free flight aviary with storks and other beautiful birds. This place also has a huge museum with paintings, sculptures from different times of past. Also has a toy train. One will need 4-5 hrs to do justice to this place. Only negative point is too many visitors.

Name: HOMPRS
Title: Well maintained and lively zoo
Review: Much better in terms of animals, the way they were being fed, cleanliness, space and path after entry to exit (Only Rs.60/pp). The map explains the route very well and if you stick to the route, u will not miss any animal. Oldies can opt to go by the toy train inside the zoo (less noisy and nice though it wont stop anywhere for you to see the animals from nearby)Note: Don,t miss the real mummy of a 13 year old girl that is kept in the lucknow museum inside the zoo (Rs.5 ticket). There are only 6-7 places in India were mummies are kept including lucknow.

Name: TravelnShutterbug
Title: Government should spend more than making parks
Review: A very old Zoo but unkept. The real attraction is the recently opened information centre. Must see before it is spoiled. Quite informative. The park has entry fee of 60 for adults. The zoo is in pathetic state and needs urgent attention. We went so that our entry fee at least contributed for the welfare of animals. There is a toy train for kids and for senior citizens there is golf cart buggy.

Name: sunilsine
Title: Zoo
Review: This is one of the best zoological garden of India.. I feel it's better from Delhi zoo. You can  visit all the area by  walk or  with the  tourist train. Here is  zoological Park, museum and in museum you can see mummy also.

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Fascinating
Review: I went to Lucknow Zoo. Some of the fascinating animals and birds such as Royal Bengal Tiger, White Tiger, Lion, Wolf, Great Pied Hornbill, Golden Pheasant and Silver Pheasant can be spotted here in their natural habitat. It is great place to go.

Name: StephanieO34
Title: Sad place
Review: The animals here all looked rather bored, woebegone and shabby, in similar compounds despite their different natures. One lonely giraffe typified what we saw.There were many local children there when we visited as it was "Children's Day", and the school parties were out in force - perhaps on a quieter day it might have been better, but somehow I doubt it. We did not see the whole zoo, as we were passing through on the way to the Museum, which is in the grounds.

Name: neha763
Title: Great place for kids
Review: Most all animals can be seen here. A very good experience for the kids. Lucknow zoo comes in as one of the India's best zoo.

Name: Aarav K
Title: It's Amazing
Review: Lucknow zoo is very big and full of many animals. The charm here will appeal to you. Everybody must go here.

Name: Pradyumna M
Title: Upgraded zoo of lucknow.
Review: My family visited there after long time and we saw that many things are changed like according to the passing years zoo is upgrading too.. Many good places to sit and enjoy a good view and have some food. Many things are there to watch and click some pics.

Name: nitesh1985
Title: intersting
Review: good place must go there ,fun will be there in your veins.different animal to see ,giraffe an gorillas .

Name: Rajani B
Title: Look out for Orangutan
Review: Setup in the 1920s, this is one of the large zoos in India. Collection is good. Special attractions are orangutan and Giraffe. Restaurants, Rest rooms, Drinking water facility is available. Video camera and still cameras are allowed.

Name: Pankaj G
Title: animals or eco picnic place for familes
Review: one of famous place in uttar pradesh. it's famous for his golf car and children train .museum will also there , and boating area, owl house, aquarium , snake house , and the best thing is one big Aeroplane has there. famous hukku monkey sounds great for visitors.

Name: ChiefExplorers
Title: Kids friendly
Review: Lucknow Zoo is a beautiful place to visit with your family. Its a kids friendly place which can be visited at any time of the year, preferably during winters.

Name: Pawan B
Title: Lucknow zoo
Review: This is a big zoo I never seen before and wide variety of birds,mammals and reptiles.I also visited Kanpur zoo but it has not this variety of animals .Toy train also attracting thing in this zoo

Name: aks19682003
Title: Place for nature lover
Review: Nice family place for nature lover best place for picnic kids enjoy this place and get in touch with the beauty of nature.

Name: Nikhil Sethi
Title: Lucknow Zoo
Review: A great place for the children to enjoy. They have a variety of animals for the whole family to enjoy. My daughter particularly loved the toy train.

Name: chirantansoor
Title: GOOD PLACE FOR FEW HOURS...
Review: Good collection of animals at wajidh ali shah zoo.specially white tigers.the bal rail ride is pretty good compared to other zoo's.but lots of area is poorly maintained and many cages are empty.good for kids ...

Name: durex p
Title: Awesome.zoo
Review: This zoo is famous for white tiger..lots of other animal also found here..this park also have lots of trees and have very greeny surrounding

Name: alec7393
Title: Lucknow
Review: I and my family go on Lucknow... When I rech Lucknow... I saw a zoo..this zoo is very big..and very animal here.

Name: Tabrez388
Title: Wonderful tour
Review: It was great time there I love the place it was beautiful and pleasure tour without any headache ambience was great

Name: Samanvya
Title: Neat and clean- but..
Review: Very neat very clean, but limited animals. The reptile section is especially disappointing as it has 100s of snakes and pythons but all of them of same variety. The biggest problems are the guests who will keep on teasing and irritating the animals just for fun. Do visit once- you get opportunity to see a few animals and birds really close.

Name: Travel732059
Title: Good place for outing with kids
Review: One of my favorite places to visit with my family, clean place, not very expensive & good food outlets

Name: Sapan Banga
Title: Ok ok
Review: Animals here are weak, had to walk very much and the weather was not helping, too hot and humid. Eating joints here are not clean and henceforth not gud

Name: randhirt2017
Title: FAMILY PLACE
Review: As i have been there many times i would personally recommend everyone to visit one's if you are at Lucknow

Name: Yogesh T
Title: A small zoo
Review: It is a zoo situated near the local colonies, with limited animals and that too looks like sick, and with no facilities like packaged drinking water, water is available on cart per glass which tastes like salty, and no cafe anything to eat there

Name: Susej B
Title: A casual visit !
Review: The aim was to renew our childhood memories of this place. S very compact and well organized Zoo considering the size. The Museum co-located inside the Zoo was the main attraction for us.

Name: KISHORE S
Title: Noisy visitors, silent wild life.
Review: The Zoo is situated in the heart of city, next to Hazratganj. If you are traveling by car, go to the gate near Police headquarter of Lucknow. Ample parking in available. The fee at INR 60 is rather high for a big group. Try not to go on a public holiday, as you are likely to face huge noisy crowd. Too many eating places within the premises make it more of a picnic spot than a real Zoo. However, the toy train is good for kids. Ask at the gate if the museum is open.

Name: Nitish N
Title: Zoo
Review: I visited this place in april 2017 with my family and found it worth visiting.. it is bigger and more variety of animals in there.. should visit in the autumn..

Name: Stupid E
Title: Lucknow Zoo is Amazing
Review: Lucknow zoo is full of animals, you will see one of the amazing animals from here. This zoo is awesome. There can be no better place than to go with your family or friends.

Name: Rakesh s
Title: Lucknow Zoooo
Review: Zoos are always beautiful with its animals in it. The place is very big and awesome to visit. Have a try.

Name: Vibhu S
Title: Zoo
Review: This common place having zoo in all city in India but we enjoy holiday in zoo with full joyful and family place

Name: vikas9743
Title: Nice place for mini picnic wid small kids
Review: Must go for toy train ride kids enjoy watching animal from train ride.... good place to visit if your child curious about animals....this zoo also have museum aquarium....

Name: amitverma091
Title: A day with real animal
Review: As mentioned in the title, if you want to see some amazing animals in real then you really need to visit it.

Name: greatsamar
Title: Must visit
Review: Covered in very big area.. has various kind of animals . Its a good picnic spot but take of climate . If it is hot then you may not like the place

Name: vikram218
Title: Pleasantly Surprised  !!!
Review: If you are coming here thinking it's a zoo in Lucknow, UP and not a zoo in metro.....Well think twice. It's one of the best maintained zoo in India. Lots of variety of most of the species. Tigers are a treat to watch..... Must visit with your family and friends.

Name: TRYVL
Title: Must visit
Review: A must visit spot in Lucknow,can enjoy different activities there other than bird and animal spotting.

Name: UTKARSH PRATAP S
Title: A great place for nature lovers
Review: A good weather and free time can add happiness to your visit and the birds amd animals makes you feel amazing

Name: Shubham669
Title: Visit
Review: We have great fun with animals here although cleanness of zoo is one of the big problem and government must aware of it ..but awesome place to visit

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Good one
Review: Lucknow zoo situated near hazratganj, nice place.This zoo having lots of animals, burds, it's always nice to go there.

Name: Puneet A
Title: Interesting for families with children
Review: This place is perhaps good for families with children. There weren't too many animals to see and the place is not too well maintained, but okay for a picnic.

Name: anu m
Title: Quite large zoo
Review: The Lucknow zoo is quite large and also hosts all kind of animals. A very good place for bringing your children along.

Name: mishra712
Title: Refreshing outing
Review: Lucknow zoo has a big advantage compared to a lot of other newer zoos in different cities - its location. It is located right next to Hazratganj and now houses probably as many specimen as it would have ever did. A few sections were a disappointment as still not fully functional (e.g., nocturnal section). There is ample amount of attraction for young children in terms of open spaces/lawns and play grounds (with swings, slides, merry go rounds etc) and also the mini zoo train. It's a perfect outing on a sunny winter!

Name: sun_abhay
Title: Great place to enjoy a day with family, friends
Review: Saw lot of improvement and facilities at zoo visiting after a long time. Nice maintenance of animal shelters and museum. Toy train give a great ride. Need significant improvements in fooding facilities.  Over enjoyed the place.

Name: Pradeep Ambat
Title: Good visit
Review: Had a good visit to d Lucknow zoo. The big cats were d main attraction with asiatic lion,White tiger,leopards etc. the toy train adds to d charm. You need to devote 3 to 4 hrs to explore the complete zoo. A good place to vis with d family.

Name: Catherine Boyden
Title: One of those crazy Indian treats.
Review: Visited a couple of years ago with a friend. It’s amazing and a great place to take photos but, when I visited at least, not yet taken over by Instagram hungry people jostling for the perfect snap.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Very grand, very majestic!
Review: This place exudes power and grandeur in a sprawling expanse of Rajasthani stone work. The 80 odd royal elephants dot the backend of the park, while various other structures and monuments inside are all fantastic picture spots and a place to spend a lazy evening.

Name: Vidhata bache
Title: Biggest monumental waste
Review: Biggest waste of environmental disaster, cement, steel, prime land, green space etc. What could have been done in rightly and duely in some 20000 sq ft is wasted in acres of land and greenery. No trees, no benches, just stone, stone and different stones, elephants, statues, open space exposing you to harsh weather. Monumental waste. Same money could have fed, educated, poor of UP.

Name: zyanmalik
Title: Ambedkar Park Visit
Review: It's an amazing place to visit.really good work as a public place.Pride of Uttar PradeshStones and Baba Saheb Ambedkar statue is amazing.

Name: BISWABRATA
Title: Ambedkar Memorial Park
Review: OMG. You just can't complete your Lucknow tour without visiting A.M. Park. Lots of places to walk inside. Good architectural work, just once visit this place and will realise what you have seen. Evening lighting is amazing.

Name: John Muriango
Title: Good
Review: The park is great for an evening walk. Founded as a memorial for Dalit Indian constitutionalist and reformer who bears its name.

Name: debparamita
Title: Mayawati Park
Review: It is a 108 acres of barren granite polished stone park . Hardly any trees and slippery floor to walk on. Read more on Papumashi the Nomad --- "The Great Gangetic Plain and The Kumbh Mela"

Name: krishna292
Title: No Park only a Memorial with Stone Statues
Review: After checking out from Hotel Hilton we planned to visit Dr Ambedkar Memorial Park  before taking our flight for Delhi as we had heard a lot about it being one of the modern tourist attractions. The memorial has been made in the memory of Dr. B R Ambedkar,  one of the most popular social reformer and famous lawyer who drafted Indian Constitution after independence. That is why many people visit it and we also wanted to visit it. The credit for the construction of the memorial goes to the top leader of a political party of downtrodden and backward masses who had come to power in the State of UP. During our earlier trips to Lucknow about 45 years back, we had seen various well known historical monuments like Chota Imambada, Bara Imambada, Residency etc. and so we did not want to go there. However, after reaching the memorial we were disappointed to see its vast Lay out of stony statues. It is not a park and to go around the whole area of the Memorial during a a warm day (even in the month of March) is very tiresome, particularly for senior citizens. The time of our visit was around 11 AM and because of stony structures every where, without any shelters, we felt very uncomfortable. There is no greenery or shelter in this so called park for visitors to have some respite. The memorial occupies a large area with stony statues of elephants and icons of some leaders also. There are several stoops and structures with inscriptions. There are a large number of elephant statues and even these elephants have been made on the top of towers spread throughout the park., because elephant is the symbol of that political party. Whosoever had designed this Memorial should have taken care to plant trees and shelters from rains or sun. As such, this place should only be visited in evenings or on cloudy days. Because of shortage of time we did not go inside the halls and galleries exhibiting items in the memory of political leaders and social reformers of India.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Amazing Memorial, but definitely not a park
Review: Architecturally this is an amazing place. Opulence reflects in the way this is constructed. This is the legacy of this city, however found that maintenance and security wise, I found this to be not well treated. Thing to note is either visit this memorial in morning or evening that too till 4 PM, because in afternoon you would not find any trees or greenery here and it will be too hot. Ideally this is a memorial and not a park. But it is good place, a must visit if you are in Lucknow. Time to visit 11 - 4 PM, visit on a not so hot day and keep around 2 hours for this memorial.

Name: JoyBose
Title: A clean and well maintained park containing statues of Dalit icons and a Buddhist stupa
Review: This is a huge park, built in Gomti nagar Lucknow by the previous chief minister of Uttar Pradesh, Smt Mayawati. It is one of the tourist attractions of Lucknow and also called Parivartan sthal. The park is quite spacious, the main highlight is a Buddhist stupa containing the relics of the Buddha. The pat to the stupa is decorated with rows of elephants. There are statues and sculptures of dalit icons including Kanshi Ram, Mayawati and Ambedkar, Jyotiba Phule, Sahuji maharaj, along with a summary of their life and contributions. There are also scenes from the Buddha's life inside the main building. It is a good place to learn about the dalit struggle, injustice of caste system and social equality in India. Its quite clean and well maintained. Its a good place to hang out with friends. There is an entry ticket at a cheap price.

Name: Amit
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: must see it, if you are in lukhnow, greate Art of workmanship. go in Evening or early morning only..

Name: Pradyumna M
Title: Ambedkar park :the best place to enjoy
Review: I visited there quite a few months ago and in winters and i have to say in this context that me and my friends enjoyed a lot there and we took photographs there which were so awesome

Name: Tom B
Title: Amazing how this has been built
Review: This is a great few hours out and about.  The architecture is incredible.  The whole park is made of marbel and you see dragonflies trying to lay eggs on it.  Not the best for evolution but there are bloody hundreds of them so can't be doing too bad for them.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Ambedkar Memorial Park
Review: Ambedkar Memorial Park is a fantastic place to hangout and enjoy with dear ones. One should definately visit this place.

Name: Anuradha

Review: Too much of concrete is eye soaring. Came to know from the cab driver that the area had lush green forests before this park was constructed.

Name: Satyam S
Title: Simply Awesome
Review: The Ambedkar park has entry fees worth it. I went with my friends in this park and really amazed with the architectural beauty of the park. Must one time visit , if you are in lucknow. I see many people enjoy by admiring the park beauty and click awesome photographs.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Amazing place

Title: Picnic

Name: Bhai ji
Title: Very nice
Review: This part is very nice main is very nice I am go to with boyfriend enjoy this is very beautiful place

Name: RAJAT SINGH

I have seen the only park with no trees that was a minus to it.Although visit just once and enjoy the beautiful architecture.Thanks for reading

Review: As we had to pass time for an hour so we decided to visit Ambedkar Park ,having fountain but it works only in the evening from 6pm to 9pm.We had a good time to njoy green part of park.very well maintained.

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Huge park dedicated to Ambedkar and elephants…
Review: The park is very huge with open wide spaces in all directions. There are several elephant statues and huge statues of Dr. Ambedkar along with other political leaders. The view from the top is good and the park is well maintained.

Name: Somaseshu Gutala
Title: My Visit to Ambedkar Memorial Park, Lucknow
Review: Lucknow has a rich cultural heritage with many historic monuments, gardens and famous parks. Everywhere one can see greenery with shady trees and spacious parks. nearly there are one hundred parks such as Gautam Buddha park, Dr.Ram Manohar Lohia Park, Janeshwar Mishra Park, Swarna Jayanti Smriti Vihar Park, Chandrasekhar Azad Park etc.  The Nawabs of Awadh beautified this city with many gardens, palaces and mosques. During my short stay there I had an opportunity of visiting the Ambedkar Memorial Park, a public park and memorial in Gomti Nagar. Ms. Mayavati, the former Chief Minister and leader of B.S.P. established this park with many monuments and pillars to represent the democratic ideals of social reformers and noble persons who worked for the upliftment of Dalit people. The foundation stone for this memorial park was laid in 1995. It was called Dr.Bhimrao Udyan. Construction and development work continued up to 2002 and the park was re-named as Dr.Bhimrao Ambedkar Memorial. In 2007 it was further renovated and developed. On April 14, 2008 the park was opened to the public. Finally in 2012 the park was re-named as Bhimrao Ambedkar Memorial. Red sandstone from Rajasthan was used for this megalithic construction. Nearly seven billion rupees were spent to build this lofty monument which has become the pride and glorious symbol of this city. Unlike other parks, here one does not find much greenery and gigantic trees. So we don’t find any shelter if it suddenly rains. It would be better if the authorities have set up some shelters for visitors to protect themselves from intense heat of summer and rainy showers. You will see a very spacious land of 107 acres with a broad stretch of road flanked by sixty-two stone elephants on either side at the main entrance. This spot is called “Pratibimb Sthal”. Priority is given to statues of elephants as the elephant is the election symbol of Mayavati’s Bahujan Samaj Party and also of  Ambedkar’s Republican Party. Nearly three thousand elephant figures are seen in this grand construction.  In the center of the park there is a massive musical fountain. It stands as a symbol of Dalit empowerment and dignity. On the left side of the park one can see a huge building called Ambedkar Sthupa located on a mound. Inside the Sthupa one can see a big bronze statue of Ambedkar seated in a chair. At the base of the statue a message in Hindi is engraved which means “My struggle of life is my only message.” Many statues are seen depicting the life of Ambedkar. In Ambedkar Samajik Parivartan Sangrahalay spread over 2.5 acres, one can see a monument with two domes. Under one building one can see the statues of eminent social reformers like Jyothi Rao Phule, Shri Narayana Guru, Dr.Ambedkar, Kanshi Ramji and Rajarshi Chatrapati Shahuji Maharaj . In the second building the marble statues of Gautam Buddha, Sant Kabir Das, Sant Ravi Das, Guru Ghasi Das and Sri Birsa Munda are seen. This monument is an objective representation of equality, humanity and social justice. In Drashya Sthal one can see an eighty- foot tall pyramid structure with water flowing from its top. From here one can have a panoramic view of the whole park with its monuments and pillars spread around. In Dr.Ambedkar Samajik Parivartan Gallery spread over four acres one can see many bronze murals. It would better serve the purpose of spreading the ideals and message of Ambedkar and other leaders if a gift shop is set up there where one can buy books, photos and souvenirs that contain the teachings and messages of these noble personalities. This park is open from 11.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m. on all days except on Monday. This park was under the supervision of the Lucknow Development Authority.

Name: priyansh
Title: Excellent place
Review: It's great place to see, to roam to enjoy with friends and see the beauty of Lucknow...This things are like assets for the UP.

Name: wewingii

This place is the pride of Lucknow. So whenever you plan to visit lucknow, dont forget to visit this place

Name: Sutima
Title: Voyage alone
Review: Admission fee is just 15 rupees. It was worth it. I have never come to this low cost park entrance fee. I like building work It indicates commitment and a heart that believes in this.Is a wesome place.I love this place so much

Name: Sparkling soul
Title: Vizit

Unique architecture with so many interesting facts. facilities are good like lock rooms ,washrooms,drinking water, security. Many reason to visit with family.I would like to recommend all of you to visit at least one time.Ticket price is just 20

As far as this fact I'd concerned, lots of public money seems wasted. 9 large statues of mayavati is the lowest point in making of this park. Don't ever think of visiting this park on a summer noon. I was as much disappointed as i appreciate its grand scale design.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Good time
Review: I always want to visit the place which has a beauty of art in architecture and love in side but the place is become hot at the time in mid day best visit the evening time after 6 pm must visit

Name: ranvirsinghrathore
Title: money wasting
Review: just wasting money you can imagine only elephant last visit janeshwar i think may be some attractive but really disappointed

Name: Ashish Gupta

Name: Amit M
