Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Handsome Structure !!!
Review: Very wide building, only with the panaroma mode we can capture the full building in a single photo, we nice to see from outside,We went there on 15th October 2015,we where on our way to Mukthinath yathra via Gorakhpur, Since this building is on the main road, we can't miss this building when we are in Lucknow,Thanks a lot for everything,Loving you so much,Peacefully yours,S M Bega Raaj,Happy travelling...

Name: bharati2408
Title: Mesmerizing view of lightings during festivals or Independence day!
Review: The vidhan bhawan islocated at the heart of the city, i.e Hazratganj. The fab architecture, the lightings done during festivals, or on republic or independence day are breath taking.Special permissions are needed to enter.

Name: guddu1954
Title: a magnificent structure of British era
Review: You have to necessarily pass through this structure when in Lucknow.During Independence day and republic day,the lights are added attractions and very inviting.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Beautiful
Review: The octagonal-shaped chamber has a domed roof, decorated with peacocks in fully plumed splendour. Really beautiful

Name: am1618
Title: Vidhan shaba
Review: we visited the place  for a cursory glance while driving ..good facade and quick photos ...dont"nt need to spend much time

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A Historical Building
Review: VIDHANSABHA  LUCKNOWAll lageslive work of UP government  is run from this Vidhan sabha Bhavan. I saw from road side because special permission is required for entry. The construction of the building OF Vidhansabha is one of the finest examples of Indo-European architectural craftsmanship of the twentieth century. The front part of this crescent shaped two storied structure is built with carved light brown sandstone blocks.

Name: Neerajdangi15
Title: Lucknow Vidhansabha
Review: A very good building for the members of legislature to sit. I saw it from outside only. An excellent stone work of british time.

Name: prabhakarbaba
Title: Not for all
Review: Vidhan sabha is not tourist spot its UP legislative only selected VIP allowed on special case to visit

Name: wish2traveltheworld
Title: Not a Place for public
Review: Well this is one of the houses of the UP assembly and not a place for tourists to visit. It well guarded by security and you can only admire the architecture of the building from outside. For me it is not a must to do things in Lucknow.

Name: Ashok_Kumar_Singh
Title: Beautiful building
Review: Very beautiful. Located in the heart of Lucknow. Just beside the road. This very important building of Uttar Pradesh. so, very well managed. Very neat and clean.

Name: MariaK638ET
Title: A Parliament house is a parliament house is a parliament house
Review: The Vidhan Sabha is the Uttar Pradesh's Legislative Assembly's home.  It is an impressive building indeed, obviously built in British times.  It's not easy to get in here, people.  I managed to do so because my political science student daughter's friend's father is the assistant of a politician who has a seat here.  A few girls in the class wanted to go in, to see how a legislative assembly works and an adult was needed to accompany them.  So I went in.  OMG, the security was something else.  You had to take off all jewellery, rings and earrings, What was particularly worrisome was that the security people didn't take their eyes off you for a second.  An innocent whisper to your companion as you sat next to her in the visitors' gallery is hushed immediately. Let's face it, I had to do it sometime, I don't know Hindi.  It's quite thrilling seeing the local political   personalities of whom one reads in the newspapers  giving their speeches right in front of you, even if you don't know Hindi well. Oh and BTW, do NOT raise your hand to scratch your ear, you will get glared and prodded by the security women in the gallery.  It's just not worth it. Oh, well, I guess it's necessary. The building is beautiful and well preserved and for me, a politically aware long-term resident of Lucknow, well worth seeing.  The trouble is, I don't think tourists would enjoy it very much, those policewomen tend to look at you as if to say 'one false move and you're going to the dungeon in chains'. I mean, who needs that on holiday? But as a photo opportunity, the Vidhan Sabha is gorgeous. Do do try to get outside and get a picture and leave the political shenanigans where they belong - inside the building.  It will save you having to retrieve your handbag and jewellery later.

Name: Durgesh K
Title: Vidhan Sabha Bhawan Lucknow
Review: It is a 200 year old building built in British period. Houses the Lower assembly of UP government. A great structure with a bold presence is on the display. Worth seeing on Republic day and Independence Day as it got lit by tricolor lights.

Name: aviray
Title: Average
Review: Characterizes colonial architecture. They don't allow people to get in. One can catch glimpse from outside. Nothing great to drop by, best watched while on the way on the auto/bus.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: vidhan sabha
Review: A good architectural piece and worth seeing, specially when it gets lit up and decorated on r-day and independence day

Name: varghese2sanu
Title: Fantastic Design
Review: one of the brilliant construction design I have ever seen in Lucknow. a native of Lucknow can be proud. thumbs up!!

Name: Shobha V
Title: Mirzapuri  Assence feel in lucknow
Review: #just watch from outside coz now it has been converted into govt. department.# every year on national fest !5 aug. and 26 Jan uses to decorate from tri-color of indian flag. # built by britishers # the Mirzapuri stones  were used to complete this building.

Name: Pawan_Shrotria
Title: Rich - Look Structure
Review: Vidhan Sabha Building looks great for its huge dome. This is located on Station road and the road itself called Vidhan Sabha Marg.

Name: Jeet S
Title: Beautiful structure
Review: Very clean, spacious and Beautiful structure built in the city by the Government. It's not historical, but still you will love to see it.

Name: MSaksham
Title: Nothing to view
Review: If you are passing by ,then only stop for some time to see around ,especially in night,get some icecream and then move on.Nothing to see there.

Name: Swatimathur
Title: Very good
Review: An imposing structure in the heart of the city, Vidhan Sabha has conditional access through special permission from the UP government. Inside, the building has the chambers of the Upper and Lower House (Legislative Council and Legislative Assembly) like the British upper and lower houses. When the legislature is in session, special permission to enter as a visitor can be obtained from the government for access to the visitor's gallery.

Name: Adeel
Title: Big Building
Review: Its a nice big building that is spread horizontally. Had the chance of passing by on 15th August and the building was very lit with a picnic type environment all around.

Name: caroline_dutton
Title: Wish this could be seen from inside.
Review: Only if it could be seen from inside, it would have been another marvel of the Colonial buildings in India. If it is so very beautiful from inside, it would be striking from inside as well.

Name: KINGSHUK S
Title: Imposing structure and nicely illuminated in evening
Review: On 26th Jan'2013, all office buildings in Lucknow were brilliantly illuminated in tri-colored light combinations matching with the tri-colors of Indian National Flag. The Vidhan Sabha was no exception. Brilliantly illuminated. But we got only a few seconds to shoot our pic. The road in front was crowded, lots of fast-food vendors were selling paani-puris and other snacks, my wife got down for a plate of paani-puri and immediately she had to rush back to the car as an old policeman arrived at site and barked at all cars parked in front of the will-lit building to take away their car as it is a no-parking area. The question remains : If it is such a high-security, no-parking spot even in evening, when harmless, law-abiding revellers in holiday-mood with family are out for some enjoyment on a holiday, why in the first place so many street-side vendors are allowed to sell their products just in front of the high-security citadel?? Or as they say "It happens only in India?"

Name: Dr Narottam L
Title: U.P Seat of Governance the "Magestic “Vidhan Sabha" We love it
Review: As a residents and natives of Uttar  Pradesh  (U.P.);  let me tell in a clear voice  and aloud to one and all that we, the natives of this state are proud of our domicile in this state and our seat of Governance the “VidhanSabha”.   Some pseudo-progressive people refer us  as backward and avoid  marrying  a  boy  from  UP ,saying they are not progressive ,  take pan and tobacco etc and do not speak    (read  good ) English .Let me add it is no disrespect to any body and  every body is entitled to personal opinions . Most of such people were born and brought up in this (backward) state but had to migrate to so called developed states because of compulsions of their service or because of any other similar reasons.  I have no problems with them. It is also true that U.P is mini India which has absorbed migrants from all over India who follow their tradition and culture and we are proud of our heterogeneous culture . Seat of U.P .Government the “Vidhansabha” building is majestic and    beautiful structure with no  parallel.Tricolour at the top of  central dome adds to its grandeur    .  The state symbol in form of two fishes in an emblem is engraved at top- front of building which gives  majestic look  to the  building .Front lawn is lush green and well maintained .The space opposite and across the road has a unique semicircular design difficult to describe. Right and left wings spread on both side of main Vidhansabha building looks like two wings of a very big birds spread and  ready to take off to fly. These wings are called UP state secretariat and houses offices of UP secretary level officers and Ministers.           The Vidhansabha is located at main road leading from city to Main railway stations (Lucknow NR & NER) and to Air port .Every visitor to Lucknow has to pass through the road in front of it and   can not escape looking at and admiring this beautiful building .Its decoration on republic day is a great attraction for locals. Be it Independence Day or Republic Day; main flag hosting is done in front of this building. The presiding dignity takes salute of parade of these functions in front of Vidhansabha . It is not only symbolic seat of Government but place of Pride for U. P walas              Entry in this complex in restricted by pass system for official  business only

Name: Akshay Sharma
Title: A working clock tower in the city
Review: This tower was made by the British and is located next to historical places like Imambara and the pond. The clock is still operational and provides a key milestone for the city landscape.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Tall and majestic!
Review: This clock tower stands besides the Chota Imambara. It is an excellent architectural work by the Nawabs, and a symbol of Lucknow's history. A great picture spot while touring the Chowk area. The the horse carriage ride around this area to get a true feel of the Nawabi era.

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Old world charm
Review: Great place to visualize old world charm of Lucknow. Center of old town & has a lot of history all around it. Can be enjoyed in the evening as well

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Tallest Clock Tower in India
Review: Soaring to about 219 ft, this has been identified as the tallest Clock Tower in India.... it was built in 1881 to welcome Sir George Couper, the first lieutenant governor of United Province of Avadh... Designed by Richard Roskell Bayne, the architecture blends Victorian and Gothic structural patterns, indicative of London's Big Ben.... the clock dial is in the shape of 12 petals of a full gold flower with bells around and a pendulum which is about 14 ft long

Name: gpradeepshenoy
Title: In between Bara Imambara and chota Imambara
Review: Ghanta ghar as it is called locally is about 15 minutes walk from bara Imambara .        This clock tower can be visited when one travels from bara Imambara to chota Imambara.          Ghanta ghar is just near the picture gallery. This clock tower is India's tallest. Surrounding area can be maintained more neatly.           Can be visited when one travels from Bara Imambara to chota Imambara.

Name: Nilakshi S
Title: A view to remember.
Review: The clock tower stands tall in the middle of the city. Old Lucknow. Near the water tank. History jumps out through the time telling clock tower.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Ok to visit, if you have time
Review: Ok to visit, if you have time. Very near to Rumi Darwaza and Bada Imambara. Not much to visit at this spot.

Name: JoyBose
Title: A nice clock tower in old Lucknow, but not allowed to climb
Review: Its a nice clock tower built by the nawab, next to a beautiful man made lake. It is in chowk area of Lucknow, walking distance from bada and chota imambara. Nowadays it is not allowed to climb the tower due to safety concerns. There are nice gardens and park around this place.Its specially beautiful during the sunset time.

Name: Ajeet
Title: Landmark.. and beautiful
Review: A landmark of lucknow, located close to Rumi Gate.. nice place to visit. However this place ans surroundings need maintenance.

Name: Syedabid2014
Title: A britsh era relic
Review: Loosely inspired by Big Ben, Husainabad Clock Tower is surely a place to visit, as it is quite near to the Chhota Imambara. Dont miss the moon viewing watch tower near by.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Beautiful
Review: Very nice and four sided clock tower from the British times .Not far from Rumi Darwaza .No ticket to take .

Name: Tanvi
Title: Nothing much here to watch
Review: The architecture is good . But there is nothing more to watch . My kids got bored here . It was an okay okay visit .

Name: ShikshaC
Title: Beautiful tower but nothing else…
Review: You can see the clock tower when you go to visit the Imambra. The tower is a good example of beautiful architecture but you can just see it from outside as it’s not accessible inside. Not much to do at this attraction.

Name: chikpick
Title: Nothing great...
Review: Near to rumi darwaza. Its just a big clock built like in most of the towns as ghantaghar. The area around is not well maintained. On a holiday u will find big guys playing cricket and u will be afraid of getting hurt.

Name: TJRDunne
Title: Impressive Clocktower
Review: The area is cool and the clock tower is impressive. Not a lot to do to spend a great time there, we passed through it.

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: A 19th century marvel
Review: The Husainabad Clock Tower was constructed in 1881 to mark Sir George Couper's arrival, the first LG of United Province of Avadh. You can spot the Clock Tower from kms, but as you come closer, you can also see a large step-well next to it.

Name: taotzu
Title: Lovely colonial area
Review: This clock tower is reminiscent of the British Raj. A very outstanding campanile type tower overlooking a lovely step well type pond and a beautiful cobbled promenade. Reminds of Europe. Municipal corporation can still improve this location

Name: Rajjat Sabhrwal
Title: Nice view, get your pic clicked like you are holding the clock tower top
Review: In the city of nawabs you will also get to see clock tower.. this looks really stunning anytime you visit this.. it is said that it was constructed in 1881. The building is historic, one is allowed to go inside the clock tower one can easily watch from outside and get your picture clicked by posing like you are holding the top of clock tower..

Name: durham05
Title: Unable to climb the tower.
Review: Nice clock centrally located but door locked and no opportunity to climb the tower. Step well adjacent to it is equally impressive.

Name: 982pradipb
Title: A Hurried Trip
Review: It is a well maintained tower erected in a wide area . It can be seen from a distance behind the Ruminator Darwaja .Next to it is the Saptakhand

Name: Gastronomical_Chariot
Title: Amazing masterpiece of nostalgic Lucknow memories
Review: One of the iconic locations of Lucknow usually crowded during the evening. Lot and lot of people visit this place. Would definitely recommend taking umbrella there on a sunny day. Go get some nice pictures !!

Name: Pushpendra M
Title: NICE
Review: Nice place for tourists. It is very old tower. It looks like LONDON CLOCK. Very good are sit, walk and enjoy.

Name: Bharat K
Title: Feast on the hawker eatables and stroll around
Review: This is a great place to while away time with family and friends.Very open area, to sit, walk and observe the surroundings. Avoid weekends and late evenings as they may get crowded (unless you like crowds).Lots of hawkers selling a variety of delicious eatables and fruits. Choose what you like and stroll around seeing people, talking and enjoying with the company you are in.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Nice Place for Tourist
Review: Situated in Old Lucknow walking distance from Rumi Darwaza, Choota Imambara and Bara Immambara.Famous for its Ding Dong ancient bell. To get it repaired the only Clock Repairer in india from Kolkatta was called few years back. Next  to iy is Picture Gallarey

Name: Harsh V
Title: beautiful place
Review: the clock look like london clock the local people called the place gunta ghar the ticket price is include in emambhara so not so looking the place just for one time visit

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Beautiful structure
Review: In the old part of Lucknow, on the road connecting bada and chota imambara, the place is a hub of activity in the evening.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Decent place to have a stroll around
Review: This clock tower is taller than the ones I've seen in other cities. Just a chill place to visit with family. Lots of open space & foot joints around to enjoy an evening walk.Its a typical open grounds you'll find in India

Name: FANOUT
Title: Grand
Review: will please some one ensure that the flood lights illuminating this grand structure actually function....when they do please do stand back and enjoy the view of the Tower, Satkhanda and Picture Gallary....not to forget the Husainabad Reservoir...

Name: mehtarakeshkumar56
Title: CLOCK TOWER
Review: the clock tower was made in 1881 and in line of the rumi darwaza . the clock tower is an famous tourist destination and its famous for its golden bird which is on the top which shows the wind directions

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: CLOCK IN HEIGHT
Review: Husainabad clock tower is longest height clock.It is in 63 meter height.It is also the biggest clock in the world.

Name: Krupabn
Title: Historical landmark covered in filth
Review: Clock tower is a must see from historic perspective but maintenance is pathetic and you can see flith everywhere.. Need to have a proper maintenance..

Name: keith h
Title: A Popular Landmark.
Review: Erected in 1881 to mark the new British Governor General of Avdh. Styled in the Victorian Gothic & reckoned to be the tallest clock tower in India. It stands in a wide plaza, adjacent to a stepped pool. The nearby, startlingly red bricked picture gallery flanked by tall palm trees when conjoined with the clock tower makes for a good photograph.  It's a popular area & not the cleanest with cow pats & litter about.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: Stull working !!
Review: It's more than 138 years old and surprisingly still working fine, located close to Chota Imambara, nothing so great.

Title: Clock Tower is  a must to see
Review: I will suggest to visit both in the day time and see the museum and appreciate the numerous paintings,in the evening to see the lighting there are so many things to see near by.You will love to go there.

Name: nikrang
Title: Time Please
Review: Magnificient example of a city Clock Tower and looks to be well maintained. Would have loved to go in but apparently its not allowed

Name: VIJAY NAHTA
Title: Lucknow sight seeing
Review: Clock tower is must visit sight seeing in old town where all 4-5 sights near by and about 4-6 hours is enough to explore the area in eating try Makhan Malai at road side e rickshaw  is there charge 100 rs for surrounding visiting all area covered 1-2 km

Name: Ajeet N
Title: A tall monument
Review: Situated close to the 2 imambaras, the clock tower is a good photo-op. The clock is working even after 138yrs. There is a water body in front which improves the ambience.

Name: Shashialabur
Title: One of the places to visit in Lucknow
Review: Located very close to the "Bara Imambara", the clock tower, better known as "Ghanta Ghar" is on the list of places to visit in Lucknow.This clock tower is 220 feet in height, is nearly 140 years old (built in 1881) and is modeled on the Big Ben in London. It is an impressive tower, but there is not much else that you can do there other than take a few photos, which is a pity because it has such a rich history behind it !Wish that the surroundings of the tower and the adjoining lake could have been kept cleaner and neater though.This was supposed to have been repaired and put back in service in 2011, it was not functioning when we visited it.

Name: lalani_13
Title: Nice tower
Review: we just passed this tower and took photo from the car and it looked very beautiful but did not get down.

Name: felicityjg1
Title: a 5 minute diversion
Review: This is located in a rather run down area of town where there many slum type dwellings.  The clock itself was interesting - being made from gun metal - but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit it,

Name: milesnmeals
Title: Just another tourist ATrraction
Review: But this has a history to be the second clock tower after the big  ben London. So do viist while you visit old city.

Name: 592abck
Title: They did not allow us to go inside
Review: They did not allow us to go inside but we liked it from outside also. One gets mesmorized with the quality of construction

Name: MoushumiBhattacharya
Title: Replica of Big Ben
Review: Hussainabad Clock Tower is a replica of the famous Big Ben in London.The public timekeeper was built by Nawab Nasir-ud-din Haider in 1882-87 to mark the arrival of Sir George Cooper Bart, the first Lieutenant Governor of the then United Provinces of Agra and Oudh. “James William Benson, the then clock  maker to the Queen of England and makers of the celebrated Big Ben was awarded the contract and Major Norman MT Horsford of the Bengal Staff Corps supervised the construction work. It is a perfect example of "Time never stops at the Nawabs Lucknow".

Name: Bobby J
Title: Historic clock
Review: Husainabad Clock Tower was built in 1881 and since has been the tallest clock tower in India with a 14 feet long pendulum and a dial in the shape of a 12 petalled flower.

Name: Usha65
Title: Beautiful and elegant structure
Review: It is really a fantastic structure, elegant and the surrounding area is very appealing. There is a small water tank and the steps near the tank are visual treat.

Name: Roomi
Title: just passing by side
Review: its a true example of fine British architecture, nicely carved red bricks, still well preserved by Lucknow Development Authority.

Name: amars777
Title: Standing Tall and ticking
Review: Built by Mohammed Ali Shah, third king of Awadh during 1837-42.Located near Hussainabad talab. Very well maintained.

Name: BPB2012
Title: An important landmark of the city
Review: The Clock Tower, popularly known in local language as Ghanta Ghar is an important landmark of the city of Lucknow.

Name: randhirt2017
Title: Historical landmark in lucknow
Review: A historic place to visit for the tourists,Nice place to hangout,you can take photoshoot also,this place is near by chota imambara

Name: Karthik R
Title: Landmarks in Lucknow
Review: Nearby Rumi Dharwaza, is an old clock tower and stepped well, which has been recently renovated and looks in style to attract people in the evenings to kill time.

Name: Kaustav Datta 🍁
Title: Testimony of British Rule in Lucknow
Review: Situated in front of Picture Gallery and on one side of the Rumi Darwaza. Beautiful clock tower built in the 18th century that marks the british rule and the architecture from those times. It is a major landmark in Lucknow.

Name: Mukesh G
Title: Clock Tower
Review: A must visit place while doing sightseeing near old lucknow area. Many indian flim got a shooting at this place.

Name: vikas9743
Title: Symbol of Lucknow
Review: Located prominently this is an iconic place of lucknow which shows the timings to the local residents... A historic place to visit for the tourists...

Name: Vazy
Title: British Era clock tower with persian touch
Review: A quick visit for few minutes is more than enough as its old British clock tower constructed by Nawab.

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Iconic structure of yesteryears
Review: We were crossing this part of the city, on way to Lakhimpur, stopped for a quick photo ops in front of this iconic structure, built by rulers of Awadh.

Name: masaccio
Title: Ummm, Big Ben? Really?
Review: Guide books say it was modelled on Big Ben in London. I guess it must be the onion domes. Guide books also say it’s open, but it wasn’t the Saturday we came, so perhaps not. Nevertheless, it’s a striking building that is an easy spot when you walk out of bara imambara.

Name: nugu9956
Title: big clock tower
Review: movie shooting here and big clock tower good place and clean latest raid movie shooting is here old herritage

Name: Aakash A
Title: Huge and old
Review: Husainabad Clock tower is right in the front of Bara Imam. This is very big and nice. It was constructed by Nawa Nasir-ud-din Haider to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, 1st Lieutenant Governor of United Province of Avadh.

Name: knightrider02
Title: Nice place
Review: Situated after Rumi Darwaza and close to chota Imaam Baada.Nice place to hangout and take photos with family.

Name: Deepak DB
Title: Clo(i)ck Mark
Review: As the name suggests it is a clock tower from the yester years. Good place to hang around clicks pics. Surely cannot be doing this spot in summers or heat of the noon as it is an open area.One of the spots from Heritage Lucknow

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Old Clock Tower
Review: Just next to the Rumi Darwaaza, we saw one of the tallest clock towers – Husainabad Clock Tower . This clock was built in 19th century and is still well maintained. Though nothing much to do, worth to stop for few minutes and click few photographs.

Name: Debojyoti S
Title: Adds to the beauty of Heritage Lucknow
Review: The clock tower is located near the Rumi Darwaza, somewhere between the Imambaras. It reflects a significant history of Mughal Era.

Name: Yashu94
Title: Just a clock tower
Review: It is a fine place which will be on the way to the imambara. There is a story behind the same which should be known!

Name: sanjivsony
Title: Every City time table
Review: Like other Historical place its a clock tower. Maintenance is good but not proper cleaning in the nearby of the tower.

Name: HOMPRS
Title: Stands tall but..
Review: This whole place and nearby well needs maintenance. Even people here are not willing to keep the place clean and throw garbage and spit anywhere. If maintained well, could be a much better place to sit and relax keeping in mind the broad location of the area nearby.

Name: Rohit RC
Title: One of the tallest clock towers
Review: The Husainabad Clock Tower is set amidst a picturesque background, near the Picture Gallery. It is commonly known as Ghantaghar and reflects Victorian and Gothic style designs. Gunmetal is used for building the clock parts. Its gigantic pendulum has a length of 14 feet and the dial of the clock is designed in the shape of a 12-petalled flower and bells around it.This 221 ft. high Clock Tower was built in 1881 to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, the first Lieutenant Governor of the United Province of Awadh.

Name: Babu P
Title: Said to be the tallest clock tower in India
Review: This clock tower is in the vicinity of Bada Imambara/Rumi gate and is not to be missed  on your visit to Lucknow. Its over 100 years old is a testimony to the architectural and building skills

Name: Raman G
Title: A historic place built by the British
Review: Based on the Big Ben. Has been recently renovated. The clock does not work. The place around is not too clean. But can do a visit. Walking distance from Bara Imambara. Walk through the Rumi Darwaza and you reach the clock tower. About 150 meters walk only

Name: mohd a
Title: BEUTY OF HUSSAINABAD CLOCK TOWER
Review: very nice place for family and childrens the atmosphere of this place is so good there are very beautiful lightings and very tasty fast food the clock tower was build in 1881 and it is highest clock tower clock in lucknow.

Name: StephanieO34
Title: Big Ben of Lucknow?
Review: Supposedly built in imitation of a British clock tower, to honour the arrival of a new British Resident. We could see no resemblance to Big Ben, despite the guide referring to it as such. Of passing interest.

Name: ashok_shrikhande
Title: Clock Tower (Ghanta Ghar)
Review: ucknow Clock Tower is located very near to the Rumi Darwaza. Built in 1881 by the British, this 67 m-high clock tower on the river Gomti is said to the tallest clock tower in India. The tower features European style artwork. The dial of this clock is shaped like a 12-petalled flower and has bells around it. Tourists while Lucknow Tour visit this famous clock tower which stands rising high in the sky. This is one of the most towering monuments in Lucknow.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Surprise
Review: The resemblance to Big Ben is intentional. Bit of a surprise. Gives presence to the area. Good photo opportunity.

Name: wing6rider
Title: We were impressed!
Review: This might be overwhelmed by the other attractions around but it is worth seeing and spending some time to admire.  YMMV

Name: Susej B
Title: Interesting !
Review: There is a art gallery to located here and the art enthusiasts may like to ponder through these old paintings.

Name: Justin J
Title: Historic place
Review: This Clock Tower was built by the British more than 100 years ago .. designed similar to the Big Ben London ... One of the tallest clock towers in India .. about 200 feet in height ... Hey good mix of Gothic and Victorian architecture... Located near Rumi Darwaza..

Name: UTKARSH PRATAP S
Title: Awesome architecture
Review: The clock tower which is a heritage site is a good place to visit specially in the evening. I enjoyed a lot.

Name: Rajani B
Title: A Very Tall 67 feet Clock Tower
Review: It was built in 1881 to commemorate the coming of first Governor of United Province of Awadh.  The clock tower is a land mark tower built in Gothic style.  The dial of the clock is petalled shaped and bells around. Great to watch a British era building.

Name: Abhishek S
Title: Good Place
Review: This place is very old but well maintained. Famous for its history. It has very old watch on a long tower surrounded with beautiful green Park.

Name: pinakin256
Title: Clock tower
Review: Its opp bada imambara . One can see from roadside there is also surrounding  public  garden were local people come for evening with family

Name: debjitsanyal
Title: CLOCK TOWER IN THE EVENING LOOKS BEAUTIFUL
Review: We stayed very near to clock tower, and visited it in a september evening. It was looking beautiful in the night, really pleasant to visit.

Name: JatinAmbani
Title: Husainabad clock tower near Rumi darwaza
Review: Constructed in year 1881 by Nawab Nasir-ud-din Haider to mark the arrival of Sir George Couper, 1st Lieutenant Governor of United Province of Avadh @ cost of Rs. 1.75 lakh. This might be the tallest clock tower in India Roskell Payne designed this structure of 67 meter high and it reflects Victorian and Gothic style designs. Gunmetal is used for building the clock parts. It’s gigantic pendulum has a length of 14 feet and the dial of the clock is designed in the shape of a 12-petalled flower and bells around it. Surrounding is neat with granite stone paving but there is no place to seat, relax & enjoy.

Name: YatriForever
Title: A tall clock tower !
Review: For a change, this attraction is not part of the Nawab/ Mughal legacy of Lucknow. This is a reminder of the British history. Sure it's tall and  seems well maintained, but nothing more than that as part of the history to know. If you are visiting the Imambaras, you might as well stop by to look up and take some snaps.

Name: Vibha R
Title: Beautiful Clock Tower!!
Review: It's a beautiful clock tower very close to the  Rumi Darwaza in Lucknow... it is a nice red colour.. which the guide says is like this since the time it was made... the brickwork is so beautiful that even after so many years it doesn't need any touching up !!

Name: Mahmud T
Title: Must see spot !!
Review: Red everywhere, You can see the whole area is made with red brick, a small lake which is surrounded red stairs and this lake is directly linked with Gomti River

Name: Ajjoo A
Title: An Evening at Clock Tower in Lucknow
Review: During our last visit to Lucknow , India , we have been Clock Tower area in the evening of August and got a pleasant surprise to see the giant clock of tower is working and looks amazing,  the clock was out of order for many decades .The Clock tower along with other place like Sat Khamba, Picture Gallery & Park is very well illuminated with lights. Hats off to the authorities for developing the area in to a clean and modern tourist place form old narrow and congested area.This area is a must see now for lovers of historical buildings and places.Historical facts beautifully crafted on pillars. The Tower was built by Nawab Nasiruddin Haider on the occasion of arrival of 1st Lt. Governor George Couper. Its Historical, beautiful and must see area.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Clock Tower
Review: Clock tower near Rumi Gate is very tall and beautiful. There is a clock in it that helps the people coming to see the time. It is also called the Ghantaghar of Lucknow.

Name: Vibhu S
Title: Husainabad Clock Tower
Review: This is developed by Britishers and this is call place Ghanta Ghar in Lucknow and very strong and high peak of tower

Name: Mohsin A
Title: Part of history
Review: Husainabad clock tower is among the tallest clock towers in India. It's near chota imambara and part of heritage zone in lucknow. Surrounding has become much better than before but can be further improved. Modelled in Big Ben its simple but important part of Lucknows history,culture and architecture. Deserves one visit.

Name: sid_ups
Title: Attached with Romi Gate
Review: This is a pillar type clock tower same as the Clock Tower of London and very close to Romi Darwaja. You can see this easily from the main road.

Name: Neighborhoodfoodie
Title: Ghanta Ghar
Review: must visit place knows as the ghanta ghar clock tower .build during nawabs duration showcases the architect

Name: Ikreatepassions
Title: A Historic Significance
Review: This place speaks about the history of Lucknow, standing 22 ft tall, this tower clock was used as a means of mass communication in older times. Built in the year 1881 it also marked the arrival of Sir George Cooper, the fist lieutenant governor of Avadh. It was built by Nawab Nasirudin Haider, and today its a sight of tourist attraction in Lucknow.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: A tower in old Lucknow
Review: This clock tower is situated near chowk in old Lucknow, it's a simple tower nothing special to visit,

Name: Seema H
Title: Beautiful Clock Tower
Review: The Husainabad Clock Tower is a landmark in Lucknow. It is 221ft tall and imposing monument built of gunmetal. It is the oldest Clock Tower in Lucknow .Located near the Imambara, it is a must see

Name: sun_abhay
Title: Oldest clock tower of Lucknow
Review: Now under maintenance, oldest clock tower of Lucknow, located near Rumi Darwaza, Imambada and Bhulbhulaiya .

Name: SomnathKhaskel
Title: The tower was built to indicate the arrival of the first Lieutenant Governor
Review: The Clock Tower construction was originally started in 1840 by Nawab Nasir-ud-Din Haider, but when the Nawab died the construction stopped at 4th storey. The rest of the construction was later renewed and the tower was completed in 1887. The architectural style and the material used to build the Husainabad Clock Tower, is an example of the excellence and finesse of the British architecture. The tower was built to indicate the arrival of the first Lieutenant Governor of United Province of Awadh, Sir George Cooper. The 221 feet tall clock tower is built of gunmetal by the Husainabad Endowment Trust. The material to build the clock tower was especially imported from Luigate Hill, London.

Name: Alok N
Title: CLOCK TOWER
Review: The Guide will tell you the History of the Clock Tower and some other interesting facts. Since it is on the way from Bara Imambara to Chota Imambara, it is easily accessible.

Name: lovetoootravel
Title: It's part of Lucknow's history
Review: This iconic clock from the British ruling days is in excellent condition.  Can be viewed from the ground or from the Terrace at the next door picture gallery.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: Being developed
Review: An imposing structure, it is currently being developed with  sit outs, cafes etc under construction.Will be a very good place to lounge around once fully developed.The clock tower it self is well preserved and looks imposing

Name: vinitasaraf2015
Title: Just a clock Tower
Review: Its a 18th century clock tower, nothing much. Saw it from the car itself. Nothing great.Very tall indeed

Name: Auscoach
Title: It's a clock?
Review: Clock towers are important in Indian towns this one was broken. They are building a park around it but good luck with keeping it clean. Colonial build of moderate interest

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Beautiful
Review: Do visit this place set amidst  immaculate garden  .No entrance to be paid .At spring time it was all flowers blooming and was worth the visit .

Name: Anuradha
Title: Peaceful
Review: A small peaceful Imambara, taking a round around the structure was very soothing. Must visit, if you are a history lover.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Mausoleum
Review: Constructed in white marble by Nawab of Awadh. Situated on Bank of gomti river.it is close to Sahara ganj mall

Name: Garry
Title: Nice place
Review: Beautiful place I love this place the sence of making it is very beautiful the small small arts on the wallls are very beautiful or fabulous really in my whole life this was my best experience in Lucknow

Name: FANOUT
Title: Bliss
Review: A visit on a Thursday evening lays out, for a visitor, a glimpse to the Ganga-Jamuni tahzeeb of Lucknow....spend some time here and observe to absorb....

Name: sunilagrawa111
Title: Beautiful
Review: The Imambara is located atPaltan Ghat on the banks of river Gomti, as a token of his devotion to Caliph Hazrat Ali, the husband of Fatima, the favourite daughter of Prophet Mohanmmed. It is supposedly a replica of his mausoleum at Najaf-e-Ashraf in Arabia. Hazrat Ali is also known as Shah-e-Najaf (the Lord of Najaf). The large dome of the Imambara is unlike the other domes which have a slender neck like drum at the base and are onion shaped.The imambara is surrounded by large beautiful park and is quite near to Botanical garden and Hazratganj. Do not miss to visit itShow less

Name: KhannaK491
Title: Nawabi tribute
Review: Bara Imamabara and Roomi Darwaza are ancient monuments lying in the heritage area of Lucknow.The roads outside it are also made of a different interlocking brick lending it an added old world charm.Tanga and camel rides are popular around the monument.Its a delight for photographers. I even did pre wedding photo shoot for a client here. The view if offers, the mosque, the Bhool bhulaaiya are a must watch .You are now asked to cover your head with a scarf (which are available there for free) and remove your shoes to enter the mosque area .Definitely recommended to visit it!!

Name: Adil Rashid
Title: great wall
Review: shah najaf imambara is a historiacl moment and ..bht he sunar ha or bht he baada hai so friend plz jaaye or enjoy kare lucknow ko

Name: Siddhartha Biswas
Title: Historical Site
Review: This is perhaps one of the lesser visited places (at least by tourists) in Lucknow, but it is definitely worth a visit. It does not have the grandeur of the Asifi Mosque but it is as significant in the history of India as any other monument. The history of the Imambara is easily available, what made the place even more special is the local lore that said this was one of the headquarters of the Sepoys during the mutiny of 1857. It has brilliant architecture and is worth looking into.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Fantastic Design
Review: This is quite beautiful made of design. Visiting this was worth. This is amazing place. Must visit place. Recommended to all of you.

Name: ashok_shrikhande
Title: shah najaf imambara
Review: Ghazi-ud-Din Haider built the Imambara Shah Najaf at a place called Paltan Ghat on the banks of river Gomti, as a token of his devotion to Caliph Hazrat Ali, the husband of Fatima, the favourite daughter of Prophet Mohanmmed. It is supposedly a replica of his mausoleum at Najaf-e-Ashraf in Arabia. Hazrat Ali is also known as Shah-e-Najaf (the Lord of Najaf). The large dome of the Imambara is characteristic, because it is so unlike the other domes which have a slender neck like drum at the base and are onion shaped.

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Different architecture disgin
Review: Very different architecture structure and has huge area.Inside hall different type and style of zhoomer.very good.

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Beautiful place at night
Review: Visited this place with a friend of mine around Maghreb ki Namaz and found this place very beautiful and peaceful. Chandeliers and lights were looking brilliant at night. High point was soothing sound of Azan from mosque outside this shrine.A must visit place while you are in Lucknow.

Name: kamal_innovaa
Title: Old and Historic monument
Review: People visit this place for worship. An old monument to visit one of  old places for historic importance.

Name: sun_abhay
Title: Architectural monument
Review: An old monument and good place to visit for people interested in old places of historic importance . A place of worship , very clean and peaceful .

Name: Makarand Pundalik
Title: excellent
Review: whenever i am in lucknow, i make a point to visit imambara. just awesome place to spend evening. worth visiting !!!!

Name: iamrawat
Title: Strictly average
Review: After visiting the bada and Chota imambara this monument doesn't excite you. It's a Muslim religious place of worship with a white some. Can be skipped.

Name: lovetoootravel
Title: Make sure you walk up the stairs to the top level!
Review: An amazing structure.  Quite plain inside with the real treat - climbing the steep steps and walking through the narrow passageways within the building to the upper three levels for views within the building and the Lucknow sky line.

Name: pompombionique
Title: Architecture
Review: Nice spot on the center of the city. Very nice architecture, gardens. A must see in the city. Historic.

Name: krazikams
Title: Nawabon ka Sheher - Lko
Review: One of the very popular tourist and heritage structure in Lucknow is  Shah Nazaf Imambara. Another towering structure with beautiful architecture offers a glimpse of rich culture, history and tradition of Mughal Period.

Name: ashoklko56
Title: LUCKNOW'S HERITAGE
Review: Shahnazaf Imambara is the biggest imambara of Lucknow. It is said to be constructed as a relief to famine, so that people can get food. It is said that the famous biriyani of Lko was invented here. For fast preparation of food the meat and rice was put together for cooking and thus the biriyani was made. The tempting smell attracted to the king and this became the famous dish. This historical building hosts the famous Bhulbhulaiya also.

Name: fahzilmahfuz
Title: "Nawabon ki city"

Review: Visited Shah najaf imambara last week during Lucknow visit.. it is located near the saharaganj mall in Hazratganj and is another famous place to visit when in Lucknow.. it is a white domed structure and is situated in the banks of river Gomti.. It is open from 9:00 to 5:00 n there are no entry fees to visit this place.. it'll take arnd an hour to see this place completely.. This monument was made by Nawab Ghazi-ud-din Harder and serves as him own mausoleum.. you can see the tombs of the Nawab and his wives in gold and silver and the designs are really beautiful.. Try to visit this place also once along with the famous bada imambara and chota imambara.. Along with this you. An also visit the saharaganj mall and relax n unwind as it's very close.. the mall is also big with lot of brands for shopping n a big food court..

Name: amiitkt

My advice would be to couple your trip to saharaganj mall with this imambara for this is located just at the edge of saharaganj mall. This is a good place to sit and relax with peace.

Name: Atif M
Title: beautiful historical monument

Name: scarfman
Title: A couryards huge mosque with beautiful
Review: This mausoleum complex in the centre of Lucknow is a pilgrimage destination for many locals visiting the tomb of a former ruler. Entry is through a narrow archway into a beautiful large courtyard filled with flowers and a central lawn. Further on is the mausoleum  itself (shoes and socks off) which contains a labyrinth of small passageways as well as the tomb itself.. Outside and adjacent is the mosque which is unfortunately off-limits to non-Muslims. If you're tombed-out people-watching here is great.

Review: This is a small mosque and tomb complex with some rather unusual chandeliers and paintings and odds and ends of fascinating stuff. It's a pleasant and interesting out if the way place, but a good choice to follow an early morning visit to the Botanical Gardens up the road as you can walk here in 10 mi Utes from the gardens.

They charge a nominal fee of 50 INR for Entry and you also have the option of a guided tour for another 200 INR per person.

Constructed on the bank of the river Gomati, this architectural marvel is designed in the shape of a dome. The central dome is decorated with passages on its sides and on the birthday of Hazrat Ali. You can avoid this Place to visit.Do Visit Bara and chhota Imambara.

It is a replica of Hazrat Ali's tomb in Najaf in Iran and this is why it is called Shahnajaf. It is a beautiful domed building and has memorabilia and photographs from the days of the nawabs. It is a tranquil and beautiful building.

So it mix of new and old culture here, You will be visiting the mall and some foot away to to this heritage, there is park in the compound  of it, but not well maintained , there is some residential house also available with it , some family are living there form old time, you can visit the imambara from inside and can have feel of old time

Name: ThyUrbanMonk
Title: A Place to introspect from your own perception
Review: You will like the architecture,but depends upon the way you look upon the monuments.It Includes :i) Asafi Imambaraii)Rumi Darwaza on the roadsideiii)Bhool Bhulayiya ( labyrinth )iv)Jama Masjidv)Bauli Building( security surveillance )Loving the old walls and serene architecture,you will meet the nawab's grave in Imambara with old photographs hung on the wall.State Govt. is not taking much care to maintain to inner structures or it may be the responsibility of the private boards but don't think much of it,just look at the walls,roam around.Quickly catch up to the labyrinth to play and find around each other,maybe you'll get hide and seek thing to do too.Guides are available there,I will recommend to have guide for first time only.The roof is must to go,do go there and sit calmly.On returning,do visit the bauli and drink coconut water outside while moving towards parking.

Name: KGB777
Title: Worth a quick visit
Review: Not as impressive as Bara Imambara, but still worth a visit. 30 minutes is more than enough to get a feel for the place.

Name: Debarati D
Title: A beautiful tribute
Review: Shah Najaf Imambara may not be as grand as the other two Imambaras in Lucknow – the Asafi or Bara Imambara and the Hussainabad or Chota Imambara, nevertheless it transports you to a world which reflects the eclectic past of Lucknow. Fewer tourists being aware of the place, it is an island of serenity just next to the typical trappings of the modern world – chaotic traffic and a  huge mall.In 1816, the Nawab of Awadh Ghazi-ud-Din Haider built Shah Najaf Imambara at a place called Paltan Ghat on the banks of river Gomti, as a token of his devotion to Caliph Hazrat Ali, the husband of Fatima, the favourite daughter of Prophet Mohammed. The white domed structure is said to be a replica of Hazrat Ali’s mausoleum at the city of Najaf in modern Iraq. The rear of the Imambara which faces the river.Shah Najaf Imambara is also called Karbala, because within its main hall lie the mortal remains of its builder, Ghazi-ud-Din Haider, who wished to be buried here. It also contains the graves of his wives, Mubarak Mahal (a European), Sarfaraz Mahal and Mumtaz Mahal . Ghazi-ud-din Haider’s silver tomb is flanked by the tombs of his wives on either side and the golden tomb is that of Mubarak Mahal.The hall is beautifully decorated with chandeliers and a lot of memorabilia relating to the Nawabi era. You can also see the ‘ tazia’s - intricate designs of wood, bamboo and silver paper, which are carried during the celebrations of Muharam. Enjoy a leisurely stroll in its passages which offer a great view of the Gomti river. There are no designated guides unlike Bara Imambara. One of the caretakers showed us around. He informed  us that the Shah Najaf Imambara presents a spectacular view when it is decorated and illuminated on important occasions. A nice place to enjoy some moments of tranquility.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: One of the oldest & very good university
Review: Lucknow University (LU) is one of the oldest universities, it is a birth place of many Former President Of India, governors of various Indian States and acclaimed poets, Scholars and lyricists & political leaders of UP in state and national politics. Huge campus and large number of courses.Lucknow University (LU) is a government owned Indian research university based in Lucknow. LU is organised into more than 146 colleges, and institutes, located throughout the city and other surrounding areas. It was affiliated to UGC in the year 1921. LU has improved its facilities over the years and has managed to provide a number of online facilities like getting latest-notification, filling up of admission forms available to students online.The campus is known as Canning Collage, the University also provides residential facilities to teachers, students and non-teaching staff.The following three Colleges provided the nucleus for the establishment of the University: •	The King George's Medical College. (Now Known as King George's Medical University)•	The Canning College.•	The Isabella Thoburn College.The mission of the University is, to be a University driven by values enriched with diverse cultures, to promote economic, social and spiritual advancement for the society.

Name: Durgesh K
Title: ..::Lucknow University::.. The Proud of Awadh
Review: The idea of starting a University at Lucknow was first mooted by Raja Sir Mohammad Ali Mohammad Khan, Khan Bahadur, K.C.I.E. of Mahmudabad, who contributed an article to the columns of "The Pioneer'' urging the foundation of a University at Lucknow. A little later Sir Harcourt Butler, K.C.S.I., K.C.I.E, was appointed Lieutenant-Governor of the United Provinces, and his well-known interest in all matters under his jurisdiction, specially in matters educational, gave fresh life and vigour to the proposal. The first step to bring the University into being was taken when a General Committee of educationists and persons interested in university education appointed for the purpose, met in conference at Government House, Lucknow, on November, 10, 1919. At this meeting Sir Harcourt Butler, who was in the chair, outlined the proposed scheme for the new university.A discussion followed, and it was resolved that Lucknow University should be a Unitary, Teaching, and Residential University of the kind recommended by the Calcutta University Mission, 1919, and should consist of Faculties of Arts, including Oriental Studies, Science, Medicine, Law, etc. A number of other resolutions was also passed and six sub-committees were formed, five of them to consider questions connected with the University and one to consider the arrangements for providing Intermediate Education. These sub-committees met during the months of November and December, 1919, and January, 1920; and the reports of their meetings were laid before a second Conference of the General Committee at Lucknow on January 26, 1920; their proceedings were considered and discussed, and the reports of five of the sub-committees were, subject to certain amendments, confirmed. The question of incorporation of the Medical College in the University, however, was for the time being left open for expression of opinion. At the close of the Conference donations of one lakh each from the Raja of Mahmudabad and Jahangirabad were announced.The resolutions of the first Conference together with the recommendations of the sub-committees as confirmed at the second Conference were laid before a meeting of the Allahabad University on March 12, 1920, and it was decided to appoint a sub-committee to consider them and report to the Senate. The report of the sub-committee was considered at an extraordinary meeting of the Senate on August 7, 1920, at which the Chancellor presided, and the scheme was generally approved. In the meantime the difficulty of incorporating the Medical College in the University had been removed. During the month of April 1920, Mr. C.F. de la Fosse, the then Director of Public Instruction, United Provinces, drew up a Draft Bill for the establishment of the Lucknow University which was introduced in the Legislative Council on August 12, 1920. It was then referred to a Select Committee which suggested a number of amendments, the most important being the liberalising of the constitution of the various University bodies and the inclusion of a Faculty of Commerce; this Bill, in an amended form, was passed by the Council on October 8, 1920. The Lucknow University Act, No. V of 1920, received the assent of the Lieutenant-Governor on November 1, and of the Governor-General on November 25, 1920.The Court of the University was constituted in March, 1921, and the first meeting of the Court was held on March 21, 1921, at which the Chancellor presided. The other University authorities such as the Executive Council, the Academic Council, and Faculties came into existence in August and September, 1921. Other Committees and Boards, both statutory and otherwise, were constituted in course of time. On July 17, 1921, the University undertook teaching -- both formal and informal. Teaching in the Faculties of Arts, Science, Commerce, and Law was being done in the Canning College and teaching in the Faculty of Medicine in the King George's Medical College and Hospital. The Canning College was handed over to the University on July 1, 1922, although previous to this date the buildings, equipment, staff, etc., belonging to the Canning College had been ungrudgingly placed at the disposal of the University for the purposes of teaching and residence. The King George's Medical College and the King George's Hospital were transferred by the Government to the University on the March 1, 1921. The following three Colleges provided the nucleus for the establishment of the University: The King George's Medical College. (Now Known as King George's Medical University)The Canning College.The Isabella Thoburn College.This was a rich inheritance for the new-born University in 1920, both materially and intellectually, and it brought with it also the richest of all heritages "a fine tradition of some fifty-five years in the case of the Canning College and some nine years in the case of the King George's Medical College." To this the generous taluqdars of Oudh added an endowment of nearly thirty lakhs. The support from Sir Harcourt Butler's Government was strong and hearty. Since then the Government of the United Provinces has annually contributed a substantial share towards the maintenance of the University.

Title: A must see place in Lucknow

They are very discipline and punctual in time. Also visit the Library and book stall and appreciate the surrounding gardens.I think what even i say is very little, The monks are very dedicated and doing a great work, They have a 400 beds super- specialty hospital  near to Math.

Review: When you get a Ramakrishna Matha and Mission right opposite your hotel, you get blessings as bonus. The Lucknow math is serene and spaciously constructed. Didn't get time to attend the evening aarati, but felt the same vibes of positivity and divine bliss right after walking in!

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Visit to Ramakrishna Math
Review: This Math is worth seeing by the visitors of all the religion and nationality. It is situated in the heart of the city.

Name: Alok N

Review: It is situated little out of place but once you reach the Math, the feeling of peace in the environment is prevalent. Nothing about Lucknawi culture and if one does not have time then nothing is missed.

Name: sujatapant
Title: tranquil place
Review: From the chaos of outside,enter the peaceful environ of this spiritual,religous,charitable,educational ,medical institute.Amidst its expansive campus is the temple,a meditative space,a school run for the poor students,a kitchen where food is cooked and poor families are fed .a yog center open to all,bhajan and religous activity also.a library which has a good collection of books . a hospital is also run by the math as part of its charitable activities .

Name: ASTHA G
Title: Nice Place
Review: This is a bit si crowded place in the city. Accessible from all corners and is a silent place. Photography is not allowed inside and you have to remain silent.

Name: jaya u
Title: Sat Chit Ananda.
Review: If one has an attitude of a serious search for God, this place is a must visit. The quietude and peace at the Math is something one cannot express in words, one has to experience it to realise that. This place became my daily escape and my sanctuary. One whos consciousness is directed inwards, for whom things of the material world are of less significance will only be able to fully understand and experience this place. Leave your conceptual burdens behind before entering the math and experience ultimate bliss.

Name: Nivesh A
Title: Serene!!!
Review: It is a simple building..Nothing much inside ..Just a big hall for meditation and landscape outside. In totality it is a so so place

Name: ASTHA G
Title: A peaceful Place !!
Review: Located in the residential area this is a peaceful place to visit. It is never crowded but is a beautiful and spacious place. you are not allowed to make noice here. Just go and enjoy the beauty !!

Name: journey2016
Title: OLDEST MATH IN LUCKNOW
Review: ramakrishna math which is in niralanagar near IT crossing lucknow. ramakrishna math is in under of math's trust they keep and maintain all of its assets.. one thing i have to also mention here that vivekanad policlinic medical sciences is also under in math's trust.earlier i had gone here that time there was a huge crowd and ramkrishna paramhan's memorable antiques were kept for public.this is fabulous building.

Name: Uday Kumar H
Title: Ramakrishna Math & Mission- Lucknow
Review: After visiting Vivekananda Ashram, Shyamla Tal and Advaita Ashram, Mayawati for six days, we went to Ramakrishna Math & Mission- Lucknow. Duly taking into account the local circumstances and demands of public need, the activities of the Sevashrama have been mostly directed towards medical and health sectors, for giving relief to the ailing and the sick. This mission has been implemented does through Vivekananda Polyclinic which is a multi-facility hospital. The polyclinic fulfils the public needs by way of Rural Health Programmes carried on in the adjoining villages. More and more facilities are getting added to the polyclinic.The multifarious activities of the Math includes library, daily worship and bhajans, fortnightly Ramnam and Shyamnam, Sankirtans, and weekly religious discourses and lectures, Celebration of the birthdays of Sri Ramakrishna, Holy Mother Sri Sarada Devi, Swami Vivekananda and other religious prophets, in addition to Durga Puja and other festivals. The Math various cultural programmes, and personality development and yoga classes for students. Furthermore, the Math organises free coaching centre for 100 slum children, daily distribution of milk and tiffin to 100 poor children. The Math is instrumental in the expansion of cultural, religious and spiritual activities according to the universal principles propounded by Sri Ramakrishna, Holy Mother Sarada Devi and Swami Vivekananda and exemplified by their divine lives. Photography is prohibited inside the Math. But before knowing that, we took two photos. All contact information is available in the website. But I am furnishing them for the convenience of Tripadvisor fellow members.Address: Ramakrishna Math, Nirala Nagar, Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh  226020Phone: 0522-2787191 & 0522-2787143Telefax: 0522-2787168Email: lucknow@rkmm.org, rkml@ramakrishnalucknow.orgWebsites: www.ramakrishnalucknow.org, www.rkml.org
