Name: Harsh V
Title: masti time
Review: i love to visit water park and amusemant park to chill out with my friends i visited blue world in kanpur dream world in banthra but amrapali is quite go i was not indoor but the rides are good i was planning to visit again this summer with my friends

Name: Archana R
Title: Bad experience
Review: Too bad !!!! Water was not good at all pools were not maintained . hygiene cautious people may not visit

Name: Adil Rashid
Title: full on masti
Review: so guys plz go and enjoy is too much masti and water dance and mamy more soo plz go and feeling awes

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Scenic Surrounding
Review: I went to Amrapali Water Fun Park. It is a perfect Weekend Getaway as Anandi Water Fun Park is a Resort-cum-club spread over 15 acres of lush green lawns with serene and scenic surroundings. Pollution free, privacy, and a subliminal experience is promised at the premises of Anandi Water Fun Park. It is great place to go.

Name: aks19682003
Title: Best place for enjoyment
Review: You can enjoy life in summer at this place. Great water game and rides are available their. Nice lunch included with package.

Name: Aman K
Title: Must Visit
Review: You must definitely Visit amrapali water fun park once. This is a great place to have fun with your family and friends. There are lots of water rides and all are amazing.

Name: rockzzM77
Title: Fun with friends
Review: Nice water park in Lucknow, i went here with my friends, we enjoyed a lot here, many water rides available here.

Name: saini74
Title: Water Games
Review: Enjoy a hot day afternoon in water park and can be spend time with family. good facility of water games

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Visit to Amrapali Water Fun Park
Review: The Park is worth visiting with family. It is quite in proximity with Lucknow people visiting Lucknow must enjoy a visit to the Park.

Name: Ronak S
Title: Good fun
Review: Good water part with lot many activities to do. specially for kids. We had nice time with family and friends. Entry fee is bit steep at Rs 800, but fun for full day

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Nice place for fun loving people
Review: We went at this water park in November 2015 last time. Very nice place with all the facilities. Must go and enjoy.

Name: Manvendra77
Title: Nice water Park
Review: Last time i went this water park with my friends at one on friend's birthday, it is nice water park,

Name: uarvashityagi21
Title: Amazing with friendsd
Review: I had lot of fun . it is my friends birthdayparty amazing food so beautiful cake a kind of hanghout

Name: Deepak Nadvanshi
Title: Waste of money
Review: Waste of money 800/- entry fee + 40 rs. Packing+ 30 locker+ 60 costume.. 3rd class food and.. halwa is like just suji was boiled in water.. water was very dirty, no swings ( which was committed at the time of entry)

Name: Deepikatandon
Title: Nice Place
Review: It as nice place to enjoy of summer. A good hangout for kids on holidays. They also offer food through their restaurant at extra payment.

Name: Kanhaiya L
Title: Birthday celebration of our little champ.
Review: It as nice place to enjoy of summer, we got too much fun at Amrapaali Water Park. you should take a family package because, I got complete entertainment at watermark as like Food and various type of Hammocks.some Hammocks are very thrill.

Name: Poseidon_4991
Title: Fun place
Review: It's a decent water park. A good hangout for kids on hlidays ad weekends. Worth a visit. The staff were also very visible and proper safety measures was also ensured.

Name: ramsingh82838
Title: Good Place for Kids
Review: This is a water fun park..where kids can chill out. So be sure to check in here if you are in Lucknow. Lucknowites like it here.

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Oldest Water Park
Review: I was there long back . Just a regular water park with some good water slides. Situated in the outskirts of Lucknow. A good place to spend some family time with kids. They also book this place for function party and other stuffs. There are also some normal joy ride with the water rides as well. Overall satisfactory experience and a good place to go in summers.

Name: DrNavneetRanjan
Title: Entertaining place
Review: I have been there with my friends and family. Its really nice place away from Citi pollution in the greenery of mango trees. The water park has almost all rides and swings. They also offer food through their restaurant at extra payment. Worth yo there once with family.

Name: Prosico
Title: An Average Place To Go With Family
Review: Hi my name is Pranav. I visited this place last month, it was a good experience. I been there with my friends there are nearly three pools in which two is for adults and one is for childrens. It is an awesome place for birthday celebrations or anniversary or any group celebrations. But there are nearly seven rides and a rain dancing place in the place and two huge parks but there are insects and a junk-yard of amrapali and from seven rides there are only nearly three or four rides which works. So, for family enjoyment an excellent place but for solo or with an friend not good. Thanks Pranav

Name: satyaprakash375
Title: Fun Park
Review: We are visited in October 14 along with my friends, amrapali water park is realy good park for fun with lost of slide.

Name: foodieebyheart
Title: Charm is fading
Review: Amrapali is still a good place to beat the heat, Situated in peaceful part of lucknow, its becoming obsolete, Needs modification!

Name: nuts_medico
Title: nice water park to beat the heat..
Review: its been much time since i visited this park, but i remember it as a fun water park to beat the heat with enough of rides and waves..cant say the present situation..

Name: Sanyashree
Title: Summer relief
Review: A good place to spend a weekend in summer. The rides are nice and the resort has proper facilities for staying. A good place to visit with your family or in large groups.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: water park
Review: situated at Malihabad mango growing place, a good place all water park lovers, specially children, there is provision for holding corporate meeting with dinning facility

Name: nitesh911
Title: An average water park
Review: In the modern times when Amusement Parks are the better deal, water-parks alone don't hold too much attraction in India. It is very far from the main city. There are few rides like merry-go-round, roller coaster, etc. The main attraction is the water park slides which have decent length. If you are a family person having a day's time and want to take your kids for an enjoyable experience then I will recommend you this place. However tourists should look for other attractions in Lucknow.Visiting hours- 9am to 11pm.What to bring- Swimwear

Name: Tanvi
Title: Peaceful place
Review: It is one of the places where you feel positive vibes and peacefulness in Lucknow . Spent some quality time with my family here .

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Nice place for visit
Review: Very nice place for visit with family. There was many trees in park. You may visit with food from home and enjoy lunch there. There was different swings for kids.

Name: Niraj K
Title: Ideal for Summer Evenings
Review: A nice place for spending evenings in hot summer. Attraction for kids to enjoy the Pedal Boat ride in an arificial river.Even you can enjoy your evening time here in cool breeze.

Name: Nabeel N
Title: Calm and peaceful
Review: Very nice place to visit with family. Spent a day with family there and it comes out to be peaceful and fun. Really good tress everywhere. You can take your home food there. Perfect for family outing.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Nice place
Review: It's the most old and popular park in Lucknow, great place to spend a entire day with your family, you better get your food stuff with you, they have it there but a bit over priced. They also have parking facility.Have Fun!

Name: Manas R
Title: Common park
Review: A good place when you are with your friends but don't expect some extraordinary experience here. Many other places are there in Lucknow to explore when you come here for few days.

Name: 592abck
Title: Best place here
Review: Best place here in Lucknow to spend time with everyone. Clean place, ample parking and peaceful environment

Name: nirmalsrivastava1000
Title: best park in lucknow
Review: This is seriously one of the best park in lucknow with all its attraction like the roller-coaster , swinging boat and the big water slide though i think the slide has being closed now , but still it is on of the best park .It even has a big park to play .A part place to bond with family

Name: Inspiration821481
Title: Great place to hangout with kids
Review: There is literally ample space for the kids to roam and play by themselves, but fr me its that dragon boat swing makes my day...

Name: Amit M
Title: Remebrance of my childhood days
Review: I used to visit this park when I was a school going child. Despite being one of the oldest park of Lucknow; it is still maintained. Becomes bit crowdy with children in the evening. Visited this place again in Apr'18 during my visit to Lucknow for remembrance of my childhood days

Name: Niya1315
Title: Children Park
Review: There is another park adjacent to it, which is called Hathi Park. This park is little more greener than Hathi Park.Gautam Buddha Park becomes crowded during weekends. Nice place to go with family and friends.

Name: Robert G
Title: How parks would look if designed by someone who hated children.
Review: Nothing works, everything is rusted, the lake looks like it is a sewer and there are transvestites wandering around asking for money.Thank goodness the Buddha has already achieved enlightenment so he is spared another reincarnation and the possibility of having to visit his park.Avoid at all costs.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Popular Park
Review: From childhood I am going here. This park is quite fame in lucknow. A large number of people come here to enjoy. I love to go here. Must visit place for everyone.

Name: AAA
Title: Impressive
Review: Must visit place of lucknow. Gautam Buddha park is quite green and beautiful all around. There is a fascination in the park. There is a lot to do fun.

Name: Hitesh Rathore
Title: A community park
Review: This Gautam Buddha park is one of the attractions of Lucknow,located on the verge of the city was built 30 years ago. It's a perfect half a day out with family with children rides boats lawns and other facilities to hang around.

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Visit to Gautam Budha Park, Lucknow
Review: This  place is worth visiting by the visitors of any age. It is situated in the heart of the city and can be easily accessed.The natural scenes arequite impressive

Name: Aman K
Title: Best park for people of all ages
Review: One of my favorite parks. It's very popular park. There is so much fun for every age of people. There is a lot of interest here especially for children. Very nice place to go with your family.

Name: Vibhu S
Title: Oldest Park in Lucknow
Review: This is place of Gautam Buddha Park in Lucknow nearest of College and there was different type of Hammock

Name: msadiqsalman
Title: A Must visit place for childrens
Review: The park is very famous for its swings and boating. There is a canteen also , although not very good. The ticket is quiet cheap and the toy train is also very attractive among children.

Name: saini74
Title: Walk on Greenish
Review: good space with greenish area and cleaness. Good place to spend quality time with childrens in cool evening only, the ticket fare also very less, playarea is nice, kids love it

Name: rachvinod
Title: good garden
Review: This is quite a good green open space for people to enjoy long walks and children to play around happily.

Name: BantakalDotCom
Title: Children's or Kids Park in just 6km from Lucknow Railway station,
Review: This park is around 6km away from railway station. It's having children's play area, walking track and seats to sit and relax for some time. Entry to this park is Rs 5 and the perfect time to visit this park is around evening. This park is very easy to find as it's attached to the main road. Park opens at 7am and closes at 9 pm. Do not forget: If you found this review helpful, please click THANK below.

Name: Shruti_Poki
Title: Recreation park for family outings
Review: Famous among children and families for evening recreational outing. Rides, Boating and eateries make this a budget accessible place for all. fun day activity place.

Name: kc j
Title: A good park for children
Review: This is a nice park with a good statue of Gautama Budha.  It has a number of rides and swings for kids. In fact it has a lot of amusement for the children. It is well kept.The boating facility is ok. The day we went it was not operating.

Name: Kakoli C
Title: Can be avoided
Review: This place and adjacent Kansiram Smarak are grand structures constructed with pink colored rock. These huge structures are completely made of rock and become so hot it's difficult to go ear it during summer. Avoidable.

Name: Makarand Pundalik
Title: very good
Review: quite well maintained place. better to go in evening or early morning if you are visiting in summer.

Name: Ronak J
Title: Good place
Review: This place give me the soothing and calming effect everytime I visit just a fantastic experience and memories here

Name: Ronak S
Title: another beauty
Review: Lucknow has some of the best parks in town. The Gautam buddha park is huge and very peaceful. Good place to spend time with family on weekend evening

Name: sujatapant
Title: nice place
Review: this is an old park built on the river banks of the Gomti river.it is peaceful till the crowds come in .it has places to sit,relax,boating .could do with some better upkeep.

Name: SKBhatiya
Title: worth a visit
Review: My childhood memories are relived by visiting this park almost after 24 years, it has been well kept and is much better now.a good place to spend half a day or an entire evening with family and children. Children will enjoy here

Name: sunilagrawa111
Title: An old park
Review: The park was built about 40 years back on the bank of  river Gomti with pedal boat  facility.It was an good attraction till 20 years ago but gradually lost its attraction.It is not very well maintained and some new attractions should be added to repopulate it. Just time pass place

Name: shalinisharma
Title: Best place to hangout in evening
Review: If you are looking for a peaceful place to spend your evenings, do visit this place..With and amazing view of gomti nadi and beautiful breeze you are surely going to come back. Plus the lighting on the gomti bridge makes the view spectacular.

Name: Nivesh A
Title: An old attraction
Review: It is just an old attraction. Nowadays it does not have anything interesting. Not many people go here as there are better places inlucknow to visit... in terms of parks

Name: Vijaypsingh81
Title: Excellent Park, nicely maintained.
Review: Small but very beautiful Park in Lucknow.one can visit the place in the evening in Park lighting.It has got very nice boating.overall ambience is good in this park.

Name: NayanKothari
Title: Good place
Review: A huge garden nicely maintained and with nice monuments. Good place for evening or early morning walk.

Name: nik_0107
Title: Well Kept
Review: Well maintained, great to visit during evening. Right next to the river bridge and offer great photo shots.

Name: Arpitgupta25
Title: Evening place
Review: An ordinary park with boating and lots of food shops and park struture is good beside gomti river ..

Name: travellerasr1407
Title: One can miss
Review: An ordinary park with buddha statue, needs good maintaince, dusbins were heaped full and was not cleaned for long

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: old and beautiful
Review: while the city has a lot of parks now, this old park still have its own place. It is very famous among locals for evening outing with children.

Name: Romil M
Title: nice
Review: its a nice place and very calm and relaxing.. u will enjoy it if u r a believer must visit if in that area

Name: manoj k
Title: Good park visit for Pcnic
Review: one can visit this park with young children . young enjoy this park playing. a picnic can planed in winter specially on a sunny day. Nice Park

Name: chetan1586
Title: Nirvana
Review: Buddha park is one of the few attractions in lucknow where once can go to find peace. Another attraction in the park is the boat ride

Name: nitu_gupta_in
Title: good park !
Review: plan trip with kids. enjoy boatride in the shallow artificial stream flowing around. The park is near to other parks (lemon), so enjoy that area

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: outing
Review: A place to relax in busy chowk area. Though approach road from all corners are busy and congested. A good place for taking children to stroll and outing

Name: Taz_Bh
Title: It can open any time and close any time.
Review: The park is no doubt huge and beautiful. But the gates for some reason remain closed and some times open at very weird timings.We happened to notice this as we stayed quite close to the place and wanted to visit the same but could not manage an entry cz of the constant closure. The disputed statues are however humongous and well visible from outside as well.

Name: Avadh B
Title: Very Beautiful
Review: I went to this park with lot of hesitation but it is really beautiful. The elephants sculptures are really huge and made with awesome and sharp work with no scope of mistake.

Name: mountaincharm
Title: Little natural world in the heart of city. ..
Review: Although situated between the crowded part of city, but it is a little natural world to please you when you are tired. In front there is busy city road, and behind is river gomti.  Size is few hundred meters. Park is split into two part green park and ride portion.           Green Park comprise of small canal system in which boating by paddle boat is done, and around that a walk way is made. There are two artificial mountain shaped bumps.  And one artificial island.            Ride portion was once a attractive portion but now no fun. Canteen is also there but good quality is average.

Name: Pratibha C
Title: Good place for kids to enjoy
Review: Buddha Park is a nice mid size park for kids to have fun around  and enjoy few swings. Food outside the park is available.Boating facility is also available.

Name: mountaincharm
Title: Small Fun park
Review: 300 *150 meter in dimension, side to a road, 4 meter wide 200 meter long loop canal for boating and two mountain shape artificial bumps, attached is a jhula park having 3-4 rides, snacks coffe south indian food available but not good,

Name: Parth101
Title: Palace in grand complex
Review: Kaiserbagh Palace is built in 1850 in grand complex. It was awesome palace. Well maintained property. There was beautiful garden too.

Name: BlrTravR
Title: Under renovation
Review: In the city centre of Lucknow, beautiful, huge palace and an annexe which is being renovated into a museum apparently.

Name: 592abck
Title: Experience old Lucknow
Review: This place gives you a feeling of how lucknow used to be. Although the city has lost its charm but still..

Name: Nandana1
Title: Beautiful Nawab Palace
Review: Very beautifull palace of nawab. Now this building is used for many purposes. There is two statues of Maharajas. Very nice historical building.

Name: Shonali79
Title: Palace of the last Nawab of Awadh
Review: Its said even the ruins of a palace tell about its grandeur during its heydays!This huge palace or rather haveli, used to be the abode of the last Nawab of Awadh, Wajid Ali Shah. Now, in a ramshackle condition due to negligence of the authorities concerned. It still bears memories of the bygone times in its intricate Persian architecture. I wonder why this palace has not been maintained well despite its heritage value. This goes for so many other places of historical significance.I don't mind paying an appropriate entry fee if it goes into maintaining the property, which forms an integral part of Lucknow's history.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Historical and Memorable
Review: Kaiserbagh is very old palace. This is a historical place. This building has become very old because of this it is broken from many places. Building needs maintenance. However visiting here once is made.

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Nice Old Architechure
Review: It is another example of Pre mugalian architecture. Nice old building.  is a complex in the city of Lucknow, located in the Awadh region of India. It was built by Wajid Ali Shah (1847-1856), the last Nawab of Awadh

Name: Pallavi S
Title: Experience the lost grandeur of a bygone era
Review: This used to be the royal quarters of the erstwhile nawab of Lucknow. It is now just a shadow of its glorious past, that tells tales of a bygone ear, lost forever. Most of the complex is run down and decrepit but there are still a few gems that you can see.

Name: Atif M
Title: beautiful old building
Review: beautiful old building, classic example of persian architecture. now used for functions. in the old city. charming. needs more care

Name: travellerasr1407
Title: Nice Palace
Review: One must visit to know the legacy of Lucknow, The palace is well maintained and also the area is neat and clean

Name: Virus King
Title: Very Interesting place to visit in Lucknow
Review: Indira Gandhi Planetarium or India Gandhi Nakshatrashala is a famous planetarium in Lucknow, which displays interesting items.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Saturn shaped
Review: It has state of the art projection system. Very small fees. Fountains , multiple shows - attractions here.

Name: durham05
Title: Impressive building
Review: This is an impressive building design, made to imitate the planet Saturn, but showings do not start until 1pm and run hourly through the afternoon. Sadly I was too early to see a show.

Name: niya27
Title: Awesome building
Review: The building of the Indira Gandhi planetarium is having a shape of Planet Saturn. The ticket is very cheap, just 25 Rs for a show. Both Hindi and English shows are played there.

Name: aarkpandey
Title: Planets and satellites
Review: It was nice to visit Indira Gandhi Planetarium at lucknow with my grand kids. They gathered knowledge about our scientists like Aryabhatt, Varahamihir etc. along with ISRO, PSLVs, GSLVs and various Indian satellites which were depicted in a circular gallery before the main entrance.During the show, brief description and positioning of various planets with their changing position in different seasons were well explained. Surroundings are also well maintained.

Name: kushBans
Title: Try it out !!
Review: A good visit for the people who are really into the astronomy. Bulk of information and nice views can be seen.

Name: 592abck
Title: Study science
Review: This place is good for kids who wants to study planets and stars. Also, there is a small cafeteria here.

Name: Hedonist_Surya
Title: Nice place for young learners.
Review: Various helpful and knowledge gaining stuffs are availible here at the display section which mostly attracts kids.The best part of whole was the laydown 360° space tour. but specify your choice english one is better.

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Best one
Review: Indira Gandhi Planetarium is the best Planetarium in the entire Uttar Pradesh. The only one which I have visited.

Name: Aloy M
Title: A Celestial Experience Descaled!
Review: The visit is limited to the Space show only, which is actually very enlightening and good. The institution is poorly maintained and very less time is allowed to observe the exhibits that are displayed in the outer waiting room. The behavior of the accessory staff is very poor and totally non co operative.

Name: umesh_12
Title: Learning Centre
Review: Any body can visit the place......Spend 2-3 hours with children...My children enjoyed very well......you can feel that you are in space...

Name: Nivesh A
Title: Very interesting
Review: Very interesting building from outside.Building looks like planet sapturn from outside but inside it has got regular shows of planetarium which are there in all the planetariums.Quite Boring actually

Name: lotusdiamond
Title: Story of Galaxy !!
Review: The story of universe is depicted in very nice way. Very good place for young children to understand the story of our Galaxy. Comfortable seats and well maintained area.

Name: travellerasr1407
Title: I loved this Planetarium
Review: Though it may not be very neat and clean but I loved the presentation and seating arrangements, thanks

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: Good for understanding universe.
Review: This place many be good options with growing age children have a lot of question in their mind about planet and universe. This is a good place to visit.

Name: Nishant K
Title: good
Review: experiences on every visit different ,,,looks like its getting upgrade from the sky above every night

Name: Arpit141
Title: Great experience
Review: The Planetarium is in unique Saturn shape with visible five rings. The diameter of the Planetarium is about 21 meter and it rests on a platform, especially designed to provide an idea of crater formation of celestial bodies.Overall a great experience to visit this place

Name: manoj k
Title: worth for school going Kids
Review: it is very interesting for school going kids. they can learn a lot. demo can be seen by them about our  solar system

Name: Shivanshu74
Title: Worth the Experience
Review: Have never seen such a time 3-D presentation of our universe. Dont go  by the looks of the place i seems a little out dated however once you are in you will be surprised especially the projector which makes the experience of our universe too good. You will feel like you have been sent into outer space.I travelled in August 2014 however i dont have option to select it so mentioned AUgust 2015.

Name: Amitava_dg
Title: May skip if short of time
Review: Nice planetarium but not extraordinary. May be skipped for other attractions if there is constraint of time.

Name: Satish G
Title: not as expected
Review: building is nice and beautiful....in shape of planet saturn.....has a small museum...ticket price is also reasonable....after entering inside the main auditorium..i was shocked to see broken chairs..one person nearly hurt himself while sitting....the show started in english but in the middle sound went mute and it started in hindi...after a while again it started in english....there was no notice board to tell the visitors what show was going on and in which language.....the show was kind of boring because it only focussed on moon and some famous stellar groups and our solar system.....slide show was not up to mark but yes i will say it will take your brain in a countryside where you are watching the wonderful dark sky with no pollution or bright light.there was no canteen or vehicle stand when i visited.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: planetarium
Review: A good place to visit and observe planets and star at sky artificially. the shows are in Hindi and English at scheduled timings

Name: Anuradha Manjul
Title: This place is can be a better maintained and made more interesting
Review: This is one of the few places in Lucknow for everyone with scientific bend of mind. Would be a good opportunity for kids to get the feel of planets and other astronomical delights. One major setback - staff has a laid back attitude, not willing to help out or no opportunity for a explanations etc. in the display area. Worth one time visit for sure.

Name: Nupursingh
Title: Lots of medicinal plants
Review: If you fan to see medicinal plant then this is right place to chill out. Many informative things can be seen here.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Botanical Gardens
Review: Botanical Gardens is situated in Charbagh and is a nice place to visit with your family on a weekend.

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Best place in Lucknow for morning walks
Review: I am a health enthusiast and always try to find the best place for my morning walks and workouts. While in Lucknow, this is the best place for this.  You will find lots of people, from almost all age groups, who visit these gardens for fresh breath.

Name: AAA
Title: Good Garden for Morning Walk
Review: Botanical Gardens is quite green on all sides. There are many tree plants here. This is great place for stroll, many people come here to get fresh.

Name: P N M
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent place for Greenery in Lucknow. So many hundred people daily have early morning walk. You can find there variety of rare costly plants. This place is called N B R I Institution

Name: 268yusufn
Title: GOOD PLACE FOR  HOOKAH LOVERS
Review: i visit is place at early morning for morning walk. the crowd in morning is really good. many people come for walking , exercise, meditation,jogging , yoga its huge place.

Name: sujatapant
Title: GREAT place to walk
Review: please be advised this is open to the public only in the morning for walking ,exercise,yoga,and meditation.it is a lovely place ,with several beautiful trees,flowers ,cacti,bonsai plants ,peacocks,birds aplenty.there are water bodies toothis is a botanical research institute run by the govt.

Name: PawanTMMNainital
Title: Botanic Garden, Rana Pratap Marg, Lucknow
Review: Its a very nice place to visit specially Morning Walks, Nature Lovers, Huge space. favourit place Walkers and joggers. really its a nice and pleasant place. maintained by UP Govt. Hats Offbig ground inside. people do Yoga there - lots of fun by locals - they actually rejuvenate themselves.

Name: raks125
Title: ok type
Review: i visited the place for 2 hours. this is one time visit only as there is nothing to see much. it needed maintenance.

Name: pensioner090
Title: Outstanding research institute with lovely gardens open to public
Review: We found the Botanical Gardens by accident. They are not on any tour routes. They are open only from 6.30 - 9.00 am each morning and are well worth the visit if you like gardens and if you want to see real residents of Lucknow out for their  morning exercise...power walking, jogging and just enjoying the gardens. It was a splendid way to begin our day and the gardens are lovely.This is a research institute, not a public garden so they are not open during the hours when scientists are working in the gardens and premises.The gardens are only a 10 minute easy walk down a straight road from the end of Shahnajaf Road where it intersects with Rana Pratap Marg. The lovely Shah Najaf Imambara complex is located at this intersection. When you finish walking around the gardens, walk up the road to the Shah Najaf Imambara and spend a delightful hour there.

Name: rajat agrawal
Title: Kukrail empty reserve!
Review: Kukrail reserve once the pride of lucknow has become victim of government apathy .the park is so poorly managed .hardly u see any crocodiles.totally avoidable.

Name: Harsh V
Title: Good place
Review: If you are planning to visit the place keep in mind that you are going to see only and only crocodile there is no other for few time the place look interesting after that you will fell some boring so visit for not more than 1 hour

Name: 592abck
Title: Nice green place
Review: Nice green place near the city. One can spend 2-3 hours with loved ones. Nothing to eat here though.

Name: Amit M
Title: A place for Picnic
Review: This is my third visit to Kukrail Forest Reserve but reviewing for the first time. The place is lush green with lots of vegetation and is a place for Picnic with friends and family on weekend. Lots of crocodile there. The city is very crowded so gets some relax in the lap of nature.

Name: vinybhu
Title: Good For Weekend
Review: It's good park. You can visit with friends and family. Its small park and you can spend one to two hours there. You can get glimpse of crocodiles. Good for some natural photography.

Name: ajaypritu56
Title: Good place to see medicinal plants and crocodile hatchery.
Review: I visited many times with my family to see different kinds of medicinal plants which are very useful for our life. My children are eager to see different sizes of crocodiles (from 10 days to 1 or 2 years). Big crocodiles are living in separate and big ponds. Good place to enjoy 3-4 hours with family and friends.

Name: Manish Pande
Title: for alligator lovers
Review: a nice place covered with  small patch of forest in the concrete modern city, where you can see alligators and crocodiles from close quarters

Name: Pradeep Ambat
Title: A day in the forest reserve
Review: Situated in d outskirts of lucknow we visited the Kukrail forest reserve on 30 April. The day was overcast making it an ideal day for outdoor visits. Nothing much to see except for the baby Gharials and Crocodiles seen at a distance. But if u want to spend a peacefull time with small kids this reserve forest is good. A little bit more effort in maintainance will improve its desirability a long way.

Name: TheWorldNut
Title: Utterly disappointing
Review: Most of the cages are empty and there is hardly anything to see. We just kept roaming through largely unkept premises only to see the baby alligators. Make better use of your time and go to the zoo instead.

Name: Anika S
Title: Worth seeing the gharial breeding and crocodiles
Review: Situated about 9 km from Lucknow ,this is a place worth visiting for families with kids.Timing 8 am to 5 pm.The walk from parking till the breeding centre is also full of various flora and fauna.One can see the various stages of the life cycle of a gharial( including the newly born,the hatchlings,yearlings and adults) a member of the crocodilian family. There is a section for rescued gharials which are brought in from various villages or other locations.The gharials are bred and freed in the rivers after they grow big.There were about 500 gharials and 11 crocodiles when we went.There is a museum also but it was under renovation in January.It's a good family picnic spot as well.

Name: Priyanka C
Title: grossly mismanaged
Review: The three stars are for the baby alligators which are bred here and you can see them just on the periphery of the park. Don't waste your time going inside. The whole park is falling apart. No amenities, no maintenance of the rusted cages or the fences. Overgrown weeds and grass. Avoid !!!

Name: Anupam S
Title: Nature in natural form
Review: This is the place which you should visit when you are not in a hurry. Lots of vegetation. Entrance is like you are entering in a jungle. Though it is a crocodile breeding centre but also known as picnic spot. Most of the time it is crowded with families or school kids. It's also favourite place for loving couples. But apart of these hassles you can find a peaceful place for you where you can have interaction with nature. I've few such great memories in my records. For a tourist it is just a crocodile breeding centre, for kis & families a picnic spot, for loving couples a meeting place and for nature lovers a natural place. For others it will seen as not maintained place but for nature lovers it is a place where few spots is available where nature is kept as it is and not much disturbed.

Name: PALLAVI S
Title: nature lover
Review: If you have good taste for nature love this is the right place for you, its a crocodile reproduction center, you can have a close understanding of the reproduction system of this animal.

Name: Aishihm
Title: A great place to hang out especially with kids.
Review: It is one of the best places to hang out at the same time have a good learning curve for the young ones. To me a must visit a place where the kids can learn a lot while the elders can hang out and breath easy out from the busy life of a cosmopolitan.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Kukrail
Review: A fantastic place to celebrate picnic with family or friends. Here crocodiles are a speciality here. There are more than 50 crocodiles. Kukrail Forest is a special place for kids.

Name: sun_abhay
Title: Crocodile sanctuary
Review: A park with largest crocodile sanctuary, a good place for family visits , not very good in terms of maintenance and cleanliness.

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Visit ti Kukrail Forest Reserve
Review: This is a picnic spot worth seeing by people of all the ages. People go far watching Crocodiles and scenic beauty.

Name: Vipul556
Title: Nice picnic spot
Review: The place lies ahead of Indrinagar and is quite a big forest reserve in Lucknow city.. Good for picnic and some family time with the kids

Name: authorneelesh
Title: so many of them.
Review: A gharial and crocodile breeding center, You can see them in all shapes and sizes , from the just born lizard like babies to the huge and menacing full grown ones.It is also a very pleasant walk from the parking to the breeding center.The tree shaded walk gives the feel of being in a forest.Lawns are well maintained and used as picnic spots by locals. There is a canteen inside but did not look too inviting and hence we did not sample it. The loos are clean . A really worth going place.

Name: pinaki50
Title: More of a crocodile reserve
Review: On the outskirts of the city ( actually with the spreading populace this place is now almost touching a colony called Shivpuri) is located this large expanse of greenery & it's natural beauty n solitude soothes the nerves after the boisterous city clamour. The authorities here are doing commendable work in the conservation of the smallish indian crocodile called ghariyals. This place is also a popular picnic spot. Worth a visit if time permits.

Name: Samiur_Rehman
Title: Theme Park with a good concept but need finish
Review: The theme of the crocodile park is very good and informative and the size of park is quite large and having a good vegetation cover.Lot of renovation activities were going on because of which the park looked incomplete and missing some key facilities.Area where breeding of alligators is done,was quite interesting,with all sizes of alligators around.Missed to see crocodiles as they are confined to a small pond at a lower elevation.Area where turtles are kept is also not developed properly and some of the holding ponds were empty.This could be a good place for a must visit once all construction/renovation activities are completed.

Name: Durgesh S
Title: Lungs of Lucknow
Review: Full of greenery. Lots of birds. If you will come here you can feel the fresh and cold air anytime. Morning access is preferable.

Name: Vidharva
Title: Nothing much to see
Review: Its just a park good for kids and picnic , there are not much crocs there as you might expect. Definitely worth a visit if you are planning a long stay. Avoid if you are planning a short stay as it is not worth it. The place is well maintained in patches and not all of the place is well maintained. A visit like 3pm - 5pm should be better avoid during afternoon as it is pretty hot.

Name: SONAL2089
Title: Family picnics
Review: The place is like a large forest, with parks and gardens to sit, play, relax and enjoy the green lush surroundings with family or friends.

Name: Vijaypsingh81
Title: Good place in But need proper maintenance.
Review: The place is really good, but it requires proper maintenance. Though this is nice attraction, out of the city. One can visit this place with family or friends.

Name: Pranav M
Title: Natural beauty
Review: Its little far from main city , but its nice places , when i went there was some problem in roads, work was on progress but i think now it is ok .. its nice place to visit . you can see many corocodile & others also . also you can spend a peaceful time here .

Name: shyams174
Title: poorly maintained as picnic spot
Review: it seems that Kukrail picinic spot is most neglected area, very poorly maintained, as par as visitors are considered. no basic amenities  in the park, except to have a look at crocodiles, the situation is horrible in park. My advice for not to go with family, if want to time pass with friends it's ok

Name: khadds
Title: good only for showing crocodiles to kids
Review: A big let down. Average type of picnic spot for school children. Good for love birds, but dont think much privacy is available. Like most govt properties its soul less. Only good thing is baby alligators/ crocodiles which you can show to your children. Disappointing visit. Avoidable .

Name: Manvendra77
Title: Nice
Review: nice place, i went to this park many times with friends and sometime alone, nice and peaceful place, you also enjoy this park with girlfriend or boyfriend.

Name: Shalu2016
Title: If you love crocodiles
Review: Its an awesome reserve where many crocodiles , alligators, gariyals and camons live .its a place where you can see a huge river predator .Kukrail is a place for enjoyment, and having a  family picnic

Name: Arpitgupta25
Title: Nature and aligators
Review: Good place for family and couples also nowadays but too few crocodiles are there now.. now picnic spot for family...

Name: journey2016
Title: nature for lovers
Review: kukrail forest reserve in indira nagar near sivpuri colony in lucknow. this is the attactive place where crocodile and turtle keeps alive.here is collection of eggs from natural as soon as these were laid, incubation of these eggs under ideal temperature and humidity maintained in artificial  hatcheries.this place is really really wonderful for nature of lovers.here i have seen big, bigger and biggest crocodile which i did not see in lucknow zoo.don't miss this opportunity, come and enjoy.

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: natural and awesome
Review: this place is full of crocodiles and aligators. This place is also known for tortoise. This has become a picnic spot among locals..:)

Name: Sagar C
Title: Park to relax
Review: It is just a park to relax. Quite green Only problem might be that for some, there are quite a few young couples in embarrassing postures. Nice outing with family. Kids will definitely enjoy it.

Name: Manmohan17
Title: good place for nature
Review: Good place for nature lovers. and also lots of love birds too, overall good place away from lots of traffic and pollution.

Name: manoj k
Title: Hot Picnic spot of Lucknow
Review: most visited place of Lucknow by the local for Sunday or on holiday Picnic. one can see all verities of crock there. nice place in mid of nature.

Name: Varun S
Title: A rare jaw of an attraction
Review: Kukrail is one of its kind attraction with those motionless yet deadly creatures housed in a cage for the guests to see. It has a huge spread ideal for a picnic with lush green lawns, play area and a jungle feel to it. The huge pool of alligators with their open jaws and unflinching eyes are a rare treat to watch. The place has a nice peaceful ambience and kids can enjoy running around for hours. There are a few turtles also to watch. Though the place could have been better maintained, I would still rate it as a good picnic spot.

Name: Satish T
Title: CROCODILE SANCTUARY CUM PICNIC PLACE IN THE NATURAL WILDERNESS
Review: Nestled in the dense forest, this crocodile and ghariayal sanctuary cum picnic spot, takes you off from the buzz of the city. Just 10 Kms from the Charbagh Railway station, near Khurram nagar and you find yourself in the lush green natural jungle off from the concrete jungle. OPENING TIME AND FEES –It opens from morning  7 Am to  6 PM ,parking fees for two wheeler is 10 and Rs 20 for 4 wheelers This place is appreciated by all types of peoples and best suited for those loving loneliness in ambiance of nature. Particularly young couples and love birds like it most.  This crocodile sanctuary was established in the year 1975 under UP Govt’s  scheme of extinct forest animal project. This is written on the sign board shown just before the Entrance gate .It was basically a crocodiles rehabilitation and breeding centre which was later on converted into a picnic spot,  It is maintained by the forest department.   Named Kukrail ,because it is situated in the Kukrail forest and on the bank of Kukrail river.                                               After entering inside the sanctuary, first thing to be noticed is statue of a big crocodile opening its mouth with a big fish in its jaw as seen from the side. Peoples and children stand inside its jaw and take group snaps .Back side of the crocodile looks like a rounded entrance.                                                                                                                   Infant, unprotected recently hatched crocodiles and tortoises are brought from nearby rivers and kept here till they become adult enough to protect themselves. Then grown up and extra ones are released in the nearby big rivers. At one place you’ll see thick steel wired cages, in which different sizes of crocodiles are kept and transferred into other when they become bigger. It was a feast for the eyes, to watch baby crocodiles creeping in the cage and basking in the sun, in groups. Going ahead we saw a natural pond with crocodiles in it. Ahead you will see a small divided ponds complex, where you can watch tortoises and crocodiles. There is an area for children, having swings and rides. Besides you can watch different types of birds, deer’s , sāmbhar’s and some other animals. I saw one cafeteria also, serving snacks and tea. Walking inside this sanctuary was a very pleasant, mind refreshing and rejuvenating experience. Satish Tripathi Gorakhpur . Sctri48@gmail.com

Name: Prosico
Title: A Good Place For Going For A Picnic
Review: Hi, I went there yesterday and experienced one of the best places in whole of the Lucknow, but not i cleanness and security as there are some monkeys there which can attack or snatch food. When i went at the entrance there was a statue of a crocodile with a fish in his mouth, the statue was like hollow you can enter it take selfies. After that if you go to the right you will see very cute babies of crocodiles and gharial and if you go forward you will see three big crocodiles with a giant turtle in a cage like structure below the ground level and in a forest type environment and when you go more forward there will be some cages and there at the last cage will be a rare Gharial. But at the path and the park there is no cleanness. There are swings also for kids. You can enjoy on a holiday but i would better advice Janeshwar Mishra Park.Thanks.

Name: Poseidon_4991
Title: Amazing experience
Review: If you'd like to see crocodiles sun bathe, this is the place to go. Creepy as it may sound, it should be a must-to-visit on your checklist. It's perfectly safe and adventurous.

Name: Aman A
Title: Crocodile Reserve
Review: This excellent forest reserve is located near Indranagar at Lucknow and is around 12 kms from the heart of the city.This is basically a crocodile reserve and is one of the finest places in Lucknow for family outing for picnic in forest.

Name: nitu_gupta_in
Title: peaceful area
Review: see the crocodiles hiding amidst the greenery and water. a peaceful place. can be better enjoyed in a group.

Name: Kushal N
Title: Small is beautiful
Review: Great place to hang out, otherwise known as picnic spot. It has a tortoise and crocodile breeding center. Often crowded on weekends and holidays.  Best to carry your own food

Name: satyaprakash375
Title: Kukrail Forest Reserve
Review: A nice place for holidays and for picnic nicely maintained lawn with play area and Restaurant. It can be developed into a proper forest reserve with inclusion of animals.

Name: iSaurabh S
Title: Unique and must see
Review: Kukrail is slightly out of the city. A good picnic spot it is also a very unique breeding house of crocodiles and aligators. One of its own class. A must see .

Name: abhineetsingh
Title: Kukrail Forest Reserve
Review: A nice place for holidays and for picnic. You may like to spend the whole day with your family, friends and children.Basically it is Kukrail Reserve Forest and a Gharial rehabilitation Centre.   and its one of the most renowned breeding centres in India and covered with natural forest you will find children's on jhoolas or playing badminton.... the worst part is pathetic upkeep trash can be seen every where and people are making it dirtier it is more if a place for couple hangout

Name: bharati2408
Title: Perfect for family picnics!
Review: Its a forest reserve, which is said to be the largest breeding ground for crocodiles and allegators. You can find big and small crocodlies , allegators, tortoises etc. The place is like a large forest, with parks and gardens to sit, play, relax and enjoy  the greem lush surroundings with family or friends.

Name: Shruti_Poki
Title: Interesting place but li'll risky
Review: The place is inside a reserve forest area and hence is quite and serene.Breeding of crocodiles takes place at the center here you can find them categorized month wise.There is a mother pond for big crocodiles too but it’s dangerous since the barricading is very small and one can easily jump inside it which may prove risky.Authorities should take concern on this part.Park is well maintained with flowers and slides.There is a good canteen in between of parks which serves hot snacks.

Name: Nipurn B
Title: Quiet Place !
Review: The road which leads till here is more fun and serene.On a quite path you drive away in kind of midst of a reserve area.The toll fee is Rs 10 for two wheelers and Rs 20 for CarThey have even developed parking which costs about Rs 10/- and 25 for parking scooter and car respectively.The area is lush green and surrounded by flowers,hedge ,long trees.It used to be a good picnic spot in early 90’s since then love couples have completely ruined it with obscene activitiesStill it is good to have a walk around and check out the crocodiles.They also have created an artificial one which is the biggest.

Title: Dont miss it.
Review: If your are visiting Lucknow then never miss it,and have a great fun in the forest reserve ,and witness the breading of crocodiles and also see the big crocodiles and other animals, the atmosphere is very peaceful and have a picnic with your family and friends. My advice that don't stay till the dark especially if you have family with you, and need more forest and police guard to avoid untoward accidents.

Name: prabhakarbaba
Title: Crocodile reserve
Review: Kukrail forest is very good place for family picnic . Actually in area crocodile reserve forest where you see growth of crocodile

Name: Satish G
Title: good but needs improvement
Review: it is situated at the far north side of city and if you have your own vehicle then its better.the place is worth a visit if you love the peaceful environment amongst trees with birds chirping around you.the place is well maintained although at some part of the year the management looks careless because i saw long grass in the playground with garbage.....this place is famous as a picnic place hence named picnic spot.....but its actually crocodile rehabilitation centre to conserve crocodile population against poaching in the past....canteen is below average.toilet untidy.but the best part is that it has no entry fee.it is few kilometeres far from running main road so its better to have own vehicle or reserved vehicle.

Name: kartik9670
Title: nice but not safe
Review: kukrail is a nice place. but not safe for evening and night visit'sKukrail Reserve Forest is located in Indiranagar adjacent to Shivpuri colony on picnic spot road.recommended only day visit.

Name: Durgesh K
Title: Nice place to see aligators and crocodiles..
Review: Good to visit place to see aligators and crocodiles in the close vicinity of a huge cily like Lucknow. Just outside of the city on the banks of Kukrail this forest reserve plays a host to  some good quantity of aligators and crocodiles. The place is controleed by Forest Dept.Nice and ample open space for kids to play and have a picnic. The only fallback is u find Love Birds every where just spoiling the family atmosphere. Else a good place to visit.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: kukrail
Review: a forest reserve with attraction for picnic spot and cultivation of crocodile and alligators, there is provision for play ground for children.

Name: vijay s
Title: Love birds spoiling the site
Review: I advice UP GOVT. To take care of the place.  And just get ride of love birds as its hard to visit place with family and elderly.  As we like to get sone fresh air away from city. But due to love birds. . Its all ruined.

Name: priyank1310
Title: Good place to visit in shabby state
Review: We went to Kukrail which was once a good picnic spot but not much any more..It's good for kids to play around.. rides are in Ok condition. Slides are bit risky as it broken and some places makes its edges sharp.new attraction is a Aligator mouth shaped entrance for Aligator. .ghariyal.tortoise...museum will be open only when there is electricity available..u can see love birds here and there sitting in every nook and corner..I would advice to visit with family in holiday time so that u have lots of other people with u as well..

Name: Aloy M
Title: Can be Developed Better!
Review: A good Forest Reserve which has not been maintained; or should we say used more as a Park for entertainment. has a big, nicely maintained lawn with play area and Restaurant. It can be developed into a proper forest reserve with inclusion of animals. Primarily being used as a Ghariyal Breeding center, it has a lot of potential to be developed into a real Forest Reserve. The approach road is good. Were disappointed with the resident Fauna!

Name: silva s
Title: very small museum
Review: A small museum within residency. did not attract us much. The rifle and canon shots in wall have been preserved here.

Name: John Muriango
Title: Alright
Review: As you visit the British Residency, make sure to also visit this site within it and you'll definitely learn a lot especially if you're a history junkie.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Awadh and 1857
Review: Though ill kept yet the displays are worth the visit  what with many cpis of original sketches  of the period  that weave their own story .They also show  a film n residency at specified hours and if around stay to see this .One's bags need to be kept out  so be prepared .

Name: Tanvi
Title: Dedicated to first war of Independence
Review: It is dedicated to first war of Independence . It contained photos , maps and paintings related to war . Visit this place if u love history .

Name: Reyan11
Title: Treasure
Review: Part of main residency building. It includes some old photographs , maps and paintings of major sites associated with the rebellion

Name: durham05
Title: Poor museum
Review: This museum is within  the residentiary and is pretty poor with very few original artifacts on display. Model was badly labelled. Maiming pictures of those involved in the 1857 siege.

Name: niya27
Title: Great museum
Review: This museum is in the middle of British Residency and there is no separate ticket for this museum. The museum exhibits many paintings and photos in the era of 1857. Remember to go in the basement.

Name: William899
Title: Excellent 1857 artefacts
Review: The museum is located at the centre of the 1857 seige estate and it has some brilliant memorabilia from that time with documents, portraits, artefacts etc.. Photography is permitted and the rooms are light and airey.

Name: felicityjg1
Title: Part of the Residency
Review: Definitely worth a visit whilst at the Residency.  The pictures are excellent.  There is also a short video.

Name: 592abck
Title: History but nothing great
Review: History but nothing great. One can spend good time but nothing much to see here. Kids got bored and we left

Name: Rohit T
Title: Heritage of Lucknow
Review: A must visit while on trip to Residency at Lucknow. Many British portraits and model of Residency is tere. Takes about 15 minutes to finish the trip.

Name: Mukesh G
Title: Informative
Review: 1857 Memorial Museum is a good place to get information about the history. specially war of independence.

Name: mkeshav
Title: War memorial
Review: A great place to visit to learn about the first war of independence , someone who likes history , will surly enjoy visiting this place and read about war .

Name: Dalbir_S_Virdi
Title: Memories of War of Independence
Review: As I mentioned in my review of Residency, this is the only active building inside Residency complex where you will get to see a complete Model of Residency (as it used to be), some paintings and pictures that will make you feel pride about those who started the war of Independence.

Name: Robert G
Title: Great background to the history of the siege
Review: There's a more than a little poetic licence in the narrative of some of the exhibits; "war of independence" is stretching things somewhat, given that only one region of India was involved in the uprising, for example.However, the tragic history is well documented in the museum and the atmospheric ruins tell their story.

Name: sid_ups
Title: A small museum with Historical weapons
Review: This museum is the part of British Residency. This part or museum is in a very small area, inside the museum you will see the map of British residency and full history, Photography is allowed but you have to deposit your baggage.

Name: Seema H
Title: 1857, memorial museum, Residency
Review: The boys wanted to visit the war museum, so we took them to the 1857, memorial museum, located in the residency premises. It is an ASI protected monument, and though now in ruins, it reflects the ambience of a bygone era.There are several galleries here, with several interesting artifacts Well worth a visit for history lovers

Name: AsisBandyopadhyay
Title: Remnants of India's first war of Independence
Review: A small museum that recreates the mutiny hours at the residency with visual descriptions, weaponry  and artifacts of the time. The human characters and geographic details of the place are depicted realistically.

Name: 810wanderwoman
Title: Interesting little museum about a sad, terrible event.
Review: The photos and maps inside, the stories of individual bravery andsuffering make for a poignant visit, fascinating in a grim, weary way.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: just some pictures and maps
Review: Located inside the residency complex it is a good quick see through as it has some maps and pictures of the area giving you some idea about the grandeur of the place as well as about the siege in 1857

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice Museum...
Review: A nice place for museum lovers. The place is ideal to recall the memories of first fight for independence of India. The museum is nice and well maintained. Thought museum is not that big but worth a visit.

Name: Manish B
Title: First War of Indian Independence
Review: The museum at residency is the reminder of the first war of independence by indians against the Britishers. The exhibits present the story of 1857 in a chronological order and gives deep impact to visitors.  Highly recommended place to visit.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: 1857 Memorial Museum, 19 Sep'15
Review: 19 September, 2015.One of the prime highlights of our tour of the city was a visitto the 1857 Memorial Museum, co-located inside the BritishResidency, Lucknow. The small, but extremely well-maintainedmuseum does not allow visitors to take cameras, or mobile phonesinside the premises: the above items have to be left behind inlockers, located conveniently outside the pathway to the maingate. The museum is located centrally inside one of the mainbuildings in the British Residency. There are cannons outside theentrance. The museum chronicles the events in the First War ofIndian Independence, of 1857, in historical documents,photographs, lithographs, paintings, and arms and ammunition ofthe era. A number of historical maps also trace the chronologicalorder in which the events of the uprising happened, over the area.The museum includes a model of the Residency itself, in one ofthe rooms. One of the rooms has a bas relief of Ms. SusannaPalmer, who had died due to a cannon ball hitting the room: thepoint of impact of the shell in the building can still be seen.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Great Museum
Review: Among the most popular tourist attractions in Lucknow, museums in Lucknow feature in a big way. The museums are a virtual treasure trove that offers the tourists an insight into the major historical events that have been instrumental in shaping the future course of Lucknow. 1857 Memorial Museum, Residency in Lucknow is one of the most famous Lucknow museums that are often visited by the tourists during their Lucknow Tour.

Name: chetan1586
Title: War of 1857 Museum
Review: 1857 Memorial Museum is a very good repository of the historical artifacts related to the Independence war. This is a must visit for all history lovers to revisit the war with photographs & artifacts of that time

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: museum
Review: A good collection of the Historical artifacts reminding  the war of 1857. Of course not much clean as compared to many other museums seen.

Name: Aloy M
Title: Reminds of the First War of Independence
Review: A very good collection of the Historical artifacts from the vestiges of the Residency reminding of the war of 1857. A little cleanliness will be better appreciated. But the sheer historical importance of the articles displayed outweighs any other negatives. A must visit for any Indian to Lucknow. Reminds of at least the first Collective effort for the Independence by the Otherwise divided Indians!

Name: Shameer S
Title: Must visit Anandi Magic world. Lucknow.
Review: We visited there Anandi Magic world property and it is awesome. Worth each penny. Excellent room service. Good rooms. Good food. Good rides. Waiters were prompt. Overall loved my exp.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Enjoyed at water park
Review: There were good rides enjoyed here . Water park charges are normal . My kids played a lot and we're very happy .

Name: Harshit
Title: Just okay.
Review: Price in my opinion is little high from what service and facilities it provides.Few rides are available and is most crowded on weekends.

Name: Mukesh Srivastava
Title: Expensive and poorly maintained resort
Review: I visited anandi water park today.The turn for the resort is not marked prominently. If you are coming from BBD side,  u have to take a turn immediately after crossing the canal,  cross it again and take left turn,  the road is almost a service road adjacent to the canals and has different coloured flag all along till the resort. For a weekday the entry was for 700 rs for adults. Lunch was an addon for 150 rs, which we didn't opt for. The guy at the reception offered us private changing rooms for additional amount which we declined, a decision we regretted. The entry amount included one small cold drink,  a small cup of ice cream and one snack with choice between pav bhaji and noodles. The management dies not allow outside Food and your bag is checked. Food offered was of average quality. The pool and the slides are good and continuous DJ plays on quite loudly,  we enjoyed this part. The sour point were the changing rooms which were actually filthy,  cubicle doors were broken,  in ladies room people had thrown used sanitary pads,  so it was a real bad experience. The do provide costumes on payment both for men and women but people in the shirts baniyans and other dresses were also visible. Coming to pool and slides they have a good assortment but all if them do not function simultaneously.  I was there from 12 to 330 and the wave pool was not operative. Some youngsters with life guard t shirts are present.  But they were actually doing crowd management next to slides and blowing whistles.  The sitting area of the restaurant  was again dirty and unkempt.  Though tired we moved away from there quite fast. Go there if you are only in for pool and slides. Also the parking is not free. They do provide a small locker in the men's changing room. It can accomadate a small back pack.

Name: ShivaniK
Title: Jannat
Review: I love this ...place it's like jannat 😀for me becoz..we enjoyed a lot whenever we go each nd everything is good .. washroom are clean always..staff are very helpfull quick facilities provide delicious food... my fav water park ever is Anandi .thenkew Anandi nd his Team😍 i'll come soon again

Name: Pawan_Shrotria
Title: Nice to hangout
Review: A good place to hangout but only in summer season.  There are sufficient number of rides.  Though tubes are too less.  Wave pool is operated ONLY on the days when there is crowd.  On our two visitsfrom 10-2 pm,  wave pool and water cascade were not operated.

Name: Abhineet
Title: Great in Summers
Review: get relieved in the scorching heat of April- June. good day out for the family. food is also OK and economical

Name: 592abck
Title: Just like any other water park
Review: Just like any other water park. Nothing special. There is no point going here if you don't have lot of time in your hand.

Name: vikashvikki2
Title: Vikas Trivedi

It is great place to go.

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: Full masti
Review: This may be a good day outing in summer. This place can be best enjoyed with friends and family. The water quality is good.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: outing
Review: A water park for  amusement and fun for children as well as other family members. There is a provision for family party adjacent to the park

Name: satyaprakash375
Title: Anandi water park
Review: one of the best water park in  land on city of Nawab, lost of water slides and lots of funif u visited Lucknow pls visit Anandi water park.

Name: maddash-traveler
Title: Bad design, under staffed but good value
Review: This place is okay for adults or teenagers but is less than optimum for young kids. Why? Because the designers crammed dozens of rides in a small area. To reduce footprint, they eliminated the long flat landing Lane and instead made the landing zone for every slide deeper by ~1 feet. That makes it unsafe for smaller kids below 4 years. There is one life guard for every set of slides but on a busy day they can't literally catch all the small kids. My day was spent in catching my son as opposed to letting my 4 year old son enjoy on his own. The upkeep especially of the changing areas is a bit lacking in hygiene and could do with better standards. It's very 90s.The tube slides have tubes which are massively under inflated. The place is good value because the ticket includes clothes, lockers and a round of food. That leads to some mess since people keep going in and out of the water into the garden to eat and the water gets a bit muddied. There's a lazy river but there is no directional flow not tubes on which you can sit. Defeats the whole purpose. Lastly, the wave pool operates with limited frequency and at that time other rides are switched off. The waves are nice but the pool is gender segregated. My wife and mother in law enjoyed separately from us!I paid 1.5x the price in Gurgaon for Oysters but it is totally worth it!

Name: Ashish
Title: Pathetic water park
Review: Overly pricesVery bad foodBad condition of changing rooms and washroomPlease visit at your own risk.

Name: harshnegi
Title: A decent effort led down steeply by lack commitment to keep any standards
Review: With few options for kids around Lucknow (I mean monuments of historical importance is not an equivalent alternative), a water park is a logical options. The dept of the water is apt for kids, even my 2 years old can be comfortable, but it is dirty.There is no demaraction of area for children and dont think there is anyone to enforce it. The condition of change room not for discussion, but it is also dirty. They charge full tickets for kids more than 120 cms , measured on a board standing at the entrance (Rs 600) . They also force you to buy meal coupons to eat from inside.The Paw-Bhajji , Chowmein and some other option they give along with ice-cream (not sure which brand) and a small drink (200mL coke). We took Pav-Bajji and Chowmein and did not eat, wasted it(it tasted weird) (like others did before us).(A little effort could do into prepare the dish and can save some food wastage). Tips to have good time would be visit on working days, carry some food, your own towel, locker space given is really small so carry a polybag to keep your sandals/slippers, which is also a tip for foot wear.

Name: RBS2706
Title: Clearly not geared up for the big event
Review: This property is a water park, with about 50 rooms.  For a wedding in the family, we booked this place with almost all rooms occupied by the two sides.  However, it was clear from the very beginning that the property management team is not geared up for such a big occasion.  The rooms were extremely dusty.  Even after repeated reminders there were no one to clean the rooms.  We were there for 2 nights 3 days.  Since it was quite cold we did not try the water park.  However, best avoided.

Name: ravi p
Title: Pathetic Water Park, water is too dirty, rides are old and rusty
Review: I have visited this water park on 26 June 2014 with my wife, cousin and his wife. We thought of it a decent water park, with sub par facilities. But my experience is turned bad with the water quality and rides maintenance. I seriously do not advice this to families. Though its way too economical and budget friendly but no one love to take risks for price factor. This water park was way too better when it opened and few later years as I have visited this during my school days back in 2003. My suggestion skip this, there are far too many options available in Lucknow, check them out.

Name: Satyendra P
Title: Beautiful experience
Review: I went to temple 🛕 it was full of peace neat and clean . When I went there it was raining 🌧 but lots of peoples  came for darshan .

Name: garhwaliya
Title: God place
Review: This is god place so very much peaceful, everywhere is lots of people gather to pray to god and meditation.

Name: AVNISH SINGH
Title: Supercool and beautiful place  devoted to goddess radhe & Krishna
Review: Sri Sri Radha Raman Bihari Ji Temple is situated in Lucknow, Uttar-Pradesh. It is basically resided in Sector- F near Ansal Sushant Golf City at Sultanpur Road, Shahid Path. This illustrious Hindu Temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna and his consort- RadhaRani. Sri Radha- Raman is a revered deity inside the main abode which is a magnificent Manifestation of Lord Krishna. Piecefull place.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Temple
Review: Sri Sri Radha Raman Bihari Ji Mandir is a calm and serene abode situated in Ansal sushant golf city.

Name: Blitzkrieg3
Title: Spirituality at its Best!
Review: Do visit this Iskon temple if you find yourself in Lucknow. The temple is the best place in Lucknow to indulge yourself in some spirituality. I could see the difference it made in my life. I would recommend this place to anyone who is interested in a spiritual experience.

Name: sangeetasrivastava
Title: Divine experience
Review: The Iskon temple is divine as always. Temple  is still under construction but the lay out plan and location is superb. The greenery all around is admirable.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Iskon Temple is great
Review: Iskon is the most beautiful and popular temple of lucknow. There is a lot of piece here. Many people visit here daily. Must visit Temple.

Name: Ronak S
Title: Iskon temple
Review: Like other Iskon temples, the place is unsually quiet, calm and peaceful. Always make a point to visit this temple whenever I am in town

Name: Gurumurthy Bhargava
Title: Spiritual visit
Review: Iskcon Temple located in Sushant Golf City was visited on Mother's  Day along with my wife and in laws. Around 0930 hrs in the morning had a beautiful Darshan of Radha Raman followed by the Aarti.Overall ,a good spiritual experience .Another highlight was the adjacent Gaushala where Cows  and calves of various built were present ,the way they approached us to greet was a new experience .We had the privilege of having prasadam also.Note that the Temple remains  closed at the following timings:01:00 pm to 04:30 pm09:00 pm to 04.30 am

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Beautiful ISKON Temble
Review: It is an ISKON Temble. Building is nice. Calm and Quit atmosphere. Very greeny area. It is still going construction.

Name: Shubham S
Title: A beautiful temple in making
Review: A very peaceful, green and spiritual destination , Enriched not only the body but even the soul.A must for all Lucknowites

Name: uutsav
Title: An ISKCON Temple in construction
Review: The temple is still in construction. The locality is very peaceful and quiet. There was a prasadam lunch on the day I went and it was quite good.

Name: SVAYAMBHU C
Title: Satkhanda Dec 2022
Review: We marvelled at the iconic watch tower, the Satkhanda, which was supposed to be 7 stories but ended up being 4 because of the untimely death of the nabab. The tallest clock tower of the country was also nearby.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Incomplete tower
Review: This iconic tower has an octagonal base, arched windows & Islamic design details. Conceived as a 7 storied structure, it could only be completed till the 4th level, as the Nawab's family saw a few deaths during the construction and this was conceived as bringing ill omen to the family. A nice picture spot though.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Tower of Seven Storeys
Review: Commissioned by Nawab Mohammad Ali Shah, this was actually intended to be a 7 Storeyed Watch-tower.... unfortunately, due to the untimely death of the Nawab, the construction of this tower got stalled and did not go beyond 4 levels.... the structure incorporates subtleties of Greek designing whilst the arches depict Mughal & French craftsmanship.... the unique architectural feature of this 68 ft tower is that every successive level has been built in the decreasing order of height & breadth of it's base floor

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Landmark
Review: The place is located  near clock tower and visible also from Rumi Darwaza  but is in decay  and cannot be missed from the areas around .

Name: ShikshaC
Title: An eye catching monument.…
Review: The Satkhanda is located just near the Clock tower and cannot be missed if you are visiting the tower or Rumi Darwaza. This is an incomplete structure as its construction was stopped after the death of the Nawab’s daughter for whom he was building this place.

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Watchtower from the 1800s
Review: The Satkhanda was a watchtower built in the 1800s. The iconic tower has an octagonal base, arched windows & Islamic design details. It is located next to the Husainabad Clock Tower; so, if you're in the area, you can't miss it.A reminder of Lucknow's Avadhi & colonial past.

Name: kushBans
Title: Good sight !!
Review: This place is close to bara imambara. But this tank is not well maintained as compared to the remaining other structures.

Name: FATBOY
Title: SATKHANDA- Indian leaning Tower of peesa
Review: Satkhanda is a watchtower near Bara Imambara and Rumi Darwaza, Lucknow. Though it name means Seven Floors but it only has four red-brick floors. It's construction was undone due to the sudden demise of Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah. This vintage watchtower reminds you of French architecture. In all nice place to visit for history seekers.

Name: infojonny
Title: Satkanda
Review: The Satkanda is not much to see but it is the old structure which is made in the nawab time but nice to visit

Name: _adhikarigautam10
Title: satkhanda lucknow..
Review: its attraction is just because it is nearer to imambara picture gallery and clock tower ..more of the lucknowrs dont no abot the satkhanda ..so not so good ..but the goverment making lots of efforts to re make its charm as old time.

Name: FahadK61814
Title: Good to Know.

Name: qahead123
Title: nice place
Review: THis looks like leaning tower of pica n Colosseum of Rome. it provides a great view to the history of Lucknow.

Name: GingerBeer1979

A tour will take about 20 minutes.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Good building near Roomi gate
Review: Must see this building. Its just in the corner of Roomi gate. You can see this building from Bara Imambara

Name: Fahim_Khan_13
Title: History Behind the Building
Review: Visited the place while in Lucknow, If you go to Bada Imambara, there are auto people who take 40 rs. & show you another 4 attractions in which 1 is this, other 3 will be clock tower, chota imambara & romi darwaza. Also they take you to big shops which do chikan embroidery work, so they will show you how they make it & than will try to sell some clothes to you.Coming back to the building as Auto Person told, this was used to see the Moon of Ramzan & Eid & likewise.Good Trip for historical monuments, mostly all monuments nearby in this area.

Name: Manish B
Title: Condition is deteriorating day by day
Review: This building was the dream project of the Nawab Muhammad Ali Shah, but the building was never took its shape as planned. Was originally planned to build 7 story building to see the moon but due to death of the nawab the project is closed. The building is very important piece of indian history but its getting worse day bay day.

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Nice Building
Review: Satkhanda, built in 1842 by Nawab Mohammad Ali Shah, is a decaying 67 meter red-brick watchtower, located just opposite to the Hussainabad Imambara. It is a splendor of medieval architecture and is visited by a number of tourists from all over the world.The tower shows a blend of French and Italian style structural designs. It was constructed during the time of Nawab Muhamad Ali Shah, but his untimely demise in 1840 blocked its construction. Though the towering structure is named as Satkhanda, which means seven stories, it holds only four stories. Famed as the tallest tower in India, Satkhanda, is believed to be built in the 1880s in memory of Sir George Couper, a reform-minded Governor of UP.

Name: guddu1954
Title: old glory restored
Review: This used to be a seven storeyed structure but now only four storeys are there.Till few years back it was in a very bad condition but now after extensive restoration old glory has come back.

Name: uutsav
Title: Looks like leaning Tower of Pisa from far
Review: This tower is near to Husainabad Clock Tower and the Bada Imambada. It was supposed to have 7 stories but only has 4 completed ones. According to Wiki, it was build during 1837-1842 during the time of Muhammad Ali Shah, but was left incompleted after Shah's untimely demise.Since the tower is next to the road, it won't take more than a few minutes even if one plans to halt for a while.

Name: Avirup Guha Roy
Title: Jama Masjid
Review: The structure of this Mosque is a blend of both Muslim and Hindu architecture and the entire structure of Jama Masjid stands straight over 260 pillars, which also supports 15-arched domes that are seen at various elevations

Name: Voyager826163
Title: Ignored marvel

After a few moments another old man came and told us “have you seen he board? You are not allowed here”  !!!! When we said that we know the rule and not entering the mosque – he was not happy but left he place……….. so may be I is a tricky place but we liked the architecture !!! its wonderful !

Name: tafayyaz

Name: Mina N

Name: krazikams

Review: Mughal era-architecture is simple beautiful and the feeling when you enter this place is ethereal. Garden and lawn need maintenance, as people simply destroy the beautiful nature and pluck flowers.

Name: Gauravkhuraana
Title: Nice place good to go in the evening
