Name: Giri_Mlr
Title: Historical place to Visit
Review: Place is in the campus of Bara Imambhara. People who interest in the history or curious to learn about places should visit. Not very crowded place.One can visit in any season.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Good architecture work must see
Review: This masjid is a fine work of good architecture. Grand building and looks very good. Must see. Its only 1 Km from Chok.

Name: Pallavi S

Name: anuragbhaumiik
Title: Prayer

Review: its very famous mosque in old lucknow. fine work of persian architecture. very popular with locals and tourists.must be visited

Name: MananDhuldhoya
Title: Stunning architecture
Review: So gorgeous to look at from the outside and it makes for a great sight, whether from outside its doors or atop the Bada Imambara.

Name: Aman A
Title: Peaceful
Review: This Masjid is located inside the Bada Imambara gate. The Masjid is a very peaceful place to be while you are visiting the Bada Imambara at Lucknow.

Name: SKBhatiya
Title: Good to Spend a few hours
Review: Once the pride of Lucknow is a good place to visit and spend a few hours, you will find guides willing to show you around, make sure to negotiate the price

Name: Paritosh1521
Title: Majestic
Review: Though entry was not allowed inside the structure, it is quite and impressive piece of historical Architecture

Name: Aniruddh A
Title: Beauty at it's best! Non-muslims not allowed
Review: visited this place in the afternoon and mesmerised by the exteriors! coudn't really get in though as the rules allow only Muslims to enter! Fair though as a rule is a rule! can be there outside for a glimpse of the architecture! :)

Name: indianlady
Title: Non muslims not allowed
Review: Its a beautiful mosque from the outside with a serene calm surrounding. This is rather uncommon since places of worship are always crowded in India. However on is not allowed to even step onto the structure around the mosque as a non-Namazi.

Name: kp_vy
Title: OK
Review: Have to take cycle rickshaw , through the by lanes as parking is very difficult near the mosque . Nothing much and they charge 300Re for cameras. Can be skipped

Name: Rishabh Saxena
Title: Huge ground area along with dedicated practice area
Review: Cricket tournaments I like most there . Matches along with practice . Very huge ground with dedicated practice area . Best cricket academy in Lucknow

Name: Vipin Yadav
Title: Best cricket environment with lot of facilities,
Review: Ground is very neat and clean , and we'll maintained, cricket academy the creators cricket club Lucknow, providing lot of facilities of cricket for the players, conducting and participating lot of practice cricket matches , tournaments on this ground. Best place to learn cricket skills in Lucknow

Name: ARPIT Kumar
Title: Best cricket academy in Lucknow with excellent  cricket environment

Name: Rahul Bajaj

Name: Sachin Gupta
Title: Best cricket academy in Lucknow with supportive coaches, lot of facilities , matches, tournaments ...
Review: Best academy in Lucknow, this academy have huge ground with dedicated practice area, supportive coaches they help each student to know their ups and downs and enhance their skills practice matches, tournaments, national and international visits full day practice sessions and many others things .

Name: umang saxena
Title: Best cricket academy in Lucknow  with lot of facilities as per international cricket standard
Review: one of the best place to learn cricket skills , beautiful and huge playground , lot of facilities that provides standard of international cricket , lot of practice matches, tournaments like district level, state level, national level, or international level . coaches are very supportive. best academy in Lucknow

Name: Shauryā PS
Title: Best place to learn cricket skills
Review: children play , practice category wise , and ground is very huge and sufficient area . you should visit at once if you are cricket freak , enthusiast...

Name: Ambarish2012
Title: Wow Awadh
Review: History and culture mixed together.I am not writing this review to tell you about Lucknow.I would like to say just 2 things:1. Don't just restrict yourself to the Imambaras and the Parks. Take a stroll through Quaiserbagh area and visit the tombs, gates, Baradari and other monuments.2. Don't restrict yourself to just Tundey Kababi and Dastarkhwan. Check out the local places for Awadhi cuisines. Also try the Basket chat and Nimish (available only in Autumn/Winter)

Name: rehan
Title: Nice to walk over here
Review: Felt goodGood place and environmentNice to walk over here And I also like the people over thereQrqrwrtehehfififhhdhajiwi

Name: Abinash M
Title: Lucknow Tour Hotel, Places to visit, foods and How to Travel
Review: I visited Lucknow on 16-10-2021, COVID 19 has changed everything but COVID 19 restrictions are low in Lucknow, Mask is important but not mandatory here. No Airport Restriction about double vaccine or RT CPR report is required but still take all precautions.We were staying in Hotel Nexus near Gurudwara Charbaag, hotel and staffs all are good in rating I will provide 4 out of 5 stars .Now comes about local sightseeing must visit points are:- 1. British Recidency (DSLR Allow but no video recording)2. Bara Imambara(DSLR not allow but Mobile photography is allowed)3. Chota Imambara4. Rumi Darwaza5. Bouli 6. Picture gallery(DSLR and Mobile allow but no photography)7. B.R. Ambedkar Memorial Park(DSLR not allow only Mobile photography)8. Janeshwar Mishra Park (optional)These places are mandatory and extra places you can choose by yourself.First when to purchase tickets in Bara Imambara it includes from 2nd point to 6th point in single ticket. In Bara Imambara you will need a local guide to help you in Bhul Bhulaiya we were three in number so it cost 125 for all which include Bara Imambara but we paid 150 for all which include Bara Imambara, Chota Imambara, Bouli so I will suggest you to take guide for full or else you have to pay extra to enter Bouli In B.R. Ambedkar Park Rs. 15.00 for entry the place is beautiful and good for relaxing If you wish to purchase Chikon Items there is a local factory of government which provides best quality Chikon in low rates 2 days are enough to visit all places. Where to eat:- You can eat food near Mohan hotel Maharaja but food quality is avg. I will prefer to eat from your hotel price maybe higher but the quality will be good or if you like a south indian food please take a visit to Selvam's.Now how to visit these place and how to reach the hotel:- If you really book Hotel Nexus, from Airport it will take 30min and from Railway Station, it will take 12 mins a taxi will take 250-320 for Airport and auto will take 40 from station.And how to visit these places you can book you own ride but I will suggest a Panjabi Guy Amarjeet Singh he Drives an Auto Rickshaw but this guy is very good in manner and trustable he set the rate at very reasonable price and I really appreciate that his Contact Number is 7860509907 if you ar 3 to 4 in number try him you won't regret.On 18-10-2021 we return back.

Name: dhananjay sharma
Title: Lucknow is vry nice place
Review: Luknow is the ambedkar park are making this park through mayawati (BSP) this ambedkar garden spread in about 2km.

Name: Ogonn Technology
Title: feel
Review: I have experienced this city it is awesome it is a attracting center there is lots of park and good places to travel and also if you want to rent a car or bike you can also rent from Ogonn Technology company

Name: Shabbir S
Title: Visit to place of parks
Review: We stay at Gomti nagar for 3 days at vibhuti khand. Hotel Bodhi Inn comfortable to stay with good quality rooms and staff and room rent will suit your budget convenience. An automan helps us taken lucknow city ride @Rs.100 per hour. Gyaneshwar mitra park and bhulbhaiya palace are most attractive ones. Besides large number of ambedkar park covered with gomti river at night walk will melt you. Famous for Chikan dresses we buy them in large quantity as gift to own family members. Besides lucknow zoo is an additional attraction.

Name: siva p
Title: Ghasal night in Lucknow
Review: Lucknow is famous for its nawabi culture, especially it's food and ghasal. we had an unforgettable experience of nawabi food and music in faluk Nama,in hotel Clarks Inn during our visit to Lucknow.We were not staying there,but I had been there,years back and had beautiful memories of a ghasal night I had there.I could feel the same nawabi ambience, the food was excellent,with the ghasal concert in the background.Faluk nama is a great experience in Lucknow, for those who love good food and music.

Name: P singh
Title: Area review
Review: Its a posh area of lucknow. Most of the residents are from service class. Market is also good. One can find every single thing here.

Name: Rachana M
Title: Lucknow...bada imambara
Review: Had a chance to visit Lucknow ...bada Imambara is a must to hisit....specialky the Bhool Bhuliya...Do hire a guide else u wont be able to enjoy the actual structure.. The view from the top was amazing...

Name: Priya
Title: Good residential place
Review: It is one of the best places for residence at lucknow. You can have all the facilities here at gomtinagar like schools, market etc.

Name: Bhuwan
Title: Amazing and Unique
Review: This is the best Coffees Shop in Lucknow,We randomly bumped into it and the way waiters welcome and treat us.was warm.The atmosphere of the place is really awesome. Great comfort food and especially garlic naan.overall wonderful memories with great experience provoded by Jaskiren, Arun, Archita and Rahul.

Name: Manish
Title: Trip
Review: Developed area, further development is on the cards which will ensure it to be sought after area in Lucknow.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Capital of Uttar Pradesh
Review: Lucknow is the capital of the Uttar Pradesh. This is the city where all the political offices and administration head offices are there. The city gives you a classical look. The city has two parts. Old Lucknow and new Lucknow. The old Lucknow touches the classical old architecture and congestive places. The new one is also having beautiful places and many classical buildings built by various governments. The special food here is Mughalai and specially biryanis and kababs. The transportation is also good.

Name: sanjaygupta6
Title: Visit to Lucknow
Review: Beautiful place , with broad roads & good greenery, Historic place famous for bhul bhulya & other monuments.

Name: Nupur S
Title: Fashion place
Review: Fashion is the right word for this place. Lots of latest collection is special feature of this place.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Major brands available
Review: Good to buy major brands products which are having discount and reasonable price with high quality stuff.

Name: Dhyan Chand
Title: Wave Cinama
Review: A place for shopping, eating and watching movies. Here is McDonalds, Vodafone Store, lot if usable shops and Wave Cinama. This place also known as Wave.

Name: Anurag243
Title: Satisfactory
Review: The mall is big and well keep up .. there are lots of options for all ages people visiting here frequently.. at the end a good and satisfactory one..

Name: Gurumurthy Bhargava
Title: An evening in Mall....
Review: East End Mall is one of the oldest mall of Lucknow which is frequented by all age groups. Had the opportunity to visit with  my son as he wanted to buy a new mobile which we could buy from the authorised Samsung Dealer located in the ground floor near the Barista outlet .At Barista  had Cappuccino which was refreshing . This mall also boasts of Vodafone store in addition to most of the branded stores. Wave cinemas is an another attraction.Food court on the top floor is relatively small but okay.McDonald and Pizza Hut outlet  at the ground floor makes for the food court. Parking facilities are good.Overall a nice mall to hang around.

Name: Cyclivist
Title: Nice mall to hangout in the hot sun
Review: The weather in the Lucknow is extremely harsh in the afternoon. I went to this mall as I was bored to sit in hotel.It's a nice well maintained mall having a cinema hall too. As it was extremely hot, I spent some time by watching a movie there. It was a nice experience

Name: sid54321
Title: Good place to hangout in lucknow
Review: This comparatively lavish mall in Lucknow small but have all very big brands. one can enjoy movies at wave cinemas inside mall after /before shopping.

Name: vsrinet
Title: An Experience to Remember
Review: This is the oldest Mall in Lucknow and also the most well managed.Centrally situated,very well connected and has all facilities under one roof.Many international brands,and other reputed iconic showrooms are located here.It is a good place to come and spend a few hours,chilling out with family and friends.Some halls here have GOLD CLASS,which is sheer luxury in movie experience.Our favorites for dining are the Pizza Hut and MacDonald on the ground floor.A very safe place they have their own in house security.

Name: kartik9670
Title: Place for food,shopping,movies and also a bar.
Review: If you are in gomtinagar or Indiranagar must visit place.*MacDonald restaurant*wave cinema*go banana club for partying

Name: Bharat1702
Title: Nice place to be
Review: Had nearly everything inside it. Food court, big brands, everything. Nice place to kill time. Enjoy movie

Name: John Muriango
Title: Soul Care
Review: An amazing historic Church. Provides spiritual nourishing to our souls as they preach the Gospel of grace.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: 1857 Relic
Review: Here is a Church that was built to commemorate those Britishers who were killed in 1857 uprising .Has wonderful  commemorative plaques all in the church  with stained glass windows  not to be missed by historical buffs.

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: An eye catcher attraction
Review: Christ Church in Lucknow is a place of worship, sign of British heritage in this region.  It is beautifully illuminated after sunset and is a favourite of all young and old photographers.

Name: durham05
Title: Very old church
Review: One of the oldest churches in Lucknow. Was closed when I arrived but caretaker opened especially for me. Very historic and liked the monuments. Sadly needs some maintenance work.

Name: mohitv
Title: Christ Church
Review: Initially known as the church of England, this was the first church in Lucknow made in the memory of British soldiersA very beautiful architecture becomes more beautiful in the night lights. Situated in Hazratganj near to the governors house.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Big maintained place
Review: Mostly churches are highly maintained. This is very big place. Lots of people come here for wishes and peace.

Name: ayushagarwal022
Title: calm and peaceful
Review: Though all churches are usually very calm and peaceful but this church deserves a special mention of its calm environment. well maintained and neat and clean surroundings.

Name: Nandana1
Title: Nice place to Pray
Review: This is a Christian Church and called as Christ Church. Everyone is welcomed here to know the Gospel of Christ. Sunday worship is very nice here.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Christ Church
Review: Christ Church is very peaceful and attractive. Here the heart is very relaxed. Must Visit place. Recommend to you all

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice Church...
Review: A nice church to visit if you are in Lucknow and like visiting churches. The architect is simple but beautiful, not so big either. the place is calm and peaceful. It is near Wing fileld park.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Had fun
Review: I came here with my family . My kids were very very Happy . We enjoyed to our fullest . Rides were amazing .

Name: kushBans
Title: For kids
Review: The rides here are not all for the adults. Kids in the family will enjoy the rides more. Rides are here for all.

Name: ayushagarwal022
Title: Fun masti and adventure
Review: Visited this amusement park along with family and we all enjoyed a lot. They have rides for people of all ages including kids

Name: Blitzkrieg3
Title: Good Amusement Park
Review: Dream World Amusement Park is a good place to spend a day out with your loved ones. it is a perfect setting for a family day out. The park has lovely rides and games. The staff is also very helpful. You can also savour some good food at the park. Overall, a very good place to visit.

Name: Adil Rashid
Title: awesome short ride
Review: lets have short prty then will be go and enjoy the water pool and many more ride include in ticket..

Name: Heather B
Title: Fun holiday day
Review: Happy to say that Dream world looks like  its on its way to becoming a great day for the family once again. There are a few rides still closed however the staff and cleanliness  of the park more than makesup for it.The park was looking tiered  however it appears that a lot if work behind the scenes  has been done and a lot of face lifts for the rides have been achieved.  The water park included  within the park also has great staff and is a whole lot of fun.Worth the day out.

Name: reenadivyaraj
Title: Nothing is there
Review: It is a worst place I have ever visited The food is very bad , no maintenance  , no cleanNo body should go that place

Name: P N M
Title: Excellent
Review: The place Of Dream world amusement park is very natural. This is the worth place for children. You can enjoy with groups as picnic spots . You can have lunch , snacks etc.at very reasonable rates. The security of park is up to the mark for children.

Name: credit356
Title: Excellent  theme park
Review: This   theme park in the LDA colony is  quite  far from the city. But  good  transport facility is available. The amusement  park has  got lot of items where everybody can enjoy . For all age groups , they have  special items. Good food is  available  at  reasonable  price

Name: Abhishek R
Title: New place for Dhamaal & Masti
Review: Good Rides, Nice Place, Huge Area, Good Food, Overall Happy. my kids enjoyed a lot specially train & Boating is awesome.

Name: Jitendra Bhatnagar
Title: No photography!!
Review: I have just written a review of the Gallery. I would like to add that taking photographs here not allowed, which is a big disappointment. i wonder why photography is prohibited. It must visit place.

Name: Rohit B
Title: Nawabi portrait collection
Review: The picture gallery hosts a dozen paintings of all the Nawabs of Lucknow in a small single hall. Visit the place if you care to see them in their royal attire, framed in large size canvas work.

Name: silva s
Title: Small quiet place
Review: The portraits of nababs are kept here. The paintings are beautiful. The lustrous silk dresses, the bespoke jewelries or even the shadow of the zafri is painted by master painters. Some pics are kind of 3D. Definitely a glorious past of Indian art history.

Name: JoyBose
Title: Photo gallery of all the nawabs of lucknow
Review: It has a gallery of all the nawabs of lucknow from safdar jung to wajid ali shah. You can get a guide as well. No photos allowed inside but outside photos can be taken and has a good view of old lucknow heritage buildings.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Gallery is small
Review: There's a small visiting fee about RS 20 for Indians and high rates for foreigners . It's small gallery one can visit here if they are interested in art and history .

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: Nawabs' Portraits
Review: The Picture Gallery houses portraits of the erstwhile nawabs of Awadh. The portraits were quite fine, with intricate details. The caretaker also pointed out to us a few amazing bits here & there. Like how the nawab's shoes seem to move!Our minds were also blown off by the view that the Gallery offered. The Clock Tower to the left, Chhota Imambara straight ahead, & the Satkhanda to the right.Photography is prohibited. The Husainabad Picture Gallery also doesn't seem to be frequented by tourists. We'd the place almost to ourselves.

Name: durham05
Title: Small gallery
Review: Small gallery with some portraits of the rulers of Lucknow. Guide thrust himself onto me but all he did when he took me round was to read off the captions on the bottom of the photos. Rushed me by some of the more interesting historic photographs of Lucknow and then told me the 50 rupees I offered was too small! Not impressed.

Name: melb0urnemuzza
Title: Did not go
Review: Admission price asked was 500 rupees even though the board stated 200 which is what I expected.I turned around!

Name: FATBOY
Title: HUSAINABAD PICTURE GALLERY
Review: This picture gallery shows big oil painting of Nawabs of Awadhi. The entry fee for Indian/foreigners is ₹20/₹200.The work on these paintings is actually quite good. It you want the staff to give you summary of the history of the house of Nawabs then you have to pay more. There is a big water tank (Baoli) in front of the building. This gallery is near Rumi Darwaza, Lucknow.History seekers can have a awesome time here.Note: Taking pictures is strictly prohibited here.Timing: 0800 hrs to 1700hrs

Name: Krupabn
Title: Nice pictures but bad maintenance
Review: The gallery houses 10 - 12 life size pictures of Nawabs which is 3D and optical illusions created in painting are amazing. There are no details mentioned anywhere so forced to hire guide who are overly priced for such a small tour. It's not a gallery just a room of pictures.. Outside view is worst.. You can see filth everywhere, very badly needs some maintenance.

Name: Praveen Singh
Title: 10 - 12 painting
Review: This picture gallery contains around 10 to 12 huge 3D paintings. Observing the 3D effect of these paintings is really good once must definitely visit. You will find paintings of various Nawabs of Lucknow here. This can be covered with in 20 mins .

Name: Ajeet N
Title: Nice paitings
Review: A collection of 9 to 10 life-size paintings commissioned by the nawabs and drawn by European painters.Each painting has a nawab and the building that he created, in the background. Gives a lesson in history.

Name: Indraneel
Title: Interesting - Could have been better
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery was my last stop during my Lucknow visit. This place is next to Rumi Darwaza and the Clock Tower. The gallery is housed in a beautiful building made by the third Nawad of Awadh and has some rare life-size portraits of the various Nawabs of Awadh painted by British artists and one Indian Painter Mr. D K Singh. The portraits are really interesting and has elements of optical illusion in them.This place is ticketed and the cost is included in the combo ticket available in Bada Imambada.Pro:- The building housing the gallery is beautiful. Watch out for- Iron pillars in the upper story pavilion facing the lake - used first time in Nawabi building- Bowling alley or Gendghar build by Mohammad Ali Shah for the Britishers- Rare Pictures; believed to be made on elephant skin and the colors used were prepared from diamonds and other precious stonesCons:- Picture Gallery is a misnomer as it is just a large hall with pictures & paintings on all the four walls.- The paintings and the pictures have no detailing. Forced to take guide at high cost.- Photography is strictly prohibited - reason best known only to the administrators- Unprofessional maintenance,Viewing time : 20 mins

Name: 592abck
Title: Not many pictures
Review: I am an art lover but I was disappointed due to very less pictures. I am not sure why they don't increase them.

Name: Teja
Title: It's just ok
Review: Some of the paintings of the nawabs of Lucknow are quite well done. But otherwise it's just a gallery of items associated with them, without any particular guidance on which ones are significant, etc. Also, you can't take any pictures inside, so by now I've forgotten pretty much everything.

Name: saurabh k
Title: Guides are irritating, they force you to take them to see picture gallery.
Review: You will see 3d photo of mughals and other kings, nice place to visit if you are interested in the the history.But the thing that irritate me is that agent are present on the gate of this gallery and they recommand you to go with them to see picture gallery. If they show you the gallery they take extra charge for it.So i highly recommand not to take guide with you.

Name: amars777
Title: Rare Collections
Review: Some old and rare collection of paintings and photographs are displayed here. Photography is strictly prohibited. Reason best known to the keepers.....

Name: randhirt2017
Title: Must watch this place for artist and also non-artist
Review: its a amazing place,a must visit for art lovers,collection of beatiful paintings,everyone should visit .

Name: akg_9
Title: A few pictures at a high entry fee
Review: The main attraction here is a room full of portraits of rulers of Lucknow, which appears to be highly priced at an entry fee of Rs.50.

Name: knightrider02
Title: Amazing paintigs
Review: Picture gallery have some amazing paintings. Paintings have some kind of 3D effect. E.g. Nawab's shoe direction will change as you walk past the picture. One of the photo, one will feel that Nawab is looking at them and person standing at other side will feel that Nawab is looking at them. Guide will walk you through all the photos, history and amazing facts.

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Nice Gallery
Review: Picture gallery is very to husainabad clock tower. if you are a history lover, you can enjoy some beautiful paints of the kings of ancient time. I was disappointed as they don't allow photography. Rest a worth visiting place.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Historical&Beautiful
Review: This is a historical place of lucknow. Very beautiful inside and outside. If you are a history lover then definitely go here.

Name: arindammullick100
Title: Historical Importance
Review: Not Large Gallery...... half an hour visit is okay...Gallery is on the first floor ..... Recommend to take a guide, available on first floor, to understand the marvelous art in paintings..... other than guide it will be just some ordinary paintings

Name: mohd a
Title: Historical museum.
Review: It's a good place for history lovers. In this museum you will know many thing about the Lucknow and their kings.

Name: Seema H
Title: Beautiful pictures
Review: The Hussainabad picture Gallery is close to the Clock Tower and the Imambara. The picture gallery has some beautiful paintings, but you need a guide to explain the history behind them. For me ,it was a disappointment as photography was not allowed . Not many tourists were visiting the place, so we were able to view the pictures comfortably.

Name: Alok N
Title: BEST ART GALLERY UNFORTUNATELY POORLY DESIGNED
Review: One of the best Art Gallery but poorly designed ( lighting and space ) and not promoted properly. Located between Bara and Chota Imambara it is easily accessible but not many tourists go there. The Paintings are just ' fantastic' but you need to have a guide to give the history and explain the intricacies of each to really understand and appreciate them. Photography NOT ALLOWED.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: Art lover will never be disappointed
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery of Lucknow is situated near the Chhota Imambara and the Gallery Building is visible from the main road. The Pictures here are amazingly maintained and one can not tell whether they are so old. It can be compared to any good art gallery and an art lover will never be disappointed. Must visit if one can appreciate paintings. Some paintings are said to have been made on elephant skin. Also, the so called `famed' paintings which seem to look straight to the viewer from almost all angles (it is an optical illusion, with the subject looking straight ahead), are here.

Name: Ronak J
Title: Good place
Review: A must watch place .with such an alluring picture gallery this place give me a calming effect. Good place

Name: souvikjana83
Title: For Art Lovers
Review: The Pictures here are amazingly maintained and one cant tell whether they are so old.. It can be compared to any good art gallery and an art lover will never be dissapointed.. Must visit if one can appreciate paintings..

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Amazing Collection
Review: Hussainabad Picture Gallery in Lucknow is situated near the Chhota Imambara  and the Gallery Building is visible from the main road. Nice image collection is hereThe gallery is open on all days from 08.00 hours in morning to 18.00 hours in evening.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: Husainabad Picture Gallery, September, 2015.
Review: 19 September, 2015.The Hussainabad Picture gallery has an impressive collection,which can be viewed by climbing a flight of stairs to an upperfloor, and is adjacent to the main road through the Rumi Darwaza.Some paintings are said to have been made on elephant skin.Yes, the so called `famed' paintings which seem to look straightto the viewer from almost all angles (it is an optical illusion,with the subject looking straight ahead), are here. The works ofart are housed mainly in one main gallery, and are in a goodstate of preservation.

Name: shubham Srivastava
Title: Telling about life guard behaviour
Review: I request u all about life guard name mohit and anil, many times both do jokes lot and also tlk about sexuality. Anil is very short tempor guy जरा सा कुछ हो जाए मारने लग जाता है। its better to tell him behave properly with all client. See Im coming since 2011 know these 2 guys since may 2013 indnt want any problem। बरदाश करने की भी एक हद होती हैIf any one behave rudely then i will have to give bad rating which effct your rating also

Name: Mrinal Gautam
Title: Heritage school
Review: This is one of the oldest and at one time best school of U.P., Situated on university road at one time it was "The School" of Lucknow. The area of the school is as big as university.

Name: kushBans
Title: Old place !!
Review: Decent view from outside. Can give it a visit if you are passing from it's near by. Not much to see.

Name: Montu
Title: Un-fadeable  Glory
Review: A School's glory can only be judged by its products -- global standing of  Colvin's alumni tells its own story!   Though the buildings and ambiance which creates the excellence are astounding too!  For me it was the teachers- but that come and goes!  For visitors it is a very interesting site also, to absorb history of a princely era, now only scene in films an TV period dramas!

Name: himanshulko
Title: Personality Development
Review: I have done schooling from Colvin Taluqdars College. All teachers were technical good & efficient, especially our Principal Mr. Tandon. Library was also Good. On the hole THE best college of Lucknow.

Name: infojonny
Title: Old College
Review: This College  is very old in Lucknow they have ground swimming pools over here this college is very famous

Name: Aarav K
Title: Colvin
Review: I have gone here. This is taluq dar college. It is old enough. One would like to tell that there is nothing special for travelers.

Name: AAA
Title: Taluqdars College
Review: Colvin taluqdars college is very old college of lucknow. There's nothing special to visit in it. Can be visited once to see.

Name: _adhikarigautam10
Title: colvin talukedars..
Review: colvin talukedar...its not looks like a visint point in lucknow ..for lucknowers ..but i heard and read that its a good college in its time..but now its repo is not so good..the best thing i know in talukedar is its pool whick provide swimming facility...

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: VISIT TO COLVIN TALUQDARS' COLLEGE
Review: This is the old college of educational excellence. Taluqdars means elite class and originally the college was said to be meant for the students coming from elite class. The College has got good and attractive building and in the heat of the city and near Lucknow University. The College was the centre for attraction when the Prime Minister visited the College in the recent past.

Name: Mohsin A
Title: Not for tourists
Review: This Is one of Lucknow's older collège. There is nothing for a tourist.  Near to Lucknow University. One Can ses Old style architecture here.

Name: Ghazi A
Title: Very good place in lucknow( shaan of lucknow )
Review: Love this place i m studying at this school. Nice place for visit it have big grounds and airy classes this is made by sir AKULAND COLVIN IN 1884 .

Name: zia535
Title: Swimming Pool & Historical Building
Review: its pride of lucknow.  I may say it a heritage building. One can visit it if someone has time.The buildings are beautiful and interesting in architecture

Name: Arpit141
Title: Very old and reputed college
Review: Colvin Taluqdars' College in Lucknow is one of the oldest and very reputed public schools in India.You can see the old Lucknow structure college buildings which is a great experience to watch.

Name: manoj k
Title: Old Legacy
Review: It a School ,having a Huge ground , the building have some Structural/architectural Value. Just Fine to Visit here.

Name: Shivanshu74
Title: Swimming and Cricket
Review: I visited for swimming as this is one of the places in lucknow where you can pay per day or join on monthly basis for swimming. They also have cricket coaching available open to public not sure on the charges for cricket however swimming goes for 100 INR per day. It is clean and well maintained i would say. Located in a accesible place near Hazratganj.

Name: lucknowkitchenin
Title: heritage school
Review: its pride of lucknow.......... the big ones and now famous entire globe have studied here and have produced many leaders too

Name: HBHB59
Title: It has been alma mater to many including me .
Review: Historical buildings and very majestic ambience. A great seat of learning .for those who studied here upto say early eighties it was an honor

Name: SKBhatiya
Title: Old Colonial Building
Review: A very Old colonial building gives you the feel of the British Era, a school once was the prime of Lucknow not its just another scholl

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: college
Review: an old college in Lucknow, situated nearby Lucknow station. It has its own heritage for its degree college, Many students have risen from this college to respected position

Name: DotDivx
Title: Old College and Heritage Building
Review: This is one of the oldest college in Lucknow and it building is very old, I may say it a heritage building. One can visit it if someone has time.

Name: RajeshMisraDr
Title: Have a good lawn tenis court
Review: I personally visit this college almost daily to play tenis , saif Acadamy maintained it well . This court also have lights so one can play in the late evening hours.

Name: SUDHIR J
Title: Good building but hardly maintained.
Review: It was once upon a time a very prestigious school. Now it is in a bad shape. The buildings are beautiful and interesting in architecture but because of lack in maintenance it is loosing its beauty and glory.

Name: Shussa
Title: Educational History
Review: Beautiful place ... excellence in education! History speaks .... long list of successful students, very beautiful. A place in Indian history, architecture, education, society excellence, Lucknavi tehzeeb ka ek jeeta jagta majmoowa.

Name: Anuradha
Title: Neglected heritage
Review: A beautiful Awadhi style building used by the Nawab of Awadh as his residence. Adjoining this place is another kothi which was owned by a French general Martin Cloud, later purchased by the Nawab. It has excellent French architecture. Both the buildings are in sheer neglect. High time to start protecting our heritage before it goes !

Name: Tanvi
Title: Skip it
Review: Yah architecture is beautiful but not worth visiting here . Now it's a office . So won't recommend anyone to go here .

Name: niya27
Title: Nothing there
Review: You can skip this place as it is not a tourist place. It is actually an office of central drug research institute of India. The building is old but beautiful.

Name: baburammarch25
Title: Great dome shaped architecture
Review: It is a great example of Mughal era architecture. The chattar or umbrella gleams majestically in sunlight. Currently it houses the office of drug research institute of India

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Excellent Place
Review: I went to Chattar Manzil. The buildings have large underground rooms and a fine dome with gilt umbrella that glitters upon the fall of sun's rays on it. The palace has an excellent garden. It is great place to go.

Name: Rajani B
Title: Nawab era monument
Review: It's an old monument having an umbrella shaped dome.  This was built by the Nawab rulers. Now it is an office of Drug Research Institute.  Underground rooms and edifice show nawab era architecture.

Name: P N M
Title: Very Good
Review: Chattar Manzil is situated at the bank of Gomati River. It is a historical Building made Mugal Emperors, Now a days C D R I of Central govt. Dept. is placed over here.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Chattar Manzil
Review: The upper head of this building is like a umbrella, which is why it is called the Chattar Manzil. This is very old. It's made of very old design. It still remains good and is worth looking at. Great place.

Name: Nitish N
Title: Excellent place
Review: I live here in lucknow.. it is one of most amazing monuments here.. you will surely enjoy...it is a huge ornated structure at the heart of the city.. its beauty will surely make your blown away..

Name: raks125
Title: nice place
Review: i visited the place during evening time as the whole day was hot.i enjoyed the place. the place needed more maintenance as some of the place may go bad if not taken care properly.

Name: Manish B
Title: Excellent Building
Review: The Chattar Manzil is the place of nawabs and their wives. The building was build by Saadat Ali Khan. Its one good place to see if you are travelling to Lucknow.

Name: Sarbari G
Title: A building built for the Rajput Mother of a Muslim Nawab
Review: Chattar Manzil is so named because of the shape of its dome, which looks like an umbrella.  This was built by Nawab Gazi Uddin Haider but changed many hands thereafter.  Currently it is under the Indian Government Council of Scientific and Industrial Research and hence not open to general public and tourists.

Name: Travelbuddy
Title: Good place
Review: Nice place to visit for shopping and  movies, It's good place to spend time with friends, food court also there to have lunch or snacks. I am regular visitor of this plavey, will come soon again.

Name: Narayanan
Title: Shop, Eat, Enjoy
Review: One Awadh Center has good restaurants ranging from KFC, Pizza Hut, Subway, Keventers, Sagar Ratna, Vango, Chocolate room, Sagar ratna, covering all cuisines. Lots of branded showrooms for shopping. Kids gaming zone at Masti zone. Cinepolis offers great movie experience. Groceries can be bought from Spencers.

Name: P singh
Title: Review
Review: Good place for people around or near shahid path. Good for movie, grocery and outfit shopping. Better to go on weekdays.

Name: abs0110
Title: Good place to shop and eat
Review: One of the newest mall. The best thing here is the Cinepolis cineplex. Has number of shopping options including Lifestyle, Max, Trends etc. The food court also has number of good options to choose from. One negative point is the high parking fees that these guys ask.

Name: Shashi78
Title: Family shopping centre
Review: Multibrand shopping centre, especially lifestyle, many branded food outlets such as KFC, Subway etc. and local cousins also there, you can enjoy movie with cinepolice , nice place to visit.

Name: SanjaiShukla
Title: Good place
Review: Visited the property today. The location was good. Cleanliness was good. It has Spencer's store and so many shops of different brands. It has multiplex. The food court has so many brands like subway, kfc, barcelos, sagar ratna etc.

Name: raijvdeepali
Title: Very polluted food court
Review: There is one outlet selling sizzlers - twistedThe whole food court is full of fumes of the sizzler majign it uncomfortable to sit for many The team is least interested in trying to sort outThere seems to be no proper ventilation system The whole experience if the food court becomes sour

Name: KseniyaMaslennikova
Title: Best cinema hall i visited
Review: The min reason we visited this mall is Cinepolis, which situated on the 4th floor. They have 8 screen, comfort food zone, and big varieties of movies, even in english. 3d floor - food court, with different cousins. We eat in sagar ratna small thali  -  it was great. 1 /2 floors is for shopping, mostly all shops are branded. Though mall is not big, it's good.

Name: Rohit_G17
Title: Great and new mall...but slightly small
Review: This mall is located in Vibhuti Khand in Gomti Nagar and is very close to hotels like Hyatt. Fairfield etc.The mall is new and hence very well done. The mall also has some kids activities at the ground floor which includes a toy train, rides in small cars plus the jumping activity.Inside it has a lot many showrooms including lifestyle and cinepolis. The food court is laso good with some 10-15 restaurants. Cinepolis is good as well with a lot of eating options.

Name: Vikram K
Title: It SUCKS
Review: It's already 30 mins over the scheduled time and they have still not started the movie. Really painful to see the ads shown

Name: Blitzkrieg3
Title: Just Another Mall
Review: One Awadh Center is just another mall in Lucknow. Visit it if you have free time, but don't go out of your way to visit it. There is nothing special in here. Though the mall houses some good fashion brands. But one can skip it if they are on a schedule!

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Good for visiting
Review: One Awadh Centre is one of the very few malls in Lucknow. It is not too big, but it is beautiful. I loved this mall.

Name: Harpreet S
Title: Overall Good place to visit
Review: The mall is good with almost all the major brands for shopping. These brands can offer a good shopping experience. The food court is excellent with variety of food - KFC, Pizza hut, vaango, sagar ratna and many more. The seating space of food court is also quite big.Besides shopping and food courts, the major highlight is gaming zone. It offers a lot of games and kids (and even elders) can enjoy thou roughly. It is quite an experience!!

Name: Amal G
Title: Best shopping,food,entertainment and relaxing place of Lucknow.
Review: One Awadh Center has the best multiplex-Cinepolis,Best apparel stores-Lifestyle,Max,Fabindia and many more.Also nice food court & Gaming zone.We can spend our entire day here watching movies,playing games,enjoying coffee,eating delicious food,and most importantly shopping. Must visit for all.

Name: Harshit
Title: Okay
Review: This water park don't have so many rides but you'll surely enjoy here.Chages is also very pocket friendly.

Name: nehach86
Title: Terrible
Review: Dirty and unhygienic for kids.. the washroom was out of water, and due to indoor area, it was crazy hot and humid..Consider it as a last option if planning a waterpark day

Name: Harshit
Title: Chill out
Review: The place is good for youngster the place is indoor pool with wave speeder if you are planning to visit the place the slids are very excitful so make plan with your friends and family and this place give offer in summer season must visit the place

Name: Parag P
Title: Worst Water Park....Never Go there...
Review: I have visited this water park with my fionce, and it was one of the worst experience I have ever had. The rides are broken, water was stinky and it was like they haven't changed or cleaned the water sice 2-3 months...the staff is stupid and so over i dont give a songle rating to this place and we have wasted 1000 rupees on entry and 400 on petrol...

Name: nitin m
Title: Wonderful place for kids
Review: My kids enjoyed this place very much. Reached there in evening and took a package so that kids could enjoy to the fullest

Name: infojonny
Title: Water Park
Review: The water park is very nice place to visit you can have much fun over here is place is much visit in summer

Name: 268yusufn
Title: INDOOR WATER PARK
Review: Dream world water was the first indoor word park in lucknow.This place is really safe and affordable.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Good place for family
Review: We went at this water park one time in 2015 in the month of September. Good place for fun loving people. Affordable water park.

Name: Manvendra77
Title: Fun Place
Review: waterpark is best place for spending your summer, i went this waterpark with my friends, if you are in lucknow and want to spend some time with fun and chill must go this water park

Name: ashish m
Title: Indoor Water Park
Review: Water Park is completely Indoor. best for summer season. kids are safe. They have good Restra for food also.

Name: K72
Title: small
Review: Small monument in a lovely manicured park. It's a lovely restful place to sit and relax. The monument is quite lovely and doesn't take long to view. Much smaller scale and design compared to the Kolkata monument but nice all the same.

Name: Companion32331321681
Title: Visit to victoria memorial kolkatta
Review: 150 year old monument stands majestically in centre of huge gardens and water bodies on all four side. Houses a museum rich in history of british conquests in India and some unique picture galleries of kolkatta of those days. Worth a visit.

Name: niya27
Title: In Begum Hazrat Mahal Park
Review: It is small monument in the Begum Hazrat Mahal Park. No separate ticket to visit this place. It was locked when I visited. I took few photographs from outside.

Name: kushBans
Title: Can't compare
Review: You can't really compare it with Kolkata's memorial but this one is also a good site to visit with your friends or even family.

Name: Nandana1
Title: Historical Building
Review: A beautiful memorial built for Queen Victoria. There is a park attached to it for happily relaxing. The building is built with white marble and looks awesome.

Name: irfan5081
Title: Victoria Memorial
Review: Nice place to hang out with friends specially on bike. And the atmosphere is really good in evening. We had really enjoyed a lot.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Awesome Photo Spot
Review: Coming with friends can be fun here. Beautiful place to take group photos and selfie. I liked this place, Enjoy yourself too.

Name: AsisBandyopadhyay
Title: Victoria Memorial in Lucknow!
Review: Usually Victoria Memorial is an icon of Kolkata. But in the Begum Hazrat Mahal Oark in Lucknow, there is a small structure in white which is name Victoria Memorial. It is not a huge structure and does not have any Hall. But the white structure in the green surroundings looks attractive and the stone work is quite good.

Name: mirzasamir1970
Title: A short visit deserve
Review: Good photo spot, not  for long time... Only some minutes and photoss...nice surroundings and parks... Many couples sit around...

Name: MANISH S
Title: A park for special one
Review: Situated near Parivartan chauraha, Begum Hazrat Mahal Park is a beautiful park with lush greenery and nice ambiance. Not very suitable for outdoor sports but quite good for spending some time with friends and not family. Young couples can be seen in every corner making it somewhat awkward for others. Great place for photography and to relax and chill.

Name: Sabiruz A
Title: Nice place
Review: its nice place for roaming with family.Very clean.My two of friend staying this place.Make shopping also good.

Name: Pallavi S
Title: Nice gardens
Review: At one time Lucknow was known as the city of gardens. Some of the old gardens have survived and this is one of them. Not spectacular anymore but still good to spend a winter morning or a summer evening at.

Name: joshi_rajneesh1
Title: wondering park
Review: this park is the shan of lucknow .....it is in purana lucknow and the hyginic park is best to wonder and and hitorical and also for kinds

Name: Rishabh K
Title: For history lovers...
Review: A very good attraction of Lucknow for history lovers....it is a memorial of Queen victoria and it is very peaceful place

Name: bryan t
Title: Beautifully kept
Review: A beautifully kept memorial and gardens right in the centre of the city. A lovely place for strolling through the grounds

Name: Amber S
Title: park
Review: one of the famous park of lucknow, not clean as desired, people need to keep the place clean it is your property.

Name: uskhushi
Title: beautiful place
Review: histopric park where u can spend time in peace with natural feel of environment ..kind of family park since old times

Name: Vinaytiwari06
Title: Not intresting
Review: Very old park, in evening lot of rush, It 700 m from the Hazarat ganj. Actually, there is nothing to write more about this, you can visit if you spare of time and nothing remain in lucknow

Title: Imagine when the Queen Victoria Monoment was there
Review: During 1960- 70, it was the only best park with the monument of Queen Victoria in spotless white marble, and a very attractive park where all the leading political leaders used to delivered their speeches from  respected Atalji, Jagmohan Lalji and others. I think the best place to play cricket matches and it was  difficult to count how many matches are going on, but everybody loves to visit this park, which  was later known as Begum Hazrat Mehal park , very well maintained, best place for morning walk.

Name: SANDEEP24886
Title: Victorial Memorial - lost in history, finally getting it's due.
Review: Over the years, this memorial has gone through a lot of transition. I remember this place was once used for Ramleela and burning Ravan/Meghnath/Kumbhkaran during Dushhera festival. Then after few years, it witnessed the organizing of Lucknow Mahotsav for few years consecutively. For the past 5-6 years, it has been transformed into a well-maintained park managed by Lucknow Development Authority. The memorial has finally got its due since the memorial dates back to the Fight for Independence of this free India. Not many are aware of the significance that this memorial has, as it has seen the ruthless times of pre-1947 struggle.

Name: bdeveloperinfo
Title: place always remain in your memory
Review: best one from ancient time's memory .it reminds us about old times ,about our forefathers and also for person who fight for our country

Name: kushBans
Title: Peace
Review: This mosque is a place where you'll find peace and internal happiness. Baba listens to you and prays for you !!

Name: 592abck
Title: Historic place
Review: Historic place to visit. Not much to see here but one must visit it considering its historic importance.

Name: Blitzkrieg3
Title: Quaint Mosque
Review: Aurangzeb Mosque is a quaint mosque is Lucknow, which belongs to the times of Aurangzeb. The mosque was built on the orders of Aurangzeb, who wanted to build a place to offer prayers for the public. Today, the mosque needs some maintenance but one can still get glimpses of old world charm in it.

Name: infojonny
Title: Mosque
Review: This Aurangzeb mosque is very old which was made by the king Aurangzeb the structure which is made is beautiful

Name: credit356
Title: Historical place
Review: This  has got great  historical importance as it  belonged to  Auranagazeb time. The   architecture  reflects our  cultural  values , which  has  inherited from  Mughals. The  place is  maintained well

Name: mhussain_bohra
Title: Heritage Mosque
Review: This is one of the oldest mosque in Lucknow. NIce lush hills behind the mosque and i really liked the white dome of the mosque. It is a nice historical and heritage site in Lucknow.

Name: abhayverma2007
Title: Aurangzeb's Mosque
Review: Easy to reach by Ricksaw or auto ricksaw. Aurangzeb's Mosque is located at Hussainabad in Lucknow. Situated near the well-known Bara Imambara, this mosque is a fine example of the Indo-Muslim architecture

Name: Tanvi
Title: Har Har Mahadev
Review: One of the nice temple of mahadev I have visited in Lucknow . Temple is good and well maintained . I visited here with my kids on Monday .

Name: Ankur M
Title: Peace and Calm...
Review: A very beautiful temple dedicated to Mahadev. A must visit place for spiritual and mental wellbeing.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Peaceful and Great
Review: Many times I have gone to this Mahadev Temple. A lot of people come here to worship. This is very peaceful place. Must visit.

Name: Gurumurthy Bhargava
Title: Temple visit....
Review: This temple located on Mohan road is about 500 Mtr from the Budheshwer crossing.One can easily find the main gate and park vehicle nearby.The temple opens from early morning to late evening and closes only around 1230 hrs for about an hour or so . Wednesday is usually crowded.According to the  legend Lord Ram paid obeisance to Lord Shiva  at this very place seeking mental peace on a  day that happened to be Wednesday, hence the name of the Temple is Budheshwer. People from all walks visit this place to seek blessing for various reason .As one enters there are plenty of shops either side selling flower;coconut and other puja items for an amount ranging around Rs 51/-.One can leave shoes in one of these shops .Milk is usually not offered .One can get a small utensil from the shops fill it with water and add coconut water obtained by breaking the coconut ;which  is done at a separate place before entering the main  temple. This is then offered  on the Shivaling located in the Sanctum sanctorum to  seek blessings. A must place for  Lord Shiva devotee.

Name: kushBans
Title: Beauty
Review: This aquarium has some really beautiful collection of fishes and tortoises. You can find the varieties and color to be amazing.

Name: ayushagarwal022
Title: nice and knowledgeable visit
Review: The visit was very knowledgeable. got to know about many different species of fish  and children enjoyed a lot.

Name: Shalu S
Title: Good place to go with kids
Review: I have been to this place many a times, and thoroughly enjoyed the fishes kept in aquariums. It's a small nice clean place, well maintained.

Name: Faizuddin H
Title: Good Aquarium
Review: They have variety of fishes and other sea animals. Ticket is very cheap. Their can be improvement in the interior of the building.Some of the aquarium were empty, however we saw totally new kind of fishes. Kids were very excited.They can have a theatre and run short films on life in Oceanside.

Name: P. V. Arul
Title: Ganga Aquarium, Lucknow
Review: The aquarium has some interesting specimens. But the upkeep needs a lot of improvement. The labelling & a brief explanations would a lot better.

Name: garhwalia1994
Title: Nice collection of fish
Review: They have nice collection of fishes and other living which live in water. They maintain them very much proper way. Worth place to go.

Name: credit356
Title: Need a  facelift
Review: This  aquarium  was a name to reckon with    in the  tourist  destinations. But  now due to  poor  maintenance, losing its attractions, It surely needs a facelift and  thereafter a good maintenance to  regain its lost charm

Name: abhayverma2007
Title: Ganga aquarium
Review: Not so good place, intead you can choose Lucknow Zoo and enjoy the aquarium. Not in good location, poor maintenace.

Name: sangeetasrivastava
Title: Ganga Aquarium - A new attraction in City of Nawabs
Review: The Ganga Aquarium is situated in lush green surroundings of NBFGR Campus, just near the main gate on Canal Ring Road.   With more than 40 large glass aquaria containing fish species from Africa, Asia and North and South America,etc., with attractive Feng Shui, deadly piranhas, tiny tetras, ornamental, goldfishes, Koi Carp, Angels, Alligator gar, Sting ray, Tetras, Ghostfish, Fire mouth, Malawi Cichlids, Malayan Angels and several other types of fishes and Indian ornamentals like  Kerala Queen, Flamingo barb, Loaches are special attraction for the children and students.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Obelisk for those Indians Killed in 1857
Review: On the banks of Gomti is located this Obelisk for Indians killed in uprising of 1857 .A white Obelisk set amidst a garden near the Residency .No entrance ticket .Good photo back drop.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Located near gomati river
Review: It is built to pay tribute to martyes who losed their life for freedom of our country . It was well maintained and good .

Name: Yogesh P
Title: Very near to Gimti river
Review: This place was located very near to Gomti river.  Place was built to remember brave soldiers. Well developed and well maintained.

Name: niya27
Title: On the bank of Gomti river
Review: It is a minar which is erected in remembrance to martyrs died during Indian independence. The view of Gomti river is awesome from here. The park surrounding this attraction is also nice.

Name: kushBans
Title: PAtriotic !!
Review: this place is not very crowded or dense. Can give a visit anytime. Not so good neither so bad. Give it a try !

Name: Amit M
Title: War Memorial
Review: The Shaheed Smarak was built to pay tribute to martyrs of first war of Independence. Made up of white marbal. Mainly visited by locals for a evening stroll and international tourists for history. Devoted 15 mins there.

Name: Rohit T
Title: Icon of Lucknow
Review: Located on the banks of River Gomti, this is a landmark tourist destination, facing Residency. The white tower pays true homage to the martyrs

Name: Aarav K
Title: Shaheed
Review: Shaheed smarak is a memorial place, located in bank of gomti nagar lucknow. Here is a pillar made of white marbal. Really this is very beautiful. Must visit.

Name: Rajani B
Title: Memorial for the martyrs of First War of Independence
Review: This memorial was erected to pay tribute to the martyrs of India's first war of Independence.  The memorial is made in marble and has beautiful architecture.  It's surrounded by garden on three sides and there is river Gomti flowing on the fourth side. Place is rich in scenic beauty and is rejuvenating.

Name: YatriForever
Title: Nice Stupa in memory of Matyrs
Review: This is a tall, well built stupa Memorial to salute those who laid thier lives for the freedom of the nation. Since we were staying in Riverbank Colony, it was easy to walk up here. The upkeep of the park is not at its best and the Gomti was dirty, some sort of dredging was going on. If you happen to be in this area of Lucknow or visiting the Planetarium, its worth a quick visit here. This is not exactly a tourist attraction.

Name: Hemant K
Title: Quiet serene place on bank of river Gomti
Review: It is a small clean park on the banks of river Gomti with a pillar honouring the martyrs. Therefore the name is Shaheed Smark, A good place to just sit, relax and admire the Gomti river. Boating is also available. It is easily accessible and is in the middle of the city.

Name: msadiqsalman
Title: A Place best for Solitude lovers
Review: Its a well maintained park, easily accessible and visited by couples and families.It has an option for boating in the Gomti river !! A nice experience and there is almost no waiting period.

Name: sid_ups
Title: Tribte for Great Indian Soldiers
Review: This is situated on the bank of Gomti River and is a white marble pillar stands in the middle of the Garden.

Name: P N M
Title: Nice
Review: It has good picnic spot . Shaheed Smarak is situated at the bank of Gomati river ,so that Boating facilities are there with your family. You can enjoy there with full of fun

Name: AsisBandyopadhyay
Title: A quiet place to pay homage to the martyrs
Review: Located on the bank of Gomti, it is a tall tower with clean cemented space where one can take a stroll and pay respect to the martyrs. The stairs from the road are quite a few so reaching close to the tower involves little physical effort.

Name: Alok N
Title: WHITE MARBLE-IMPRESSIVE
Review: It is one of the modern day creations but impressive and the views are nice with the Gomti river flowing below it. Not many people visit it as it is not part of the Guided tour.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Must see
Review: This shaheed smarak located at Ring road Sitapur bypass at the Gomti river bank in memory of freedom fighters involved in Kakori kand. Must see,. Nice place

Name: Manish B
Title: Dedicated to martyrs
Review: The place is dedicated to brave indian solders who gave away their life for the country. Beautiful white marble memorial in middle of the park. Good place to visit and spend some time in relax.

Name: Arpitgupta25
Title: Memorial only visit
Review: It is near gomti river and only war memorial and in evening there are some crowds otherwise it is empty...

Name: Atif M
Title: its war memorial
Review: near gomti river, war memorial. not much to be seen, still crowded by locals. around nice place to sit and relax

Name: nidhi2099
Title: Terrible!
Review: Absolutely nothing to offer as of now! I guess they are planning to develop the area as a green belt but all I could see right now was debris and dirt. May be in an year or so, it will improve. For now, please don't waste your time in visiting this place.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: Shaheed Smarak, Lucknow, 19 Sep'15
Review: 19 September, 2015.As we neared the British Residency on our two-day tour ofLucknow, our auto-rickshaw driver pointed us to the Shaheed Smarak, a monument erected in honour of the martyrs of the FirstWar of Indian Independence of 1857. The memorial is located on the banks of the riverGomti, and is constructed in a small park on the banks of the river.We had gone there in the hot afternoon, where the cool shade of the trees complemented a cool breeze across a clean stretch of the Gomti river, which flows past the place.There is a tall white monument in the main part of the park, andanother monument to the right (as one faces the tall mainmonument), in honour of the great freedom fighter, Shaheed BhagatSingh, with a bust of the freedom fighter displayed on it.

Name: manoj k
Title: leisure time visit
Review: one can go to the place to enjoy the place to have some relaxing time. Paddle boat ride can be  enjoyed over here.

Name: chetan1586
Title: Symbol of Tribute to martyrs
Review: Shaheed Smarak is built on the banks of river gomti & is a symbol of tribute to the martyrs who laid their lives.This place is a little mismanaged & the surroundings are not properly kept

Name: Pallavi S
Title: Valndalized and dirty
Review: You would expect more care to be taken of the martyr's memorial. There is no lighting, the place is unkempt, dirty and littered with garbage. Wish someone would take cognizance and do something to make it clean and presentable again.

Name: HBHB59
Title: A great monuments for those who laid lives for the country
Review: A white monument created in early 1960s on the banks of river Gomti. The place gives a great view of the city across the river including the bridges. Quite nice place to visit around sunset. With four elephants in white on the ground of the base the whole place is very elegant.

Name: SKBhatiya
Title: Just another building
Review: Used to give me the shivers when it was made 20 yeas ago, now its just another landmark. Its activity for a couple of hours

Name: sangeetasrivastava
Title: Place for Evening stroll
Review: Built on the banks of river Gomti, it is a tribute to the heroes of India’s First War of Independence. Lush green gardens, boating in the river and natural greenery are its major attractions.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: place
Review: A historic place in city of Nawabs- Lucknow near the bank of river Gomti. A good place to see specially for those who has inclination to know about Indian History- specially during British period

Name: Ruchi_Ahuja87
Title: Nice place to relax!
Review: This is a memorial built in the memory of unknown soldiers who laid their lives during the freedom struggle. It is only a structure and does not require much time to see per say. However area around has been well created. There are big steps where one can sit back and relax. Also this place is right by the banks of the Gomti river, hence the views are nice and this also makes the weather pleasant always. You can also go further down for boating on the Gomti river

Name: Sanyashree
Title: For the Martyrs
Review: A beautiful way of paying tribute to the brave heroes of the city. Not much to see at this place, just the smarak is there.

Name: Johnny J
Title: A Must Visit Fragrance Store In Lucknow
Review: There isn’t any fragrance that Opulence Perfumery cannot get you. They are a class apart. The store is a beauty for fragrance lovers. With a wide variety of choices, you won’t feel like leaving. Also, Mr. Gaurav is a such a gentleman who is always ready to assist and guide you perfectly. He is a well respected and a known person in the fragrance community in India. Don’t leave Lucknow without a quick trip to this store and have an unforgettable experience in the world of beautiful scents.

Name: Dev Rawat
Title: Hosting, Guiding, Quality that matters and its 10/10
Review: 100 words are less to appreciate spalshfragrance.I have visited lucknow from dehi only to experience their extreme range and its world class the best part is their way of hosting Gaurav bhai personally gave his time that went beyond but he was equally intersting in telling about everything from guiding to educate he showed some private collection as well. You may ask thousand query and he is the man with 1001 answers/guide. He and his assistant was extremely co operative unlike other top brands who just sell or judge. I am extreme fragrance explorer and that's the place where you can have proper time to experience everything with great gesture (very important). Guerlain and trudi bleu London will be my future houses to buy elite classy fragrances though i love heavy unsual stuff like chopard incense malaki. Must visit if you love fragrances. Gaurav bhai is a genuine gentlemen in fragrance business that I met in last 4 years.

Name: Indroneel
Title: Beautiful Shopping Experience
Review: I had to get the new Armai ADG EDP (2022), and this store was the only place in which I could get it. Mr. Gaurav was very courteous and he has both, an amazing range of fragrances and an amazing knowledge about fragrances. Absolutely brilliant shopping experience! He and his employees are always very well behaved and patient with the customers. I would give the experience a 10/10

Name: Rajasekar Selvaraj
Title: The best in India for Exotic and Niche perfumes
Review: I have known him for almost a Decade now and never ever have been disappointed by the device product or the price. The best in his business. Keep up the excellent work Gaurav

Name: Lalrema V
Title: 5 star
Review: What can i say about the owner gaurav ji, more like a brother to me. Since 2017 i have been buying from  him , customer care is 5 star. Cant thank him enough for all these years. Im happy he is growing every year

Name: Priya S
Title: Best Perfume shop in Lucknow
Review: This is one of the best perfume shops ever you will find in Lucknow. The hospitality is amazing aIong with the fragrances available at the showroom.i will highly suggest you to visit and make a purchase. I bought Gucci Bloom and it was love at first sniff.

Name: Kaustubh Verma
Title: Aaah extremely highly recommended
Review: Let me give you a story review, I spend 1hr 30min in that store and that politeness of staff and that friendly nature helped me a lot while deciding the perfect parfum for meh I got 3 of them and all those products were a complete satisfaction like seriously I never stayed in any store for so long I discovered a lot fragrance and all of those were genuine product if you are a fragrance lover you must visit it.. trust me you won’t get disappointed, highly recommended store and the best store for fragrance, having a vast collection of fragrances.. love being there and will visit again very soon..! One again I am saying do visit it and trust me you will love it ♥️

Name: Prajval J
Title: Excellent 👌
Review: Opulence perfumery has an amazing collection. The options are unrivalled, prices and quality can rival any Sephora or any luxury outlet throughout India. Have options to purchase decants, miniatures, travel kits, or testers individually which you wouldn't find anywhere. Go for it, you wouldn't be disappointed

Name: Abhishek V
Title: Best Fragrance Boutique in Lucknow
Review: Enjoyed my visit  to Opulence Perfumery  The store has such a huge range of fragrances that will make you go crazy. It was amazing time spent .. Best fragrance I came across was Trudi Siberian Oud and 24 Gold Elixir Scentstory .. Kudos to the team

Name: Debashree Mukherjee
Title: Must visit places in Gomtinagar
Review: Nice place with great collections and  vast varieties... Must visit if u wanna have some good experience

Name: Sherwin U
Title: Mesmerising experience
Review: The best place to get any perfume you desire at great prices. Whenever I place an order, i receive it within a day or two and that is just great service  !! Keep up with the customer satisfaction and smooth effortless transactions.

Name: R N
Title: Great service
Review: I have only discovered this store recently, but have had excellent experiences each time I order. A personalised handwritten note, a sample or two, a couple of other gifts such as a small notebook, have all accompanied the original perfumes I've ordered. Gaurav is available for support online whenever I message him, and I'm definitely a repeat customer for life! The inventory is vast, and there are samples and discovery sets aplenty if you're bored with your stash. Will continue to buy regularly.

Name: Shabeer km
Title: A Must visit for all perfume lovers
Review: I've been a customer of opulence perfumery for years now and they are yet to disappoint me.They deliver time and time again and I couldn't be happier with the professionalism the team has displayed. Their rates are unbelievable, deliveries are fast and most importantly the customer service is impeccableHere's to smelling great! Cheers!

Name: Manorath
Title: Gaurav has always offered discounts no matter what I buy. I will keep on buying fragrances from him.
Review: I am in buying perfumes from Gaurav for last four years. Experience with him has been excellent so far. he is a gem of a guy.

Name: Kiran
Title: Amazing fragrance store for perfume lovers
Review: The visit was an absolute delight.Opulence Perfumery not has good brands of fragrance but even their staff seems to be quite knowledgeable in terms of understanding the customer taste. It is one of the best perfume showroom in Lucknow

Name: Pratik
Title: Good
Review: One of the best place to buy perfume. Loved the experience. Thanks gaurav for the whole experience. Great work.

Name: Saurabh Sachan
Title: Awesome & Gaurav (Opulence Perfumery) both are same
Review: Gaurav is a master in perfumery, he knows what kind of perfume u r looking for n u ask about any fragrance he has it. I always follow his recommendatio. Great hostVr gud knowledge n the most authentic person from perfume industry.

Name: Shoaib Shariff
Title: Perfume lovers’ heaven
Review: Gaurav is a extremely patient and knowledgeable, and will help you choose the right perfume for you. Coming to the collection in his store, it is simply unmatched. A must visit for all perfume connoisseurs. His website is also kickass with superb delivery and service.

Name: goutham n
Title: Opulence perfumery Review
Review: Opulence perfumery has been doing wonderful job for perfume connoisseurs in India by bringing Desginers , Niche & Indie houses at affordable prices . I have been buying since 7 yrs & never had single issue with products & services . Thanks to the Gaurav bhai 😊

Name: Bhawini
Title: Perfume Paradise!
Review: This counts as one of the best experience as a fragrance enthusiast with the widest range of exquisite perfumes for everyone from every range. Absofreakinlutely recommended!!!

Name: M Kumar
Title: BEST PERFUME SHOWROOM IN LUCKNOW
Review: It is an amazing place to try new fragrances. the employee is quite polite and patient,.Ill highly recommend to everyone to visit once. The store is made up in 2 floors. The above floor is mecca for perfume lovers

Name: PRIYNASHU
Title: Sure shot stop if u r looking for authentic perfumes in Lucknow
Review: Amazing experience at opulence perfumery. Here u get all authentic perfumes with guarantee.Amazing variety they have.Though i m not perfume enthusiast but the staff as the owner Mr. Gaurav were amazing host n helped me choose a good perfume within my budget.I wud highly recommend this place for lucknowites.

Name: Davensh Y
Title: Lovely store with wide range of fragrances
Review: The store is amazing. I had lovely experience there. Glad that Lucknow has such niche fragrance store. It was much needed

Name: Abhishek Kumar
Title: Now in ruins
Review: This place is now in ruins,though a protected place.This was the last place of holding of rebels against british and a beautiful place then before being seized.Behind this structure is also a grave of captain wales.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Named on Nawab Asaf-ud-Daulah
Review: This bagh , garden ,made by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daulah  dating to the first decade of 19th century .The falling structures today  are symbolic of the vanishing heritage of the Aawdh rulers .What should have been preserved is falling apart in connivance with those who need to protect it .Herein also lies a grave of the British soldier Captain Frederick Wales .The same has been appropriated  by locals who propound the place as Captian Baba and  love birds come and pray on this whitewashed  grave seeking Baba's blessings for their romance !!Go see this place  before itvanishes .

Name: Anuradha Manjul
Title: Explore Lucknow – Musa Bagh, the Lost Gem, its role in the history of Lucknow and the history of Independent India
Review: Had never thought that cataloguing self-clicked photographs of one of the popular tourist points in Lucknow would lead to finding a treasure trove or as many would say Pandora’s box.A name which tumbled out was Musa Bagh. Don’t know but it had some unknown attraction; the next thing we knew was that on a sunny Saturday morning we were driving led by Google Aunty to find it. The location was on the IIM Road (from the trisection Bithauli Khurd crossing on Sitapur Road), one needs to cross the river Gomti and then take a left past the Garbage Landfill (yes the authorities in Lucknow have made the city garbage landfill right on the bank of the water source of the city River Gomti). One needs to drive for around a kilometre; and as Google says – the destination would be on your right.Some construction work is happening on the 2 lane one way road and we had to drive on the wrong side. There are no boards to inform where Musa Bagh is, though as per the Archaeological Survey of India, this is a nationally protected monument.   We could see traces of some old building, and seeing that it was it made of the Lakhori bricks (a speciality brick of the region from the time gone by), assumed that it was Musa Bagh. Yes, google confirmed that it was Musa Bagh. There was no sign board informing about the same, just a blue board proclaiming that it was a protected monument.Just before the entrance on the left there was garbage dumped (glass pieces), there were storage structures for cow dung cakes and there were two bulls (definitely of the villagers) sitting (properly tethered). Right at the entrance there were two males sitting and observing us.Nawab Asaf-ud-Daulah, 4th Nawab Wazir of Awadh (Oudh) has chosen this site and had a garden made here. Nawab Saadat-Ali-Khan (5th Nawab) built the garden complex. It was designed by the French General Claude Martin (yes a French serving in British East India Company, who had designed many buildings in Lucknow), who lies buried in Constantia or what today is known as La Martiniere Boys School (another one of his designs). The design was on the lines of an English Manor. The garden complex is on a raised mount, close to the river Gomti. Earlier the river was closer, and now it has moved slightly farther (changed its course). Around it are lush green fertile farms (they were there even when the garden complex was constructed) which thanks to unplanned development would soon turn into concrete jungle or barren land, if nothing is done.The garden complex was completed between 1803-1804 CE; far away from the main city, to serve as a country retreat. There is story about the name of the complex – many people believe that Musa Bagh was a corruption (as we say in Hindi – Apbransh) of Monsieur Garden (Frenchman’s garden) as they believe that Musa (meaning Moses in English) has no place in Islam (the Nawabs were followers of Shia sect of Islam – having their roots in Iran). This is incorrect. Musa Bagh could have been named in the memory or honour of Hazrat Musa, who is a revered prophet in Islam. Musa or Hazrat Musa is mentioned in Quraan (the holy book of Islam), he is revered by the Muslims the same way he is revered in Judaism. Yes Hazrat Musa and Moses are same. One can find mention of Hazrat Musa across Quarn – e.g. Surah Al-Baqara, 51, Surah Al-Baqara, 67, Surah Al-Maida, 22, Surah Al-Araf, 116, Surah Yunus, 81.Another name by which this garden complex has been referred by old European chroniclers is Baroween which could have been the anglicised version of berūn (an urdu word meaning outside or pertaining to the suburbs or country); the complex for sure would have been referred by this name as it was outside the main city.This complex was once the entertainment ground of the Nawab; the wild beast fights organised by him were famous among the Europeans and the natives; it is said the smaller animals like antelopes were trained to fight here.The structure today is in ruins. At the entrance there are stairs in a shape of semi- circle, broken at many places. The structure is without roof. The walls are made out of Lakhori bricks and had been plastered. The building would in its hay days would have had many floors, the level on which we were standing and a level above (because of the presence of pillared walls on the higher level). Some restoration work has been done by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) more than a decade ago.  We could see beautiful Roman style pillars on the top level, having beautiful stucco work. At centre there is a large hall (no roof), which is surrounded by a large wide gallery like area which earlier were rooms. At the corners of the hall, there are two cylindrical chamber with dome like structures having winding staircases reaching the upper level. The staircases are in bad shape and it’s advisable not to risk climbing them as it might damage them further. The domes have oval shaped windows (now just gaping oval holes). It is said that the Nawab used to watch the fights from these oval windows. There is small open well like structure (no water only plants and garbage) in this hall. According to historians this was part of Claude Martin’s architectural skills – using such sunken structures to cool the surrounding rooms, idea is to use the natural elements to cope with the heat. Nothing much remains in terms of the interiors except the floral vine patterns on the walls here and there, remnant of some faded patterns (probably some Frescos) on the walls.Musa Bagh played an important role in the revolt of 1857 (related to Awadh region), India’s first war of independence against the British or as the British call it the Sepoy Mutiny. It was here that the revolt in Awadh region started in 1857. Musa Bagh was occupied by 7th regiment of Oudh Irregular Infantry (British army) which had majority of native Indian soldiers. Adjutant of the regiment was Lt. Mecham of Madras army.
