On 30th April 1857, the soldiers refused to use the cartridges fearing that these were new beef & cow lard laden cartridges (the cover of cartridges was supposedly made out of lard from Beef and Pig which had to be chewed off). Lt. Mecham was able to pacify the soldiers informing that these were the same cartridges which they had used last fortnight. The soldiers proceeded with their practice. But Lt. Mecham was met with the same resistance next day, the soldiers were adamant and didn’t relent. By the 3rd of May 1857, the soldiers had decided to kill the Europeans in the regiment. Somehow this was avoided, the soldiers or the sepoys returned to their lines but refused to surrender their arms. They were paraded and subdued in complying.Sir Henry Lawrence, the chief commissioner of Oudh didn’t take the mutiny lightly. He marched to Musa Bagh (from the main city) with a force consisting of 32 foot European Battery, 32 regular native regiment infantry and 1 cavalry. The 7th regiment was rounded up and asked to lay down their arms, under force and fear they complied. The next day their leaders were captured who informed Sir Lawrence of the plans of General Uprising. They were hanged in-front of the regiment.The mutiny though curbed for the moments had left some sparks which in the coming months led to major events in the region and Lucknow. The scene of action moved from Musa Bagh to other places in the city and it was not until 1858 when it returned back.Interestingly it was at Musa Bagh where the insurrection ended in the year 1858 (almost a year later) in March. Begum Hazrat Mahal (the queen or the wife of Nawab Wazid Ali Shah) and his son Birjis Qadr along with many revolutionaries (according to records around 7000-9000 in numbers) made Musa Bagh as their headquarters in their resistance against the British army after being driven out from Kaiser Bagh Palace. The revolt was coming to an end in Oudh with British army gaining over and recapturing many areas in Lucknow. Sir Colin Campbell, Commander-in-Chief of British Army in India, ordered the commissioner of Oudh, Lt. General James Outram to capture Musa Bagh. On March 19, 1858, Outram marched towards Musa Bagh with 2 squadrons of the 9th Lancers, 1 company Royal Artillery, 1 company native sappers, Middleton’s Field Battery, 2 18-pounders, 2 8-inch howitzers, 4 S-inch mortars (all under Captain Carleton, R.A), 3 companies of 20th Regiment, 7 companies of 23rd Regiment, the 79th Highlanders, and the 2nd Punjab Infantry. He was supported by Hope Grant’s guns and musketry fire from the opposite side of the river.The complex was badly damaged by the British Army. The rebels either fled or were killed. The Queen and her son fled to Terai area and later to Nepal. Other important revolutionary leader Maulvi Ahmadullah Shah also fled (it was much later he was recaptured and hanged). The revolutionaries or rebels who were caught were hanged – Musa Bagh became the mass hanging area. So in a way the circle was complete – the revolt ended from where it had started.Once a thriving place, a classic piece of Indo-European architecture, is today in complete ruins. Thanks to the neglect by the authorities and complete disregard of its historic importance by the locals. The complex is being used by villagers and locals in the vicinity as open defecation area– we had to step carefully as there was human feaces  all around. We could also see broken syringes lying around – probably this place has become a favourite haunt for drug addicts. A gentleman walked in and started following us while we were exploring, on questioning him who he was he informed that he was the caretaker appointed by the ASI. On further probing he showed his helplessness in doing anything to stop open defecation in the complex.This place has lot of heritage value, has a beautiful architectural history. It needs immediate attention and awareness of its plight. If nothing is done soon, this hidden gem would soon be lost in the rubbles of time; and like many other places only pictures would remain to tell its story.Definitely worth a visit, not once but many times.

Name: kushBans
Title: Located far away.
Review: This sanctuary is located at a very far distance from the city on the kanpur-lucknow road . People and animals both are not found here.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Winter is good time to see
Review: Place is good but it is the best in winter time as you can enjoy lots of greenery here. Can be half day trip

Name: shobha agarwal
Title: Good for picnic purpose
Review: This place is good for picnic purpose but from wildlife point of view this does not seems to be a good choice. Even after spending half day could not spot some unique species.

Name: Shrikant S
Title: More of a picnic spot than nature sanctuary
Review: We went on a sunday afternoon. It came as no surprise that the place was managed poorly with officious forest officials giving tickets and asking for IDs and mobile phone numbers. Why a mobile phone number is required is beyond me!Inside the park, there were large groups of young students who had come for afternoon picnic, and with no interest in birds. So they were making ruckus, and disturbing the natural fauna. Interestingly, unlike other bird sanctuary which I have visited, there were no official guides who could spot and identify birds. It is up to the traveller to explore the pathways fully, and take pot luck at bird watching. I think that the best time would be to go there in the morning - 8ish, and spend the morning there. This would ensure that there are less picnickers and more nature lovers around.Also, the fee for taking a still camera is INR500 and gate ticket is INR 30. Swapping these rates around would also ensure that less number of picnickers enter the park, which would help in the overall maintenance and preservation. I guess that is the call the Forest Department will have to take.

Name: supriyo g
Title: Picnic spot
Review: Went there on a chilly December morning. Only change noticed is the nice walkway bordering, maybe, one side of the lake. Though no migratory birds were visible, could be due to the freezing conditions, the lake was in rather poor condition and full of weeds. Also one has to face the menace of the monkeys if not careful of their food items.Inspite of all this a large number of people had turned up both from Lucknow and Kanpur.There's a restaurant and a children's park , so one can enjoy with family.Entry fees is ₹ 30/- per head.

Name: chetan1586
Title: Great Weekend place !!
Review: You can cover nawabganj birds sanctuary on a weekend as this place is not very far away from Lucknow. It is known as a bird sanctuary.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: Nawabganj Birds Sanctuary
Review: Nawabganj Birds Sanctuary is a great weekend trip from Kanpur and Lucknow. This bird sanctuary is spread over  an area around 5 sq km.  Migratory birds in large numbers are attracted to this area during winters. There is a lake which is the perfect place for the migratory birds species. Proper time to visit the sanctuary is from December to February. There is a restaurant and bar . Lot of bird varieties are visible especially during morning hours but beware of monkeys.

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Wildlife Sanctuary Nawabganj,
Review: This is an old Bird sanctuary located on Kanpur - Lucknow Highway some 40 Kms. from Lucknow. This is worth seeing while passing through Lucknow.

Name: mdheman
Title: Bird Sanctury
Review: State Government is promoting this place all over in media and one will go with high expectation. It is approx 40 kms from Lucknow on Lucknow-Kanpur Highway and should be visited in winter months.Not much maintenance.Overall not worth a visit.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Great experience
Review: One of the major wildlife sanctuaries attractions of Uttar Pradesh, Nawabganj Birds Sanctuary is a great weekend trip from Kanpur and Lucknow. The small sanctuary, spread in an area of 3 sq km, attracts hundreds of migratory birds species during winters. The sanctuary is mainly the area around a shallow lake The lake forms a perfect place for the migratory and water birds for a long stay.

Name: NitinV81
Title: Enjoy winter afternoon and bonfire at night
Review: Situated 40 kms away from Lucknow on Kanpur highway this quite and less visited place can be visited after the monsoons to enjoy the lush greenry or during fading winters to enjoy the different varieties of birds that nest here during this season. One can plan after their lunch and can spend the night here and leave early morning next day. Decent rooms are available with restaurant facility. Bonfire can be lit on request.  Families with young children will have good fun in the park situated inside (though very few swings are there). Elder ones can enjoy their stroll around the lake. A deer park is also situated inside.

Name: manoj k
Title: good  place see the Birds
Review: its a small Wildlife Sanctuary. on way Lucknow to Kanpur. plainty of bird can be seen here . ponds and greenery fascinates to be here.

Name: Sudhakar7
Title: Silver plate addition who like jungle.... Birds, Butterfly  etc.....
Review: Welll... It's a bird space.... It's a jungle  area with a very large water pond ... And wide filled area with some animals.... One guest house with rooms also.... And some watch towers there... Use these for watching tree top Birds and their nest...In very early morning find too many birds seen .. And in evening sunset time... Jan to mid February more migrated birds very easily seen...there... Some neel gaye also seen there.. Different ducks and floating birds also seen.. And too much butterfly also these on sides of pond.... Better to go with mono lens viewer, binoculars, if you go with camera then must have telephoto lenses...

Name: shivshankarsingh
Title: Birds Watching Around Lucknow /Kanpur
Review: Nawabganj Bird Sanctuary is located on Lucknow-Kanpur highway. It's managed by the State Forest Department. Proper time to visit the sanctuary is from December to February. There are restaurants and bar . Lot of bird varieties are visible especially during morning hours. Beware of monkeys.

Name: Satheesh Babu
Title: a leisure place
Review: I had been to this place during the  last week of November  with a lot of expectations, but unfortunately there was only a small pocket of water with a few birds in that. Only pleasant thing was the  relaxed walk around the lake which definitely will take a very long time if we need to move to all places ( I had to cut short at many places due to no birds or a simply dryland there). A walk into the woody cover gave a sight of a few more birds hid in the trees.  It is better if we ask the office people or anybody who had been there before going there as it will be these people who will be able to tell us the avian visitor crowd.

Name: anuj729
Title: Once a golden tourist spot now mismanaged.
Review: If you are travelling to kanpur via Lucknow then it is situated on the midway mark approx 40 kms from both the cities.I won't recommend the place if your sole purpose is to visit it.There is a motel having 20 rooms to stay overnight and a nice Cafeteria premises ideal for bird watching during winters.The water body is mostly dry all around the year.Although government has huge plans and budget to facelift the place but still awaiting the grant.Thirty years back when it was newly opened there was full water body a dear park and migratory birds all around with a wide variety of flaura and fauna but all lost.Hope to revive it soon.Best to avoid it. If going to kanpur then only halt for a cup of tea.

Name: guddu1954
Title: migratory birds for bird watchers
Review: The sanctuary is on Lucknow -Kanpur highway .During winter months you can see birds migrating from Siberia .The place is very poorly maintained.Lot more is needed.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Wildlife park
Review: It is located 15 km away from city. Aim to protect endangered crocodiles. Children park is also located nearby

Name: 592abck
Title: nothing to see here
Review: I personally don't like crocodiles so I did not like this place. I cannot believe someone may like crocodiles.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Crocodile Nursery
Review: Crocodile Nursery is a nice place to visit and get to see wildlife up close in Lucknow. It is in Kukrail Reserve Forest.

Name: Amit M
Title: Close to nature
Review: Crocodile Nursery in is Kukrail reserve and if time permits one should visit to see the Crocodiles in Kurail. Since childhood I have loved to see the crocodile and it still impress me to visit these places.

Name: Yaatendra Mamgain
Title: Kukrail lungs of Lucknow
Review: This is an amazing 1500 hectare of reserve forest amongst a thickly populated township. It is an asset to Lucknow but the presence of roads that facilitate shortcuts to locals must be stopped. The upkeep around the crocodile park is nice and well maintained. But a lot of other old infrastructure is in ruins. The government must take it seriously and turn this on it a thick neem saal and teak forest. It's nice to be walking in this forest. The current forest becomes barren during the patjhar but must be glorious after monsoons.

Name: aks19682003
Title: Natural Place to visit
Review: Nice place for natural seen you may plan for picnic you must have 2 to 3 hr to visit this place. Children will find their interesting points.

Name: _adhikarigautam10
Title: picnic spot..
Review: we dont say it kukrail reserve forest ..for lucknowwale its picnic spot ..but dont know why? ..nothing like picnic spot ..the jungle is superb place behind the reserve..i explored it with my friends..i find it good..

Name: Shruti_Poki
Title: Kukrail Reserve Forest
Review: It a good sight seeing place and if you are amazed with crocodiles and natural beauty this is a perfect place for you to visit. Tt is basically Reserve Forest aiming at  wildlife conservation programmes.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: they come in all shapes and sizes
Review: A must see as it is rare to see so many crocodiles and alligators in all possible shapes and sizes in one place. The walk inside is also pleasant and the lawns well maintained.

Name: Dryogendranath M
Title: Crocodile Nursery
Review: This is good picnic spot in the city and a point of attraction for the local residents and people coming from outward.

Name: Arpitgupta25
Title: Simple visit place
Review: Now there are few crocodiles in this area but go atleast once to see crocodiles and thrill  adventure place..

Name: NitinDhyani
Title: Average place
Review: Crocodile Nursery is an average place until unless you love to see crocks. World famous crock breed is found here and some one who loves wild life can visit and can take some good pictures.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Nice place to visit if you are a crocodile lover
Review: Very good place I like it, because there are very limited place in India for Crocodiles and here people of this place takes care of them. If you are a Crocodile lover then go here and you can see many types of Crocodile here.

Name: Prashant G
Title: the perfect date with crocodile - a must visit in lucknow
Review: had a adventure trip with colleagues to this forest and crocodiles all around was one of the dangerous and awesome thrill everyone had.

Name: manoj k
Title: Heaven of Crocs
Review: perfect place for Crocodile lovers. one plan picnic  over there. you can see the plenty of crocs there. good place to visit in leisure time

Name: Nipurn B
Title: Could have been a better place!!
Review: The place is located within city limits rather in between city.As you enter the area you get the fresh feel of air since it's all forest around.You need to cross a toll and then give a parking fees for car/scooter.No ticket needs to be purchased.You need to walk long pathway to reach the actual nursery area where you will find crocodiles.There is a mother pond also which has some big crocodiles but it's little risky since there are no security arrangements no guards.If any mishap happens you may be at danger.The fence for the big pond is also broken you can actually go inside the big crocodiles pond at your own risk though!! Advice for travelers from other cities/country - localities don't go there since mostly love birds are involved there into obscene acts.Park is huge for playing and relaxing.You may not be able to see a croco there but surely you will spot on love birds involved in obscene activities.PS- no pun intended.!!

Name: Molay A
Title: excellent place for outing
Review: kukrail crocodile nursery is located in kukrail forest reserve a little away from city. though there is no entry fee but you need to pay toll of Rs 50 to access the park.its one of a kind of experience. here you get to see the alligators from hatching to growing stage.they have a very good no of alliagators & few crocodile in these reserve.good for outing

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: outing
Review: A picnic spot, as it is named locally also, is a good place  for  family outing  and  leaning  about crocodile and its siblings ( alike cultivation)

Name: Kushal N
Title: Oasis for the replites
Review: Well placed and quite well maintained nursery.  It is an oasis "well almost" in the city periphery.  A wonderful place to hangout and see the crocodiles and tortoise.  Though the management is forced to keep some enclosures out of bound for the visitors; it is a worth visiting place.

Name: anuj729
Title: Indeed a Crocodile Park but fading Glory.
Review: Past thirty years I am watching this beautiful place dying due to lack of funds and neither of the state governments paying any attention to maintain a place which could be a must visit for every visitor.There is a guest house but not available for general people. Huge lawns are there were localities go for picnics during holidays.A small forest is also around.In winters if you have an extra time and have small kids then you can try this place otherwise in summers it will be painful to visit the place as the cars are stopped half a kilometre before the entry gate of the park.

Name: guddu1954
Title: find a better place to spend time
Review: I had visited the place long back only to hope that with years passing by there would be some improvements.My latest visit was equally disappointing.

Name: BanishSharma
Title: Are you kidding??
Review: A Crorodile Nursery, you gotta be kidding? This place is nothing but a tiny forest with all dirt/waste. Please visit this place only if this is the last place to visit on the earth or you don't value your time (rather want to insult urs). Can't write more about it.

Name: TravelerForLife_Ro
Title: kukrail - skip this if u value your time
Review: This place is all hype. The crocs are mostly babies. The place is not at all maintained. Seems like the forgotten section of some zoo.Most of the folks we saw here were locals coming to have a picnic.Definitely would not recommend!

Name: JoyBose
Title: Definitely worth seeing to get an idea of history of india
Review: It is located inside lucknow zoo and needs a separate entry ticket apart from zoo ticket. It has 3 floors. Remember to see all the galleries, some are at the end of narrow corridors and can be easily missed. It's filed with many hidden gems even though it's maintenance can be improved. It has buddha gallery, jain art gallery, coins, natural history section, war museum section, egypt section etc. Wpuld highly recommend it to see. The bronzes are pretty good and so is the egypt section.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Awful- Don't Waste your time and money
Review: The most foolish thing is location of the Museum right inside the Lucknow Zoo ...which means one has to buy a zoo entry ticket ( as I was forced to buy before being allowed to walk in towards the museum ) and then one buys again an entry ticket to the museum -it can only happen in India where  history and archaeological museum is located inside a zoo !The displays are tardy employees hired for life to spend their life there watching on their mobiles movies think of visitors as disturbance ..many exhibits  removed what are there are not dusted >Indian bureaucracy ripping tax payers money by holidaying here .Just Avoid This Place .

Name: Saif Khan
Title: Awesome
Review: It's really good museum I really Love it too much and  Egyptian gallery is good over all I say that I have a great feeling when I visited there I say to all of u should watch

Name: Joe
Title: Disgraceful museum
Review: This is the worst museum I've ever visited. Dilapidated, dirty and dull. The display cases look as though they were banged together 50 years ago and haven't by touched since. The staff were disinterested or unhelpful, and spoke little English if any. I felt unwelcome, and the place had the atmosphere of a funeral parlour. The only good thing was that the entrance fee was only 50 rupees (though we had to pay 80 to enter the zoo within which the museum stands. Don't waste your time. It's a disgrace.

Name: DGK, UK
Title: Very poor, old and dirty place
Review: Regrettably after visiting the excellent folklore museum in Pune, this one in Lucknow is not recommended to visit. The very few artefacts are poorly displayed, explanations in English are mostly absent, dust, rubbish and dirty toilets make it unworthy of a visit. We had to wait in the cold for the Museum to open at 10.30 and none of the staff could communicate with us in English and confusion prevailed. You have to enter first the Zoo and pay a ticket of 80 Rupees per person and then at the Museum foreigners pay an additional ticket of 50 rupee each. What a waste of time! Best to be avoided.

Name: durham05
Title: Mummy is the best
Review: This museum is located within the zoo so costs in total 130 rupees to get in. Enjoyed seeing the mummy but most of the Egyptian exhibits are modern copies. Other galleries are good and quite a lot to see. Good value.

Name: Gene R J
Title: An interesting but tired collection better suited for locals.
Review: We took an Uber from our La Place Sarovar Hotel 1.7 km to the Lucknow Zoo. After paying 60 Inr each, we followed the colored zoo signs 1 km east to this museum.  The ticket office opened at 10:40 AM where we paid 50 Inr each before walking to the main hall built in 1963. The 1st floor Egyptian Room with its glass cased 1000 BC Mummy was the best exhibit. Then we climbed 3 1/2 sets of stairs to view the other rooms dedicated to archaeological antiquities, Buddha's dioramas, guns and swords, ancient coinage, Buddhist Thankas, 18th-19th C paintings, and natural animals.  Most of the displays show their age with difficult lighting, lack of English descriptions/dates, and overall a semi clean facility.  But it was Tuesday morning and the litter was being swept down the stairwells and the red spittle was being removed from the corners. For a brighter sight, we took an Uber  3 km east to La Martiniere College to see the beautiful "Constantia" Palace, noted as the best preserved colonial (1790's) building in Lucknow.

Name: ashok_shrikhande
Title: State Museum
Review: The State Museum is a four-story building established in 1863 in Lucknow. It is one of the oldest and largest multipurpose museum located in the state of Uttar Pradesh.Initially, it only had a collection of Awadh arts and contemporary Awadh objects. But later on, the collection was expanded to many antiquities exhumed from nearby places. Many of them are particularly from the place where the Lord Buddha grew up. The museum today has a variety of bronzes, sculptures, paintings, etc. The sculptural masterpieces displayed in the museum date back to the 3rd century AD. The centre of the attraction of this museum isEgyptian mummy and a wooden sarcophagus. The museum exhibits hundreds of antiquities including numismatics, paintings, art and archaeology, manuscripts, and anthropology.The design and construction of the museum offer visitors the visual accounts of the freedom struggle of 1857. The museum has been divided into two parts- ground floor and basement parts. There is a huge double columned portico at the southern direction of the entrance of ground floor. The museum has also added a new gallery to the basement.It exhibits a range of artworks recovered during the excavation of the south part of Residency.

Name: Aarav K
Title: State Museum
Review: State museum is in banarsibagh. This is very old museum. There are many such historical things in this museum that are worth seeing. Good place for history lovers.

Name: P. V. Arul
Title: State museum, lucknow
Review: The collections are good. But the upkeep is not up to the mark. Compared to several other museums in India, this is not a very impressive one.

Name: bukc
Title: Nice museum. Heritage value
Review: The State Museum, located within the Zoo, is a well kep museum. It has artifacts from the Mauyan Shunga and Kushana era (3 Century BCE onwards).But the newly created Egyptian gallery around the mummy of 13 year old girl and the casing is unique to this museum and surely worth a visit.This museum should have a guided tour programme like they have at the National Museum Delhi.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: State Museum, 20 Sep'15
Review: 20 September, 2015.The State Museum is a hidden gem in the city of Lucknow,curiously enough, co-located with the Lucknow Zoo, and locatedright inside the complex. The museum is old, but extremely neatand clean, and well-maintained. We had a short visit to the placeon Sunday, 20 September, 2015. The place is spread over quite afew floors, and has a large number of exhibits of India's historyand culture, to natural history. The historical artifacts rangefrom Harappan era seals, to famous statues and statuettes(especially of the Buddhist era), and also, historicalphotographs of Lucknow! Junior found the Natural History sectionquite exciting, with stuffed animals in very realistic settings.Another curiosity is a Tu-124V aircraft parked right outside themuseum, a VIP transport aircraft, which is preserved there.This has quite a lot of attraction for aviation buffs, since this isone of the two Tu-124V planes of the Indian Air Force, and one of the veryfew actually built in the former Soviet Union.

Name: Shubham Gupta
Title: Its awesome place for art lover
Review: here you can see art of ancient india as this is museum . but it a great place of history lovers and i love this place

Name: Arpit141
Title: Nice experience
Review: The Lucknow State Museum takes the guests to the trip of history and lets the history freaks lost in the primordial times. This museum is extremely impressive with its etchings, decorative arts, woodworks, housing sculptures, paintings, bronze statues from the ancient epoch.

Name: pensioner090
Title: Some fantastic pieces in this large collection
Review: You do have to pay to see the zoo in order to get to the Museum, but that's OK as the zoo is not too bad! The museum is huge, but you can move through it quickly and stop when you find some special items to spend time appreciating. There are some terrific stone carvings in the collection and a range of other artefacts which give a good introduction to Uttar Pradesh archaeology.

Name: chetan1586
Title: Glimpse of History
Review: State museum is a good place for history lovers. There are a lot of figures & collections of Hindu & Buddhist artifacts.The only issue is that you have to first enter the zoo & then only you can visit the state museum by paying the entry prices again for it

Name: sandy c
Title: Pay twice to kill a little time.
Review: Yes- first you must pay to get into the zoo, then again to enter the museum.  If you're a foreigner you'll pay higher prices both times.Anyhow, this dusty old building has a half-interesting collection.  Not much info and looking at the state of things here, that ain't going to change.Lot's of Buddhist and Hindu stuff here, but you'd really have to be an enthusiast to know what's what.  For some reason the applied arts section consists of knives and machine guns.There is a really dumbed down history of the Buddha diorama, I guess directed at kids.Most of the building seems abandoned.  You could kill a little time here, but don't expect enlightenment.

Name: Durgesh K
Title: A are collection of artifacts from around the world.
Review: A well established and well preserved collection of artifacts are here for display.It doesn't only put forth the history of Awadh or UP or North India but it showcase a wide verity of knowledgeable pieces of history for the visitors. The entrance is through the Lucknow zoo. One can take one's 4 wheeler inside with proper permissions and on conditions that it will be parked in State Museum Campus. The compound also houses a Crafts Museum. The state museum is decently maintained (in fact it is more or less similar to other Archaeological museums across the country). The place has three floors open to public and houses items from various eras in Indian history including Indus Valley civilisation. It also has a special section on the state of Awadh. One interesting attraction here is an Egyptian Mummy - though not in so well lit area.

Name: Anuradha Manjul
Title: A good place to visit to get a hang of history of not only Awadh but also India
Review: As an ardent lover of Indian history, iconology and architecture, this place is always is my first preference. The entrance is through the Lucknow zoo. One can take one's 4 wheeler inside with proper permissions and on conditions that it will be parked in State Museum Campus. The compound also houses a Crafts Museum. The state museum is decently maintained (in fact it is more or less similar to other Archaeological  museums across the country). The place has three floors open to public and houses items from various eras in Indian history including Indus Valley civilisation. It also has a special section on the state of Awadh. One interesting attraction here is an Egyptian Mummy - though not in so well lit area. This place would be a good experience for all history lovers and school kids.

Name: wanderlust_AGH
Title: Worst museum I've ever visited
Review: Came here on the recomendation of a local, I have seen better exhibitions in school halls...have to walk through the zoo to get here, that in itself is depressing enough if you have any ounce of humanity in you; dont bother visiting eithe of these.

Name: Binay Kumar P
Title: Require huge upgradation
Review: Very small area compared to other science cities in the country,sill the 3d show is missing, when the whole state is on the road without any mask,sanitizer, the scholls are open,then why the show is off?

Name: Shobha
Title: Knowledge and fun loving experience
Review: I went last weekend at science City Lucknow..it's very nice place for all age groups cause there is playing area and sitting area also available for older people. There is a big activity area lawn all activities related to science and technology. They also provide you a good cafeteria to lunch with your friend and family.they also conducte my type of shows like 3D SHOW and Ximax shows you can experience many different things.you will see also a fish gallery aqaurium like under water effects really a good place for all.

Name: Ashish Gupta
Title: Good Place to learn about science with fun
Review: It was Sunday and we planned to visit Planetarium but one person suggested to visit this centre and we went here. From the entrance you will find numerous equipment placed to tell you and feel the science behind each equipments. It was fun to use all equipments and at last there was this show which presents technology of working of Aircraft Carriers.

Name: Nupur S
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Being here like to spend some time with wild life stuff and collecting knowledge about them for it your knowledge.

Name: Sameer D
Title: Nice experiments; Good experience; 3D show is for kids only
Review: Nice optical and mechanical experiments. My 12 year old son enjoyed it a lot. I khad fun with him. Overall it was a very good experience. 3D show is for kids only - nowadays 3D movies are a commonplace. Scimax show was good. But they could have used the theatre for something better (compared with my trip to Boston Science Museum long time ago). The real fun is the experiments - spend more time there.The canteen is below average. They should better hand it over to a good food chain.

Name: Inspired_by_Xperiences
Title: Good place to visit for kids
Review: This place displays some of the science experiments that students read in their books but most never get a chance to see them as a working model or even try it themselves. This place holds a special place in my memories. As kids, we used to love going to the science centre and enjoy all the experiments and tools at display. I visited this place after a long time to relive my childhood memories and also introduce my 6 years old daughter to the same. While this place still holds the same charm as it used to a couple a decades back, many of the installation are in bad state or not working. One added attraction is the kids area which houses a small play area for smaller kids. Overall felt good going back and my daughter enjoyed the trip too, but would have definitely loved if things were in a better state. With all the technology and plethora of information that today's generation has access to on tips of a finger, this place may seem dated..but still holds the attention of all its visitors. A must visit for all kids.

Name: infojonny
Title: Main Ghat
Review: This ghat is not so good place to visit but if you want to spend time and to explore more so you can visit here

Name: Aarav K
Title: Nothing special
Review: This is not must visit place, if you have the time you can pass the time here. There is nothing special to see.

Name: Dharmendra S
Title: Nice place at Gomti River bank
Review: This place is very good architecture work and any one can like this place. This place is located at the Gomati River bank near Ghanta ghar. Very good for kids.

Name: raks125
Title: okay type
Review: this is one time watch place if you are in lucknow for some other work. this is very very average place and it should not be in the top priority list if you are in lucknow for sightseeing.

Name: kushBans
Title: Good location
Review: The palace itself is not so much magnificent but it is well maintained from inside as well as outside.

Name: shobha agarwal
Title: Just a residential colony
Review: Nothing unique and no need to visit this place. It is just a residential colony of government officers wherein you will get to see huge bungalows of IAS officers.

Name: sshuklalko
Title: It's Government officers residential colony...
Review: It has nothing royal or regal only huge bungalows for IAS officers were there ,now they are constructing apartments inside colony so lots of dust and pollution .The only speciallity is AKANSHA Foods which provide  snakes items and grind masala .

Name: sujatapant
Title: Nothing regal about this palace
Review: This is now the property of the GOVT and houses the officers of the state GOVT . Nice open spaces , green area good for walks , and akanksha is here , which is a ngo run by women from the weaker section ,who prepare the most delicious snacks.

Name: indiatravel35
Title: historical place and now residential colony
Review: this place has historical significance, now resident colony inside this place ,was built by Spencer Harcourt Butler.

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Great Rajastani Architecture
Review: It is beautiful palace was used for the official residence of Sir Harcourt Butler. After independence, the Palace had been the academic centre (Library)  of the Indian Council of Philosophical Research (ICPR) until 2005 when the Council vacated the Palace following the Supreme Court order. Built in Rajasthani style, it is a four faceted  palace  and a rare object of architecture.There is a lake adjacent to the Palace which provides a magnificent look to the Palace. The Palace is  the property of to Raja of Mahmudabad, Mohammed Amir Mohammed Khan, hence you can see it from outside only.

Name: rchohan
Title: residential colony
Review: it is a residential colony near botanical gardens in Lucknow and houses the elite class of Lucknow . there is a small water body near the place but mainly residential area

Name: ayushagarwal022
Title: good place for spending time
Review: Good place to spend quality time with family and one can do shopping at reasonable and competitive rates.

Name: shobha agarwal
Title: Good place for shopping
Review: Located at the centre of the city, it is a perfect place to fulfill your shopping bucket. One will find almost all the brands that a common man would think of.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Nice mall
Review: Vishal shopping mall is a very nice mall. There are several shopping outlets there. The parking is also available.

Name: 268yusufn
Title: everything available
Review: Vishal shopping mall is mind-blowing maill.You can get everything easly and it is very well in convenient location. Price is also reasonable.

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice Shopping mall...
Review: A good mall if you want to have shopping and some good food. The malls is quit big and have good options and showrooms for shopping as well nice restaurants. Ample parking space is also there.

Name: credit356
Title: Good shopping mall
Review: This is one of  the good shopping malls in Lucknow. It is  located  very well  in a  convenient location . Good  parking place and  public utilities. Many  shops of  international  and  Indian  brands.

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: Good one.
Review: This mall is in city area and has a lot of shops and brands inside. The variety is sufficient and it ranges from traditional to modern.

Name: Afsar Jahan
Title: Habibullah Estate
Review: The place is an amazing dining and shopping venue. What more if you like clicking pictures amidst the greenery .yes,exactly. I have been visiting this place regularly since last month and I recommend you all to visit this place

Name: SHIVI AWASTHI
Title: habibullah estate visit
Review: I visit this  place almost daily.The place has cherry tree cafe which provides with best meals and drinks to quench my hunger.The place has designer stores of reputed designers and the collection they hold is really splendid.Satyapaul has amazing  tie and bag collection which I keep bying prominently.ever want to know the secret of my beautiful pictures ,come to the estate and get yourself clicked in the greenery that envelops the estate.When in lucknow,visit this place .

Name: niya27
Title: Not an attraction
Review: Habibullal Estate is not a tourist place. It is a complex with few shops such as Anokhi, parlour etc. It should be skipped.

Name: kushBans
Title: Okayish place
Review: You can find some decent stores here. We went to geetanjali saloon and the experience was up to the mark for us.

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Shopping !!
Review: Habibullah estate is a nice place for shopping at his a great stores and saloon. This place is a god shopping option in the city.

Name: 268yusufn
Title: GOOD LANE
Review: This lane has few store but good ones. its has designer store and even superb saloon geetanjali . Even cherry tree on the same lane.

Name: anshoobajaj
Title: Charm and atmosphere
Review: Being rehabilitated finally! Dont know how much historical significance it has but it exudes charm and has a great deal of atmosphere. Getting to it is a problem though- through the Military Cannt.

Name: infojonny
Title: Not well maintain
Review: This bibiyapur kothi is not well maintained the condition of the building is not so good the government has to look

Name: Aarav K
Title: Need Maintenance
Review: Bibiyapur Kothi condition is very bad, this kothi needs strict maintenance. For this reason very few people come here. Best place for history lovers.

Name: Stupid E
Title: Bibiyapur Kothi
Review: Very old kothi. Kothi is not maintained properly. Kothi needs maintenance, but can be visited once in the kothi.

Name: Manish B
Title: Beautiful Building
Review: Excellent European style building at the bank of river gomti was build by Nawab Asif-ud-Daula. Now most of the part is in bad condition and needs restoration. Its one good place to visit.

Name: Sajeed K
Title: Double Storeyed Structure
Review: It is located on the right bank of river Gomti on the south east of the city. This royal building was built by Nawab Asaf-ud-Daula. The double storeyed structure was simple but attractive in design, consisting of spacious halls, high ceilings with wooden beams and rafters, spiral stair cases (probably first time in India) and imposing double columns. The large hall was tastefully embellished with white and blue European tiles. The building is constructed on a rectangular ground plan with lakhauri bricks laid in lime mortar and coated with thick lime plaster

Name: raks125
Title: good
Review: the building is old but worth watching once. it has not been maintained properly. if it is had been maintained properly it would have been a excellent place.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Nice experience
Review: Bibiapur House (Bibiapur Kothi) in Lucknow  is located on the right bank of river Gomti on the south east of the city.The double storeyed structure was simple but attractive in design, consisting of spacious halls, high ceilings with wooden beams and rafters, spiral stair cases (probably first time in India) and imposing double columns.

Name: Shobha V
Title: glimpse of british monument
Review: #its a relics of 2 stored building.# go if u takes interest in historical monuments .# max. part has been damaged but the renovating work is in progress.#  love the way of kothi bibiyapur.

Name: abhineetsingh
Title: Bibiyapur Kothi
Review: A neglected monument....what else... ruins only tell the grand history of this monument....was disappointed once reached there as nothing  was to see except walls...

Name: Sarbari G
Title: a garden house for the nawab and his beloved
Review: situated on the banks of the Gomti river (at its romantic best too) is the Bibiyapur Kothi, surrounded by Army barracks.  The building itself is in shambles, but is being repaired by ASI.  It has a lovely garden cum large field attached to it and which ends at the Gomti river.  worth a visit.

Name: Arvind Misra
Title: Best shopping destination
Review: One of the best place in Lucknow to shop. Middle class to premium segment.. wide range of products available here. Thank you Pallasio for introducing Gant, Superdry, GAS, AX, The White Crow and The Collective in Lucknow. Food court is noisy but ok to sit and eat. The Big Grill and Manbhavan are best dine in option inside the Mall. Wide range of Jewellery segment also available here. So overall it’s one stop shopping place just come with ur time and money and surely u will get what u want. Overall best shopping destination in Lucknow till date.

Name: Ashish P
Title: NO Social Distancing inside the INOX Theatres in the Palassio Mall! UNACCEPTABLE
Review: DATE: 07.11.2021The Mall looks Grand like a palace! All good from outside but the INOX Theatres inside are NOT AT ALL ADHERING to the Social Distancing norms! NO social distancing observed while ALLOCATING SEATs and people coughing inside the Theatre!Highly UNACCEPTABLE and UNETHICAL!I wont go there again!

Name: Arpit Bajpai
Title: Pathetic staff
Review: the mall staff is terribly rude, plus one of the staff coughing. When I said that I am going to complain he said do whatever you want. Pathetic

Name: Gobindalal Mukhopadhyay
Title: With family
Review: Nice place , clean and less crowded suitable for spending time at Lucknow on the week end. Food court is excellent with all branded companies to serve food.

Name: Susej B
Title: Not a tourist attraction.
Review: The first astro-turf pitch for hockey in Lucknow was laid here and located at The Lucknow Sports College !

Name: Sundeepgupta
Title: Grand.
Review: This place is always full of player and sport persons. Visit this place if you love to sports, health and fitness.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Nice Visit
Review: Dhyan Chand Astroturf Stadium or Dhayan Chand Sports College is a field hockey stadium in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, India named after Indian hockey player Dhyan Chand. It serves as the home ground for Hockey India League franchise, Uttar Pradesh Wizards.

Name: SKBhatiya
Title: Good Place to see Once
Review: A good stadium built a little far from the city but the astroturf is of high quality, i remember there were some international hockey matches played here a few years ago...

Name: abhineetsingh
Title: Dhyan Chand Astroturf Stadium
Review: Dhyan Chand Astroturf Stadium os next to Dhayan Chand Sports College on kursi road lucknow is a field hockey stadium in Lucknow I named after  hockey player Dhyan Chand. Its also home ground for Hockey India League franchise, Uttar Pradesh Wizard

Name: Nupur S
Title: Walking point
Review: Cool environment in evening and good to do yoga walking and other exercise. Famous among localites around it

Name: Indira IV
Title: A chapter from Indian Freedom struggle - Chandrasekhar Azad
Review: We visited the PARK dedicated to the Indian freedom fighter Chandrasekhar Azad. Previously this park was known as Alfred park during the British rule of India. Chandrasekhar Azad was killed by the British Police here - we can see the tree behind which he tried to hide from the British police and where he fell to the bullets. A statue has been raised in his memory here

Name: akankshacoolgirl
Title: Great Food !!
Review: Shivala Ghat serves both the purpose, first to visit a tourist attraction and second the food joints and stalls at the place which are simply amazing

Name: mhussain_bohra
Title: Religious feel with food experince
Review: As it is located near the Ganga river, it is usually over crowded. However one must eat food provided by the local vendors.

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice place for some local food...
Review: The Ghat is situated near to Ganga River. Its considered to be spiritual place but we like the local food and chat which is available in this area. We often visit here for the food and the feel.

Name: Pandey Mahendra
Title: Peacefully and perfect place
Review: I feel spirituality in the air of near Ganga and shivala ghat is the one of them.Food products like chat and pani batasas are best.

Name: kushBans
Title: Boring
Review: Located in one of the most prominent place in lucknow, this place is not well maintained.  Will be more crowded if improved.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Knowledge point
Review: If you are interested to gain knowledge in peaceful place then this is right place of our choice to fill the requirement.

Name: ayushagarwal022
Title: needs improvement
Review: this used to be a good place for kids till few years back but now then need some innovation and out of box thinking to maintain its relevance in this fast changing world

Name: infojonny
Title: Sangrahalaya
Review: This Bal sangrahalaya is best place for kid they can learn much more over here and they can also enjoy

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice place for families to go with Kids...
Review: The place is most suitable for kids. The collection is nice, it used to be more fun and better before but now that charm is not there. Also it is more for other commercial purposes now than it used to be.

Name: garhwalia1994
Title: Bog collection
Review: They have very huge collection here. Many people with their family come here and maintain the silence during here. Worth place to go.

Name: abhayverma2007
Title: Okay place
Review: Good place to go with children but whenever there is any knd of show or special activity. Children can enjoy there when there is any show.

Name: Ahmad Faiz Mustafa
Title: Once a Gem, now its gone...
Review: Until 10 years this place was a fun and informative place for the kids to hangout and learn.But now it is taken over by an adjecent school, Bal Vidya Mandir as part of the school's expansion...And nowadays, its lawns are used as venue for marriages.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Not well maintained
Review: As it is a historical place was very much excited to visit here . But when I visited here all my excitement was finished . This bagh is  not well maintained and not clean also .

Name: durham05
Title: Small
Review: This is an ok park but not huge and won't take long to look round. Place associated with 1857 battle of Lucknow.

Name: Harsh V
Title: not so good
Review: i was specially visit sikandar bagh to see the beautiy but my mood is spamed when we visit the place the place is closed i am so angry and there no proper timing instructions very bad managment

Name: baburammarch25
Title: Signifies the great landmark of India's first war of Independence.
Review: This great historical landmark is not as much maintained as it should be, give the great historical significance that it stands for. The garden area is well maintained. However, work can be done to restore glory of the architecture.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Sikandar Bagh
Review: This is a historical place. Not well maintained. If you are a history lover, you should definitely check it once. There is nothing special for everyone else.

Name: Rajani B
Title: Park within Botanical Research Institute
Review: This is a park within the National Botanical Institute which was built in the year 1800. The park was named after the queen of Wajid Ali Shah , who was the last ruler of Awadh.  The historical importance of this place is that it was the site of India's first war of Independence.  The garden is a beautiful and well maintained one.

Name: chetan1586
Title: Decent Attraction !!
Review: Sikandar bagh is not a very well known tourist destination & can be covered if you have some time during the day.

Name: Atif M
Title: historical monument
Review: historical monument, with lot of green space, but badly kept. good for history lovers.in the middle of the city.

Name: manoj k
Title: small place  need to go to see it  specially
Review: this is small place, you   need to go to see it  specially rather can be seen while passing though the road next to it.

Name: Rudrapratap R
Title: nothing very special
Review: Shikandar bagh made by saadat ali khan , nawab of awadh.Not very popular, near by of Hazrat ganj. and gomti rever.

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: place
Review: A place of interest from Mughal period. Quiet and calm place amid busy city area near hazarat ganj. One can appreciate the old building and structure here

Name: ameoba88
Title: Should not be an option of TripAdvisor
Review: Seriously, no joke. The only reason this is up here on TripAdvisor is because it's a protected site by the Architectural Society of India. Wouldn't take you even 5 minutes to visit - and you'd hardly be adding any value in those 5 minutes either.It is a smallish park basically - with a few benches around. A good place to sit and have a conversation perhaps, but it's located at a major intersection so pretty noisy. There is a largish arched doorway - inside of which construction is stored. There's a small masjid which you can't enter unless you're a muslim - not stand out from an architectural PoV anyways. Annd that's about it.

Name: KGB777
Title: A small garden with a renovated gateway
Review: Worth a quick stop to soak up the atmosphere of old Lucknow. Some peace and tranquillity near a major intersection.

Name: Deepak P
Title: nooooooooo
Review: its awasome place to roaming but toooo.... noisy............

Name: indiatravel35
Title: Medium size mall at good location
Review: This mall is located in the ashiana area of lucknow and as this has been open recently so not all shops and food courts(a few open like pizza Hut, wow momo)  are  open.  Gentry was good inside the mall and the decorations and ambience was also good.  Shopper stop and zudio showroom are main shops.  This mall is worth a visit.

Name: Amit Shishodia
Title: Best place to spent time with family
Review: Best place to visit and feel tha nature. This place gives you a peace. This place have lot is things for small kids, they definitely love this place like my daughter.

Name: Nupur S
Title: Amazing
Review: Amazing and mind blowing are the words for this beautiful and lovely place. Come with open learning mind.

Name: alok p
Title: Old place
Review: Me and may friend travelling kothi roshan. Very old place very nice place structure so beautiful very nice place

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Good place for History buffs.
Review: I was travelling with a friend of mine, from Kaiserbagh to Aminabad and crossed an old structure, with a signboard saying "Kothi Roshan-ud Daula".  We stopped here and went around this building, which houses the office of Archaeology Department of Govt of Uttar Pradesh. We were told by the staff available there that renovation of this historical structure is going on.  Will surely visit during day time on my next visit.

Name: moniyash01
Title: A mind blowing experience
Review: What a experience it was in the Mystery rooms the challenges , tasks , surprises and the MYSTERIES we faced were awesome. I went for the 2nd time me and my friends enjoyed the experience 2 times and we are very lucky that we got to know about this place and visited there and enjoyed the experience. It's also a exercise or a test of your brain how could you face the challenges and solve them leniently . It was very good and the team was also very friendly to us .

Name: nitinks1987
Title: No one can escape without all hints.
Review: No one will be able to escape without hints.. All clues are very tough to understand.Without hint no one can escape in 60 mins

Name: Kavyaaaaaaaa
Title: A Night in Bhangarh - Really fun, interesting and spooky
Review: This mystery room was quite well made and the mystery was very interesting to solve. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an adventurous fun, spooky time with friends.

Name: 516manav
Title: Mystery Room Review
Review: I loved my day at Mystery room with my friends. Although a tad bit pricy especially for 3 to 4 people, I really liked the real life experience game I played there and would love to spend some time again.

Name: RishadMurtaza
Title: Mystery Rooms....  Adventure worth imbibing
Review: Mystery Rooms. It's an adventure worth imbibing. You may visit them with family or friends at any time of the day or year. Even if you had been an ardent fan of Sherlock Holmes you would still need all your intellect and imagination to succeed in the journey.  There are clues concealed with supreme acumen and hints drop by.  A knowledge of law and love for books would come handy.  So pull up your skills and take the challenge.  The more people are in the group the more one would enjoy. So all the best and have an enjoyable and mesmerizing experience

Name: Amogh_Shukla
Title: The experience was good
Review: Our experience was good ..But i have a complaint which has to be worked onIn the first escape room in bhangargarh theme theres an opening at the back of the room so one of my cousin tried to see whats inside that  as he touched the curtains he thought something is inside some kind of wall .. as he touched the curtain he fall down and had an injury in his back and head . This was the worst thing .. pls see into it and revert me back Email - amoghshukla8@gmail.com

Name: gauri151
Title: Loved my experience over there
Review: We had a party over there and even had a lot of fun the rooms over there . You will not be a to go in the horror one if there are no adult present in there with you

Name: prerna1232022
Title: Liked the adventure.
Review: It was an adventurous experience. A must visit place for the people who like adventure. Will visit again for rest of the remaining mysteries👍👌

Name: bubblesbansal07
Title: A fun experience !!
Review: By far my favourite experience of escape rooms... They're so well done and detailed !! The rooms are challenging and fun, a must go to place to have fun with your friends or fam. Loved it <3 I'll surely try all of the rooms xD

Name: shagunagarwal12
Title: Over expensive
Review: Experience was good but it was overpriced .Not worth spending 4000 for a game with 5 friends. Although I played 2 games back to back so I enjoyed the game but yes it was overpriced.Price should be of a kind that everyone can enjoy the game .And I think it was just because of overprice i found d place completely vaccant.It was just 5 of us who played.Rest is companys choice

Name: MallikaDwivedi
Title: Fun adventure!
Review: My family and I had a wonderful time solving the clever puzzles and meticulously designed rooms. Theres a good variety to select from with varying difficulty levels, and i look forward to visiting again! Definitely recommend with family/friends

Name: sambhavisingh2008
Title: Best place to visit with your friends
Review: The games are very exciting once you play one you want to play all of them. Even the staff is very good. They are friendly and helpful. A must visit place.

Name: GodDevil_14
Title: Strange but interesting
Review: It was a good experience as far as the story and theme goes as well as the hints but the only issue that I face while solving the mystery was that the hints provided were not matching with the place where those hints were to be utilised. It was more like a guess game for the first room as most of the things were solved on the basis of instincts.

Name: Skelly2202
Title: Great place to have fun
Review: This is one of the most fun places in Lucknow, the experiences are very challenging and immersive. I hope they add more experiences in Lucknow

Name: Nida U
Title: ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC
Review: Excellent experience! Hyper realistic props and the thrill and excitement of everything was unmatched. We were so addicted to the fun we had that we visited it four times at a stretch! Highly recommend it.

Name: Bhavya1008
Title: About the place and service.
Review: Excellent place to visit with family, friends and even parents. Very good and healthy environment. I loved it.

Name: wahebaHusain
Title: A must visit
Review: It was a delightful experience..once you go in the mystery begins and it seem so realistic..so it is worth trying..I have tried one and I am looking forward to go for other levels as well

Name: srijansaxena11
Title: Must have experience
Review: It was a very nice experience. The puzzles and everything was interesting to solve. It wasn't easy but it was doable. It's a unique experience. Overall it was enjoyable.

Name: atul g
Title: Family visit to mystery room
Review: I visited mystery room on 5.4.2022 with my kids and wife. The place was deserted but staff was behaving as if they are very busy and over booked. The room was small, dark and lacked any adventure. I will not recommend it as it is a costly affair @800 rs per adult.

Name: spardhachess
Title: Excellent Puzzles
Review: Mind shuffling games. More such centres should be added in Lucknow. I have done all 5 themes and want to explore more.

Name: Srivastava921
Title: Excellent
Review: It was really a good experience. It was my first time and to be honest I was thrilled and i am sure i will try more rooms from next time. Thank you!

Name: khushibanker5
Title: Thrilled
Review: Was a full of thriller and suspense experience inside the lock roomMust visit with friends to have fun and enjoyment

Name: palak31agarwal
Title: over expensive
Review: 800 per person for an hour  .  we paid 8000 for 10 . the game was fun but still it was highly overpriced..

Name: varshitatandon0
Title: Amazing experience
Review: It was indeed an amazing experience and to escape the room was definitely nerve-wrecking. All in all a great experience but a little expensive.

Name: vickykaushik81
Title: Amazing real life experience
Review: You will get real life experience.. A unique way of enjoying and spend time. Must visit once because once you visited then second time you won't stop yourself to visit again..

Name: kohlipragya
Title: amazing experience
Review: initially we were sceptical of visiting this place but it was one of the most memorable experience, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves

Name: Meander40032954841
Title: Family fun time
Review: It was nicely managed. The team was monitoring through out the one hour. The puzzles were interesting and required observation and deduction. All the members of the team enjoyed. Children enjoyed the most. Even our 1 yr old member got into the mood and enjoyed by trying to use keys to open the locks which were ample. We tried the The Hurt locker. Surely will be trying others soon.

Name: saurabhmh2021
Title: Mystery Room Lucknow
Review: A good innovative concept, however highly overpriced. Also the in-room safety was a concern as one of our group members fell in the deep pit, luckily was not injured seriously.We were smartly charged extra on account of some invisible taxes, not mentioned on the tickets, however upon raising the issue it was returned, Be cautious and pay only the amount mentioned on the tickets.

Name: Priyankameetugupta
Title: Scary games
Review: Wonderful experience amazing games.The whole setup and the entire activities was too good.you can more fun with family & friends

Name: ps2959
Title: Worth one time visit
Review: It's interesting and enjoyable for the first visit but they should include offers and better rewards and decrease the charge. Also share the pictures taken by them.

Name: ojaswanikumar
Title: staff was very rude and indifferent 😐 and price is too high
Review: the mystery room good but the staff/cashier there was very rude and indifferent and kept downplaying us and when i was checking whether my locker is locked or not he gave us a snarky remark as if i as a customer am not even allowed check the locker WHICH CONSISTS MY STUFF overall a very annoying guy but the game master and the person that came afterwards was very nice and 800 rupees is too much gor only 1 hour experience

Name: Mishthy A
Title: Amazing Experience 💫
Review: It was overall an amazing experience and probably the first time I ever did this even though I didn't escape it was pretty cool to try. Although I would like you to improve one thing that the TV's in the room should like always show the clues, we were getting a bit confused while looking at the tv, otherwise everything was cool.

Name: kashishrizvi003311
Title: It was interesting
Review: It was damn good we visited it on my birthday which was on 30 September it was damn interesting and bit difficult

Name: kgehwal17
Title: Good experience
Review: The experience was good, however if the main person was a bit fun then the experience would be more great.

Name: Akshat9105
Title: Great experience
Review: Great and fun experience !!! Totally enjoyed it with friends . Would love to visit it once more for some other game , themes are so exciting.

Name: pl_321789
Title: Mysteryrooms@Lko
Review: The themes need to be rethinked and renamed in accordance to the experience being provided and not just to attract people. The staff need not be inherently rude and should be helpful and guiding. Also the time allotted and ticket pricing for mystery room should be synchronous to the level of the room. Waiting area for the room was good but ambience should be bettered.

Name: Vibhu24
Title: Our experience.
Review: Experience was good.We really enjoyed. The only thing we didn't like is the price, as it was highly expensive. Rupees 800 for one mystery and for 1 hour is quite a bit expensive. Except for the price we loved the mission.

Name: sonalsingh22350
Title: Wonderful Experience
Review: If you are looking forward to spend a fun and interesting weekend with your friends, visit this place. Mystery rooms offer you good variety of options to chose and test your skills on different levels.

Name: escanor389
Title: game chosen was abduction
Review: dont play abduction if you have epilepsy or are in any way affected by flickering of lights secondly the clues are not at all helpfull anyone opting for abduction my advice is its just a waste of your time and money go for jailbreak or that bomb diffuse or any other but not abduction as the clues are not at all relative in any way possible btw our same friend group has solved almost every game in their catalogue but abduction is a broken one from their end only

Name: rohanpathak2021
Title: Amazing place for fun and games
Review: We played Lockout , the experiance was amazing. The game was thrilling and required good strategy...

Name: SHRISTI V
Title: It was funnnnnn!!!!!!
Review: Our overall experience was good, though it was our first time. We did enjoy a lot and had fun together. Even the staff members were very friendly and polite. I just loved this place and especially the mystery room games that made us work together to sum up the clues and hints and move forward to next steps. The games were totally brainstorming fun activities that made us think about the situation and solve them together. Me and my best friends really had a great time together. And I suggest you all to just give this place some time so that you can experience the same too.✌🏻✌🏻

Name: vrantikashukla
Title: The cabin in the woods
Review: The experience was good but i just have one suggestion it’s good the way you people design the game but i guess you can make the game more interesting by creating more real life experience that is try to play with psychology of the players rather than the difficulty level of solving the codes it would be more exciting and more of fun

Name: amolkrishnapatel
Title: Mind Boggling!!
Review: Really fun place, Hangouts for friends or family. Well organized. Excellent themes. And great puzzles.

Name: Shreya_Bharti
Title: Bhangarh Fort Experience
Review: Bhangarh fort experience was a wonderful. I really want to visit again for solving the mysteries of rest of the rooms.

Name: lightkeeper69
Title: setup&puzzles
Review: I t  w a s   g o o d   o v e r a l l   . H a d   a g r e a t    t i m e   t h e r e ..  ...........................💓💓 we'd be visiting again soon💓💓

Name: CookieZon
Title: A brilliant challenge
Review: When it comes to outings, there's nothing I've enjoyed more than mystery rooms. It was a wonderful bonding experience. Mystery rooms is a must visit place... Be it with family or with friends.

Name: shanumalhotra6
Title: Good experience
Review: Unique and an appealing concept. The very first experience and an awesome one. Seems you guys have made it up with all the unveiling imaginations.Keep up the good concept. #Hurray

Name: Kushagra P
Title: Will plan again to visit here😁
Review: Place was good. I will plan again to visit here. Must visit with group of friends and your 1 hr will be worthy.

Name: PUSHP N
Title: One of the best Mystery rooms , in our country.
Review: amazing ambience , decor. and everything was superb . ive been to many mystery rooms , but this one had a different look and more over , the cafe combined is just extra ordinary.

Name: Rachna
Title: Mastery at Mystery
Review: I went to the Mystery Rooms in Lucknow with a very dear friend. It was our first time at the game. it was truly a wonderful experience. Not for once did we feel bored. The excitement levels only went up with each passing second. A fun-filled experience for family and friends together. shall visit again.

Name: Daksh2801
Title: AMAZING CONCEPT
Review: This is super interesting for people who like challenges and want to keep their logical skills strong. This is a 'Must visit' place. I love the whole concept of Mystery room.

Name: Suryansh
Title: Masquerade food review session!
Review: Ever wanted to enjoy a real life escape experience along with some really good food and drinks?If yes then masquerade lucknow is the perfect place for you! Calling this place awesome would be undermining it! This place is the ultimate hangout place for you and your friends. Be it playstation, famous novels, scrumptious food, refreshing drinks, mystery rooms, this cafe got everything! ❤️Coming to ambience ,this place has for sure, one of the most soothing and pleasant environment! You just feel at peace as soon as you enter the cafe! The comfy seatings, the vibes are just perfect!Starting with food, black hot dog, mystery pops and black pizza are a must try! You'll just love the taste, the texture everything! Their kitchens are the one of the most hygienic kitchens I have ever seen. Service is prompt and every person working there attends to each and every customer properly! Now the drinks and shakes, I must say their brownie and red velvet shakes will definitely win your hearts! Their presentation is just top-notch - 10/10. Their mocktails are also really good and quite refreshing. So overall, you will love this place and you can't stop yourself from coming again and again. This is by far one of the most perfect cafes in Lucknow!❤️

Name: muskanmittal2349
Title: Appreciable
Review: I really enjoyed...the 1st time experience was vry good...does not matters we win or loose...the most important part is to take part and experience...it was worth going there.

Name: Pooja A
Title: Superb
Review: Awesome game great ambience well c ordinated activities and very friendly staff. L loved being there. Will visit again

Name: shammychanchal786
Title: Bhangarh
Review: It is full entertaining game. They allow 60mins but I just took 54 mins to solve the mystery into the game. Amazing amazing amazing game ever.

Name: ENVIRONMENT A
Title: Complete fun in an hour
Review: Great experience...friendly staff ... value for money...really good to spend time without electronic gadgets

Name: Yesh M
Title: Intellect fun
Review: Hardly we find a Place where we can have a group activity applying our common sense. It was reallt fun, would visit again for more levels.

Name: Varsha S
Title: Amazing, thrilling experience. Does not disappoint.
Review: The entire experience is thrilling, unique and new. You will definitely enjoy your time and still be wanting more. Go For It !!!!

Name: Prakarsh_Sinha
Title: Pretty great!
Review: Looking forward to sherlocking the other mysteries. And the medals really burnished the credibility in our team work.

Name: Meander55139161299
Title: Place Has my heart
Review: This place has my heart. Mystery rooms is a unique concept in lko where u r locked in a theme based room with your team and all u have to do is solve the mysteries to get out of there before the time kicks u out.

Name: akashyadav12
Title: It’s an amazing place. Time flies away so fast that you won’t even realise. I loved the experience.
Review: The rooms are full of hints but you won’t even capture them. One hour of suspense and the happiness on escaping the mystery room is all worth it.

Name: TheWorldNut
Title: The famous Kakori Kand.
Review: Kakori Shaheed Smarak, built in memory of the braves and immortals of the famous Kakori Kand which took place on August 9, 1925. The memorial stands one kilometer from Kakori railway station, where Ashfaqullah Khan, Chandrasekhar Azad, and Ramprasad Bismil stopped the train moving towards Lucknow carrying government treasury. The place is a great picnic spot and a good day activity with family on a fair weather. I was kinda surprised to not find this iconic place on TA and hence glad to get it listed and write the first review :). Hope this place gets more and more attention and uplift through TA. Cheers.

Name: raj kamal singh
Title: Anandi magic water park a day out
Review: This place us about 20 kms from lucknow airport. Roads are good for travelling. Place is too big and many people are unaware about this location. The day we went some school trip was also there probably promotion for future......Since so many slides are there I feel it was difficult for them to manage as many of the slides didn't have water supple so could not be used. Some of the places tiles were broken. All in all I didn't enjoy the water park much. This place also has an amusement park which starts from 1600. This was good. There was a puppet show and rajasthani folk dance and swings were amazing wrt all ages.We had taken up rooms and rooms were decent but seems no one uses them. Food that was served during the lunch, the buffet, was below average. Dinner we ordered separately and that was also not that good. Snacks were tooooo oily.But yes one can plan for a day trip and that is enough for this place. Night time leaving the premises is risky as it's about 2 to 3 kms to reach the highway and you have to pass through the local village. So if you are alone dont think of departing in night.

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: An old charm..
Review: Its an old place still having its charm specially among Muslim group. The place mostly remains crowded now.  One can enjoy some local cuisines in here.

Name: Sanyashree
Title: Pay tribute
Review: The karbala here is a very old and renowned place. it has a deep faith amongst the Muslims. Though, now the area has become really crowded and the roads are really narrow at that place.

Title: An old charm..

Name: Tanvi
Title: Only for people who follow islam
Review: It is not a tourist attraction where anyone can visit . Only people who follow Islam should visit here .

Name: infojonny
Title: Farangi Mahal
Review: This Farangi Mahal is not tourist attraction but it is religious place mostly muslim people visit here

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Religious place...
Review: Its a religious place for Islam. Its not a touristic place and mostly visited by peoples who follow Islam. Being a religious place its not a place who are looking for sum thrill or fun.

Name: DotDivx
Title: Religious building not for tourists
Review: You would like to visit this place if you follow Islam. Does not have any thing attractive for the tourists and people who want to have fun.

Name: Shashak G
Title: Very poor management
Review: No proper mangement, people were already sitting on our seats when we reached. When we told them very reluctantly they leave. My seat was corner to the stairs and on stairs there were so many people standing even if full seats are occupied. There were many more people than actual seats and this seems disgusting. People were fightings for seats all around and there were no people from management to resolve these issues.

Name: Krishnaraj I
Title: Sublime and deeply gratifying olfactory experience
Review: Sugandhco is ideally one of India's oldest-living traditional perfumeries upholding the world's pioneering perfumery tradition. Truly admirable is their versatility that spans all the 3 major perfumery traditions of the world-Indian, Arabian and French.Sugandhco's Arabesque scents in particular form a magnificent selection of tightly permutated formulations that spring surprises at every turn and bring a smile to the fragrance aficionado's face. 'Oud Badastur' with its animalic, musky, woody oud tonality  took me back to the Khaleej-the Gulf States with their quaint old alleyways, the Bedoiun serenades and the old dhows sailing gently across Dubai Creek.While the warming and energetic 'Hina' and 'Musk Amber' resurrect the Nawabs of old, oud innovations like 'Mukhallat' , 'Hasrat e Oudh' and 'Jashn e Oudh' to name a few, make magic with musk, pour passion into patchouli and awe me with amber.A refreshing dab of 'Yaquet' or for instance, 'Nafasat' on the back of your hand would rejuvinate you with not just the amazing sillage of enchanting notes but even the longevity on skin or on fabric. PS-Do not miss the drydowns of any of these scents! There is invariably, always a little surprise awaiting you there! A certain note that emerges out of the blue as you exclaim 'wah! kya baat hai'!Mr.Vishwas Vijayvergiya, the knowledgeable and friendly upholder of this renowned tradition enlightened me about each of his masterpieces in thorough detail.

Name: Rakesh Kumar
Title: Hospitality
Review: We heard so much about this famous attar showroom and that's why we visited sugandhco while our recent visit to Lucknow. We had a great experience as the hospitality was really nice and the products are amazing as well.

Name: Tanishq Vijay
Title: Thank you for making my experience so memorable
Review: What an experience visiting this store. The hospitality was so good and the products were so unique. Highly recommend Sugandhco for the visitors of Lucknow.

Name: Inim
Title: Love love love!
Review: What an awesome experience it is to be at this perfume store!Love their unique concepts and variety of perfume specialities.

Name: Mayank
Title: Highly recommend
Review: Its one of its kind store in the historic city Lucknow. They excel in what they do ! Their perfumes are a big hit with me,my family & friends. I would highly recommend this store . They are available on scentkart.com as well

Name: Lubna hashmi
Title: The best place for Perfumes
Review: If you are looking for good perfumes, attars, natural personal and home care products then there is just one stop for this -Sugandhco. And you will just love it.

Name: Isha
Title: Sugandhco is one of the best perfume shop in Lucknow.
Review: Sugandhco has a variety of Attars and Perfumes for every occasion which smells so so good that you will surely go back. It also has variety of homecare products which are also equally good.

Name: AmanRustagi
Title: Firts thank your sense of smell, then thank Sugandhco.
Review: It hustle bustle of Ameenabad, on opening glass door of Sugandhco, it seems as if you have entered in a different world. Even the tag line is that first thank yoir sense of smell and then us. (something like that) Different concotions bottled in various sized   bottles. You have perfumes for all occassions and all needs. For worshipping needs, housekeeping needs, aromatherapy to  toiletteries, they have perfumery solutions for every problem and need. Mr Vijayvergiya, the owner, tells that they have been serving people of luckhnow since time of Nawabs. and now name Sugandhco, truly has spread to conneisseurs. He not only explians difference between various formulations but also correct way to wear different formulations of perfumes.One can not help but leave satisfied buying various sized jars and bottles.Though there are other branch also and online sales as well but visit to sugandhco was worth all the pains to negotiate the hustle bustle and crowded streets of Ameenabad.Thanks Sugandhco.One can not help but

Name: Pratyakshism
Title: The fragrance capital!
Review: Just like gods are housed in temples, the best and the most invigorating fragrances are housed at Sugandhco. Without a doubt, and I say this with a popular unanimity, that Sugandhco is the fragrance capital of our times.Unthinkable fragrances, amazing variety of attars & perfumes for all types of moods and not to forget the amiable hospitality and smiling faces make this place a one stop shop. Absolutely unmissable is this place, and trust me you cannot walk out with just 1!

Name: Vishwas V
Title: best iitars of lucknow
Review: Dear Pratyakshism, Thank you for taking out time to review SUGANDHCO on Tripadvisor. Your positive feedback is truly appreciated. Stay Fragrant!

Their online website Scentkart is also very user friendly and offers wide ranges of perfumes, attars, air fresheners, and so much more! Love shopping here. Definitely a must-stop-shop here in Lucknow!
